ref: "However, we do not see any corresponding response from the U.S.," he said.

src: 「在沒有獲得美方信任的情況下，我們無法確保國家安全，而我們也因此不可能先單方面解除核武。」
mt: "We cannot ensure national security without the trust of the US, and we cannot unilaterally disarm nuclear weapons because of this."
ref: "Without any trust in the U.S. there will be no confidence in our national security and under such circumstances there is no way we will unilaterally disarm ourselves first."

src: 在北韓接納「階段式」去核並以此獲得獎勵後，這並不是李第一次就北韓對華盛頓的壓制表示不滿。他的言論看似重大，但卻未像平壤過去般直接拒絕單方面去核一說。
mt: This is not the first time Lee has expressed dissatisfaction with North Korea’s repression of Washington after North Korea accepted a “staged” denuclearization and rewarded it. His remarks may seem substantial, but they did not, as in the past, directly reject the one-sided denuclearization of Pyongyang.
ref: While Ri reprised familiar North Korean complaints about Washington's resistance to a "phased" approach to denuclearization under which North Korea would be rewarded as it took gradual steps, his statement appeared significant in that it did not reject unilateral denuclearization out of hand as Pyongyang has done in the past.

src: 李提及由金正恩 (Kim Jong Un) 和唐納德·川普 (Donald Trump) 在 6 月 12 日新加坡的兩方在任領導首次會面後發表的聯合聲明，其中金承諾將致力推動「韓國半島去核化」，而川普亦承諾將確保北韓的國土安全。
mt: Lee mentioned a joint statement by Kim Jong Un and Donald Trump, who led the first meeting in Singapore on June 12, after Kim Jong Un and Donald Trump promised to push for "denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula", and Trump also promised to ensure the safety of North Korea's territory.
ref: Ri referred to a joint statement issued by Kim Jong Un and Donald Trump at a first ever summit between a serving U.S. president and a North Korean leader in Singapore on June 12, when Kim pledged to work toward "denuclearization of the Korean peninsula" while Trump promised guarantees of North Korea's security.

src: 北韓一直在尋求正式結束 1950 至 53 年韓戰的方法，但美國表示平壤必須先放棄其核武器。
mt: North Korea has been seeking a formal way to end the Korean War between 1950 and 1953, but the US said Pyongyang must first abandon its nuclear weapons.
ref: North Korea has been seeking a formal end to the 1950-53 Korea War, but the United States has said Pyongyang must give up its nuclear weapons first.

src: 華盛頓亦已拒絕放鬆對北韓的嚴厲國際制裁。
mt: Washington has also refused to relax its strict international sanctions against North Korea.
ref: Washington has also resisted calls to relax tough international sanctions on North Korea.

src: 「美國堅持『先去核』並透過制裁增強對北韓施壓以用一種強硬態度達到其目的，甚至不惜反對『終止戰爭宣言』建議，」李說道。
mt: "The United States insists on 'denuclearizing first' and uses sanctions to increase pressure on North Korea to achieve its goal with a hardline attitude, even opposing the 'Declaration of Termination of War' proposal," says Lee.
ref: "The U.S. insists on the "denuclearization-first" and increases the level of pressure by sanctions to achieve their purpose in a coercive manner, and even objecting to the "declaration of the end of war,"" Ri said.

src: 「制裁可以讓我們屈服的這一想法為那些輕視我們的人所提出的無稽之談。
mt: "The idea that sanctions can make us surrender is an abomination to those who look down on us.
ref: "The perception that sanctions can bring us on our knees is a pipe dream of the people who are ignorant about us.

src: 但實際上，持續的制裁正加深我們的不信任。」
mt: But in fact, ongoing sanctions are deepening our distrust. "
ref: But the problem is that the continued sanctions are deepening our mistrust."

src: 李並未提起任何有關美國領導人在這個禮拜初在聯合國重點提及的金與川普的第二次會談計畫。
mt: Lee did not mention anything about the U.S. leaders' second talks on Trump and Kim at the UN earlier this week.
ref: Ri made no mention of plans for a second summit between Kim and Trump that the U.S. leader highlighted at the United Nations earlier in the week.

src: 部長卻提及了金與南韓領導人文在寅 (Moon Jae-in) 在過去五個月中舉行的會談，並表示：「如果與我們討論去核的是南韓方而不是美國，韓國半島去核化可能不會走入今天這般死局。」
mt: The minister mentioned that Kim and South Korean leader Moon Jae-in had held talks over the past five months, saying: "If we were to discuss with us that South Korea was nuclear, not the United States, denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula might not have been as dead as it is today."
ref: The minister instead highlighted three meetings between Kim and South Korean leader Moon Jae-in in the past five months and added: "If the party to this issue of denuclearization were South Korea and not the U.S., the denuclearization of the Korean peninsula would not have come to such a deadlock."

src: 即便如此，李採用的語氣卻明顯與去年有別。去年他曾在聯合國大會中表示，在「邪惡的總統先生」川普稱金為參與自殺任務的「導彈人」後，將北韓的導彈指向美國內陸已然是不可避免的結果。
mt: Even so, Lee's tone is clearly different from last year's. Last year, he said at the UN General Assembly that after Trump called Kim a "missile man" involved in a suicide mission, pointing North Korea's missiles at the US interior was inevitable.
ref: Even so, the tone of Ri's speech was dramatically different from last year, when he told the U.N. General Assembly that targeting the U.S. mainland with North Korea's rockets was inevitable after "Mr Evil President" Trump called Kim a "rocket man" on a suicide mission.

src: 在今年的聯合國大會中，去年曾要脅將「徹底毀滅」北韓的川普大讚金勇敢採取去武行動，但表示之後還有很多的路要走，因此仍然需要在北韓徹底去核前繼續制裁。
mt: At this year's UN General Assembly, last year Trump praised Kim for taking action against North Korea, who threatened to "completely destroy" North Korea, but said there are still many ways to go after that, and therefore still need to continue sanctions before North Korea completely removes nuclear weapons.
ref: This year at the United Nations, Trump, who last year threatened to "totally destroy" North Korea, heaped praise on Kim for his courage in taking steps to disarm, but said much work still had to be done and sanctions must remain in place until North Korea denuclearizes.

src: 在禮拜三，川普表示他對此未有任何時間表。「如果這耗時兩年、三年甚至五個月—這都沒有關係。」
mt: On Wednesday, Trump said he had no timeline for this. “If it took two years, three years or even five months—it wouldn’t matter.”
ref: On Wednesday, Trump said he did not have a time frame for this, saying "If it takes two years, three years or five months - doesn't matter."

src: 中國和俄羅斯在聯合國安理會中爭取應就平壤目前所作出的讓步予以獎勵。
mt: China and Russia are fighting at the UN Security Council to reward Pyongyang's current concessions.
ref: China and Russia argue that the U.N. Security Council should reward Pyongyang for steps taken.

src: 但是，美國國務卿邁克·蓬佩奧 (Mike Pompeo) 在禮拜四向聯合國安理會表示：「安理會實施的制裁必須繼續且不能有任何鬆懈，直至我們確認已達致完成、完整且真正的去核。」
mt: However, US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo told the UN Security Council on Thursday, "The sanctions imposed by the Security Council must continue and must not be lenient until we confirm that they have been completed, complete and truly denuclearized."
ref: However, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo told the U.N. Security Council on Thursday that: "Enforcement of Security Council sanctions must continue vigorously and without fail until we realize the fully, final, verified denuclearization."

src: 安理會已自 2006 年起一致決定對北韓推動制裁，以試圖切斷平壤的核彈和導彈計劃的資金來源。
mt: Since 2006, the Security Council has unanimously decided to impose sanctions on North Korea in an attempt to cut off funding for Pyongyang's nuclear and missile programs.
ref: The Security Council has unanimously boosted sanctions on North Korea since 2006 in a bid to choke off funding for Pyongyang's nuclear and ballistic missile programs.

src: 蓬佩奧在聯合國大會場邊與李碰面，並在之後表示他將在下個月再次造訪平壤以準備兩方領導人的第二次會談。
mt: Pompeo met Lee at the UN General Assembly venue, and later stated that he would visit Pyongyang again next month to prepare for a second meeting between leaders of both sides.
ref: Pompeo met Ri on the sidelines of the U.N. General Assembly and said afterwards that he would visit Pyongyang again next month to prepare for a second summit.

src: 蓬佩奧在今年已訪問北韓三次，但他的上一次造訪並未如預期般順利。
mt: Pompeo has visited North Korea three times this year, but his last visit did not go as smoothly as expected.
ref: Pompeo has visited North Korea three times already this year, but his last trip did not go well.

src: 他在七月離開平壤後表示，在達成一定成果後，北韓在數小時內譴責其提出「流氓般的要求」。
mt: After leaving Pyongyang in July, he said that after achieving a certain result, North Korea condemned him for making "hooligan demands" within several hours.
ref: He left Pyongyang in July saying that progress had been made, only for North Korea within hours to denounce him for making "gangster-like demands."

src: 北韓在這個月與文的一場會議中承諾解散一個導彈及一個核武基地，前提是美國採取「相應措施」。
mt: North Korea has committed to disbanding a missile and a nuclear base at a meeting with the US this month, provided that the US takes "corresponding measures".
ref: North Korea pledged in a meeting with Moon this month to dismantle a missile site and also a nuclear complex if the United States took "corresponding measures."

src: 他表示，金已告訴他尋求的「相應措施」為川普在新加坡所作的安全承諾，並與華盛頓的關係趨向正常。
mt: He said that Kim had told him the "relative measures" he sought were Trump's security commitment in Singapore and his relationship with Washington trended towards normalcy.
ref: He said Kim had told him the "corresponding measures" he was seeking were security guarantees Trump pledged in Singapore and moves toward normalization of relations with Washington.

src: 哈佛學生修讀課程以獲取足夠休息
mt: Harvard students take courses to get enough rest
ref: Harvard students take course in getting enough rest

src: 哈佛大學今年的一個新課程讓學校的所有本科學生取得更多睡眠時間，以打擊以咖啡因作為燃料「通宵」的日漸流行的學習文化。
mt: This year's new program at Harvard University allowed all undergraduate students to get more sleep, in an effort to combat the increasingly popular "all-night" learning culture fueled by caffeine.
ref: A new course at Harvard University this year has got all its undergraduates getting more sleep in a bid to combat the growing macho culture of studying through caffeine-fueled 'all-nighters.'

src: 學者發現，這家全球第一學府的學生在面對如何照顧自己的這一基本學題上，往往無法作出讓人滿意的答案。
mt: Scholars have found that students at this world's first academic institution often cannot provide satisfactory answers to the basic question of how to take care of themselves.
ref: An academic found students at the world's number one university are often clueless when it comes to the very basics about how to look after themselves.

src: 哈佛醫學院的睡眠醫學教授 Charles Czeisler 連同布萊根婦女醫院 (Brigham and Women's Hospital) 的一名專家設計了這門課程。他相信這是美國的首例。
mt: Charles Czeisler, a professor of sleep medicine at Harvard Medical School, designed this course with an expert at Brigham and Women's Hospital. He believes it's the first in the United States.
ref: Charles Czeisler, professor of sleep medicine at Harvard Medical School and a specialist at the Brigham and Women's Hospital, designed the course, which he believes is the first of its kind in the US.

src: 他在完成有關缺乏睡眠對學習造成的影響的一次演講後，突發奇想決定開設這一課程。
mt: After completing a speech on the impact of sleep deprivation on learning, he suddenly came up with an idea and decided to open this course.
ref: He was inspired to start the course after giving a talk on the impact sleep deprivation had on learning.

src: 「在演講的最後，一名女學生向我提問：『為什麼要在現在，我學生生涯的最後一年，才告訴我這個問題？』
mt: "At the end of my talk, a female student asked me, 'Why do I have to tell this question in my last year of student life now?'"
ref: 'At the end of it one girl came up to me and said: 'Why am I only being told this now, in my senior year?'

src: 她表示從未有人告訴她睡眠的重要—我對此感到驚訝無比，」他向電訊報 (The Telegraph) 表示。
mt: She said no one had ever told her the importance of sleep—I was amazed at this,” he told The Telegraph.
ref: She said no one had ever told her about the importance of sleep - which surprised me,' he told The Telegraph.

src: 這門課程，在今年首次推出，將向學生解釋良好的睡眠習慣對學業和體能表現的重要，同時也可以改善他們的整體健康。
mt: This course, first launched this year, will explain to students that good sleep habits are important for academic and physical performance, and can also improve their overall health.
ref: The course, rolled out for the first time this year, explains to students the essentials of how good sleep habits help academic and athletic performance, as well as improve their general wellbeing.

src: 哈佛醫學院的精神病學教授，同時也是大學健康服務執行董事的 Paul Barreira 表示，大學也是在發現學生在一個禮拜中嚴重缺乏睡眠後同意開辦這一課程。
mt: Paul Barreira, a professor of psychiatry at Harvard Medical School and executive director of the university's health service, said that the university also agreed to launch this course after discovering that students were severely sleepless in one week.
ref: Paul Barreira, professor of psychiatry at Harvard Medical School and executive director of the university's health services, said the university decided to introduce the course after finding students were seriously sleep deprived during the week.

src: 這個一小時的課程包括一系列互動任務。
mt: This one-hour course includes a series of interactive tasks.
ref: The hour long course involves a series of interactive tasks.

src: 在其中一部份，學生會看到一個宿舍房間的圖片。他們可以點擊上面的咖啡杯、窗簾、運動鞋和書本以了解咖啡因、燈光對睡眠的影響、缺乏睡眠將對體能表現造成什麼樣的影響，以及睡前準備的重要。
mt: In part, students will see a picture of a dormitory room. They can click on the coffee cup, curtains, sneakers and books above to learn about the effects of caffeine, the effects of light on sleep, the effects of sleep deprivation on physical performance, and the importance of preparing for bedtime.
ref: In one section there is an image of a dorm room, where students click on coffee cups, curtains, trainers and books to be told about the effects of caffeine and light and how athletic performance is impacted by sleep deficiency, and the importance of a bedtime routine.

src: 在另一部份，學生將被告知長期缺乏睡眠可增加罹患心臟病、中風、憂鬱症和癌症的風險。
mt: In another part, students will be informed that long-term lack of sleep can increase the risk of heart disease, stroke, depression and cancer.
ref: In another section, participants are told how long-term sleep deprivation can increase risks of heart attacks, stroke, depression and cancer.

src: 一張包含互動標示的校園地圖，將鼓勵學生審視他們的日常活動。
mt: A campus map containing interactive signs will encourage students to review their daily activities.
ref: A map of the campus, with interactive icons, then encourages participants to think about their daily routine.

src: 「我們知道這不會對學生的行為產生即刻的影響。
mt: “We know that this will not have an immediate effect on student behavior.
ref: 'We know it won't change students' behavior instantly.

src: 但我們相信他們有權知道—正如你有權知道選擇吸菸對健康可能造成的影響，」Czeisler 教授說道。
mt: But we believe that they have the right to know—as you have the right to know what the health impact of choosing to smoke can have,” says Professor Czeisler.
ref: But we believe they have a right to know - just as you have a right to know the health effects of choosing to smoke cigarettes,' Prof Czeisler added.

src: 他表示，對「通宵」感到驕傲的文化仍然存在，而現代科技和學生面對日漸增長的壓力表示缺乏睡眠這個問題將變得更嚴重。
mt: He said that the culture of being proud of "all-night" still exists, and modern technology and students facing increasingly growing pressure indicate that the lack of sleep problem will become even more serious.
ref: The culture of pride in 'pulling an all-nighter' still exists, he said, adding that modern technology and ever-increasing pressure on students meant sleep deprivation was a growing problem.

src: 他說道，確保你有優質且足夠的睡眠，應該是學生對抗壓力、疲倦和憂慮的「秘密武器」—甚至可以避免變胖，由於缺乏睡眠將使腦袋進入飢餓模式，讓我們時時都感到肚子餓。
mt: He said, ensuring you have a high-quality and sufficient sleep should be the "secret weapon" of students to combat stress, fatigue, and anxiety—even avoid gaining weight, because lack of sleep will make our brains enter a hungry mode, making us feel hungry all the time.
ref: Ensuring you have enough sleep, of a good quality, should be a student's 'secret weapon' to combat stress, exhaustion and anxiety, he said - even to avoid putting on weight, as sleep deprivation puts the brain into starvation mode, making them constantly hungry.

src: 19 歲來自加州並修讀化學和物力生物學的 Raymond So，幫助 Czeisler 教授設計了這門課程，亦在去年他進入哈佛的第一年修讀了其中一堂課。
mt: Raymond So, a 19-year-old from California who studied chemistry and physical biology, helped Professor Czeisler design the course, and also took one of the courses in his first year at Harvard last year.
ref: Raymond So, a 19-year-old Californian studying chemical and physical biology, helped Professor Czeisler design the course, having taken one of his classes last year during his first year at Harvard.

src: 他表示，這門課程讓他大開眼界，並鼓勵他推動其成為全校必修的課程。
mt: He said that this course opened his eyes to the world and encouraged him to promote it as a compulsory course for the whole school.
ref: He said the course had opened his eyes and inspired him to push for a campus-wide course.

src: 他希望下一步是在他們進入競爭激烈的職業生涯前，邀請研究生參加類似的課程。
mt: He hopes that the next step is to invite graduate students to participate in similar courses before they enter a highly competitive career.
ref: The next step, he hopes, it to ask all postgraduate students to complete a similar study program before joining the competitive institution.

src: Czeisler 教授建議學生應考慮設定鬧鐘提醒自己什麼時候應上床睡覺，以及什麼時候要起床，並注意避免由電子屏幕和 LED 燈光釋出的「藍光」帶來的負面影響，這可能打亂你的晝夜生理規律，從而引致失眠等問題。
mt: Professor Czeisler suggests that students should consider setting an alarm to remind themselves when to go to bed and when to get up, and be aware of the negative effects of “blue light” emitted by the electronic screen and LED lights, which may disrupt your circadian rhythms and lead to insomnia and other problems.
ref: Prof Czeisler recommended that students should consider setting an alarm for when to go to bed, as well as for when to wake, and be aware of the harmful effects of 'blue light' emitted by electronic screens and LED lighting, which can throw your circadian rhythm out of kilter, leading to problems falling asleep.

src: 利雲斯頓 (Livingston) 以 1 - 0 險勝流浪 (Rangers)：Menga 擊敗 Gerrard 的球員成功射門
mt: Livingston edged Rangers 1-0 to defeat Gerrard’s player in Menga
ref: Livingston 1 - 0 Rangers: Menga goal downs Gerrard's men

src: 在 Dolly Menga 射門後，由 Steven Gerrard 指導的流浪再次以 1-0 之差輸給了身穿藍色球衣的利雲斯頓球隊。
mt: After Dolly Menga's goal-scoring, Steven Gerrard-led Rangers again lost to the team of Livingston wearing blue jerseys by a margin of 1-0.
ref: Rangers suffered another bout of away-day blues as Dolly Menga's strike consigned Steven Gerrard's disjointed side to a 1-0 defeat at Livingston.

src: Ibrox 方自二月以 4-1 大勝聖莊士東 (St Johnstone) 後一直試圖再次贏得勝利，但 Gary Holt 的球隊在 18 場球賽中讓 Gerrard 作為經理的球隊再次一嚐敗績，讓流浪落後於 Ladbrokes Premiership 榜首的赫斯 (Hearts) 八分之差。
mt: Ibrox has been trying to win again since February with a 4-1 victory over St Johnstone, but Gary Holt's team let Gerrard, the manager of the team, taste their loss again in 18 games, leaving Hearts 8 points behind Ladbrokes Premiership.
ref: The Ibrox side were looking to record their first win on the road since February's 4-1 triumph at St Johnstone, but Gary Holt's team inflicted just Gerrard's second defeat in 18 games as manager to leave his side eight points adrift of runaway Ladbrokes Premiership leaders Hearts.

src: Menga 在中場前七分鐘成功射門，而一成不變的流浪陣隊在之後再無追平的機會。
mt: Menga scored a goal in the first seven minutes of the midfield, and the 100% vagrant team had no chance to tie it up again.
ref: Menga struck seven minutes before half-time and a Rangers line-up short on inspiration never looked like levelling.

src: 隨著流浪跌到排名第六位，利雲斯頓攀升至第三位且僅在入球數量上落後於前一名的喜百年 (Hibernian)。
mt: As the drift dropped to sixth place, Livinston climbed to third place and only trailed behind the top-ranked Hibernian in terms of goal count.
ref: While Rangers now drop down to sixth spot, Livingston climb to third and only behind Hibernian on goal difference.

src: 繼巡邊員 Calum Spence 因被明顯由客隊方拋來的物件砸中需要接受頭部創傷治療後，流浪可能面臨更多危機。
mt: Following a head trauma treatment after being hit by an object obviously thrown by the visiting team, Rangers may face more crises.
ref: And there could be further trouble in store for Rangers after linesman Calum Spence had to be treated for a head wound after an object was apparently thrown from the away end.

src: Gerrard 對打敗艾爾 (Ayr) 進入 Betfred Cup 準決賽的隊陣作出了八項變動。
mt: Gerrard made eight changes to the team that defeated Ayr to reach the Betfred Cup semifinals.
ref: Gerrard made eight changes to the side which swept past Ayr into the Betfred Cup semi-finals.

src: 在另一邊，Holt 繼續派出在上禮拜打敗赫斯的相同利雲 11 人陣容，並為其藍衣隊伍如何輕鬆壓制對方感到無比欣慰。
mt: On the other side, Holt continues to send out the same 11-man team that defeated Hes last week, and is extremely pleased with how their blue-clad team has easily suppressed them.
ref: Holt, on the other hand, went with the same Livi 11 which took a point off Hearts last week and he would have been delighted with the way his well-drilled outfit suffocated their opponents at every turn.

src: 流浪可能掌握球的大部分控制權，但利雲斯頓卻在其持球的時間內打出了更出色的表現。
mt: Wandering may have controlled most of the ball, but Livingston performed even better during his possession time.
ref: Rangers may have dominated possession but Livingston did more with the ball they had.

src: 他們本應在開場兩分鐘後 Menga 首次做球讓 Scott Pittman 瞄準 Allan McGregor 的龍門射門時就已經成功入球，但這名前衛卻大意射偏了。
mt: They were supposed to have scored their first goal just two minutes into the game, with Scott Pittman aiming for Allan McGregor's goal shot, but this forward was slammed.
ref: They should have scored just two minutes in when Menga's first-time lay-off sent Scott Pittman through on Allan McGregor's goal but the midfielder tugged his big chance wide.

src: Keaghan Jacobs 的一記用力任意球把球送到了隊長 Craig Halkett 腳下，但他的防守搭檔 Alan Lithgow 的射門讓球僅擦過了左門柱。
mt: Keaghan Jacobs sent the ball to the foot of team captain Craig Halkett with a hard free kick, but his defensive partner Alan Lithgow shot the ball just past the left column.
ref: A deep Keaghan Jacobs free-kick then found skipper Craig Halkett but his defensive partner Alan Lithgow could only stab wide at the back post.

src: 流浪確實有奪得控制權，但他們卻對前場表現看似只有希望卻缺乏信心。
mt: Wandering indeed had control, but they seemed to have only hope for the performance in front of them yet lacked confidence.
ref: Rangers did grab control but there looked to be more hope than belief about their play in the final third.

src: Alfredo Morelos 確信他應在開場十五分鐘後與 Steven Lawless 相撞後獲得罰球機會，但裁判 Steven Thomson 卻駁回了這名哥倫比亞球員的申請。
mt: Alfredo Morelos was confident that he would be given a penalty kick opportunity after colliding with Steven Lawless 15 minutes into the game, but the referee, Steven Thomson, rejected the application of this Colombian player.
ref: Alfredo Morelos certainly felt he should have had a penalty on the quarter-hour mark as he and Steven Lawless collided but referee Steven Thomson waved away the Colombian's appeals.

src: 流浪只在上半場成功瞄準射門，但這名前任的 Ibrox 守門員 Liam Kelly 輕鬆擋下 Lassana Coulibaly 的頭槌和 Ovie Ejaria 微弱的射門。
mt: Wandering only successfully shot in the first half, but this former Ibrox goalkeeper Liam Kelly easily blocked Lassana Coulibaly's head and Ovie Ejaria's weak shot.
ref: Rangers managed just two first-half shots on target but former Ibrox goalkeeper Liam Kelly was barely troubled by Lassana Coulibaly's header and a tame Ovie Ejaria strike.

src: 利雲在第 34 分鐘的射門可能有違當下的比賽情況，但無容質疑的是，他們的確技高一籌。
mt: Li Yun's shot in the 34th minute may have been inconsistent with the current competition situation, but it is undeniable that they are indeed top-notch.
ref: While Livi's 34th-minute opener may have been against the run of play, no one can deny they deserved it for their graft alone.

src: 流浪再次錯失了 Jacobs 的死球。
mt: Wandering again missed Jacobs' dead ball.
ref: Again Rangers failed to deal with a deep Jacobs set-piece.

src: Scott Arfield 在 Declan Gallagher 將球傳給了 Scott Robinson 之後未能及時反應，即便 Robinson 本可輕鬆擊敗 Menga。
mt: Scott Arfield failed to react in time after passing the ball to Scott Robinson on Declan Gallagher, even though Robinson could have easily beaten Menga.
ref: Scott Arfield did not react as Declan Gallagher slotted the ball to Scott Robinson, who kept his cool to pick out Menga for a simple finish.

src: Gerrard 在以 Coulibaly 換入 Ryan Kent 後奠定了比賽大勢，這次換人在這名前峰 避開 Morelos 而 Kelly 英勇趕往阻攔射球後，幾乎可以說是立即見效。
mt: After switching to Ryan Kent with Coulibaly, Gerrard set the stage for the game, and this time, he avoided Morelos at the top of his list, and Kelly rushed off to block the shot, which was almost immediately apparent.
ref: Gerrard acted at the break as he swapped Coulibaly for Ryan Kent and the switch almost provided an immediate impact as the winger slotted in Morelos but the impressive Kelly raced from his line to block.

src: 但利雲斯頓的 Lithgow 和 Halkett 不斷長傳，繼續以他們擅長的戰術壓制客隊。
mt: However, Lithgow and Halkett of Livingston continued to spread the news, continuing to use their tactics to suppress the visiting team.
ref: But Livingston continued to suck the visitors into playing exactly the type of game they enjoy, with Lithgow and Halkett sweeping up long ball after long ball.

src: Holt 方在最後階段可以說是儘量拉開了領先優勢，但 McGregor 卻在 Lithgow 嘗試從角落射門前成功擋下了 Jacobs 的傳球。
mt: The Holt team did their best to open the lead in the final stages, but McGregor managed to successfully block Jacobs' pass in Lithgow's attempt to shoot from the corner.
ref: Holt's side could have stretched their lead in the final stages but McGregor stood up well to deny Jacobs before Lithgow headed wide from the corner.

src: 流浪替補球員 Glenn Middleton 與 Jacobs 發生衝突為球員換來一次罰球機會，但 Thomson 再次成功攔下入球。
mt: A replacement player, Glenn Middleton, clashed with Jacobs to give the player a free throw opportunity, but Thomson again successfully blocked the goal.
ref: Rangers substitute Glenn Middleton had another late claim for a penalty as he tangled with Jacobs but again Thomson looked away.

src: 天文年曆：蓋革計數器的發明者
mt: Astronomical Calendar: Inventor of Geiger counter
ref: Almanac: The inventor of the Geiger Counter

src: 我們的「禮拜天早晨 (Sunday Morning)」天文年曆顯示：1882 年 9 月 30 日（136 年前的今天），我們可以看到… 之後的物理學家蓋革 (Johannes Wilhelm "Hans" Geiger) 出生於德國。
mt: Our "Sunday Morning" astronomical calendar shows that on September 30, 1882 (today before 136), we can see... the physicists behind us, Johannes Wilhelm "Hans" Geiger, were born in Germany.
ref: And now a page from our "Sunday Morning" Almanac: September 30, 1882, 136 years ago today, and COUNTING ... the day the future physicist Johannes Wilhelm "Hans" Geiger was born in Germany.

src: 蓋革開發了一種檢測和測量放射作用的方法，該發明最終被發展為名為蓋革計數器的裝置。
mt: Geiger developed a method to detect and measure radiation, which was eventually developed into a device called Geiger counters.
ref: Geiger developed a method for detecting and measuring radioactivity, an invention that eventually led to the device known as the Geiger Counter.

src: 作為科學的一個支柱發明，蓋革計數器亦成為了流行文化中的骨幹元素。在 1950 年的電影《Bells of Coronado》中，主角 Roy Rogers 和 Dale Evans 就是一對看似不可能的牛仔科學家：
mt: As a pillar of science, the Geiger counter has also become a backbone of popular culture. In the 1950 film Bells of Coronado, the main characters Roy Rogers and Dale Evans are a pair of seemingly impossible cowboy scientists:
ref: A mainstay of science ever since, the Geiger Counter became a pop culture mainstay as well, as in the 1950 movie "Bells of Coronado," starring those seemingly unlikely cowpoke scientists Roy Rogers and Dale Evans:

src: 男人：「那到底是什麼東西？」
mt: Man: "What is that thing?"
ref: Man: "What in the world is that?"

src: Rogers：「這是一個蓋革計數器，用來找到好像鈾之類的放射性礦物。
mt: Rogers: "This is a Geiger counter to find radioactive minerals like uranium.
ref: Rogers: "It's a Geiger Counter, used to locate radioactive minerals, such as uranium.

src: 當你戴上這對耳機，你可以確實聽到這些礦物放射性原子的作用。」
mt: When you put on these headphones, you can actually hear the effects of these radioactive minerals. "
ref: When you put these earphones on, you can actually hear the effects of the atoms given off by the radioactivity in the minerals."

src: Evans：「看看，這裏頭正卡喀作響！」
mt: Evans: "Look, there's a rake in the head!"
ref: Evans: "Say, it sure is popping now!"

src: 蓋革就在他 63 歲生日前的幾天，在 1945 年去世。
mt: Geiger died just a few days before his 63rd birthday in 1945.
ref: "Hans" Geiger died in 1945, just a few days short of his 63rd birthday.

src: 但這個以他的姓名命名的發明卻繼續流傳至今。
mt: But this invention, named after him, has continued to be passed down to this day.
ref: But the invention that bears his name lives on.

src: 全新的癌症疫苗可以讓免疫系統學會「看到」變異細胞
mt: New cancer vaccines allow the immune system to see mutated cells.
ref: New cancer vaccine can teach the immune system to 'see' rogue cells

src: 全新的癌症疫苗可以讓免疫系統學會「看到」並殺死變異細胞
mt: New cancer vaccines allow the immune system to see and kill mutated cells.
ref: New cancer vaccine can teach the immune system to 'see' rogue cells and kill them

src: 疫苗在療程中教會免疫系統辨認出變異細胞
mt: The vaccine is used to identify mutated cells by the immune system during treatment
ref: Vaccine teaches immune system to recognize rogue cells as part of treatment

src: 其中的方法包括從病患體內抽出免疫細胞，再在實驗室中對其進行改造
mt: The methods include extracting immune cells from the patient's body and modifying them in a laboratory.
ref: Method involves extracting immune cells from a patient, altering them in lab

src: 它們之後便可以「看到」多種癌症中常見的蛋白質，之後便被重新打入病患體內
mt: They can then “see” the proteins that are common in many types of cancer, and then they are re-entered into the patient’s body.
ref: They can then 'see' a protein common to many cancers and then reinjected

src: 試驗疫苗在不同癌症病患身上皆可見出色成果。
mt: The experimental vaccine has achieved excellent results in various cancer patients.
ref: A trial vaccine is showing promising results in patients with a range of cancers.

src: 疫苗教會免疫系統辨認出變異細胞，一名接受此疫苗治療的女性在超過 18 個月後發現其原有的卵巢癌已然消失。
mt: The immune system of the vaccine recognizes mutated cells, and a woman who received this vaccine treatment found that her original ovarian cancer had disappeared over 18 months later.
ref: One woman treated with the vaccine, which teaches the immune system to recognize rogue cells, saw her ovarian cancer disappear for more than 18 months.

src: 這個方法包括從病患體內抽取免疫細胞，在實驗室對其進行改造以讓其可以「看到」多種癌症中常見的一種名為 HER2 的蛋白質，再將這些細胞重新打入病患體內。
mt: This method includes extracting immune cells from the patient's body, modifying them in a laboratory so that they can "see" a protein called HER2, which is common among various cancers, and then re-inserting these cells into the patient's body.
ref: The method involves extracting immune cells from a patient, altering them in the laboratory so they can "see" a protein common to many cancers called HER2, and then reinjecting the cells.

src: 位於馬里蘭州 Bethesda 的美國國家癌症研究所 (US National Cancer Institute) 的 Jay Berzofsky 教授表示：「我們的成果顯示我們已研發出的疫苗成果顯著。」
mt: “Our results show that the vaccine we’ve developed is remarkable,” said Professor Jay Berzofsky of the US National Cancer Institute, Bethesda, Maryland, at the US National Cancer Institute.
ref: Professor Jay Berzofsky, of the US National Cancer Institute in Bethesda, Maryland, said: "Our results suggest that we have a very promising vaccine."

src: HER2「推動數種癌症的生長，」其中包括乳房、卵巢、肺和大腸直腸癌，Berzofsky 教授解釋道。
mt: HER2 “promotes the growth of several types of cancer,” including breast, ovary, lung and colorectal cancer, Professor Berzofsky explains.
ref: HER2 "drives the growth of several types of cancer," including breast, ovarian, lung and colorectal cancers, Prof Berzofsky explained.

src: 另一個類似的方法是從病患體內抽取免疫細胞，並「教導」它們如何瞄準癌細胞。這個療法已被證明可有效治療白血病的一種。
mt: Another similar method is to extract immune cells from the patient and “teach them” how to target cancer cells. This treatment has been proven to be effective in treating leukemia.
ref: A similar approach of taking immune cells out of patients and "teaching" them how to target cancer cells has worked in treating a type of leukaemia.

src: 肯伊·威斯特 (Kanye West) 表明支持川普，並在 SNL 亮相時頭戴「讓美國再次偉大 (MAGA)」標語帽子。
mt: Kanye West has expressed support for Trump, wearing a "Make America Great Again (MAGA)" tagline hat when SNL debuts.
ref: Kanye West Embarked on a Pro-Trump Diatribe, Wearing a MAGA Hat, After his SNL Appearance.

src: 但大眾並不買單
mt: But the public doesn't buy it.
ref: It Didn't Go Well

src: 威斯特在週六夜現場 (Saturday Night Live) 重大讚美國總統唐納德·川普 (Donald Trump)，並表示將在 2020 年參選，贏得台下觀眾一片噓聲。
mt: West praised U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday Night Live and said he would run for office in 2020, winning the audience’s boos.
ref: Kanye West was booed in the studio during a Saturday Night Live after a rambling performance in which he praised U.S. President Donald Trump and said he would run for office in 2020.

src: 在當晚演唱第三首名為 Ghost Town 的曲目後，他頭戴「讓美國再次偉大 (Make America Great)」標語帽子，大談反民主黨言論並重申對川普的支持立場。
mt: After singing the third track, Ghost Town, that night, he wore a "Make America Great" tagline hat and talked about anti-Democratic Party remarks and reaffirmed his support for Trump.
ref: After performing his third song of the night, called Ghost Town in which he was wearing a Make America Great cap, he went on a rant against the Democrats and reiterated his support for Trump.

src: 「有很多次我在與一名白人交談的時候，他們都會問我：『你怎麼可以支持川普，他可是種族歧視者？』
mt: “Many times when I was talking to a white person, they would ask me, ‘How can you support Trump? He’s a racist?’”
ref: "So many times I talk to a white person and they say: "How could you like Trump, he's racist?"

src: 但是，如果我如此在意種族歧視問題，我大概在很久以前就已經搬離美國，」他說道。
mt: But if I cared so much about the issue of racial discrimination, I probably would have moved out of the US a long time ago, "he says.
ref: Well, if I was concerned about racism I would've moved out of America a long time ago," he said.

src: SNL 的開場小品中，好萊塢男星麥特·戴蒙 (Matt Damon) 嘲諷布雷特·卡瓦諾 (Brett Kavanaugh) 在參議院司法委員會就 Christine Blasey Ford 對其提出的性騷擾控訴提供的證詞。
mt: In the opening scene of SNL, Hollywood star Matt Damon mocks Brett Kavanaugh’s testimony to Christine Blasey Ford’s allegations of sexual harassment on the Senate Judiciary Committee.
ref: SNL started the show with a skit starring Matt Damon in which the Hollywood star made fun of Brett Kavanaugh's testimony before the Senate Judicial Committee on sexual assault claims made by Christine Blasey Ford.

src: 儘管未作廣播，但威斯特言論的影片卻被喜劇明星克里斯·洛克 (Chris Rock) 上傳至社交媒體。
mt: Despite not broadcasting, the West's comments were uploaded to social media by comedian Chris Rock.
ref: Although it was not broadcast, the footage of West's rant was uploaded to social media by comedian Chris Rock.

src: 未清楚洛克此舉是否希望以此嘲諷威斯特。
mt: It is unclear whether Locke's move hopes to mock West with this.
ref: It is unclear if Rock was trying to mock West with the posting.

src: 同時，威斯特亦向觀眾投訴他在後台也因頭上所戴的帽子倍受批評。
mt: At the same time, West also complained to the audience that he was heavily criticized in the background for wearing a hat on his head.
ref: Also, West had complained to the audience that he had got a hard time backstage about his head wear.

src: 「他們在後台霸凌我。
mt: "They were bullying me backstage.
ref: "They bullied me backstage.

src: 他們說，『不要戴著這頂帽子到台上。』
mt: They said, "Don't wear this hat on the stage."
ref: They said, 'don't go out there with that hat on.'

src: 他們霸凌我耶！
mt: They're bullying me!
ref: They bullied me!

src: 然後他們說我已然在萬劫不復之地，」他說道，根據 Washington Examiner 報導。
mt: Then they said I was in a land that would never be recovered, "he said, according to the Washington Examiner.
ref: And then they say I'm in a sunken place," he said, according to the Washington Examiner.

src: 威斯特繼續表示：「你想要看看萬劫不復之地嗎？」他隨後表示將「穿上我的超人披風，然後你們就再也不能叫我做什麼了。你想要讓世界進步？
mt: West continued, "Do you want to see a land that never comes back?" He then said, "Put on my Superman cloak, and then you can't tell me to do anything again. Do you want to make the world a better place?
ref: West went on: "You wanna see the sunken place?" saying that he would "put my superman cape on, because this means you can't tell me what to do. You want the world to move forward?

src: 試試看愛。」
mt: Try love."
ref: Try love."

src: 根據綜藝 (Variety) 的報導，他的言論至少兩次讓觀眾發出噓聲，就連 SNL 團隊成員也看似尷尬無比，其中一人還向記者表示：「整個攝影棚瞬間安靜了下來。」
mt: According to a Variety report, his comments have at least twice caused the audience to shriek, and even the SNL team members seem embarrassed. One of them even told the reporter, "The entire studio was suddenly quiet."
ref: His comments drew boos at least twice from the audience and SNL cast members appeared to be embarrassed, Variety reported, with one person there telling the publication: "The entire studio fell dead silent."

src: 威斯特這次亮相為頂替歌手亞莉安娜·格蘭德 (Ariana Grande) 的臨時替補嘉賓。亞莉安娜的前男友，也就是饒舌歌手麥克·米勒 (Mac Miller)，在數天前不幸去世。
mt: West made this appearance as a temporary replacement for singer Ariana Grande. Ariana's ex-boyfriend, rapper Mac Miller, died a few days ago.
ref: West had been brought in as a late replacement for singer Ariana Grande, whose former boyfriend, the rapper Mac Miller had died a few days ago.

src: 威斯特身穿沛綠雅氣泡礦泉水裝扮，表演了歌曲《I Love it》，震驚全場觀眾。
mt: West, dressed in a mineral water bubble costume, performed the song "I Love It", shocking the entire audience.
ref: West puzzled many with a performance of the song I Love it, dressed as a Perrier Bottle.

src: 威斯特受到共和黨組織 TPUSA 主席 Candace Turner 支持，她發表 tweet 推送表示：「致最勇敢的靈魂之一：謝謝你挺身而出面對暴民圍攻。」
mt: West received support from Republican TPUSA President Candace Turner, who tweeted: "To one of the bravest souls: Thank you for standing up to the mob's siege."
ref: West got backing from head of conservative group TPUSA, Candace Turner who tweeted: "To one of the most courageous spirits: THANK YOU FOR STANDING UP TO THE MOB."

src: 但脫口秀主持 Karen Hunter 卻發表 tweet 推送表示，威斯特只是「貫徹其一貫風格，而這是非常美好的一件事。」
mt: But Karen Hunter, who hosts the talk show, tweeted that West was "just following its consistent style, and it's a very beautiful thing."
ref: But talk show host Karen Hunter tweeted that West was simply "being who he is and that's absolutely wonderful."

src: 「但我選擇不會支持（透過購買他的音樂作品或服裝或支持他的「藝術作品」）一名我認為接納且推廣對我的社會有害思想的人。
mt: “But I chose not to support (by buying his music or costumes or by supporting his “artwork”) a person I think would be accepting and promoting a socially harmful idea to me.
ref: "But I chose NOT to reward someone (by purchasing his music or clothing or supporting his "art") who I believe is embracing and spewing ideology that is harmful to my community.

src: 他有自由。
mt: He's free.
ref: He is free.

src: 我們也是，」她表示。
mt: We are too, "she says.
ref: So are we," she added.

src: 在節目開始前，這名饒舌歌手在 Twitter 宣布他已改名，且他現在為「本來叫做肯伊·威斯特的人。」
mt: Before the show started, the rapper announced on Twitter that he had changed his name and that he was now "Keny West."
ref: Before the show, the rapper announced on Twitter that he had changed his name, saying that he was now "the being formally known as Kanye West."

src: 他並非第一個改名的藝人。之前的 Diddy，亦擁有 Puff Daddy、Puffy 和 P Diddy 等不同稱號。
mt: He is not the first artist to change his name. His previous Diddy was known by different names, such as Puff Daddy, Puffy and P Diddy.
ref: He is not the first artist to change their name and follows in the footsteps of Diddy, also known as Puff Daddy, Puffy and P Diddy.

src: 另一名饒舌歌手 Snoop Dogg，也擁有 Snoop Lion 之名。就連前陣子剛過世的音樂傳奇王子 (Prince)，也曾將他的名字改為一個符號再改回為 Prince。
mt: Another rapper, Snoop Dogg, is also known as Snoop Lion. Even Prince, who recently passed away, has changed his name to a symbol and changed it back to Prince.
ref: Fellow rapper, Snoop Dogg has had the name Snoop Lion and of course the late music legend Prince, changed his name to a symbol and then the artist previously known as Prince.

src: 貝爾法斯特餐廳刀刺案以殺人未遂遭起訴
mt: Belfast restaurant knife stabbing charges attempted murder.
ref: Attempted murder charge over Belfast restaurant stabbing

src: 在禮拜五東貝爾法斯特，一名男子在餐廳遭刺傷，隨後一名 45 歲男子以殺人未遂指控遭起訴。
mt: On Friday in Belfast, a man was stabbed at a restaurant and subsequently a 45-year-old man was charged with attempted murder.
ref: A 45-year-old man has been charged with attempted murder after a man was stabbed in a restaurant in east Belfast on Friday.

src: 警方表示，事件發生在 Ballyhackamore。
mt: Police said the incident occurred at Ballyhackamore.
ref: The incident happened in Ballyhackamore, police said.

src: 被告預計將在禮拜一列席貝爾法斯特裁判法院。
mt: The defendant is expected to appear at Belfast Magistrates' Court on Monday.
ref: The defendant is expected to appear before Belfast Magistrates' Court on Monday.

src: 指控將由刑事檢控服務審核。
mt: The charges will be reviewed by the Criminal Prosecution Service.
ref: The charges will be reviewed by the Public Prosecution Service.

src: 冰與火之歌：權力遊戲 (Game of Thrones) 男星基特·哈靈頓 (Kit Harington) 批評有毒的男子氣概
mt: Song of Ice and Fire: Game of Thrones Kit Harington criticizes toxic masculinity
ref: Game of Thrones star Kit Harington hits out at toxic masculinity

src: 哈靈頓以其在 HBO 的中世紀戰爭奇幻系列《冰與火之歌：權力遊戲》中飾演舞弄刀槍的瓊恩·雪諾 (Jon Snow) 一角著名。
mt: Harlington is known for his role as Jon Snow, a macho gun character in HBO's medieval war fantasy series A Song of Ice and Fire: Game of Thrones.
ref: Kit Harington is known for his sword-swinging role as Jon Snow in HBO's violent medieval fantasy series Game of Thrones.

src: 但這名 31 歲的演員卻批評這名充滿男子氣概的經典角色，並表示電視節目中的這類角色讓年輕男孩認為他們需要成為硬漢以贏得尊重。
mt: However, this 31-year-old actor criticized the classic manly character and said that such characters in TV programs made young boys think they need to become tough guys to win respect.
ref: But the actor, 31, has hit out at the stereotype of the macho hero, saying such roles on screen mean young boys often feel like they have to be tough to be respected.

src: 在與 Sunday Times Culture 的一次訪談中，基特表示他相信「事情有些不妥」且提出應如何在這個 #MeToo 時代解決有毒的男子氣概問題。
mt: In an interview with the Sunday Times Culture, Kit said he believed "something was wrong" and suggested how to solve the toxic masculinity problem in this #MeToo era.
ref: Speaking to The Sunday Times Culture, Kit said he believes 'something's gone wrong' and questioned how to tackle the problem of toxic masculinity in the #MeToo era.

src: 基特最近剛迎娶同樣為 31 歲的《冰與火之歌：權力遊戲》同劇女星蘿絲·萊斯莉 (Rose Leslie)。他表示他對這個問題「感同身受」。
mt: Kit recently married Rose Leslie, a 31-year-old costar of Game of Thrones, who said he felt “sympathetic” to the subject.
ref: Kit, who recently married his Game of Thrones co-star Rose Leslie, also 31, admitted he feels 'quite strongly' about addressing the issue.

src: 「我在此刻切身強烈地感覺到了這個問題—我們到底對男子氣概有什麼錯誤解讀？，」他說道。
mt: "At this moment I felt strongly the problem--what kind of misperception do we have about manhood?" he says.
ref: 'I feel personally, quite strongly, at the moment - where have we gone wrong with masculinity?,' he said.

src: 「我們在男孩長大的時候是怎麼教導他們的，就我們現在面臨的問題而言？」
mt: "How did we teach the boys when they were growing up, in terms of the problems that we're facing right now?"
ref: 'What have we been teaching men when they're growing up, in terms of the problem we see now?'

src: 基特相信電視上的非常具備男子氣概的角色可能助長了這波有毒的男子氣概問題。
mt: Kit believes that the very masculine role on television may have contributed to this toxic masculinity problem.
ref: Kit believes television may be partly responsible for the rise in toxic masculinity thanks to its very masculine characters.

src: 他繼續說道：「什麼是先天的？什麼是後天教導的？
mt: He continued, "What is innate, and what is innate, and what is innate, teaching?"
ref: He continued: 'What's innate and what's taught?

src: 電視上、街上教導的內容，讓年輕男孩感到他們必須成為這樣的一種男性？
mt: The content on TV and in the streets makes young boys feel that they must become such a kind of man?
ref: What is taught on TV, and in the streets, that makes young boys feel they have to be this certain side of being a man?

src: 我認為我們面前最重要的問題是—我們可以如何改變這種現象？
mt: I think the most important question before us -- how can we change this?
ref: I think that's really one of the big questions in our time - how do we change that?

src: 因為顯而易見的是，對年輕男孩而言事情的確有些不對勁。」
mt: Because it's obvious that there's something really wrong with young boys. "
ref: Because clearly something has gone wrong for young men.'

src: 在訪問中，他亦承認在劇集在明年暑假完結後，他不將參加任何《冰與火之歌：權力遊戲》的前傳或續集拍攝，並表示他已「受夠了戰場和馬匹」。
mt: During his visit, he also admitted that after the series concluded next summer vacation, he would not participate in any prequel or sequel filming of "Song of Ice and Fire: Game of Thrones" and said he had "suffused the battlefield and horses".
ref: In the interview he also admitted that he wouldn't be doing any Game of Thrones prequels or sequels when the series comes to an end next summer, saying he is 'done with battlefields and horses'.

src: 從十一月開始，基特將在山姆·謝普 (Sam Shepard) 的《真實的西部 (True West)》話劇重演。劇情講述有關一名電影製片人和其作為強盜的弟弟的一個故事。
mt: Beginning in November, Kit will reenact in Sam Shepard’s True West play. The story follows a film producer and his brother, a bandit.
ref: From November Kit will star in a revival of Sam Shepard's True West which is the story of a film producer and his brother, who is a robber.

src: 這名演員在最近表示，他認為認識他的妻子蘿絲是在拍攝《冰與火之歌：權力遊戲》中最美好的事情。
mt: This actor recently stated that he believes knowing his wife Rose is the most beautiful thing in filming "Song of Ice and Fire: Game of Thrones".
ref: The actor recently revealed that he considers meeting his wife Rose to be the best thing to come out of Game of Thrones.

src: 「我在這個電視劇中認識了我的妻子，所以這也讓我收穫了我未來的家庭，而我的未來也從此而啟，」他說道。
mt: "I met my wife in this TV show, so it also gave me a future family, and my future was inspired by it," he said.
ref: 'I met my wife in this show, so in that way it gave me my future family, and my life from here on in,' he said.

src: 蘿絲在這套贏得艾美獎多項殊榮的奇幻系列中飾演伊葛瑞特 (Ygritte)，也就是基特飾演的瓊恩·雪諾所愛之人。
mt: Rose played Ygritte in this series of Emmy-winning fantasy series, which is the love of Jon Snow, played by Kit.
ref: Rose played Ygritte, the love interest of Kit's character Jon Snow, in the Emmy award-winning fantasy series.

src: 在 2018 年 6 月，兩人在萊斯莉在蘇格蘭的家族莊園完婚。
mt: In June 2018, they were married at Leslie's family estate in Scotland.
ref: The couple married in June 2018 on the grounds of Leslie's family estate in Scotland.

src: HIV / 愛滋病：中國劇報出現 14% 增幅的新個案
mt: HIV/AIDS: 14% increase in new cases reported in the China Times
ref: HIV/Aids: China reports 14% surge in new cases

src: 中國公布出現 14% 增幅的公民感染 HIV 和愛滋病個案。
mt: China has reported a 14% increase in HIV and AIDS among citizens.
ref: China has announced a 14% jump in the number of its citizens who are living with HIV and Aids.

src: 衛生官員稱，國家境內超過 820,000 名人士已受感染。
mt: Health officials say more than 820,000 people within the country have been infected.
ref: More than 820,000 people are affected in the country, health officials say.

src: 單單在 2018 年下半年，就錄得約 40,000 個新個案。
mt: In the second half of 2018 alone, about 40,000 new cases were recorded.
ref: About 40,000 new cases were reported in the second quarter of 2018 alone.

src: 大部分的新個案都是透過性行為傳播致病，與之前的情況有所不同。
mt: Most of the new cases are transmitted through sexual behavior, which is different from previous situations.
ref: The vast majority of new cases were transmitted through sex, marking a change from the past.

src: 在之前，HIV 病毒是因為受感染的血液輸送才在中國某些地區迅速傳播開來。
mt: In the past, HIV was spread rapidly in some parts of China due to the transmission of infected blood.
ref: Traditionally, HIV spread rapidly through some parts of China as a result of infected blood transfusions.

src: 但根據中國衛生官員在雲南省的一次會議表示，因此獲 HIV 感染的人數已驟降為近乎零人。
mt: However, according to a meeting of Chinese health officials in Yunnan Province, the number of people infected with HIV has suddenly dropped to nearly zero.
ref: But the number of people contracting HIV in this way had been reduced to almost zero, Chinese health officials said at a conference in Yunnan province.

src: 但是，隨著每年的增幅，在中國感染 HIV 病毒和愛滋病的人數已增加至 100,000 人。
mt: However, with the annual increase, the number of people infected with HIV and AIDS in China has increased to 100,000.
ref: Year-on-year, however, the number of those living with HIV and Aids in China has risen by 100,000 people.

src: 透過性行為的 HIV 病毒傳播為中國的同志 (LGBT) 文化面臨的一個嚴重問題。
mt: The transmission of HIV through sexual acts is a serious problem for China's LGBT culture.
ref: HIV transmission through sex is an acute issue in China's LGBT community.

src: 在 1997 年，同性戀在中國被列為非刑事行為，但對同志的歧視情況卻仍然持續。
mt: In 1997, homosexuality was listed as a non-criminal act in China, but discrimination against homosexuals continued.
ref: Homosexuality was decriminalized in China in 1997, but discrimination against LGBT people is said to be rife.

src: 受困於國家的保守觀念，研究預計 70-90% 曾與同性發生性關係的男性在最終仍將迎娶女性。
mt: Trapped by the conservative concept of the state, research predicts that 70-90% of men who have had sex with men will eventually marry women.
ref: Because of the country's conservative values, studies have estimated that 70-90% of men who have sex with men will eventually marry women.

src: 這種病毒正是透過此類關係中未受保護的性行為傳播開來。
mt: This virus is transmitted through unprotected sexual behavior in such relationships.
ref: Many of the transmissions of the diseases come from inadequate sexual protections in these relationships.

src: 自 2003 年啟，中國政府已承諾對大眾提供 HIV 藥物治療，以幫助打擊這個問題。
mt: Since its inception in 2003, the Chinese government has committed to providing HIV medication to the public to help combat this problem.
ref: Since 2003, China's government has promised universal access to HIV medication as part of an effort to tackle the issue.

src: 瑪克欣·沃特斯 (Maxine Waters) 否認其工作人員洩露了共和黨參議員資訊，狠批其為「危險謊言」和「陰謀論」
mt: Maxine Waters denied that its staff had leaked information about Republican senators, calling them "dangerous lies" and "conspiracy theories."
ref: Maxine Waters denies staffer leaked GOP senators' data, blasts 'dangerous lies' and 'conspiracy theories'

src: 美國代表瑪克欣·沃特斯被指控其工作人員在維基百科頁面公布了三名共和黨美國參議員的個人資訊，沃特斯在禮拜六否認了相關指控。
mt: U.S. Representative Mark Watson was accused of posting three Republican U.S. Senators' personal information on Wikipedia, with Walter denying the allegations on Saturday.
ref: U.S. Rep. Maxine Waters on Saturday denounced allegations that a member of her staff had posted the personal information of three Republican U.S. senators onto the lawmakers' Wikipedia pages.

src: 這名洛杉磯民主黨員聲稱這是由「極右翼」的專家和網站栽贓的虛假指控。
mt: This Los Angeles Democrat claims this is a false accusation of "extreme right-wing" experts and websites framed.
ref: The Los Angeles Democrat asserted that the claims were being pedaled by "ultra-right wing" pundits and websites.

src: 「謊言、謊言，和更多的卑鄙謊言，」沃特斯在 Twitter 發表的聲明稱。
mt: “Lies, lies, and more underhanded lies,” Walters said in a statement on Twitter.
ref: "Lies, lies, and more despicable lies," Waters said in a statement on Twitter.

src: 洩露的資訊據報包括這些美國參議員的住家地址和電話號碼，受害人包括南卡羅萊納州的林賽·格萊厄姆 (Lindsey Graham)、以及同樣為猶他州的李麥克 (Mike Lee) 和奧林·哈奇 (Orrin Hatch)。
mt: The leaked information is reportedly including the home address and phone number of these U.S. senators, victims include Lindsey Graham from South Carolina, as well as Mike Lee and Orrin Hatch from Utah.
ref: The released information reportedly included the home addresses and phone numbers for U.S. Sens. Lindsey Graham of South Carolina, and Mike Lee and Orrin Hatch, both of Utah.

src: 這些資訊在禮拜四出現在網上，由一名在國會山莊 (Capitol Hill) 的不知名人士發布。當時正舉行有關布雷特·卡瓦諾 (Brett Kavanaugh) 最高法院大法官任命的參議院小組聽證會。
mt: The information appeared online on Thursday by an unknown person in Capitol Hill, who was then holding a Senate panel hearing on the appointment of the Justice of the Supreme Court of Brett Kavanaugh.
ref: The information appeared online Thursday, posted by an unknown person on Capitol Hill during a Senate panel's hearing on the sexual misconduct allegations against Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh.

src: 這次洩露在三名參議員完成對卡瓦諾的提問後發生。
mt: This leak occurred after three senators had completed their questioning of Cavanaugh.
ref: The leak came sometime after the three senators had questioned Kavanaugh.

src: 例如 Gateway Pundit 和 RedState 等共和黨網站稱發布來源的 IP 位址連到了沃特斯的辦公室，並公布了沃特斯一名員工的資訊，山莊報導稱。
mt: For example, Republican websites such as Gateway Pundit and RedState claim that the IP address from the source is connected to Waters' office and published information about an employee of Waters, a mountain house reported.
ref: Conservative sites such as Gateway Pundit and RedState reported that the IP address that identifies the source of the posts was associated with Waters" office and released the information of a member of Waters' staff, the Hill reported.

src: 「此毫無根據的指控是完全錯誤的，是絕對的謊言，」沃特斯堅稱。
mt: “This baseless accusation is completely wrong, it’s an absolute lie,” Walters asserts.
ref: "This unfounded allegation is completely false and an absolute lie," Waters continued.

src: 「我的辦公室成員—他的身分、個人資訊、和安全都因這些不實且虛假的指控受到了侵—不可能與這些資訊的洩露有關。
mt: “My office members—his identity, personal information, and security—are all compromised by these false and false allegations—it can’t be linked to the disclosure of that information.
ref: "The member of my staff - whose identity, personal information, and safety have been compromised as a result of these fraudulent and false allegations - was in no way responsible for the leak of this information.

src: 此不實指控為全然虛假且是一個徹頭徹尾的謊言。」
mt: This false accusation is a complete lie and a complete lie."
ref: This unfounded allegation is completely false and an absolute lie."

src: 沃特斯的聲明在網上迅速招來批評聲浪，其中包括前任白宮新聞秘書佛萊謝 (Ari Fleischer)。
mt: Waters' statement quickly sparked criticism online, including former White House press secretary Ari Fleischer.
ref: Waters' statement quickly drew criticism online, including from former White House press secretary Ari Fleischer.

src: 「這是憤怒慢慢的否認，」佛萊謝寫道。
mt: "It's a gradual denial of anger," says Fleisher.
ref: "This denial is angry," Fleischer wrote.

src: 「這表示她沒有身為國會議員應有的氣度。
mt: "That means she doesn't have the dignity of a congressman.
ref: "This suggests she doesn't have the temperament to be a Member of Congress.

src: 當一個人受到不實指控時，他們不應動怒。
mt: When a person is falsely accused, they should not be angry.
ref: When someone is accused of something they didn't do, they must not be angry.

src: 他們不應語帶挑釁。
mt: They shouldn't be provocative.
ref: They must not be defiant.

src: 他們不應質問指控者背後的目的。
mt: They shouldn't question the accusers for what they're after.
ref: They must not question the motives of the accuser.

src: 他們必須保持冷靜。」
mt: They have to stay calm."
ref: They must be calm and serene."

src: 佛萊謝沃特斯的回應與民主黨對卡瓦諾法官的批評作比較，卡瓦諾被批評指在禮拜四的聽證會中表現過於憤怒。
mt: Fleshwater's response was compared to the Democratic Party's criticism of Judge Kavano, who was criticized for showing too much anger at a hearing on Thursday.
ref: Fleischer was appearing to compare Waters' reaction to the Democrats' criticism of Judge Kavanaugh, who was accused by critics of seeming too angry during Thursday's hearing.

src: 正競選在中期選舉取代沃特斯一席的共和黨參選人Omar Navarro，亦在 Twitter 發表了其看法。
mt: The Republican candidate Omar Navarro, who replaced Waters in the midterm elections, also expressed his views on Twitter.
ref: Omar Navarro, a Republican candidate running to unseat Waters in the midterm elections, also voiced his thoughts on Twitter.

src: 「如果是真的話，事情可就大了，」他在 tweet 推送中稱。
mt: "If it's true, then things can get bigger," he says in a tweet.
ref: "Big if true," he tweeted.

src: 在她的聲明中，沃特斯表示她的辦公室已「就此不實指控通知相關機關和執法機構。
mt: In her statement, Waters stated that her office had "notified the relevant authorities and law enforcement agencies with this false accusation."
ref: In her statement, Waters said her office had alerted "the appropriate authorities and law enforcement entities of these fraudulent claims.

src: 「我們將確保找出背後的肇事者，」她表示，「並確保他們將為他們這些對我的員工的任何和所有成員造成傷害的危險行為承擔法律責任。」
mt: “We will make sure that the perpetrators behind it are identified,” she said. “And ensure that they will be held accountable for any and all of the dangerous acts that they do to my employees.”
ref: "We will ensure that the perpetrators will be revealed," she continued, "and that they will be held legally liable for all of their actions that are destructible and dangerous to any and all members of my staff."

src: 《凸搥特派員：三度出擊 (Johnny English Strikes Again)》影評—後繼無力的羅恩·阿特金森 (Rowan Atkinson) 特務鬧劇
mt: Johnny English Strikes Again (Critique) Film Review – Rowan Atkinson (Independent)
ref: Johnny English Strikes Again review - underpowered Rowan Atkinson spy spoof

src: 在任何擁有英國元素的電影中找出英國脫歐特徵已然成為再自然不過的習慣，而在這次強尼·英格力 (Johnny English) 動作喜劇系列中更是如此。這個系列首次於 2003 年推出，並在 2011 年釋出第二部的《凸槌特派員：二度出包 (Johnny English Reborn)》。
mt: Finding out British Brexit features in any movie with British elements has become a natural habit, especially in this Johnny English action comedy series. The series was first released in 2003 and the second Johnny English Reborn was released in 2011.
ref: It's traditional now to look for Brexit significances in any new film with a British slant and that does seem applicable to this revival of the Johnny English action-comedy spoof franchise - which started back in 2003 with Johnny English and spluttered back to life in 2011 with Johnny English Reborn.

src: 這套嘲諷我們目前所處的明顯不利狀況的鬧劇，是否將為我們國家帶來新的出口機會？
mt: Will this series of far-sighted, clearly unfavorable events that we are currently facing bring us a new opportunity to export?
ref: Will tongue-in-cheek self-satire on the subject of how obviously rubbish we are be the nation's new export opportunity?

src: 不管如此，這名凸眼且表情呆滯的凸槌特派員英格力已然獲得第二次機會重炒冷飯—在非英語電影地區作為一個廣為人知的喜劇代表人物，這個名字擁有莫大號召力。
mt: Despite this, the shrewd and expressionless shrewd shrewd specialist Inglewood has already won a second chance to re-fry the cold rice – as a well-known comedic icon in non-English-language film regions, this name has immense appeal.
ref: At any rate, the pop-eyed, rubber-faced incompetent Johnny English has had his license to cock things up renewed for the second time - that name of his signaling more than anything else that he is a broad comic creation designed for non-English-speaking cinemagoing territories.

src: 當然，他也還是那名笨拙的特務。儘管他那奇特的魅力與自負與法國的烏龍探長克魯索 (Clouseau) 由一點相像，同時也保留了一絲豆豆先生的特色，以及那個在 2012 年倫敦奧運會開幕式上為火戰車主題曲彈出了一個單一音符的男子的特別氣質。
mt: Of course, he was also the clumsy operative. Despite his peculiar charm and self-righteousness resembling French oolong detective Clouseau, he retained the special character of Mr. Bean, as well as the special quality of the man who played a single note on the theme song for the 2012 London Olympics opening ceremony.
ref: He is of course the daft secret agent who despite his bizarre pretensions to smoothie glamour has got a little bit of Clouseau, a dash of Mr Bean and a dollop of that chap contributing a single note to the Chariots of Fire theme tune at the London 2012 Olympics opening ceremony.

src: 這個角色最初亦是基於阿特金森曾經在巴克萊卡 (Barclaycard) 電視廣告中扮演的旅人和國際神秘人物，讓觀眾不住對其多變的形象感到頭暈目眩。
mt: This role was initially also based on the travel and international mystery that Atkinson had played in a Barclaycard television commercial, leaving audiences dizzy and dizzy with its diverse image.
ref: He's also originally based on the traveler and international man of mystery Atkinson once played in the now forgotten Barclaycard TV ads, leaving chaos in his wake.

src: 最新的強尼·英格力電影中也有一兩個優秀的鏡頭。
mt: The latest Johnny Ingle movies also have one or two excellent shots.
ref: There are one or two nice moments in this latest JE outing.

src: 我尤其喜歡當英格力身穿整套中世紀盔甲逼近直升機時，轉子葉片卻不小心敲到了他的頭盔。
mt: I especially like when Inglewood is wearing a full set of medieval armor to approach the helicopter, but the rotor blades accidentally hit his helmet.
ref: I loved Johnny English approaching a helicopter while dressed in a medieval suit of armor and the rotor blades briefly clanging against his helmet.

src: 阿特金森在行為喜劇方面的才華得到充分表現，但其中的幽默卻略顯無力且奇怪多餘，尤其是在那些如特務 007 和《不可能的任務 (Mission Impossible)》等「嚴肅的」電影系列已然提供了一些喜劇元素的襯托下。
mt: Atkinson's talent in behavioral comedy has been fully demonstrated, but his humor is somewhat weak and strange, especially in the "serious" film series such as Special Agent 007 and Mission Impossible that has already provided some comedic elements.
ref: Atkinson's gift for physical comedy is on display, but the humor feels pretty underpowered and weirdly superfluous, especially as the "serious" film brands like 007 and Mission Impossible themselves now confidently offer comedy as an ingredient.

src: 比起成年人觀眾，其中那些讓人感覺到是安排好了的幽默元素反而更適合孩童觀看。對我而言，英格力的怪誕行動遠不如阿特金森作為豆豆先生在無聲電影所表現出的創意和專注性。
mt: Compared to the adult audience, those humorous elements that make me feel like they are arranged better for children to watch. For me, Ingrid’s bizarre actions are far less creative and focused than Atkinson’s portrayal of Mr. Bean in a silent movie.
ref: The humor feels as if it is pitched at kids rather than adults, and for me Johnny English's wacky misadventures aren't as inventive and focused as Atkinson's silent-movie gags in the persona of Bean.

src: 電影主軸背景也取材於現在的常見元素—英國陷入了嚴重的困境。
mt: The film's main axis background is also based on today's common elements - Britain has been plunged into a serious predicament.
ref: The perennially topical premise now is that Great Britain is in serious trouble.

src: 一名網絡黑客已入侵了英國的超機密特務網絡，洩露了全部英國秘密特務的身份，讓在職的特務首領頭疼不已—這個戲份少得可憐的角色由凱文·艾爾東 (Kevin Eldon) 飾演。
mt: A network hacker has invaded the UK's super-secret spy network, revealing all of the identities of British secret agents, leaving the on-duty chief of agents in pain—a pitifully small role played by Kevin Eldon.
ref: A cyber-hacker has infiltrated Britain's super-secret web network of spies, revealing the identities of all Britain's agents in the field, to the dismay of the agent on duty - a regrettably small role for Kevin Eldon.

src: 這對電影中那位自大且面臨四面楚歌情況的首相而言可謂是致命一擊。她在之前已然遭受全民反對，面臨政治生涯的重大不明朗情況：艾瑪·湯普遜 (Emma Thompson) 已盡力詮釋這個與特蕾莎·梅 (Theresa May) 相像的角色，但劇本根本沒有給她什麼發揮空間。
mt: This was a fatal blow to the arrogant prime minister in the film who faced a situation of slang. She had previously been opposed by the public and faced a major uncertainty in her political career: Emma Thompson had tried to portray this character similar to Theresa May, but the script didn't give her much room to play.
ref: It's the last straw for a prime minister who is a pompous and embattled figure, already suffering a complete meltdown of political unpopularity: Emma Thompson does her very best with this quasi-Teresa-May character but there's nothing much in the script to work with.

src: 她的智囊團告知她由於每名在職的特務已被折損，她將需要動用已退休的特務人員。
mt: Her think tank informed her that since each of her on-the-job spies had been lost, she would need to use retired special agents.
ref: Her intelligence advisers inform her that as every single active spy has been compromised, she will have to bring someone out of retirement.

src: 這直指凸搥特務英格力。他現在在一個豪華的校園中擔任校長一職，但仍偶爾教授關於如何成為臥底人員的非正式課程：一名英國人教授搖滾教室風格的特務課程，這中間有一些很好的笑點。
mt: This refers to the bulging Special Agent Inglewood. He is now principal of a luxurious campus, but still occasionally teaches informal courses on how to become an undercover officer: a British person teaches a rock-and-roll classroom-style spy course, which has some good jokes in between.
ref: And that means bumbling Johnny English himself, now employed as a schoolmaster in some posh establishment, but giving off-the-record lessons in how to be an undercover operative: some nice gags here, as English offers a School of Rock-type academy of spying.

src: 英格力被召回白廳參加一場緊急簡報會，並與他那飽受苦難的前任助手大寶 (Bough) 重聚。班·米勒 (Ben Miller) 也再次回歸飾演這個角色。
mt: Ingle was called back to Whitehall for an emergency briefing and reunited with his hard-earned former assistant, Bough. Ben Miller returned to play the role again.
ref: English is whisked back to Whitehall for an emergency briefing and reunited with his former long-suffering sidekick Bough, played again by Ben Miller.

src: 大寶現在已經結婚。他的妻子為一名潛艇指揮官，由薇琪·佩珀代因 (Vicki Pepperdine) 扮演這個過分熱情而讓人討厭的角色似乎有點浪費。
mt: Big Boss is now married. His wife, a submarine commander, seems a bit wasted playing this over-passionate and annoying role played by Vicki Pepperdine.
ref: Bough is now a married man, hitched to a submarine commander, a jolly-hockey-sticks role in which Vicki Pepperdine is a bit wasted.

src: 所以這對擅長把事情搞砸的蝙蝠俠和羅賓就為了女皇的秘密任務再次踏上征途，沿途還遇到了由歐嘉·柯瑞蘭蔻 (Olga Kurylenko) 飾演美艷的蛇蠍美人。
mt: So the Batman and Robin, who were good at screwing things up, set out on a journey again for Queen's secret mission, where they encountered the beautiful scorpion beauty played by Olga Kurylenko.
ref: So the Batman and Robin of getting things terribly wrong on Her Majesty's Secret Service are back in action, encountering Olga Kurylenko's beautiful femme fatale Ophelia Bulletova.

src: 同時，首相面對極富魅力的科技億萬富翁，也正面臨重大危機。這名聲稱可以解決英國電腦危機的邪惡 Jason Volta，由傑克·拉齊 (Jake Lacy) 飾演。
mt: Meanwhile, the prime minister is also facing a major crisis as he faces a charismatic tech billionaire. The evil Jason Volta, who claims to solve the UK computer crisis, is played by Jake Lacy.
ref: Meanwhile, the prime minister is falling dangerously under the spell of the charismatic tech billionaire who claims he can solve Britain's computer woes: the sinister Jason Volta, played by Jake Lacy.

src: 英格力和大寶從此展開他們那充滿戲劇性高潮的冒險旅程：他們佯裝成服務生，一把火燒掉了華麗的法國餐廳；他們混入 Volta 的豪華遊艇，並製造了混亂；英格力還在試圖使用虛擬現實頭套摸清 Volta 家的時候，意外觸發了純粹的無政府混亂狀態。
mt: Ingle and Big Boy embarked on their dramatic adventure: they disguised themselves as waiters, set fire to the ornate French restaurant; they mixed in Volta's luxurious yacht and created chaos; while Ingle tried to use virtual reality headsets to figure out Volta's house, unexpectedly triggering a pure anarchy state.
ref: English and Bough begin their odyssey of farcical high-jinks: disguised as waiters, they set fire to a flash French restaurant; they create mayhem smuggling themselves aboard Volta's luxury yacht; and English triggers pure anarchy as he attempts to use a Virtual Reality headset to familiarize himself with the interior of Volta's house.

src: 所有的一切肯定都是為了最後一個高潮所作的安排，但是雖然這一切看似高潮迭起且無比熱鬧，但卻讓人不住聯想起兒童電視節目。
mt: All of this is definitely an arrangement for the final climax, but although it seems to be a climax and extremely lively, it makes people think of children's television programs.
ref: All the stops are certainly pulled out for that last sequence, but as amiable and boisterous as it is, there's quite a bit of kids' TV about the whole thing.

src: 只是中等水平的落俗套路。
mt: It's just a stale routine at a moderate level.
ref: Pretty moderate stuff.

src: 但再看看其他強尼·英格力電影，我忍不住想：英國電影行業是否可以給羅恩·阿特金森一個真的善用其才華的角色？
mt: But when I look at other Johnny Inglewood films, I can't help but wonder: Can the British film industry give Ron Atkinson a character that really makes good use of his talent?
ref: And as with the other Johnny English films I couldn't help thinking: can't the British film industry give Rowan Atkinson a role that really does justice to his talent?

src: 工黨否認其正在制定一項計劃，讓英國人每個禮拜工作四天但領五天的工資
mt: The Labour Party denied that it was working on a plan to get the British to work four days a week for five days.
ref: Labour denies it is devising a plan for Britons to work a four day week but be paid for five days

src: 傑雷米·科爾賓 (Jeremy Corbyn) 的工黨正考慮一個激進的計劃，讓英國人依法每個禮拜只需工作四天—但卻領五天的薪水。
mt: Jeremy Corbyn's Labour Party is considering a radical plan, allowing the British to work four days a week in accordance with law - but receive a five-day salary.
ref: Jeremy Corbyn's Labour Party is to consider a radical plan which will see Britons working a four day week - but getting paid for five.

src: 這個政黨據報希望公司老闆通過人工智能 (AI) 革命為員工提供額外的休息日。
mt: This political party is reportedly hoping that the company boss will provide additional rest days for employees through the artificial intelligence (AI) revolution.
ref: The party reportedly wants company bosses to pass on savings made through the artificial intelligence (AI) revolution to workers by giving them an extra day off.

src: 這個計畫將讓員工可以享受為期三天的周末—但仍然可以享受不變的工資。
mt: This plan will allow employees to enjoy a three-day weekend—but still enjoy the same salary.
ref: It would see employees enjoy a three-day weekend - but still take home the same pay.

src: 消息稱這個主意將「配合」政黨的經濟政策，以及讓國家扭轉至偏向工人的這一計畫。
mt: The news said this idea would "cooperate" with the economic policies of political parties, and turn the country around this plan that leans towards workers.
ref: Sources said the idea would 'fit' with the party's economic agenda and plans to tilt the country in favor of workers.

src: 將一個禮拜改為四天的工作天已被工會大會認可為工人利用不斷變化的經濟的一種方式。
mt: Changing a week to a four-day working day has been recognized by the Labor Union Congress as a way for workers to utilize the changing economy.
ref: Shifting to a four-day week has been endorsed by the Trades Union Congress as a way for workers to take advantage of the changing economy.

src: 一名高級工黨消息向 Sunday Times 表示：「預計將在年底前公佈政策審查。
mt: A senior Labour Party source told Sunday Times: "It is expected to release a policy review before the end of the year.
ref: A senior Labour Party source told The Sunday Times: 'A policy review is expected to be announced before the end of the year.

src: 「這不可能在一夕間推行，但四天工作週是一個符合黨對重新平衡經濟以為工人和黨的整體工業戰略帶來益處的一個願望。」
mt: "It's impossible to implement this overnight, but the four-day work week is one that meets the party's desire to rebalance the economy for the benefit of workers and the party's overall industrial strategy."
ref: 'It won't happen overnight but a four-day working week is an aspiration that fits in with the party's approach to rebalancing the economy in favor of the worker as well as the party's overall industrial strategy.'

src: 工黨不是第一個提出這一要求的政黨。綠黨曾在 2017 年大選活動中承諾推動四天工作週。
mt: The Labour Party is not the first party to make this claim. The Greens have committed to a four-day week in the 2017 general election campaign.
ref: The Labour Party would not be the first to endorse such an idea, with the Green Party pledging a four-day working week during its 2017 general election campaign.

src: 但是，這個願望目前尚未得到整個工黨的認可。
mt: However, this wish has yet to be recognized by the entire Labour Party.
ref: The aspiration is currently not being endorsed by the Labour Party as a whole, however.

src: 一名工黨發言人表示：「四天工作週不是一個政黨政策，它沒有被黨予以考慮。」
mt: A Labour spokesperson said: "The four-day work week is not a party policy, it has not been considered by the party."
ref: A Labour Party spokesman said: 'A four-day working week is not party policy and it is not being considered by the party.'

src: 影子大臣約翰·麥克唐奈爾 (John McDonnell) 在上個禮拜的工黨會議上，充分描畫出了他對經濟社會主義革命的看法。
mt: Shadow Secretary John McDonnell fully illustrated his views on the economic socialist revolution at last week's Labour Party conference.
ref: Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell used last week's Labour conference to flesh out his vision for a socialist revolution in the economy.

src: 麥克唐奈爾先生表示，他決心從公用事業公司「背後的董事」和「奸商」手中奪回權力。
mt: Mr. McDonnell said he was determined to regain power from the "directors behind" and "traitors" of a public utility company.
ref: Mr McDonnell said he was determined to claw back power from 'faceless directors' and 'profiteers' at utility firms.

src: 這名影子大臣的計畫亦表示自來水公司的現有股東可能無法收回全部股份，因為工黨政府可能會因為其被視為不道德的行徑而予以「扣減」。
mt: The plan of this shadow minister also indicated that the existing shareholders of the water company may not be able to recover all their shares, as the Labour government may deduct them due to their behavior being considered immoral.
ref: The shadow chancellor's plans also mean current shareholders in water companies may not get back their entire stake as a Labour government could make 'deductions' on the grounds of perceived wrongdoing.

src: 他亦重申，把工人納入公司董事會並創建包容性所有權基金 (Inclusive Ownership Funds) 的計畫，可以讓員工獲得百分之 10 的私營企業股權，這些員工也因此可以獲得高達 £500 的年度股息。
mt: He also reiterated that incorporating workers into the company's board of directors and creating an inclusive ownership fund (Inclusive Ownership Funds) plan allows employees to obtain 10% of private enterprise shares, which also allows these employees to receive an annual dividend of up to £500.
ref: He also confirmed plans to put workers on company boards and create Inclusive Ownership Funds to hand 10 per cent of private-sector firms' equity to employees, who stand to pocket annual dividends of up to £500.

src: 林賽·格萊厄姆 (Lindsey Graham)、約翰·甘迺迪 (John Kennedy) 在《60 分鐘 (60 Minutes)》就聯邦調查局的卡瓦諾 (Kavanaugh) 案調查結果是否令他們改變主意
mt: Did the FBI's Kavanaugh investigation change their mind in 60 Minutes, by Lindsey Graham and John Kennedy,
ref: Lindsey Graham, John Kennedy tell "60 Minutes" whether the FBI's investigation of Kavanaugh could change their minds

src: 聯邦調查局就法官布雷特·卡瓦諾 (Brett Kavanaugh) 的指控進行的調查已然使對最高法院提名的最終投票延遲了至少一個禮拜。於此同時亦提出了一個問題，即該局的調查結果是否能夠動搖任何共和黨參議員的支持。
mt: The FBI's investigation into the allegations against Judge Brett Kavanaugh has already delayed the final vote on the Supreme Court nomination by at least a week. At the same time, a question was raised as to whether the agency's findings could undermine the support of any Republican senator.
ref: The FBI investigation into accusations against Judge Brett Kavanaugh has delayed a final vote on his nomination to the Supreme Court by at least a week, and raises the question of whether the bureau's findings could sway any Republican senators into pulling their support.

src: 在即將在禮拜天播出的一場訪問中，《60 分鐘》記者斯科特·佩利 (Scott Pelley) 向共和黨參議員約翰·甘迺迪和林賽·格萊厄姆提問，聯邦調查局是否可以找到任何可以會讓他們改變主意的調查結果。
mt: During an interview scheduled to air on Sunday, Scott Pelley, a reporter for 60 Minutes, asked Republican Senators John F. Kennedy and Lynsey Graham if the FBI could find any results that would change their minds.
ref: In an interview airing Sunday, "60 Minutes" correspondent Scott Pelley asked Republicans Sens. John Kennedy and Lindsey Graham whether the FBI could unearth anything that would lead them to change their minds.

src: 甘迺迪看似比他來自南卡羅萊納州的同僚持較開放的態度。
mt: Kennedy appears to be more open-minded than his colleagues from South Carolina.
ref: Kennedy appeared more open than his colleague from South Carolina.

src: 「我的意思是，當然，」甘迺迪說道。
mt: "I mean, of course," said Kennedy.
ref: "I mean, of course," said Kennedy.

src: 「我說過我會列席聽證會，我說過，我也曾與卡瓦諾法官交談。
mt: "I told you I'd be present at the hearing, and I said I'd spoken to Judge Kavano once.
ref: "I said going into the hearing, I said, I've talked to Judge Kavanaugh.

src: 我在這發生後曾打過電話給他，在對方作出指控後，我曾問過他：『你有做過嗎？』
mt: I called him after this happened, and after he made the accusations, I asked him, "Have you ever done it?"
ref: I called him after this happened, that allegation came out, said, 'Did you do it?'

src: 他的回答堅定不移且毫不含糊。」
mt: His answer was unwavering and unabashed. "
ref: He was resolute, determined, unequivocal."

src: 但是，格萊厄姆一票卻貌似更為堅定。
mt: However, a vote of Graham seemed even more resolute.
ref: Graham's vote, however, appears set in stone.

src: 「我已就布雷特·卡瓦諾一事作出決定，至有一個爆炸性指控可以讓我改變主意，」他說道。
mt: "I've made a decision about Brett Cavalno, until there's an explosive charge that's going to change my mind," he said.
ref: "My mind's made up about Brett Kavanaugh and it would take a dynamite accusation," he said.

src: 「Ford博士，我不清楚到底發生了什麼事，但我知道的是：布雷特強烈否應了，」格萊厄姆在訪問中向 Christine Blasey Ford 喊話表示。
mt: “Dr. Ford, I don’t know exactly what’s going on, but what I do know is that Brett has reacted strongly,” Graham said in an interview to Christine Blasey Ford.
ref: "Dr. Ford, I don't know what happened, but I know this: Brett denied it vigorously," Graham added, referring to Christine Blasey Ford.

src: 「而她提出的每一個證人都沒辦法為她作供。
mt: "And every witness she's ever given cannot testify for her.
ref: "And everybody she names couldn't verify it.

src: 36 年已經過去了。
mt: 36 years have passed.
ref: It's 36 years old.

src: 我看不到有什麼新的改變。」
mt: I can't see any new changes."
ref: I don't see anything new changing."

src: 什麼是全球公民音樂節 (Global Citizen Festival)？它是否能確實幫助減少貧困？
mt: What is the Global Citizen Festival? Can it really help reduce poverty?
ref: What is the Global Citizen Festival and Has it Done Anything to Decrease Poverty?

src: 在這個禮拜六，紐約將舉辦全球公民音樂節。這是一場年度音樂盛典，其中包含極度豪華的明星表演陣容，以及一個同樣吸引人的宗旨：終結全球貧困。
mt: On Saturday, New York will host the Global Citizen Music Festival. It’s an annual music festival featuring an extremely luxurious lineup of star performers and an equally compelling purpose: to end global poverty.
ref: This Saturday New York will host the Global Citizen Festival, an annual music event which has a hugely impressive line-up of stars performing and an equally impressive mission; ending world poverty.

src: 今年已然是舉辦的第七年，全球公民音樂節將吸引成千上萬的人潮湧入中央公園的大草坪。不僅僅是為了欣賞例如珍娜·傑克森 (Janet Jackson)、卡蒂 B (Cardi B) 和肖恩·曼德斯 (Shawn Mendes) 等人帶來的精彩演出，亦是為了聲援對在 2030 年前消滅赤貧的這一真正目標。
mt: This is the seventh year in the world, and the Global Citizen Festival will draw thousands of people into the big lawn of Central Park. Not only to see the spectacular performances of Janet Jackson, Cardi B and Shawn Mendes, but also to support the real goal of eradicating extreme poverty by 2030.
ref: Now in its seventh year, the Global Citizen Festival will see tens of thousands of people flock to Central Park's Great Lawn to not only enjoy acts such as Janet Jackson, Cardi B and Shawn Mendes, but also to raise awareness for the event's true goal of ending extreme poverty by 2030.

src: 自 2012 年開始舉辦以來，全球公民音樂節為全球貧困計畫 (Global Poverty Project) 的一部份。這是希望通過增加積極反對貧困的人數來消除貧困的一個國際倡導組織。
mt: Since its inception in 2012, the Global Citizen Music Festival has been part of the Global Poverty Project, an international advocacy organization that seeks to end poverty by increasing the number of people who actively oppose poverty.
ref: The Global Citizen Festival, which stated in 2012, is an extension of the Global Poverty Project, an international advocacy group hoping to end poverty by increasing the number of people actively fighting against it.

src: 為了獲得參加是次音樂節的免費門票（除非你願意花錢購買貴賓 (VIP) 門票），參加者必須完成一系列任務或「行動」，例如參加志願服務、給世界其中一個國家領導人發送電子郵件、打電話或以任何其他有意義的方式來幫助提高他們對消除貧困這一目標的認識。
mt: In order to get free tickets to the festival (unless you are willing to pay for a VIP ticket), participants must complete a series of tasks or “actions”, such as attending a volunteer service, sending an email to one of the world’s national leaders, making a phone call, or in any other meaningful way to help raise their awareness of the goal of poverty eradication.
ref: In order to receive a free ticket for the event (unless you were willing to pay for a VIP ticket), concertgoers had to complete a series of tasks, or "actions" such volunteering, emailing a world leader, making a phone call or any other meaningful ways to help raise awareness of their goal of ending poverty.

src: 但在距離目標只剩 12 年的今天，全球公民離這個目標還有多遠呢？
mt: But how far are global citizens from this goal today, 12 years from the goal?
ref: But just how successful has Global Citizen been with 12 years left to achieve its goal?

src: 用免費音樂會門票獎勵人們的想法是否說服大家採取實際行動的最佳方法，還是僅僅是所謂的「點擊主義」的另一個實證—僅僅是簽署網上請願書或發送推文，人們就覺得為最終目標出了一分力嗎？
mt: Is the idea of rewarding people with free concert tickets the best way to convince them to take action, or is it just another example of what we call “click-and-clickism” – just to sign an online petition or send a tweet, and people feel like they’re doing something for the ultimate goal?
ref: Is the idea of rewarding people with a free concert a genuine way to persuade people to demand a call for action, or just another case of so-called "clicktivism" - people feeling like they are making a true difference by signing an online petition or sending a tweet?

src: 自 2011 年以來，全球公民稱已錄得由其支持者作出超過 1900 萬「行動」次數，幫助推動組織一系列不同的目標。
mt: Since 2011, global citizens have claimed to have recorded more than 19 million "actions" made by their supporters, helping drive a series of different goals for the organization.
ref: Since 2011, Global Citizen says it has recorded more than 19 million "actions" from its supporters, pushing for a host of different goals.

src: 它表示，這些行動已幫助促使世界各國領導人作出相當於超過 $370 億的承諾和政策。而這些承諾和政策將在 2030 年之前影響超過 22.5 億人口的生活。
mt: It says these actions have helped to enable world leaders to make commitments and policies equivalent to more than $37 billion. These commitments and policies will impact the lives of more than 2.25 billion people by 2030.
ref: It says that these actions have helped spur world leaders to announce commitments and policies equating to more than $37 billion that is set to affect the lives of more than 2.25 billion people by 2030.

src: 在 2018 年初，組織統計了由其行動推動的 390 項承諾和公告，其中至少 $100 億已經完成支付或已籌集資金。
mt: In early 2018, the organization counted 390 commitments and announcements driven by its actions, of which at least $10 billion had been paid or raised.
ref: In early 2018, the group cited 390 commitments and announcements stemming from its actions, at least $10 billion of which have already been disbursed or fundraised.

src: 組織預計到目前為止，已確認的資金已對全球近 6.49 億人口產生了直接影響。
mt: The organization expects that the confirmed funds have had a direct impact on nearly 649 million people worldwide so far.
