ref: The group estimates the secured funds have so far made a direct impact on nearly 649 million people across the world.

src: 一些這類關鍵承諾包括營養力量 (The Power of Nutrition)，一個由英國的投資者和政策實施方建立的伙伴關係，致力於「幫助孩童充分發揮潛力成長」，並承諾將在收到全球公民的 4,700 多條推文支持後，向盧安達提供 $3,500 萬以幫助解決該縣的營養不良問題。
mt: Some of these key commitments include The Power of Nutrition, a partnership established by UK investors and policymakers to “help children reach their full potential for growth,” and a commitment to provide Rwanda with $35 million after receiving over 4,700 tweets from global citizens to help address malnutrition in the county.
ref: Some of the key commitments include The Power of Nutrition, a U.K. based partnership of investors and implementers committed to "helping children grow to their full potential," promising to provide Rwanda with $35 million to help end malnutrition in the county after receiving more than 4,700 tweets from Global Citizens.

src: 「透過來自於英國政府、捐贈人、國際政府、還有和你一樣的全球公民的支持，我們可以讓營養不良的社會不公情況變成歷史的一部份，」營養力量大使崔西.烏嫚 (Tracey Ullman) 在 2018 年 4 月倫敦的一場現場音樂會中向台下觀眾喊話。
mt: “With the support of the UK government, donors, international governments and global citizens like you, we can make the social injustice of malnutrition a part of history,” said Tracey Ullman, the nutritionist ambassador, speaking to the audience at a live concert in London in April 2018.
ref: "With support from the UK government, donors, national governments, and Global Citizens just like you, we can make the social injustice of undernutrition a footnote in history," The Power of Nutrition ambassador Tracey Ullman told the crowd during a live concert in London in April 2018.

src: 該組織還表示，在呼籲英國改善母親和兒童營養的 5000 多次行動之後，政府宣佈為一個計畫（即營養力量）提供資金，且該計畫將為 500 萬名婦女和兒童提供營養干預措施。
mt: The organization also stated that after calling on the UK to improve the nutrition of mothers and children over 5,000 times, the government announced a plan (Nutrition Force) to provide funding, which will provide nutritional interventions for five million women and children.
ref: The group also said that after more than 5,000 actions were taken calling on the U.K. improve nutrition for mothers and children, the government announced funding for a project, the Power of Nutrition, that will reach 5 million women and children with nutrition interventions.

src: 在官方網站上的一個常見問題解答中，問題是：「你為什麼認為我們能夠結束赤貧？」
mt: In a common question on the official website, the question is: "Why do you think we can end extreme poverty?"
ref: In response to one of the FAQs on its website asking "what makes you think we can end extreme poverty?"

src: 全球公民的答案是：「這將是一條漫長且艱辛的道路—有時候我們會跌倒，甚至是失敗。
mt: The answer for global citizens is: "It will be a long and arduous road – sometimes we fall, or even fail.
ref: Global citizen replied: "It'll be a long and hard path - sometimes we will fall and fail.

src: 但，就好像那些之前的偉大民權和反種族隔閡運動，我們將會取得成功，因為我們只要聯合在一起就會變得更強大。
mt: But just like the great civil rights and anti-racial segregation movements of the past, we will succeed because as long as we are united, we will become stronger.
ref: But, like the great civil rights and anti-apartheid movements before us, we will succeed, because we are more powerful together.

src: 珍娜·傑克森、威肯 (the Weeknd)、肖恩·曼德斯、卡蒂 B、加奈兒·夢奈 (Janelle Monáe) 為今年在紐約舉行的一些表演中的部份名單。今年的音樂節將由黛博拉·李佛尼斯 (Deborra-Lee Furness) 和休·傑克曼 (Hugh Jackman) 主持。
mt: This year’s festival will be moderated by Deborah-Lee Furness and Hugh Jackman, as part of a list of some of the performances this year in New York by Janet Jackson, the Weeknd, Shane Mendes, Katie B, and Janelle Monáe.
ref: Janet Jackson, the Weeknd, Shawn Mendes, Cardi B, Janelle Monáe are among some of the acts performing at this year's event in New York, which will be hosted by Deborra-Lee Furness and Hugh Jackman.

src: 美國可能會使用海軍「封鎖」以妨礙俄羅斯能源出口—內政部長稱
mt: The U.S. may use the Navy's "blockade" to hinder Russia's energy exports - Interior Minister says
ref: US could use Navy for "blockade" to hamper Russian energy exports - Interior Secretary

src: 據 Washington Examiner 報導，美國內政部長賴恩·辛克 (Ryan Zinke) 表示，「如果需要的話，」華盛頓可能選擇採用海軍活動阻止俄羅斯能源進入包括中東的市場。
mt: According to a report by the Washington Examiner, U.S. Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke said, "If needed," Washington may choose to adopt naval activities to prevent Russian energy from entering markets including the Middle East.
ref: Washington can "if necessary" resort to its Navy to prevent Russian energy hitting the markets, including in the Middle East, US Internal Secretary Ryan Zinke has revealed, as cited by Washington Examiner.

src: 辛克稱俄羅斯積極參與敘利亞事務為探索新能源市場的藉口。值得注意的是，俄羅斯方是在合法政府的邀請下才介入當局情勢的。
mt: According to Sink, Russia’s active involvement in Syria is an excuse to explore the new energy market. It is worth noting that the Russian side intervened in the situation at the invitation of the legitimate government.
ref: Zinke alleged that Russia's engagement in Syria - notably, where it is operating at the invitation of the legitimate government - is a pretext to explore new energy markets.

src: 「我相信他們到中東的理由，是因為他們希望能像他們在東歐、歐洲南部中央地區一樣積極地投入能源，」他向報導表示。
mt: "I believe that the reason they went to the Middle East was because they wanted to be as actively involved in energy as they were in Eastern Europe and southern Europe," he told a report.
ref: "I believe the reason they are in the Middle East is they want to broker energy just like they do in eastern Europe, the southern belly of Europe," he has reportedly said.

src: 據官方透漏，有方法解決。
mt: According to official disclosure, there is a way to solve it.
ref: And, according to to the official, there are ways and means to tackle it.

src: 他提到：「透過海軍勢力，美國有能力確保海上航道開放並必要時進行封鎖，以確保他們的能源無法進入市場。」
mt: "Through the naval power, the United States has the ability to ensure that sea lanes are open and, if necessary, blockade to ensure that their energy cannot enter the market," he said.
ref: "The United States has that ability, with our Navy, to make sure the sea lanes are open, and, if necessary, to blockade, to make sure that their energy does not go to market," he said.

src: 辛克 (Zinke) 在由消費者能源聯盟主辦的活動上向觀眾發表演說。消費者能源聯盟將自身定位為美國「能源消費者之聲」，是一非營利組織。
mt: Zinke addressed the audience at an event organised by the Consumer Energy Alliance. The Consumer Energy Alliance positioned itself as “Voice of Energy Consumers”, a non-profit organization in the United States.
ref: Zinke was addressing the attendees of the event hosted by the Consumer Energy Alliance, a non-profit group which styles itself as the "voice of the energy consumer" in the US.

src: 接著他比較華盛頓對俄羅斯和伊朗所採取的手段，實際上相似。
mt: Subsequently, he compared Washington's measures against Russia and Iran, which were actually similar.
ref: He went to compare Washington's approaches to dealing with Russia and Iran, noting that they are effectively the same.

src: 他提到：「俄羅斯和伊朗的經濟方案基本上就是利用及替代燃料。」，並指出俄羅斯勢單力薄，其經濟仰賴石油燃料。
mt: He said: "Russia and Iran's economic plan is basically to use and replace fuel," and pointed out that Russia is too weak, its economy relies on oil fuel.
ref: "The economic option on Iran and Russia is, more or less, leveraging and replacing fuels," he said, while referring to Russia as a "one trick pony" with an economy dependent on fossil fuels.

src: 做出此聲明的原因是由於川普政府目標增加出口液態天然氣到歐洲，提供歐洲消費者更加便宜的選擇，以便取代俄羅斯。
mt: The reason for making this statement is due to the Trump administration's goal of increasing exports of liquid natural gas to Europe, providing European consumers with cheaper options in order to replace Russia.
ref: The statements come as Trump administration has been on a mission to boost the export of its liquefied natural gas to Europe, replacing Russia, the far cheaper option for European consumers.

src: 川普政府官員和美國總統川普本人都嘗試說服德國退出「不適當」的 Nord Stream 2 管線專案，川普稱這項計畫會使柏林變成莫斯科的「俘虜」。
mt: Trump officials and US President Trump themselves both tried to persuade Germany to withdraw from the "unsuitable" Nord Stream 2 pipeline project, which Trump said would make Berlin a "captain" of Moscow.
ref: For that effect, the Trump administration officials, including US President Donald Trump himself, try to persuade Germany to pull out of the "inappropriate" Nord Stream 2 pipeline project, which according to Trump, made Berlin Moscow's "captive."

src: 莫斯科一直強調這條 $110 億的 Nord Stream 2 管線純粹只是經濟專案。這條管線容量預計可達到 1100 億平方公尺，是目前管線容量的兩倍。
mt: Moscow has emphasized that the $11 billion Nord Stream 2 pipeline is purely an economic project. The pipeline is expected to reach 110 billion square meters, twice the current pipeline capacity.
ref: Moscow has repeatedly stressed that the $11 billion Nord Stream 2 pipeline, which is set to double the existing pipeline capacity to 110 billion cubic meters, is a purely economic project.

src: 克林姆林宮駁斥，指華盛頓強烈反對該專案只因出於經濟理由，屬於非公平競爭的一個例子。
mt: The Kremlin refuted, pointing out that Washington strongly opposed the project for economic reasons, as an example of non-fair competition.
ref: The Kremlin argues that Washington's fervent opposition to the project is simply driven by economic reasons and is an example of unfair competition.

src: 俄羅斯能源部長諾瓦克 (Aleksandr Novak) 在 9 月於莫斯科會晤美國能源部長裴利 (Rick Perry) 後，他提到：「我相信我們雙方認為能源不可是用來施加壓力的工具，消費者應可選擇供應商。」
mt: After meeting with US Secretary of Energy Rick Perry in Moscow in September, Aleksandr Novak said, “I believe we both believe that energy cannot be a tool to exert pressure. Consumers should choose their suppliers.”
ref: "I believe we share the view that energy cannot be a tool to exercise pressure and that consumers should be able to choose the suppliers," Russian Energy Minister Aleksandr Novak said following a meeting with US Energy Secretary Rick Perry in Moscow in September.

src: 美國的立場引起了德國反彈，德國已重申對該專案的承諾。
mt: The US stance sparked a backlash from Germany, with Germany reaffirming its commitment to the project.
ref: The US stance has drawn backlash from Germany, which has reaffirmed its commitment to the project.

src: 德國的工業領導組織 - 德國工業協會 (BDI) 出聲要求美國不要插手歐盟能源政策以及柏林和莫斯科之間的雙邊協議。
mt: Germany's industrial leadership organization, the German Industrial Association (BDI), has issued a statement calling on the US not to intervene in EU energy policy and the bilateral agreement between Berlin and Moscow.
ref: Germany's leading organization for industry, the Federation of German Industries (BDI), has called on the US to stay away from the EU energy policy and the bilateral agreements between Berlin and Moscow.

src: 德國工業協會 (BDI) 主席肯普夫 (Dieter Kempf) 最近會晤德國總理梅克爾 (Angela Merkel) 和俄羅斯總統普京 (Vladimir Putin) 後，他提到：「當第三方介入我們的能源供應時，問題就大了。」
mt: Dieter Kempf, president of the German Industrial Association (BDI), recently met with German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Russian President Vladimir Putin, saying, “When third parties are involved in our energy supply, the problem is big.”
ref: "I have a big problem when a third state interferes in our energy supply," Dieter Kempf, head of the Federation of German Industries (BDI) said following a recent meeting between German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Russian President Vladimir Putin.

src: 麻州參議員華倫 (Elizabeth Warren) 透露她將「認真考慮」角逐 2020 年的美國總統選舉
mt: Massachusetts Senator Elizabeth Warren reveals she's "considering seriously" her candidacy for the 2020 US presidential election.
ref: Elizabeth Warren Will Take "Hard Look" At Running For President in 2020, Massachusetts Senator Says

src: 麻州參議員華倫星期六表示，她會在中期選舉後「認真考慮」參選總統。
mt: Massachusetts Senator Warren said on Saturday that she would "carefully consider" running for president after the midterm election.
ref: Massachusetts Senator Elizabeth Warren said on Saturday she would take a "hard look" at running for president following the midterm elections.

src: 在麻州 Holyoke 所舉辦的市民大會期間，華倫確定將考慮參選。
mt: During the citizen conference held by Holyoke, Massachusetts, Warren was confirmed to be considering running for office.
ref: During a town hall in Holyoke, Massachusetts, Warren confirmed she'd consider running.

src: 根據美國《國會山莊報》 (The Hill) 的報導，她表示：「是時候讓女性入主華盛頓並整頓殘破不堪的政府。」
mt: According to a report by The Hill, she said, "It's time for women to take over Washington and clean up a dilapidated government."
ref: "It's time for women to go to Washington and fix our broken government and that includes a woman at the top," she said, according to The Hill.

src: 「11 月 6 日之後，我會認真考慮參選總統。」
mt: "After November 6, I'll seriously consider running for president."
ref: "After November 6, I will take a hard look at running for president."

src: 華倫在市民大會中評論美國總統川普「朝錯誤的方向帶領國家」。
mt: Warren criticized US President Trump as "leading the country in the wrong direction" at a city council meeting.
ref: Warren weighed in on President Donald Trump during the town hall, saying he was "taking this county in the wrong direction.

src: 她表示：「對於川普對我們的民主所做的事情，我深感擔憂。」
mt: She said, "I'm deeply concerned about what Trump is doing to our democracy."
ref: "I am worried down to my bones about what Donald Trump is doing to our democracy," she said.

src: 華倫直言批評川普和其美國聯邦最高法院大法官提名人卡瓦諾 (Brett Kavanaugh)。
mt: Warren bluntly criticized Trump and his US Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh.
ref: Warren has been outspoken in her criticism of Trump and his Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh.

src: 華倫在星期五的一則推特中提到：「我們當然需要在投票前進行 FBI 調查。」
mt: Warren tweeted on Friday, "Of course we need to do an FBI investigation before we vote."
ref: In a tweet on Friday, Warren said "of course we need an FBI investigation before voting."

src: 然而，在星期四出爐的問卷調查顯示大部分華倫自己的選民認為她不應參選 2020。
mt: However, a survey released on Thursday showed that most Warren's voters believed she should not run for election in 2020.
ref: A poll released on Thursday, however, showed a majority of Warren's own constituents do not think she should run in 2020.

src: 根據薩福克大學 (Suffolk University) Political Research Center/Boston Globe 進行的問卷調查顯示，百分之五十八的麻州「可能」投票民眾表示參議員不應參選。
mt: According to a survey conducted by the Political Research Center/Boston Globe of Suffolk University, 58 percent of people in Massachusetts "potential" vote said senators should not run for office.
ref: Fifty-eight percent of "likely" Massachusetts voters said the senator should not run, according to the Suffolk University Political Research Center/Boston Globe poll.

src: 百分之三十二支持她參選。
mt: 32 percent supported her candidacy.
ref: Thirty-two percent supported such a run.

src: 問卷調查顯示更多人支持前麻州州長派翠克 (Deval Patrick) 參選，有 38% 贊成，48% 反對。
mt: The survey showed more people support former Massachusetts Governor Deval Patrick's candidacy, with 38% in favor and 48% against.
ref: The poll showed more support for a run by former Governor Deval Patrick, with 38 percent supporting a potential run and 48 percent against it.

src: 其他被提到可能角逐 2020 年大選的民主黨熱門人選包括美國前副總統前副總統拜登 (Joe Biden) 和佛蒙特州參議員桑德斯 (Bernie Sanders)。
mt: Other popular Democratic candidates mentioned for the 2020 general election include former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden and Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders.
ref: Other high profile Democratic names discussed in regard to a potential 2020 run include former Vice President Joe Biden and Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders.

src: 美聯社報導，拜登表明會在一月時正式決定。
mt: The Associated Press reported that Biden announced it would formally decide in January.
ref: Biden said he would decide officially by January, the Associated Press reported.

src: 裴琳 (Sarah Palin) 在川普的造勢活動中談到其兒子雀克 (Track Palin) 的創傷症候群
mt: Sarah Palin speaks at Trump’s campaign about the trauma of her son Track Palin
ref: Sarah Palin cites Track Palin's PTSD at Donald Trump rally

src: 26 歲的雀克於九月入伍，在伊拉克服役一年。
mt: The 26-year-old Jock enlisted in September and served for a year in Iraq.
ref: Track Palin, 26, spent a year in Iraq after enlisting on Sept.

src: 他於星期一晚間因家暴而遭到逮捕。
mt: He was arrested on Monday night for domestic violence.
ref: He was arrested and charged in a domestic violence incident on Monday night

src: 裴琳在奧克拉荷馬州圖爾薩所舉行川普的造勢活動中告訴群眾：「我兒子回來後面臨了一些事情。我感同身受其他家庭所受到的創傷症候群後遺症，以及我們的士兵帶回的一些傷痛。」
mt: “There are a few things my son is facing when he comes back,” said Perry, in a campaign by Trump in Tulsa, Oklahoma. “I feel the PTSD of other families and some of the pain that our soldiers bring back.”
ref: "What my own son is going through, what he is going through coming back, I can relate to other families who feel ramifications of PTSD and some of the woundedness that our soldiers do return with," she told the audience at a rally for Donald Trump in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

src: 裴琳稱這場逮捕為「避談的問題」，並提到她的兒子和其他退伍軍人：「他們回來後變得有一點不一樣了，變得堅強並懷疑他們軍隊同袍對國家所做出貢獻是否受到尊敬。」
mt: Péline described the arrest as "a matter of avoiding discussion," and mentioned her son and other veterans: "They came back a little different, became strong and doubted whether their military comrades' contributions to the country were respected."
ref: Palin called his arrest "the elephant in the room" and said of her son and other war veterans, "they come back a bit different, they come back hardened, they come back wondering if there is that respect for what it is that their fellow soldiers and airmen, and every other member of the military, has given to the country."

src: 瓦西拉警察局的發言人班尼特 (Dan Bennet) 說明，他於星期一在阿拉斯加州瓦西拉遭到逮捕，被指控對一名女性施行家暴、妨礙報案及醉酒持有武器。
mt: A spokesperson for the Vasilla Police Department, Dan Bennet, explained that he was arrested on Monday in Vasilla, Alaska, and charged with domestic violence against a woman, obstruction of reporting, and possession of drunk weapons.
ref: He was arrested on Monday in Wasilla, Alaska, and charged with domestic violence assault on a female, interfering with a report of domestic violence and possession of a weapon while intoxicated, according to Dan Bennett, a spokesman for the Wasilla Police Department.

src: 18 個州和哥倫比亞特區支持對新庇護政策提出異議
mt: 18 states and the District of Columbia support objection to the new asylum policy
ref: 18 states, D.C. support challenge to new asylum policy

src: 美國新的一項政策將拒絕為逃離幫派或家暴的受害者提供庇護，而 18 個州和哥倫比亞特區支持對此新政策提出異議。
mt: A new U.S. policy will refuse to provide shelter for victims fleeing gangs or domestic violence, while 18 states and the District of Columbia support dissenting against this new policy.
ref: Eighteen states and the District of Columbia are supporting a legal challenge to a new U.S. policy that denies asylum to victims fleeing gang or domestic violence.

src: 美國 NBC 新聞報導，來自 18 個州和特區的代表於星期五在華盛頓提交法庭之友摘要，藉以支持對政策提出異議的尋求庇護者。
mt: NBC News reported that representatives from 18 states and the District filed a Friends of the Court summary in Washington on Friday to support asylum seekers who object to the policy.
ref: Representatives from the 18 states and the district filed a friend-of-the-court brief Friday in Washington to support an asylum-seeker challenging the policy, NBC News reported.

src: 美國公民自由聯盟 8 月中提出 Grace v.Sessions 訴訟，反對聯邦政策，但尚未透漏原告之全名。
mt: In mid-August, the American Civil Liberties Union filed a lawsuit against Grace v.Sessions against federal policy, but the plaintiff's full name has not been disclosed yet.
ref: The full name of the plaintiff in the Grace v. Sessions suit that the American Civil Liberties Union filed in August against the federal policy has not been revealed.

src: 7 月 20 日，她指稱受到她的伴侶和「其身為暴力幫派成員的兒子」虐待，但美國官方拒絕她尋求庇護的要求。
mt: On July 20, she claimed to have been abused by her partner and her "son of a violent gang," but the US authorities refused her request for asylum.
ref: She said her partner "and his violent gang member sons," abused her but U.S. officials denied her request for asylum July 20.

src: 她被拘留在德州。
mt: She was detained in Texas.
ref: She was detained in Texas.

src: 支援 Grace 的州檢察官指出，薩爾瓦多、宏都拉斯和瓜地馬拉由於在國內面臨廣泛的幫派和家暴問題，因此有大批人民尋求美國庇護。
mt: The state prosecutors supporting Grace pointed out that El Salvador, Honduras and Guatemala are facing extensive gang and domestic violence issues at home, so a large number of people have sought American asylum.
ref: The states' attorneys supporting Grace described El Salvador, Honduras and Guatemala, which produce a large number of applicants for U.S. asylum, as nations facing pervasive problems with gangs and domestic violence.

src: 2014 年移民上訴委員會決定允許逃離家暴但未持證件的移民尋求庇護，不過美國新的一項政策推翻了此決定。
mt: The 2014 Immigration Appeals Board decided to allow asylum seekers who have fled domestic violence but do not have a document to seek asylum, but a new US policy overturned the decision.
ref: The new U.S. asylum policy reversed a 2014 decision by the Board of Immigrant Appeals that allowed undocumented immigrants fleeing domestic violence to apply for asylum.

src: 哥倫比亞特區檢察總長卡爾 (Karl Racine) 星期五發出聲明，指新政策「無視幾十年的州、聯邦和國際法律。」
mt: The Attorney General of the District of Columbia, Karl Racine, issued a statement on Friday saying that the new policy "repeatedly disregarded decades of state, federal and international law."
ref: District of Columbia Attorney General Karl Racine said in a statement Friday that the new policy "ignores decades of state, federal, and international law."

src: 法庭之友摘要提到：「聯邦法律要求所有庇護申請必須依特定事實和申請情況來做出判決，但此新政策違反了該原則。」
mt: “The federal law requires all asylum applications to make judgments based on specific facts and circumstances, but this new policy violates that principle.”
ref: "Federal law requires that all asylum claims be adjudicated on the particular facts and circumstances of the claim, and such a bar violates that principle," the friend-of-the court brief said.

src: 檢察官在摘要中進一步駁斥，此政策拒絕這些可能會成為企業家和「提供必要勞力」的移民進入，可能會傷害到美國經濟。
mt: Prosecutors further refuted in the summary that this policy rejects immigration that may become entrepreneurs and "provide necessary labor" may harm the US economy.
ref: Attorneys further argued in the brief that the policy denying immigrants entry hurts the U.S. economy, saying they are more likely to become entrepreneurs and "supply necessary labor."

src: 司法部長塞申斯 (Jeff Sessions) 六月下令移民法官不再對逃離家暴虐待和幫派暴力的受害者提供庇護。
mt: In June, Justice Minister Jeff Sessions ordered immigration judges to stop providing shelter to victims of domestic violence and gang violence.
ref: Attorney General Jeff Sessions ordered immigration judges to no longer grant asylum to victims fleeing domestic abuse and gang violence in June.

src: 塞申斯於 6 月 11 日宣布政策，提到：「我們提供庇護給因種族、宗教、國籍，或特定社群或政治取向的成員身分而受到迫害或恐懼使得離開原生國的人。」
mt: On June 11, he announced his policy, stating, "We provide shelter to people who have left their country of origin because of persecution or fear of their race, religion, nationality, or membership in a specific community or political orientation."
ref: "Asylum is available for those who leave their home country because of persecution or fear on account of race, religion, nationality, or membership in a particular social group or political opinion," Sessions said in his June 11 announcement of the policy.

src: 庇護並不是用來緩和所有問題 - 甚至是全世界的人每天所面對的所有嚴重問題。
mt: Asylum is not designed to alleviate all problems - even all the serious problems that people around the world face every day.
ref: Asylum was never meant to alleviate all problems -- even all serious problems -- that people face every day all over the world.

src: 帕盧市死亡人數倍增，救難隊積極搶救生還者
mt: The death toll in Pallu has doubled, and the rescue team is actively rescuing survivors.
ref: Desperate rescue efforts in Palu as death toll doubles in race to find survivors

src: 對於生還者來說，情況愈加怵目驚心。
mt: For survivors, the situation is getting even more startling.
ref: For survivors, the situation was increasingly dire.

src: 在燒毀的帕盧市 (Palu) 的一處避難中心，一名母親 Risa Kusuma (35 歲) 正在安撫發燒的兒子，她說：「好緊張」。
mt: At a burning shelter in Palu, a 35-year-old mother, Risa Kusuma, calms her fever-stricken son, she says, "It's so tense."
ref: "It feels very tense," said 35-year-old mother Risa Kusuma, comforting her feverish baby boy at an evacuation center in the gutted city of Palu.

src: 「每分鐘都有救護車送來屍體。
mt: "Every minute, an ambulance came to bring the bodies.
ref: "Every minute an ambulance brings in bodies.

src: 我們缺乏乾淨的水。」
mt: We don't have clean water."
ref: Clean water is scarce."

src: 可見到居民返回已被摧毀的家中撈出泡水物品，試圖搶救任何能夠找到的東西。
mt: It can be seen that residents have returned to their destroyed home and pulled out water-soaked items, trying to rescue anything they could find.
ref: Residents were seen returning to their destroyed homes, picking through waterlogged belongings, trying to salvage anything they could find.

src: 有數以千計的人受傷，在規模 7.5 地震中受到損毀的醫院人滿為患。
mt: Thousands of people were injured, and hospitals were overcrowded in the 7.5 magnitude earthquake.
ref: Hundreds of people were injured and hospitals, damaged by the magnitude 7.5 quake, were overwhelmed.

src: 背部和肩膀骨折的哈利斯 (Dwi Haris) 和其他病患在帕盧市陸軍醫院外面休養，由於不斷發生強烈餘震，因此病患留在戶外接受治療。
mt: Dr. Dwi Haris, who had a broken back and shoulder, and other patients were resting outside the Army Hospital in Palu, where they were treated outdoors due to constant strong aftershocks.
ref: Some of the injured, including Dwi Haris, who suffered a broken back and shoulder, rested outside Palu's Army Hospital, where patients were being treated outdoors due to continuing strong aftershocks.

src: 回憶起強震來襲時，他眼泛淚光，當時他與妻女在飯店五樓的房間裡。
mt: Recalling the strong earthquake, he was weeping with tears in his eyes; at that time, he and his wife and daughter were in a room on the fifth floor of the hotel.
ref: Tears filled his eyes as he recounted feeling the violent earthquake shake the fifth-floor hotel room he shared with his wife and daughter.

src: 哈利斯告訴美聯社：「我們根本沒時間自保。
mt: Harris told AP: "We don't have time to defend ourselves.
ref: "There was no time to save ourselves.

src: 我想我被擠壓到牆壁廢墟中。」他還提到他們一家人是到當地參加婚禮。
mt: I think I've been squeezed into the ruins of the wall. "" He also mentioned that their family was going to the local wedding.
ref: I was squeezed into the ruins of the wall, I think," Haris told Associated Press, adding that his family was in town for a wedding.

src: 「我聽到我的妻子在喊救命，但之後就沒聲音了。
mt: "I heard my wife screaming for help, but then there was no sound.
ref: "I heard my wife cry for help, but then silence.

src: 我不知道她和我的小孩發生什麼事。
mt: I don't know what's going on with her and my kids.
ref: I don't know what happened to her and my child.

src: 希望他們平安。」
mt: I hope they're safe."
ref: I hope they are safe."

src: 美國外交官指控中國「以宣傳廣告進行霸凌」
mt: US diplomats accuse China of “bullying with propaganda”
ref: U.S. ambassador accuses China of 'bullying' with 'propaganda ads'

src: 中國官方報紙在美國一份日報中刊登廣告以吹捧中美貿易的雙邊益處，在此之後一個星期，美國駐中國大使指控北京利用美國媒體來散布不實宣傳。
mt: China's official newspaper published an advertisement in a US newspaper tout the bilateral benefits of Sino-US trade, and the following week, the US Ambassador to China accused Beijing of using American media to disseminate false propaganda.
ref: A week after an official Chinese newspaper ran a four-page ad in a U.S. daily touting the mutual benefits of U.S.-China trade, the U.S. ambassador to China accused Beijing of using the American press to spread propaganda.

src: 美國總統川普指控中國意圖干擾 11 月 6 日的美國國會選舉，但遭中國否認後，他上星期三點名中國日報付錢在愛荷華州第一大報《Des Moines Register》出版增刊。
mt: US President Trump accused China of attempting to interfere with the US Congressional elections on November 6, but was denied by China, and last Wednesday he named the China Daily News and paid for a supplement to be published in Iowa's largest newspaper, the Des Moines Register.
ref: U.S. President Donald Trump last Wednesday referred to the China Daily's paid supplement in the Des Moines Register - the state of Iowa's biggest selling newspaper - after accusing China of seeking to meddle in the Nov. 6 U.S. congressional elections, a charge China denies.

src: 美國官員告訴路透社，川普指控北京試圖干擾美國國會選舉，華盛頓採取進一步升級行動以對北京施壓。
mt: US officials told Reuters that Trump accused Beijing of trying to interfere with US congressional elections, and Washington took further escalation actions to pressure Beijing.
ref: Trump's accusation that Beijing was trying to meddle in U.S. elections marked what U.S. officials told Reuters was a new phase in an escalating campaign by Washington to put pressure on China.

src: 外國政府刊登廣告以促進貿易，本實屬正常，但北京和華盛頓之間的貿易戰逐漸升溫，要對彼此的進口物品徵收關稅。
mt: Foreign governments have advertised to promote trade, which is normal, but the trade war between Beijing and Washington has gradually warmed up, imposing tariffs on each other's imported goods.
ref: While it is normal for foreign governments to place advertisements to promote trade, Beijing and Washington are currently locked in an escalating trade war that has seen them level rounds of tariffs on each other's imports.

src: 中國和美國專家提到，早先中國在貿易戰中實施的報復性關稅目的在於打擊特定州的出口商，這些州支持川普的共和黨，例如愛荷華州。
mt: Experts from China and the US have mentioned that the earlier retaliatory tariffs implemented by China in trade wars were aimed at targeting exporters from specific states, which supported Trump's Republican Party, such as Iowa.
ref: China's retaliatory tariffs early in the trade war were designed to hit exporters in states such as Iowa that supported Trump's Republican Party, Chinese and U.S. experts have said.

src: 美國駐中國大使布蘭斯塔德 (Terry Branstad) 和愛荷華前州長表示北京已傷害到美國勞工、農民和企業。愛荷華主要出口農產品至中國。
mt: US ambassadors to China Terry Branstad and former governors of Iowa say Beijing has hurt American workers, farmers and businesses. Iowa's main exports are to China.
ref: Terry Branstad, the U.S. ambassador to China and the former longtime governor of Iowa, a major exporter of agricultural goods to China, said Beijing had hurt American workers, farmers and businesses.

src: 布蘭斯塔德於星期日的《Des Moines Register》投書，指出北京「在我們的自由媒體上刊登宣傳廣告，加強霸凌的行動。」
mt: Branstad’s Sunday “Des Moines Register,” in a letter, noted that Beijing “has placed a campaign in our free media to strengthen bullying.”
ref: China, Branstad wrote in an opinion piece in Sunday's Des Moines Register, "is now doubling down on that bullying by running propaganda ads in our own free press."

src: 布蘭斯塔德寫到：「藉由在《Des Moines Register》付費刊登廣告，中國政府利用美國珍貴的言論自由和媒體自由傳統，來散布他們的政治宣傳。」
mt: Branstad writes: "By paying for ads in the Des Moines Register, the Chinese government uses America's precious tradition of free speech and media freedom to spread their propaganda."
ref: "In disseminating its propaganda, China's government is availing itself of America's cherished tradition of free speech and a free press by placing a paid advertisement in the Des Moines Register," Branstad wrote.

src: 他表示：「反觀在北京街頭的書報攤，由於媒體受中國共產黨嚴格掌控，能夠在此找到的異議聲音很有限，也看不到任何真正反映中國人民對中國令人擔憂的經濟發展軌跡可能持不同意見的報導。」
mt: He said: "Looking at the newsstands on Beijing's streets, due to the strict control of the media by the Communist Party of China, there are very limited voices of dissent that can be found here, and no reports of any real reflection of the Chinese people's views on China's worrying economic development trajectory may have been disparate."
ref: "In contrast, at the newsstand down the street here in Beijing, you will find limited dissenting voices and will not see any true reflection of the disparate opinions that the Chinese people may have on China's troubling economic trajectory, given that media is under the firm thumb of the Chinese Communist Party," he wrote.

src: 他還提到「中國最知名報紙之一婉拒刊登」他的投書，但他未說明是哪一家報社。
mt: He also mentioned that "one of China's most famous newspapers refused to publish" his letter, but he did not specify which newspaper it was.
ref: He added that "one of China's most prominent newspapers dodged the offer to publish" his article, although he did not say which newspaper.

src: 分析家警告，卡瓦諾 (Kavanaugh) 慘雲會令女性選民在中期選舉前疏離民主黨
mt: Analysts warn that the horrific Kavanaugh cloud is causing women voters to leave the Democratic Party before the midterm elections.
ref: Republicans Alienating Women Voters Ahead of Midterms With Kavanaugh Debacle, Analysts Warn

src: 許多主要共和黨員現身支援陷入多宗性侵案指控的最高法院大法官提名人卡瓦諾 (Brett Kavanaugh)，但分析家警告此舉會在稍後的中期選舉帶來反彈，尤其是女性。
mt: Many major Republicans have appeared to support the Supreme Court justice nominee Brett Kavanaugh, who has been accused of multiple sexual assault cases, but analysts warned that this would bring back a rebound in subsequent midterm elections, especially among women.
ref: As many top Republicans stand-by and defend Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh in the face of several allegations of sexual assault, analyst have warned they will see a backlash, particularly from women, during the upcoming midterm elections.

src: 對此事件的情緒高漲，多數已登記的共和黨人都表示他們想站出來投票。
mt: The mood of this event is rising, with most registered Republicans saying they want to stand up and vote.
ref: The emotions surrounding this have been extremely high, and most Republicans are on record already showing they wanted to go forward with a vote.

src: 雪城大學 (Syracuse University) 麥斯威爾學院 (Maxwell School) 的政治學教授裡瑟 (Grant Reeher) 在星期六出刊的《國會山莊報》 (The Hill) 中表示「覆水難收」。
mt: Grant Reeher, a professor of political science at Maxwell School at Syracuse University, said in The Hill, which was published on Saturday, "It's hard to get water back."
ref: Those things can't be walked back," Grant Reeher, a professor of political science at Syracuse University's Maxwell School told The Hill for an article published Saturday.

src: 亞利桑那州共和黨籍參議員費拉克 (Jeff Flake) 最後一刻促請 FBI 進行調查，裡瑟懷疑此舉是否足以安撫憤怒的選民。
mt: Arizona Republican Senator Jeff Flake asked the FBI for an investigation at the last minute, and Reese suspected that this move could calm angry voters.
ref: Reeher said he doubts Senator Jeff Flake's (R-Arizona) last-minute push for an FBI investigation will be enough to placate angry voters.

src: 據《華盛頓特區報》報導，進步組織 MoveOn 的資深顧問兼全國發言人 Karine Jean-Pierre 於星期五表示「女性不會忘記昨天發生過的事情 - 她們明天不會忘記，11 月也不會忘記。
mt: According to a Washington D.C. report, Karine Jean-Pierre, senior advisor and national spokesperson for the progressive organization MoveOn, said on Friday that "women will never forget what happened yesterday - they will not forget tomorrow, and November will not forget."
ref: "Women are not going to forget what happened yesterday - they are not going to forget it tomorrow and not in November," Karine Jean-Pierre, a senior adviser and national spokeswoman for the progressive group MoveOn said on Friday, according to the Washington, D.C. newspaper.

src: 即使福特博士 (Christine Blasey Ford) 出庭作證，但控制司法委員會的共和黨員仍選擇偏向卡瓦諾。因此星期五早上，抗議民眾在參議院的走廊上示威並高喊「11 月要到了！」。
mt: Even though Dr. Christine Blasey Ford testified in court, the Republicans who controlled the Judiciary Committee chose to lean toward Cavanaugh. That’s why on Friday morning, protesters demonstrated in the Senate corridor shouting “November is coming!”
ref: On Friday morning, protestors chanted "November is coming!" as they demonstrated in the hallway of the Senate as the Republicans controlling the Judiciary Committee chose to move forward with Kavanaugh's nomination despite the testimony of Dr. Christine Blasey Ford, Mic reported.

src: 無黨派政治分析家羅森博格 (Stuart Rothenberg) 告訴新聞網站：「民主熱誠和動力會超出預期。」
mt: Stuart Rothenberg, a nonpartisan political analyst, told news sites, "Democratic enthusiasm and momentum will be above expectations."
ref: "Democratic enthusiasm and motivation is going to be off the chart," Stu Rothenberg, a nonpartisan political analyst, told the news site.

src: 「大家都說已經很高了，這是真的。
mt: "Everyone says it's already high. It's true.
ref: "People are saying it's already been high; that's true.

src: 但可能還會更高，尤其是通常不去投票的郊區女性選民和 18 至 29 歲的年輕選民，他們不喜歡總統。」
mt: But it could be even higher, especially for women voters in rural areas who usually don't vote and young voters between the ages of 18 and 29, who don't like the president. "
ref: But it could be higher, particularly among swing women voters in the suburbs and younger voters, 18- to 29-year-olds, who while they don't like the president, often don't vote."

src: 在福特公開出庭作證，對最高法院大法官提名人的性侵案指控做出詳細說明前，分析家就已指出，若共和黨人硬要推動通過確認案，可能會造成反彈。
mt: Before Ford publicly testified in court, analysts had already pointed out that if Republicans were to push through the confirmation of a case of sexual assault on a Supreme Court justice nominee, it might cause a backlash.
ref: Even before Ford's public testimony detailing her allegations of sexual assault against the Supreme Court nominee, analysts suggested a backlash could follow if Republicans pushed forward with the confirmation.

src: 據 NBC 新聞報導，共和黨全國委員會的前任主席蒂爾 (Michael Steele) 在上週初表示，「這已讓 GOP 陷入麻煩。」
mt: According to NBC News, Michael Steele, the former chairman of the Republican National Committee, said at the beginning of last week, "This has put the GOP in trouble."
ref: "This has become a muddled mess for the GOP," said Michael Steele, former chairman of the Republican National Committee, early last week, according to NBC News.

src: 美國優先 (Priorities USA) 的主席塞西爾 (Guy Cecil) 對新聞頻道指出。「這不是只跟委員會投票、最終投票或是卡瓦諾是否能就任大法官一職有關，這也牽涉到共和黨人對此事件的處理方式以及他們是怎樣對待福特。」美國優先是協助選出民主黨的團體。
mt: Guy Cecil, president of Priorities USA, told the news channel, “It’s not just about the committee voting, the final vote, or if Cavanaugh can be elected to the office of Lord Chancellor, it’s about how Republicans handle the incident and how they treat Ford,” he said. American Priority is a group that helps elect Democrats.
ref: "It's just not about the committee vote or the final vote or whether Kavanaugh is put on the bench, it's also about the way Republicans have handled this and how they have treated her," Guy Cecil, director of Priorities USA, a group that helps to elect Democrats, pointed out to the news channel.

src: 然而，在福特和卡瓦諾做出證詞後，美國人民似乎開始選邊站，但傾向相信卡瓦諾的人稍微多一點。
mt: However, after Ford and Cavanaugh testified, the American people seemed to start taking sides, but those who tended to believe in Cavanaugh were slightly more numerous.
ref: However, Americans appear to be somewhat split over who to believe in the wake of Ford's and Kavanaugh's testimonies, with slightly more siding with the latter.

src: YouGov的問卷調查顯示，41% 的受訪者肯定或很可能會相信福特的證詞，而 35% 的受訪者肯定或很可能會相信卡瓦諾的證詞。
mt: YouGov surveys show that 41% of respondents are positive or likely to believe Ford’s testimony, while 35% are likely to believe or likely to believe Kavano’s testimony.
ref: A new poll from YouGov shows that 41 percent of respondents definitely or probably believed Ford's testimony, while 35 percent said they definitely or probably believed Kavanaugh.

src: 此外，38% 的受訪者表示他們認為卡瓦諾者很可能或一定有在證詞中說謊，但只有 30% 的受訪者對福特有相同意見。
mt: In addition, 38% of respondents believed that the Cavanaughers were likely or likely to have lied in their testimony, but only 30% of respondents shared the same opinion of Ford.
ref: Additionally, 38 percent said they thought Kavanaugh has probably or definitely lied during his testimony, while just 30 percent said the same about Ford.

src: 據《衛報》(The Guardian)報導，在費拉克施壓後，FBI 目前正在調查福特與至少另一名原告拉米雷斯 (Deborah Ramirez) 所提出的指控。
mt: According to a report by The Guardian, the FBI is currently investigating the allegations made by Ford and at least another plaintiff, Deborah Ramirez, after Firiq's pressure.
ref: After the push from Flake, the FBI is currently investigating the allegations brought forward by Ford as well as at least one other accuser, Deborah Ramirez, The Guardian reported.

src: 福特上星期在參議員司法委員會聽證會作證發誓，指卡瓦諾 17 歲時在酒後侵犯她。
mt: Ford swore at a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing last week that Kavanaugh had violated her when she was 17 years old after drinking.
ref: Ford testified before the Senate Judiciary Committee under oath last week that Kavanaugh drunkenly assaulted her at the age of 17.

src: 拉米雷斯指控，這位最高法院大法官提名人於 1980 年代時，在耶魯大學就學時出席派對期間，他向她裸露下體。
mt: Ramirez accused the Supreme Court justice nominee of exposing her to the naked body during a party he attended while studying at Yale University in the 1980s.
ref: Ramirez alleges that the Supreme Court nominee exposed his genitals to her while they attended a party during their time studying at Yale in the 1980s.

src: WWW (World Wide Web) 的發明人計畫開始新的網際網路以抗衡谷歌 (Google) 和臉書 (Facebook)
mt: WWW (World Wide Web)’s inventors plan to start a new Internet to counter Google and Facebook
ref: The Inventor of the World Wide Web Plans to Start a New Internet to Take on Google and Facebook

src: WWW 的發明人柏納李 (Tim Berners-Lee) 正在推出一個目標在於抗衡臉書、亞馬遜和谷歌的新創公司。
mt: Tim Berners-Lee, the inventor of WWW, is launching a campaign to counter Facebook, Amazon and Google startups.
ref: Tim Berners-Lee, the inventor of the World Wide Web, is launching a startup that seeks to rival Facebook, Amazon and Google.

src: 這位科技傳奇人物的最新專案 Inrupt 公司將打造柏納李的開放來源平台 Solid。
mt: Inrupt, the tech legend’s newest project, will build Solid, the open source platform for Bernalli.
ref: The technology legend's latest project, Inrupt, is a company that builds off of Berners-Lee's open source platform Solid.

src: Solid 可讓用戶選擇資料的儲存位置以及什麼人能夠存取哪些資訊。
mt: Solid allows users to choose where their data is stored and what information is accessible to whom.
ref: Solid allows users to choose where their data is stored and what people are allowed to have access to what information.

src: 在與 Fast Company 的獨家專訪上，柏納李開玩笑說 Inrupt 背後目的在於「統治世界」。
mt: In an exclusive interview with Fast Company, Burnaley joked that the purpose behind Inrupt was "to rule the world".
ref: In an exclusive interview with Fast Company, Berners-Lee joked that the intent behind Inrupt is "world domination."

src: 提起這個新創公司。他表示：「我們必須現在就進行。」
mt: When it comes to this startup, he says, "We have to do it now."
ref: "We have to do it now," he said of the startup.

src: 「這是歷史性的一刻。」
mt: "It's a historic moment."
ref: "It's a historical moment."

src: 該應用程式使用 Solid 的技術，可讓人們建立他們自己的「個人線上資料儲存器」，或稱為 POD。
mt: The application uses Solid technology, allowing people to build their own "personal online data storage device", also known as POD.
ref: The app uses Solid's technology to allow people to create their own "personal online data store" or a POD.

src: 當中可包含聯絡人名單、代辦事項清單、行事曆，音樂庫，以及其他個人與專業工具。
mt: It can include contact lists, task lists, calendars, music libraries, and other personal and professional tools.
ref: It can contain contact lists, to-do lists, calendar, music library and other personal and professional tools.

src: 就像 Google 雲端硬碟、Microsoft Outlook、Slack 和 Spotify 同時可在一個瀏覽器上使用。
mt: Just like Google Drive, Microsoft Outlook, Slack, and Spotify can be used in one browser at a time.
ref: It's like Google Drive, Microsoft Outlook, Slack and Spotify are all available on one browser and all at the same time.

src: 此個人線上資料儲存器的獨特之處在於用戶可完全掌控誰能夠存取哪種資訊。
mt: The uniqueness of this personal online data store lies in the fact that users have complete control over who can access which information.
ref: What's unique about the personal online data store is that it is completely up to the user who can access what kind of information.

src: 該公司稱之為「資料的個人權利」。
mt: The company calls it "the personal rights of data".
ref: The company calls it "personal empowerment through data."

src: 根據公司的 CEO 布魯斯 (John Bruce) 表示，Inrupt 的用意在於帶入資源、處理流程和適當技能來協助 Solid 能夠供大家使用。
mt: According to the company's CEO John Bruce, Inrupt's intention is to bring in resources, processes and the right skills to help Solid be used by everyone.
ref: The idea for Inrupt, according to the company's CEO John Bruce, is for the company to bring resources, process and appropriate skills to help make Solid available to everyone.

src: 該公司目前的成員有柏納李、布魯斯、IBM 添購的安全平台、一些負責專案的簽約開發人員，還有一群程式員義工。
mt: The company's current members include Burnaley, Bruce, IBM's added security platform, some contract developers responsible for projects, and a team of programmers volunteering.
ref: The company currently consists of Berners-Lee, Bruce, a security platform bought by IBM, some on-staff developers contracted to work on the project, and a community of volunteer coders.

src: 從這個星期開始，全世界的技術開發人員可利用 Inrupt 網站上所提供的工具來建立他們自己的分散式應用程式。
mt: Beginning this week, technology developers around the world can use the tools available on the Inrupt website to build their own distributed applications.
ref: Starting this week, technology developers around the world could create their own decentralized apps using the tools available on the Inrupt website.

src: 柏納李表示，他和他的團隊不會告訴「臉書和谷歌關於是否要引進徹底變更，隔夜就完全顛覆其所有事業模型。」
mt: Bernal Lee said he and his team would not tell "Facebook and Google about introducing radical change, completely subverting all of their business models overnight."
ref: Berners-Lee said that he and his team are not talking to "Facebook and Google about whether or not to introduce a complete change where all their business models are completely upended overnight.

src: 「我們不是在要求他們首肯。」
mt: "We're not asking them to accept it."
ref: "We are not asking their permission."

src: 在星期六出刊的《媒體》(Medium) 中，柏納李投書說 Inrupt 的「使命在於提供商業能源和生態系統，以協助保護在 Solid 上打造的新網路之完整性和品質。」
mt: In his Saturday edition of Medium, Bernard Lee wrote that Inrupt's mission is to provide commercial energy and ecosystems to help protect the integrity and quality of the new networks built on Solid.
ref: In a post on Medium published on Saturday, Berners-Lee wrote that Inrupt's "mission is to provide commercial energy and an ecosystem to help protect the integrity and quality of the new web built on Solid."

src: 在 1994 年，柏納李在麻省理工學院成立的全球資訊網聯盟 (World Wide Web Consortium)，轉變了網際網路。
mt: In 1994, the World Wide Web Consortium, founded by Bernal Lee at MIT, transformed the Internet.
ref: In 1994, Berners-Lee transformed the Internet when he established the World Wide Web Consortium at Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

src: 最近幾個月，柏納李在網路中立辯論中具有相當的影響力。
mt: In recent months, Bernal Lee has had considerable influence in online neutral debates.
ref: In recent months, Berners-Lee has been an influential voice in the net neutrality debate.

src: 即便是在推出 Inrupt 時，柏納李將仍會是全球資訊網聯盟、網路基金會 (Web Foundation) 和開放資料研究院 (Open Data Institute) 的創辦人兼主席。
mt: Even with the launch of Inrupt, Bernard Lee will still be the founder and chairman of the World Wide Web Consortium, the Web Foundation, and the Open Data Institute.
ref: Even while launching Inrupt, Berners-Lee will remain the Founder and Director of World Wide Web Consortium, the Web Foundation and the Open Data Institute.

src: 柏納李還提到：「我對下一個網路新生代感到非常樂觀。」
mt: "I'm very optimistic about the next Internet generation," Bernal Lee also said.
ref: "I'm incredibly optimistic for this next era of the web," Berners-Lee added.

src: Bernard Vann：第 1 次世界大戰維多利亞十字勳章牧師，後人為他慶祝
mt: Bernard Vann: Pastor of the Victoria Cross in the First World War, later celebrated him
ref: Bernard Vann: WW1 Victoria Cross cleric celebrated

src: 在第一次世界大戰中英格蘭教堂唯一一位獲得維多利亞十字勳章的牧師，日前大家在其家鄉為他慶祝 100 周年。
mt: In the First World War, the only English church minister to have received the Victoria Cross was recently celebrated his 100th anniversary in his hometown.
ref: The only Church of England cleric to win a Victoria Cross during World War One as a combatant has been celebrated in his hometown 100 years on.

src: 中校 Bernard Vann 牧師於 1918 年 9 月 29 日因貝朗格利斯 (Bellenglise) 和勒歐庫爾 (Lehaucourt) 一役獲獎。
mt: Major Bernard Vann was awarded on 29 September 1918 for his role in the Bellenglise and Lehaucourt awards.
ref: Lt Col The Reverend Bernard Vann won the award on 29 September 1918 in the attack at Bellenglise and Lehaucourt.

src: 然而，他還不知道他已獲得最高英國軍隊榮耀，便在 4 天後被擊斃。
mt: However, he did not know that he had gained the highest British military honor and was killed four days later.
ref: However, he was killed by a sniper four days later and never knew he had won the highest British military honor.

src: 在星期六，他的兩個孫子於北安普頓 (Northamptonshire) 的盧斯登 (Rushden) 揭開了紀念碑。
mt: On Saturday, his two grandsons unveiled the monument in Rushden, Northamptonshire.
ref: A commemorative stone was unveiled by his two grandsons at a parade in Rushden, Northamptonshire, on Saturday.

src: 其中一個孫子 Michael Vann 表示，能夠在他祖父獲獎功績的 100 周年當天展示紀念碑，「極具象徵意義」。
mt: One of his grandsons, Michael Vann, said the monument was "symbolically significant" on the 100th anniversary of his grandfather's achievement.
ref: One of his grandsons, Michael Vann, said it was "brilliantly symbolic" the stone would be revealed exactly 100 years on from his grandfather's award-winning feat.

src: 據《倫敦憲報》(London Gazett) 報導， 1918 年 9 月 29 日，中校 Vann 牧師帶領他的大隊穿過濃霧及戰場上的槍林彈雨，渡過了聖康坦 (Saint-Quentin) 運河。
mt: According to the London Gazette, on September 29, 1918, Major Vann led his team through thick fog and gunshot rain across the Saint-Quentin Canal.
ref: According to the London Gazette, on 29 September 1918 Lt Col Vann led his battalion across the Canal de Saint-Quentin "through a very thick fog and under heavy fire from field and machine guns."

src: 之後他衝上火線，以「最大的英勇」帶領火線向前，之後單手奪槍並擊垮 3 隻分隊。
mt: Later, he rushed to the front lines, leading the line forward with "the greatest bravery", and then single-handedly snatched the gun and crushed three teams.
ref: He later rushed up to the firing line and with the "greatest gallantry" led the line forward before rushing a field-gun single-handed and knocked out three of the detachment.

src: 就在大戰結束一個月前，中校 Vann 牧師於 1918 年 10 月 4 日被德國狙擊手擊斃。
mt: Just a month before the war ended, Colonel Vann was shot dead by a German sniper on October 4, 1918.
ref: Lt Col Vann was killed by a German sniper on 4 October 1918 - just over a month before the war ended.

src: 72 歲的 Michael Vann 說，他祖父的行為是「我永遠無法做到如此令人敬佩卻又震撼人心的事情。」
mt: 72-year-old Michael Vann says his grandfather's actions were "I'll never be able to do something so admirable and shocking."
ref: Michael Vann, 72, said his grandfather's actions were "something that I know that I could never live up to but something which is humbling."

src: 他和他的兄弟 James Vann 博士也在布倫特伍德帝國青年樂隊 (Brentwood Imperial Youth Band) 領導的遊行後擺上花圈。
mt: He and his brother, Dr. James Vann, also set a wreath after the parade led by Brentwood Imperial Youth Band.
ref: He and his brother Dr James Vann also laid a wreath after the parade, which was led by the Brentwood Imperial Youth Band.

src: Michael Vann 表示他「非常榮幸能夠參與遊行」，並提到「藉由許多人的支持，展現了真正英雄的價值。」
mt: Michael Vann said he was “very honoured to be part of the march” and said, “To show the value of a true hero through the support of many people.”
ref: Michael Vann said he was "feeling very honored to play a part in the parade" and added "the valor of a genuine hero is being demonstrated by the support that is going to be given by a lot of people."

src: MMA 粉絲熬夜準備觀看 Bellator 206，但結果他們看到的是粉紅豬小妹 (Peppa Pig)
mt: MMA fans stay up late to watch Bellator 206, but they see Peppa Pig
ref: MMA fans stayed up all night to watch Bellator 206, they got Peppa Pig instead

src: 試著想像看看，您熬夜準備要看緊湊的 Bellator 206，結果卻被拒絕觀看主要賽事。
mt: Imagine you stay up all night watching the compact Bellator 206, and you're turned down for major events.
ref: Imagine this, you have stayed up all night to watch the a packed Bellator 206 only to be denied watching the main event.

src: 聖荷西的節目表有 13 場格鬥，包括 6 場主卡，於第 5 頻道在英國直播整晚。
mt: San Jose's program schedule has 13 fights, including six main cards, live all night on Channel 5 in the UK.
ref: The bill from San Jose contained 13 fights, including six on the main card and was being shown live through the night in the UK on Channel 5.

src: 早上 6 點，正當 Gegard Mousasi 和 Rory MacDonald 準備展開對決時，畫面卻切換成粉紅豬小妹，讓英國的觀眾很錯愕。
mt: At 6 a.m., as Gegard Mousasi and Rory MacDonald were preparing to engage in a duel, the scene was changed to Pink Pig Sister, leaving British audiences bewildered.
ref: At 6am, just as Gegard Mousasi and Rory MacDonald were preparing to face each other, viewers in the UK were left stunned when the coverage changed to Peppa Pig.

src: 一些人特地熬夜到凌晨等待該場格鬥賽，他們十分不滿。
mt: Some people deliberately stayed up late at night until dawn to wait for that fighting match, and they were very dissatisfied.
ref: Some were unimpressed after they had stayed awake until the early hours especially for the fight.

src: 一名粉絲在推特上形容，切換成兒童卡通真是「開什麼玩笑。」
mt: A fan described on Twitter that switching to children's cartoons was "just kidding."
ref: One fan on Twitter described the switch to the children's cartoon as "some sort of sick joke."

src: 被問到有關播放傳輸時，Bellator 的行銷通訊資深副總裁 Dave Schwartz 表示，「政府規定節目內容不適合在早上 6 點鐘播出，因此他們必須切換成兒童節目。」
mt: When asked about the broadcast, Dave Schwartz, senior vice president of marketing communications at Bellator, said, "The government has ruled that the content of the program is not suitable for broadcast at 6 a.m., so they have to switch to children's programs."
ref: "It's government regulation that at 6 a.m. that content was not suitable so they had to switch to children's programming, " said Dave Schwartz, Bellator senior vice president of marketing and communication, when asked about the transmission.

src: 「沒錯，就是粉紅豬小妹。」
mt: "That's right, it's Pink Pig."
ref: ""Peppa the pig," yes."

src: Bellator 公司總裁 Scott Coker 表示他們會調整賽程表，以便將來方便英國觀眾收看。
mt: Bellator CEO Scott Coker said they will adjust the schedule to make it easier for UK viewers to watch in the future.
ref: Bellator company president Scott Coker said that they are going to work on their scheduling to include UK viewers in the future.

src: Coker 說：「我認為我們可能能夠想辦法重播。」
mt: Coker said, "I think we might be able to do a rerun."
ref: "I think that when I think about the replay, I think that we can probably work it out," Coker said.

src: 「不過英國時間星期天早上 6 點，我們可能要等到我們這裡星期天的時候才能解決，也就是英國時間星期一。
mt: "But at 6 a.m. British time on Sunday, we may have to wait until we have here for Sunday before we can resolve this, which is Monday British time.
ref: "But it's six in the morning on a Sunday there and we won't be able to work this out until Sunday our time, Monday their time.

src: 但我們正在努力解決。
mt: But we're working on it.
ref: But we are working on it.

src: 相信我，在節目切換時有很多不好聽的訊息來來往往。
mt: Believe me, there's a lot of bad news coming and going during the program switch.
ref: Believe me, when it switched over there were a lot of texts going back and forth and they all were not friendly.

src: 我們試圖解決，本來以為是技術上的問題。
mt: We tried to solve what we thought was a technical problem.
ref: We were trying to fix it, we thought it was a technical glitch.

src: 但結果不是，原來是政府方面的問題。
mt: But the result was not that it was a government problem.
ref: But it wasn't, it was a governmental issue.

src: 我可以保證下一次不會再發生了。
mt: I can promise it won't happen again.
ref: I can promise you the next time it's not going to happen.

src: 我們將會把 6 場格鬥賽減為 5 場 - 就如我們平常進行的 - 我們本來嘗試為粉絲多播一點，不過超出了預定時間。
mt: We're going to reduce six fights to five - just like we always do - we were trying to show fans a little more, but it's way past the scheduled time.
ref: We'll keep it down to five fights instead of six - like we normally do - and we tried to overdeliver for the fans and we just went over.

src: 不幸發生這種情況。」
mt: Unfortunately, this happens."
ref: It's an unfortunate situation."

src: Desert Island Discs：戴利 (Tom Daley) 因自己的性向而感到不如人
mt: Desert Island Discs: Tom Daley feels less like a man because of his sexuality
ref: Desert Island Discs: Tom Daley felt 'inferior' over sexuality

src: 奧運跳水選手戴利 (Tom Daley) 表示從小到大他因自己的性向而感到不如人 - 但這也鼓舞他獲得成功。
mt: Olympic diver Tom Daley says he's been feeling less well-liked since he was a kid because of his sexuality - but it's also inspiring him to succeed.
ref: Olympic diver Tom Daley says he grew up feeling inferior to everyone because of his sexuality - but that gave him the motivation to become a success.

src: 24 歲的他提到，上了中學後他才發現「不是每個人都像他一樣。」
mt: At the age of 24, he recalls that after entering high school, he discovered that "not everyone is like him."
ref: The 24-year-old said he did not realize until he went to secondary school that "not everyone is like me."

src: 在拉維恩 (Lauren Laverne) 主持的第一場廣播節目 Radio 4 Desert Island Discs 上聊到，他說他為同志人權發聲並為其他人帶來「希望」。
mt: On his first radio show, Radio 4 Desert Island Discs, hosted by Lauren Laverne, he said he spoke out for gay human rights and brought "hope" to others.
ref: Speaking on the first Radio 4 Desert Island Discs presented by Lauren Laverne, he said he spoke out about gay rights to give others "hope."

src: 他也提到成為一名父親後，他放在贏得奧運的心思就少了一些。
mt: He also mentioned that after becoming a father, his thoughts on winning the Olympics were somewhat lacking.
ref: He also said becoming a parent made him care less about winning the Olympics.

src: 這個長青秀原本的主持人楊格 (Kirsty Young) 已因病告假幾個月。
mt: The original host of the show, Kirsty Young, has been on leave for a few months due to illness.
ref: The regular presenter of the long-running show, Kirsty Young, has taken a number of months off because of illness.

src: 戴利是拉維恩首場節目的來賓，他提到在成長時，由於「社會上不接受喜歡男生和女生」，所以他覺得自己「比較不如其他人」。
mt: Daley was a guest on LaVin's first show, mentioning that as he grew up, because "the society did not accept boys and girls," he felt himself "not as good as others".
ref: Appearing as a castaway on Laverne's first program, Daley said he felt "less than" everyone else growing up because "it wasn't socially acceptable to like boys and girls."

src: 他說：「到如今，這些不如且不同於其他人的感覺正是讓我能夠成功的強大力量。」
mt: He said, "Today, these feelings of being inferior and different from others are the powerful forces that have enabled me to succeed."
ref: He said: "To this day, those feelings of feeling less than, and feeling different, have been the real things that have given me the power and strength to be able to succeed."

src: 他想證明自己有過人之處，以便大家最終發現他的性向時不會對他失望。
mt: He wants to prove himself to be a person, so that everyone will not be disappointed when they finally find out his sexual orientation.
ref: He wanted to prove that he was "something," he said, so that he did not disappoint everyone when they eventually found out about his sexuality.

src: 贏過兩次奧運銅牌的他現在積極參與 LGBT 活動，並現身今年在澳洲所舉辦的聯邦運動會，希望更多國家為同性戀除罪化。
mt: Having won two Olympic bronze medals, he is now actively involved in LGBT activities and has appeared at this year's Federal Games in Australia, hoping more countries will decriminalize homosexuality.
ref: The two-time bronze Olympic medalist has become a high-profile LGBT campaigner and used his appearance at this year's Commonwealth Games in Australia to appeal for more countries to decriminalize homosexuality.

src: 他表示，他感到很幸運能夠公開地生活並想要為其他人帶來希望，因此他站出來發聲。
mt: He said he felt lucky to live openly and want to bring hope to others, so he stood up to speak out.
ref: He said he spoke out because he felt lucky to be able to live openly without ramifications and wanted to give others "hope."

src: 身為三屆世界冠軍得主的他提到，他「很意外」愛上了他在 2013 年遇到的一個男人 - 美國電影編劇布雷克 (Dustin Lance Black)。
mt: As a three-time world champion, he mentioned that he "surprisingly" fell in love with a man he met in 2013 - American film writer Dustin Lance Black.
ref: The three-time world champion said falling in love with a man - US film-maker Dustin Lance Black, who he met in 2013 - "caught me by surprise."

src: 戴利去年與這位比他年長 20 歲的奧斯卡得主結婚，不過他說年齡差距從來不是問題。
mt: Last year, Daley married an Oscar winner 20 years his senior, but he says that age gap has never been a problem.
ref: Daley married the Oscar winner, who is 20 years his senior, last year but he said the age gap had never been an issue.

src: 他 14 歲時第一次參加奧運，而他父親於 3 年後因癌症病逝。他提到：「當你這麼年輕時就經歷那麼多，很難找到其他同年齡的人也曾有過類似的起落。」
mt: When he was 14, his father died of cancer three years later, and he said, "When you're so young, it's hard to find people of the same age who have had similar ups and downs."
ref: "When you go through so much at such a young age" - he went to his first Olympics aged 14 and his father died of cancer three years later - he said that it was hard to find someone the same age who had experienced similar highs and lows.

src: 這對伴侶在 6 月迎接他們的兒子羅伯特 (Robert Ray Black-Daley)，戴利說他的「全部觀點」都變了。
mt: The couple welcomed their son Robert Ray Black-Daley in June, saying his "all views" had changed.
ref: The couple became parents in June, to a son called Robert Ray Black-Daley, and Daley said his "whole perspective" had changed.

src: 他表示：「如果你去年問我，我會說我一定要贏得金牌。」
mt: He said, "If you asked me last year, I'd say I'd definitely win the gold medal."
ref: "If you had asked me last year, it was all about 'I need to win a gold medal'," he said.

src: 「你知道嗎？還有比贏得奧運金牌更重要的事耶。
mt: "You know what? It's more important than winning an Olympic gold medal.
ref: "You know what, there are bigger things than Olympic gold medals.

src: 羅伯特就是我的奧運金牌。」
mt: Robert is my Olympic gold medal."
ref: My Olympic gold medal is Robbie."

src: 戴利兒子的名字與他父親的名字相同，他父親於 2011 年因罹患腦癌而病逝，終年 40 歲。
mt: Daley's son was named after his father, who died of brain cancer in 2011 at the age of 40.
ref: His son has the same name as his father Robert, who died in 2011 aged 40 after being diagnosed with brain cancer.

src: 戴利說他的父親不接受自己時日不多的事實，最後他曾問過的其中一項事情就是幫他準備好 2012 年倫敦奧運的門票了沒 - 他想要坐前排。
mt: Daley said his father didn't accept the fact that he wasn't in a long time, and one of the things he asked was to help him prepare for the 2012 London Olympics - he wanted to sit in the front row.
ref: Daley said his dad did not accept he was going to die and one of the last things he had asked was if they had their tickets yet for London 2012 - as he wanted to be on the front row.

src: 他提到：「我沒辦法告訴他：“老爸，你到時就不在了，不會坐在前排”。」
mt: He said, "I can't tell him: "Dad, you're not here when you're there, you're not sitting in the front row."
ref: "I couldn't say to him 'you're not going to be around to be on the front row dad'," he said.

src: 他說：「他停止呼吸時我握著他的手。直到他真的斷氣過世時，我才終於明白他不是擊不倒的。」
mt: He said, "I held his hand when he stopped breathing. It was only when he really died that I finally realized that he wasn't knocked out."
ref: "I was holding his hand as he stopped breathing and it wasn't until he'd actually stopped breathing and he was dead that I finally acknowledged he wasn't invincible," he said.

src: 隔年，戴利參加 2012 年奧運並贏得銅牌。
mt: The following year, Daley participated in the 2012 Olympics and won a bronze medal.
ref: The following year Daley competed at the 2012 Olympics and won bronze.

src: 他說：「我知道這就是我一生的夢想 - 於鄉親父老面前，在奧運場上跳水，感覺超棒。」
mt: He said, "I know this is the dream of my life - to jump on the Olympic track in front of my hometown father and elder brother, it feels great."
ref: "I just knew that this is what I had dreamt of my whole life - to dive in front of a home crowd at an Olympic Games, there was no better feeling," he said.

src: 這也給了他第一首歌的選擇靈感 - Heather Small 的『Proud』- 在他邁向奧運之路上這首歌起了共鳴，仍會讓他起雞皮疙瘩。
mt: This also gave him the inspiration for his first song, Heather Small's "Proud" - a song that resonated with him on his way to the Olympics, still making him goosebumps.
ref: It also inspired his first song choice - Proud by Heather Small - which had resonated with him in the build up to the Olympics and still gave him goosebumps.

src: Desert Island Discs 於英國夏令時間星期天 11:15 於 BBC Radio 4 播出。
mt: Desert Island Discs is broadcast on BBC Radio 4 at 11:15 a.m. British Summer Time Sunday.
ref: Desert Island Discs is on BBC Radio 4 on Sunday at 11:15 BST.

src: 狀態不佳的米克森星期六在萊德盃 (Ryder Cup) 坐板凳
mt: Misfortune Saturday stool at Ryder Cup
ref: Out-of-form Mickelson benched on Ryder Cup Saturday

src: 美國的米克森 (Phil Mickelson) 將於星期天為他參加第 47 屆萊德盃賽事創下記錄，不過他將必須改變他的表現以避免這次成為一個令人不開心的里程碑。
mt: Phil Mickelson of the United States will set a record for him to compete in the 47th Ryder Cup on Sunday, but he will have to change his performance to avoid becoming an unpleasant milestone this time.
ref: American Phil Mickelson will set a record on Sunday when he plays his 47th Ryder Cup match, but he will have to turn his form around to avoid it being an unhappy milestone.

src: 米克森第 12 次參加每 2 年舉辦 1 次的賽事，隊長福瑞克 (Jim Furyk) 不讓他在星期六的 4 人 4 球和 4 人 2 球的比賽上場。
mt: Mickson's 12th appearance in a two-year tournament, captain Jim Furyk did not allow him to play on Saturday's four-man, four-ball and four-man, two-ball matches.
ref: Mickelson, playing in the biennial event for a record 12th time, was benched by captain Jim Furyk for Saturday's fourballs and foursomes.

src: 他經常是美國隊的主將，但 5 屆大賽贏家的他這一天卻在當啦啦隊，並在練習場上努力希望能糾正煩惱他的問題。
mt: He is often the head of the US team, but five-time winner of the tournament, he became a cheerleader today and worked hard on the practice field to hope that he could correct his problems.
ref: Instead of being at the center of the action, as he so often has been for the United States, the five-times major winner split his day between being a cheerleader and working on his game on the range in the hope of rectifying what ails him.

src: 他就算在生涯顛峰也不會開球開得很直，48 歲的他不太適合 Le Golf National 球場，這裡的長粗草常常阻礙偏離目標的擊球。
mt: Even at the peak of his career, he wouldn't kick the ball very straight, 48-year-old he was not very suitable for Le Golf National Stadium, where long thick grass often obstructed off target shots.
ref: Never the straightest of drivers even at the peak of his career, the 48-year-old is not an ideal fit for the tight Le Golf National course, where the long rough routinely punishes errant shots.

src: 若場地情況不是太艱鉅，米克森會在星期天第 9 場比賽對上英國公開賽冠軍莫里納瑞 (Francesco Molinari)。莫里納瑞與菜鳥弗利伍德 (Tommy Fleetwood) 在這星期聯手贏得他們的所有比賽。
mt: If the venue wasn’t too difficult, Mickson would play the ninth game of Sunday against the British Open champion Francesco Molinari. Molinari and Tommy Fleetwood teamed up to win all of their matches this week.
ref: And if the course on its own is not daunting enough, Mickelson, in the ninth match on Sunday, faces accurate British Open champion Francesco Molinari, who has teamed up with rookie Tommy Fleetwood to win all four of their matches this week.

src: 若落後 4 分的美國隊在開始比 12 場個人賽時能夠有好的開頭，則米克森的比賽會變得十分關鍵。
mt: If the U.S. team, which is four points behind, can start well at the start of their 12-game individual game, then Mickson's game will become crucial.
ref: If the Americans, four points down starting the 12 singles matches, get off to a hot start, Mickelson's match could prove absolutely crucial.

src: 福瑞克最多也只能說他對隊友表示有信心。
mt: Frank can only say he has confidence in his teammates.
ref: Furyk expressed confidence in his man, not that he could say much else.

src: 福瑞克說：「他完全明白今天他扮演的角色，他拍拍我的背並搭著我的肩膀說他明天會準備好。」
mt: "He fully understands the role he plays today. He taps my back and leans against my shoulder and says he'll be ready tomorrow."
ref: "He fully understood the role that he had today, gave me a pat on the back and put his arm around me and said he would be ready tomorrow," Furyk said.

src: 「他對他自己很有信心。」
mt: "He has confidence in himself."
ref: "He's got a lot of confidence in himself.

src: 他是名人堂成員，而且他在過去和這個星期都為這些隊伍付出許多。
mt: He is a Hall of Fame member, and he has paid much for these teams in the past and this week.
ref: He's a Hall of Famer and he's added so much to these teams in the past, and this week.

src: 我應該沒想過他比兩場。
mt: I shouldn't have thought of him playing twice.
ref: I probably didn't envision him playing two matches.

src: 我本來預想更多場，但這沒辦法，我們覺得必須這樣做。
mt: I had hoped for more, but there was no way, we felt we had to do this.
ref: I envisioned more, but that's the way it worked out and that's the way we thought we had to go.

src: 他像其他人一樣都想要參加。」
mt: He wants to join like everyone else."
ref: He wants to be out there, just like everyone else."

src: 星期天，米克森將超越佛度 (Nick Faldo) 參加最多次萊德盃的記錄。
mt: On Sunday, Mickson will surpass Nick Faldo's record for most Lader Cups.
ref: Mickelson will pass Nick Faldo's record for the most Ryder Cup matches played on Sunday.

src: 這可能會是萊德盃生涯的終點，遠不及他的個人記錄成就。
mt: This may be the end of his career at the Ryder Cup, far from his personal record achievements.
ref: It could mark the end of a Ryder Cup career that has never quite matched the heights of his individual record.

src: 米克森 18 勝 20 負 7 和，福瑞克說他是團隊的精神支柱。
mt: Mickson 18 wins, 20 losses and 7 draws, Frank says he is the spiritual pillar of the team.
ref: Mickelson has 18 wins, 20 losses and seven halves, though Furyk said his presence brought some intangibles to the team.

src: 福瑞克解釋：「他很搞笑、諷刺、機智，又愛捉弄人，有他在團隊休息室很好」。
mt: Fredrick explained: "He's very funny, satirical and witty, and he loves to tease people, but he's very good in the team lounge."
ref: "He's funny, he's sarcastic, witty, likes to poke fun at people, and he's a great guy to have in the team room," he explained.

src: 「年輕球員這個星期也跟他打得很開心，蠻有趣的。
mt: "Young players have had fun playing with him this week, and it's quite interesting.
ref: "I think the younger players had fun having a go at him, as well, this week, which was fun to see.

src: 他不僅只是上場比賽，他還帶給了我們更多東西。」
mt: He's not only in the game, he's also given us more things."
ref: He provides a lot more than just play."

src: 歐洲隊隊長比昂 (Thomas Bjorn) 認為大幅領先不能持久
mt: European team captain Thomas Bjorn says a big lead won't last long
ref: Europe captain Thomas Bjorn knows big lead can soon disappear

src: 歐洲隊隊長比昂的經驗告訴他，大幅領先的情況在萊德盃 (Ryder Cup) 最後一天的個人賽時可能會輕易地變成崎嶇之路。
mt: European team captain Beyoncé's experience told him that the lead situation could easily become a rugged road in the last day of the Ryder Cup individual competition.
ref: Thomas Bjorn, the European captain, knows from experience that a sizeable lead heading into the last-day singles in the Ryder Cup can easily turn into an uncomfortable ride.

src: 比昂在 1997 年瓦德拉馬 (Valderrama) 的比賽首次登場，隊長是巴列斯特羅斯 (Seve Ballesteros)，本來對美國隊取得 5 分的領先優勢，但最終比數 14½-13½，只以些微之差獲勝。
mt: Beyoncé made his debut in the 1997 Valderrama match, with Seve Ballesteros as captain; he had a five-point lead over the United States, but ultimately won by a narrow margin of 141⁄2-131⁄2.
ref: The Dane made his debut in the 1997 match at Valderrama, where a side captained by Seve Ballesteros held a five-point advantage over the Americans but only just got over the finishing line with their noses in front by the narrowest of margins, winning 14½-13½.

src: 比昂看著 2018 年這隻隊伍於星期五和昨天 5-3 獲勝，在 Le Golf National 球場以 10-6 領先，他提到：「你一直提醒自己，我們在瓦德拉馬大幅領先；我們在布魯克林大幅領先，但我們輸了，雖然我們在瓦德拉馬贏了，但不過是險勝罷了。」
mt: Beyoncé watched the team win 5-3 on Friday and yesterday, 10-6 at Le Golf National Stadium in 2018. He said, "You've always reminded us that we're a big lead in Wadrama; we're a big lead in Brooklyn, but we lost, and although we won in Wadrama, we're a narrow win."
ref: "You keep reminding yourself that we had a big lead at Valderrama; we had a big lead at Brookline, where we lost, and at Valderrama, where we won, but only just," said Bjorn, pictured, after watching the Class of 2018 win 5-3 both on Friday and yesterday to lead 10-6 at Le Golf National.

src: 所以歷史告訴我和所有隊友，比賽還沒結束。
mt: So history tells me and all my teammates that the game is not over yet.
ref: So history will show me and everybody on that team that this is not over.

src: 明天要全力以赴。
mt: We'll do our best tomorrow.
ref: You go full bore tomorrow.

src: 上場好好比賽。
mt: Play well.
ref: Get out there and do all the right things.

src: 在你取得計分板上的分數前，都沒結束。
mt: It didn't end until you got the score on the scoreboard.
ref: This is not over till you've got the points on the board.

src: 我們專注在贏得獎盃，這是我們的目標。
mt: We focused on winning the trophies, and that's our goal.
ref: We have a goal, and that is to try to win this trophy, and that's where the focus stays.

src: 我一直都說我專注在我們隊上的 12 名球員，不過我們也非常留意場上對手 - 世界上最佳的球員。
mt: I've always said that I'm focused on the 12 players on our team, but we're also very aware of our opponents on the field - the best player in the world.
ref: I've said all along, I focus on the 12 players that are in our side, but we are so well aware of what's standing across on the other side - the greatest players in the world."

src: 比昂對他的球員在艱鉅賽道上的表現感到很高興，他還說：「我不可能會在這超越自己。
mt: Beyoncé was very pleased with his players' performance on a difficult track, and he said: "I won't be able to surpass myself here.
ref: Delighted how his players have performed on a tough golf course, Bjorn added: "I would never get ahead of myself in this.

src: 明天會很艱難。
mt: It's gonna be tough tomorrow.
ref: Tomorrow's a different beast.

src: 明天是個人賽，那又不同。
mt: Tomorrow's a race, and that's different.
ref: Tomorrow is the individual performances that come forward, and that is a different thing to do.

src: 當進行順利時，有個搭檔一起上場很好，不過當你一個人上場時，就是在測試你自己作為高爾夫球員的能力。
mt: When going smoothly, a partner is very good to be on the court together, but when you're alone in the game, it's a test of your own ability as a golfer.
ref: It's great to be out there with a partner when things are going good, but when you're out there individually, then you're tested to the full of your capacity as a golfer.

src: 你必須讓球員知道明天要全力以赴。
mt: You have to let the players know that tomorrow we're going to do our best.
ref: That's the message that you need to get across to players, is get the best out of yourself tomorrow.

src: 現在你離開你的搭檔，他也必須自己竭盡全力。
mt: Now that you leave your partner, he must do his best.
ref: Now, you leave your partner behind and he has to go and get the best out of himself, as well."

src: 相反的，比昂的對手福瑞克 (Jim Furyk) 將期待他的球員能夠在個人賽表現好過搭檔賽，唯二例外的是史畢斯 (Jordan Spieth) 與湯瑪斯 (Justin Thomas)，他們取得 4 分中的 3 分。
mt: On the other hand, Beyoncé's opponent Jim Furyk will expect his players to perform better in individual games than in partner games, except for Jordan Spieth and Justin Thomas, who scored 3 out of 4 points.
ref: In contrast to Bjorn, opposite number Jim Furyk will be looking for his players to perform better individually than they did as partners, the exceptions being Jordan Spieth and Justin Thomas, who picked up three points out of four.

src: 福瑞克本身在大巡迴賽的最後一天輸贏都有，在布魯克林 (Brookline) 時是獲勝隊伍一員，之後又在歐洲隊表演「梅迪娜 (Medinah) 奇蹟」時輸球。
mt: Furrick himself had a win-loss record on the last day of the tour, was a member of the winning team in Brooklyn, and later lost to European team performing "Medinah Miracle".
ref: Furyk himself has been on both ends of those big last-day turnarounds, having been part of the winning team at Brookline before ending up a loser as Europe pulled off the "Miracle at Medinah."

src: 被問到 1999 年的隊長克倫蕭 (Ben Crenshaw) 如何團結他的球員進行最後一天的賽事時，他回答：「我記得每一個字」。
mt: When asked how the 1999 captain Ben Crenshaw united his players to play in the final day's tournament, he replied: "I remember every word."
ref: "I remember every damn word of it," he said in reply to being asked how Ben Crenshaw, the captain in 1999, had rallied his players heading into the last day.

src: 「我們明天有 12 場重要比賽，你們要像在布魯克林和梅迪娜看到的一樣，快速發動進攻。
mt: "We're going to have 12 big games tomorrow, and you're going to launch a quick attack, like you saw in Brooklyn and Medina.
ref: "We have 12 important matches tomorrow, but you'd like to get off to that fast start like you saw at Brookline, like you saw at Medinah.

src: 當一方的氣勢起來時，會對中間比賽造成很大壓力。
mt: When one side's momentum rises, it will put a lot of pressure on the middle game.
ref: When that momentum gets going one way, it puts a lot of pressure on those middle matches.

src: 我們依序排出陣容華麗登場，感覺嘗試要在明天使出一些魔術。
mt: We make a spectacular appearance in turn, feeling that we're trying to use some magic tomorrow.
ref: We set up our line-up accordingly and put the guys out in the fashion that we felt like, you know, we're trying to make some magic tomorrow."

src: 湯瑪斯會負責嘗試帶領反攻並在第一場對上麥克羅伊 (Rory McIlroy)，之後是歐洲隊頭六名的凱西 (Paul Casey)、羅斯 (Justin Rose)、拉姆 (Jon Rahm)、弗利伍德和波特 (Ian Poulter)。
mt: Thomas will be responsible for trying to lead the counterattack and face Rory McIlroy in the first match, followed by Paul Casey, Justin Rose, Jon Rahm, Fanny, and Ian Poulter, the top six teams in Europe.
ref: Thomas has been handed the task of trying to lead the fightback and faces Rory McIlroy in the top match, with Paul Casey, Justin Rose, Jon Rahm, Tommy Fleetwood and Ian Poulter the other Europeans in the top half of the order.

src: 比昂提到他的個人賽選擇：「我依照這個順序安排這群球員，因為我覺得這樣可應付全場。」
mt: Beyoncé mentioned his personal match selection: "I arranged these players in this order, because I think it's going to be enough for the whole game."
ref: "I went with this group of guys in this order because I think it covers all the way through," said Bjorn of his singles selections.

src: 德國的新戰艦再次順延
mt: Germany's new battleships are again delayed
ref: Germany's new warship postponed yet again

src: 據當地媒體報導，德國海軍的最新巡防艦應該要在 2014 年服役以取代老舊的冷戰時期戰艦，但由於系統故障和持續上升的成本，此巡防艦要等到至少明年才可準備好。
mt: According to local media reports, the latest German Navy frigates should have been commissioned in 2014 to replace old Cold War-era battleships, but due to system failure and rising costs, this frigate will not be ready until at least next year.
ref: German Navy's newest frigate should have been commissioned in 2014 to replace ageing Cold War-era warships, but it won't be there until at least the next year due to faulty systems and snowballing cost, local media reported.

src: 《時代周報》(DIE ZEIT) 引述軍方發言人的說法，全新巴登符騰堡 (Baden-Württemberg) 級巡防艦的領導艦「Rheinland-Pfalz」已順延到 2019 年上半年才能服役。
mt: The DIE ZEIT quotes a military spokesman as saying that the new Baden-Württemberg-class frigate, the lead ship "Rheinland-Pfalz," has been delayed until the first half of 2019.
ref: Commissioning of the "Rheinland-Pfalz," the lead ship of the brand new Baden-Wuerttemberg-class frigates, has now been postponed until the first half of 2019, according to Die Zeit newspaper citing a military spokesman.

src: 此艦本來應該於 2014 年加入海軍陣容，但交付後的問題拖累了此雄心壯志的計畫。
mt: The ship was originally supposed to join the Navy's fleet in 2014, but the problems after delivery dragged down this ambitious plan.
ref: The vessel should have joined the Navy in 2014, but the troubling post-delivery issues plagued the fate of the ambitious project.

src: 海軍於 2007 年訂做的 4 艘巴登符騰堡級船艦將取代老舊的不來梅 (Bremen) 級巡防艦。
mt: The four Baden-Württemberg-class ships ordered by the Navy in 2007 will replace the old Bremen-class frigates.
ref: The four Baden-Wuerttemberg-class vessels the Navy ordered back in 2007 will come as replacement to the ageing Bremen-class frigates.

src: 據說將配備強力艦砲、防空及反艦導彈系統，並具有一些對抗雷達、紅外線、聲波探測的隱形技術。
mt: It is said to be equipped with powerful naval guns, anti-aircraft and anti-ship missile systems, and have some stealth technology against radar, infrared, and sound wave detection.
ref: It is understood they will feature a powerful cannon, an array of anti-aircraft and anti-ship missiles as well as some stealth technologies, such as reduced radar, infrared and acoustic signatures.

src: 其他重要功能包括更長的維護期間 - 應該可部屬最新的巡防艦離開母港口最多 2 年。
mt: Other important features include longer maintenance periods - the latest frigates should be able to leave the port for up to 2 years.
ref: Other important features include longer maintenance periods - it should be possible to deploy the newest frigates for up to two years away from home ports.

src: 然而《時代周報》提到，持續的延誤意味著，等到這些據說能讓德國在海外展示戰力的先進戰艦開始服役時，它們的技術已經過時了。
mt: However, the Times reported that continuous delays meant that by the time these advanced warships said to be able to demonstrate Germany's military strength overseas began service, their technology had become outdated.
ref: However, continuous delays mean that the cutting-edge warships - said to allow Germany to project power overseas - will already become outdated by the time they enter service, Die Zeit notes.

src: F125 巡防艦在去年德國海軍正式拒收船艦的交付並將其退回位於漢堡 (Hamburg) 的 Blohm & Voss 造船廠時登上了頭條。
mt: The F125 frigates made headlines last year when the German Navy formally rejected the delivery of the ship and returned it to Blohm & Voss shipyard in Hamburg.
ref: The ill-fated F125 frigate made headlines last year, when the German Navy officially refused to commission the vessel and returned it to Blohm & Voss shipyard in Hamburg.

src: 這是海軍第一次在交付後將船艦退回造船公司。
mt: This is the first time that the Navy has returned ships back to the shipbuilding company after delivery.
ref: This was the first time the Navy has returned a ship to a shipbuilder after delivery.

src: 箇中原因並不清楚，但德國媒體引述有一些嚴重「軟體和硬體瑕疵」會讓戰艦佈署於對戰任務時無用武之地。
mt: The cause is unclear, but German media cited some serious "software and hardware defects" that would render battleships useless in combat missions.
ref: Little was known about the reasons behind the return, but German media cited a number of crucial "software and hardware defects" that made the warship useless if deployed on a combat mission.

src: 巴登符騰堡級船艦將由 120 名船員中的一群人操作，所需人力只是不來梅級巡防艦的一半，因此軟體瑕疵尤其重要。
mt: The Baden-Württemberg-class ships will be operated by a group of 120 crew members, the manpower required is only half that of the non-Mei-class frigates, so software defects are particularly important.
ref: Software deficiencies were particularly important as the Baden-Wuerttemberg-class vessels will be operated by a crew of some 120 sailors - just half of the manpower on older Bremen class frigates.
