src: 此外，此船也出現嚴重超重，會降低性能並限制海軍將來新增升級的能力。
mt: In addition, this ship also appears to be severely overweight, which will lower its performance and limit the navy's ability to add upgrades in the future.
ref: Also, it emerged that the ship is dramatically overweight which reduces its performance and limits the Navy's ability to add future upgrades.

src: 7000 噸重的「萊茵蘭-普法茲 (Rheinland-Pfalz)」相信是德國於第二次世界大戰時所使用的相似級船艦的兩倍重。
mt: The 7,000-ton Rheinland-Pfalz is believed to be twice as heavy as the similar ships used by Germany during World War II.
ref: The 7,000-ton "Rheinland-Pfalz" is believed to be twice as heavy as similar-class ships used by the Germans in the Second World War.

src: 除了故障的硬體，整個計畫 (包括人員的訓練) 的費用也成為問題。
mt: In addition to malfunctioning hardware, the cost of the entire project (including personnel training) also became a problem.
ref: Aside from faulty hardware, the price tag of the entire project - including the training of the crew - is also becoming an issue.

src: 據說造價已達到驚人的 31 億歐元 ($36 億美金) - 原本為 22 億歐元。
mt: It's said that the price has reached an astonishing 3.1 billion euros ($3.6 billion) - originally 2.2 billion euros.
ref: It is said to have reached staggering €3.1billion ($3.6bn) - up from initial €2.2 billion.

src: 最近有警告說德國海軍勢力正在縮減，無法獲得最新巡防艦則變為格外重要。
mt: Recently, there have been warnings that the German naval power is being reduced, and it becomes particularly important to not obtain the latest frigates.
ref: Problems gripping the newest frigates become especially of importance in light of recent warnings that Germany's naval power is shrinking.

src: 今年初，德國國會的國防委員會主席巴特爾斯 (Hans-Peter Bartels) 承認海軍其實「快要沒有可佈署的船艦」。
mt: At the beginning of this year, Hans-Peter Bartels, chairman of the Reichstag's Defense Committee, admitted that the Navy was "nearly no ship to deploy."
ref: Earlier this year, Hans-Peter Bartels, chief of the German parliament's defense committee, acknowledged the Navy is actually "running out of deployment-capable ships."

src: 官員表示老舊船艦已除役，但沒有替代的船艦，因此問題隨著時間越來越大。
mt: Officials said that old ships have been decommissioned, but there are no replacement ships, so the problem is getting bigger and bigger over time.
ref: The official said the issue has snowballed over time, because old ships were decommissioned but no replacement vessels were provided.

src: 他感嘆沒有一艘巴登符騰堡級巡防艦能夠加入海軍的陣容。
mt: He lamented that no Baden-Württemberg-class frigate could join the navy's lineup.
ref: He lamented that none of the of the Baden-Wuerttemberg-class frigates were able to join the Navy.

src: 國民信託 (National Trust) 偷聽蝙蝠的秘密生活
mt: National Trust Stealing the Secret Life of Bats
ref: National Trust eavesdrops on secret life of bats

src: 一項新的研究正在蘇格蘭高地一處莊園進行，目標在於展示蝙蝠如何在獵取食物時利用景觀。
mt: A new study is being conducted at a manor in the Highlands of Scotland, with the goal of showing how bats can use their landscaping when hunting for food.
ref: New research being carried out at an estate in the Scottish Highlands aims to reveal how bats use the landscape in their hunt for food.

src: 希望研究結果能揭曉此特殊哺乳類飛行動物的行為，並協助指導未來的保育行動。
mt: The hope is that the research results can reveal the behavior of this special mammal flying animal and assist in guiding future conservation actions.
ref: It is hoped the findings will shed new light on the behavior of the unique flying mammals and help guide future conservation activities.

src: 蘇格蘭國民信託的科學家將在 Wester Ross 的 Inverewe Garden，對普通蝙蝠、伏翼褐蝠、長耳蝠和水鼠耳蝠進行研究。
mt: Scientists from the National Trust of Scotland will conduct research on the common bats, futile bats, long-eared bats and muskrat-eared bats at Wester Ross' Inverewe Garden.
ref: The study by scientists at the National Trust for Scotland will follow common and soprano pipistrelles as well as brown long-eared and Daubenton bats at Inverewe Gardens in Wester Ross.

src: 他們會在該地的主要位置放置錄音器以追蹤蝙蝠整個季節的活動。
mt: They will place recorders at their main location to track the activities of bats throughout the season.
ref: Special recorders will be placed at key locations around the property to track bat activities throughout the season.

src: NHS 員工和義工也將使用手持偵測器來進行行動調查。
mt: NHS employees and volunteers will also use handheld detectors for mobile surveys.
ref: NHS staff and volunteers will also carry out mobile surveys using hand-held detectors.

src: 所有錄音的專門音訊分析將會確認蝙蝠的呼叫頻率及何種品種在進行什麼。
mt: All audio analysis of recordings will confirm the frequency of calls and what species are performing.
ref: Expert sound analysis of all recordings will ascertain the frequency of the bat calls and which species are doing what.

src: 之後會建立棲息地圖和報表，以建立牠們行為的詳細景觀規模的圖片。
mt: Subsequently, habitat maps and reports will be established to create detailed landscape-scale images of their behavior.
ref: A habitat map and report will then be produced to create a detailed landscape-scale picture of their behavior.

src: NTS 的自然保育顧問 Rob Dewar 希望結果會透露哪一些棲息區域對蝙蝠最重要，以及各種品種如何利用。
mt: Rob Dewar, NTS’s Conservation Advisor, hopes the results will reveal which habitats are most important to bats and how they can be used for different species.
ref: Rob Dewar, nature conservation adviser for NTS, hopes the results will reveal which areas of habitat are most important to the bats and how they are used by each of the species.

src: 此資訊將協助確定棲息管理工作的好處，例如培植草地以及如何最好的為蝙蝠和其他相關品種維護樹林。
mt: This information will help determine the benefits of habitat management work, such as cultivating grasslands and how best to maintain forests for bats and other related species.
ref: This information will help determine the benefits of habitat management work such as meadow creation and how best to maintain woodlands for bats and other associated species.

src: 在過去一個世紀，蘇格蘭和英國全國的蝙蝠數量大幅減少。
mt: Over the past century, the number of bats in Scotland and the UK has decreased sharply.
ref: Bat populations in Scotland and across the UK have declined considerably over the past century.

src: 建築物和開發工程會影響牠們的棲息及失去棲息地，對牠們造成威脅。
mt: Buildings and development projects will affect their habitats and lose habitats, posing a threat to them.
ref: They are under threat from building and development work that affects roosts and loss of habitat.

src: 風力發電機、光害、捕蠅紙、建築材料的一些化學成分，還有寵物貓的攻擊也會造成風險。
mt: Wind turbines, light pollution, flypaper, some chemical components of building materials, as well as attacks on pet cats can also pose risks.
ref: Wind turbines and lighting can also pose a risk, as can flypapers and some chemical treatments of building materials, as well as attacks by pet cats.

src: 其實蝙蝠並非看不到。
mt: In fact, bats are not invisible.
ref: Bats are not actually blind.

src: 然而，牠們習慣夜間獵食，因此在捕抓獵物時，牠們的耳朵比眼睛有用。
mt: However, they are accustomed to hunting at night, so when catching prey, their ears are more useful than their eyes.
ref: However, due to their nocturnal hunting habits their ears are more useful than their eyes when it comes to catching prey.

src: 牠們利用複雜的回聲定位技術來鎖定昆蟲並阻擋昆蟲的飛行路徑。
mt: They use complex echolocation technology to target insects and block their flight paths.
ref: They use a sophisticated echo-location technique to pinpoint bugs and obstacles in their flight path.

src: NTS 負責看顧全國 270 棟以上的歷史建築物、38 座重要的花園和 76,000 公頃的土地，他們對蝙蝠非常重視。
mt: NTS is responsible for the care of more than 270 historical buildings, 38 important gardens and 76,000 hectares of land, and they attach great importance to bats.
ref: The NTS, which is responsible for the care of more than 270 historical buildings, 38 important gardens and 76,000 hectares of land around the country, takes bats very seriously.

src: 有 10 位受過訓練的專家，他們定期進行調查、巡視檢查，有時候還會進行援救。
mt: There are 10 trained experts who conduct regular surveys, inspections and sometimes rescue operations.
ref: It has ten trained experts, who regularly carry out surveys, roost inspections and sometimes rescues.

src: 該組織還在鄧弗里斯‧加洛韋 (Dumfries and Galloway) 的 Threave 莊園成立了蘇格蘭第一個也是唯一一個專屬的蝙蝠保育區，該區是蘇格蘭 10 種蝙蝠品種其中 8 種的家。
mt: The organization also established the first and only dedicated bat conservation area in Scotland at Threave estate in Dumfries and Galloway, which is home to eight of Scotland's 10 species of bats.
ref: The organization has even set up Scotland's first and only dedicated bat reserve at Threave estate in Dumfries and Galloway, which is home to eight of Scotland's ten bat species.

src: 莊園管理員 David Thompson 表示，該莊園是蝙蝠的理想領土。
mt: Estate manager David Thompson said the estate is an ideal territory for bats.
ref: Estate manager David Thompson says the estate is the ideal territory for them.

src: 他說：「在 Threave 這裡，我們有很好的區域讓蝙蝠生活。」
mt: He said, "Here at Threatave, we have a good area for bats to live in."
ref: "Here at Threave we have a great area for bats," he said.

src: 「我們有舊建築物、許多古樹，還有全部良好的棲息地。
mt: "We have old buildings, many old trees, and all good habitats.
ref: "We've got the old buildings, lots of veteran trees and all the good habitat.

src: 不過還有很多有關蝙蝠的事情仍然未知，因此我們在這裡和其他地方進行的工作將協助我們了解他們在成長時需要什麼。」
mt: But there is still a lot of stuff about bats that is still unknown, so the work that we do here and elsewhere will help us understand what they need to grow up with."
ref: But there is much about bats that is still unknown, so the work we do here and at other properties will help us understand more about what they need to thrive."

src: 他強調在維護房屋前先檢查蝙蝠的重要性，因為若在不知不覺中破壞一個懷孕蝙蝠的棲息之處，有可能會造成多達 400 隻雌蝙蝠和年輕蝙蝠死亡，剷移個本土數量。
mt: He emphasized the importance of checking bats before maintaining houses, because if a pregnant bat's habitat is destroyed without realizing it, it may cause up to 400 female and young bats to die and scavenge a local population.
ref: He stresses the importance of checking for bats before carrying out maintenance within properties as it is possible unwitting destruction of a single maternity roost could kill up to 400 females and young, possibly wiping out an entire local population.

src: 蝙蝠受到保護，殺害、騷擾或打擾牠們的的棲息之處是違法的。
mt: Bats are protected, killing, harassing or disturbing their habitats is illegal.
ref: Bats are protected and it is illegal to kill, harass or disturb them or destroy their roosts.

src: 蝙蝠保育信託 (Bat Conservation Trust) 的蘇格蘭長官 Elisabeth Ferrell 已鼓勵公眾盡一份力。
mt: Elisabeth Ferrell, Chief of Scotland at the Bat Conservation Trust, has encouraged the public to do their part.
ref: Elisabeth Ferrell, Scottish officer for the Bat Conservation Trust, has encouraged the public to pitch in to help.

src: 她說：「還有很多有關蝙蝠的事等著我們去了解，有很多品種的生活方式仍然未知。」
mt: She says, "There's still a lot of things we need to know about bats. There's still a lot of things we don't know about the way we live."
ref: She said: "We still have a lot to learn about our bats and for many of our species we just don't know how their populations are faring."

src: 律師準備控告德國雜誌，羅納度欲擺脫強暴控訴
mt: The lawyer's ready to sue the German magazine. Ronaldo wants to get rid of the rape charge.
ref: Ronaldo dismisses rape claims as lawyers set to sue German magazine

src: 羅納度 (Cristiano Ronaldo) 稱對於他犯下強暴的指控是「假新聞」，他表示人們只是想要利用他的名聲「拉抬身價」。
mt: Cristiano Ronaldo described the allegations of rape as "fake news," saying that people just wanted to use his reputation to "pull their weight."
ref: Cristiano Ronaldo has branded rape claims against him as "fake news," saying that people "want to promote themselves" by using his name.

src: 他的律師準備控告刊登這則指控的德國新聞雜誌《明鏡週刊》(Der Spiegel)。
mt: His lawyer is preparing to sue the German magazine Der Spiegel, which publishes this allegation.
ref: His lawyers are set to sue German news magazine Der Spiegel, which published the allegations.

src: 他現任葡萄牙國家隊和義大利甲級聯賽足球隊尤文圖斯 (Juventus) 的前鋒，被控於 2009 年在拉斯維加斯的飯店房間強暴一名美國女性瑪尤佳 (Kathryn Mayorga)。
mt: He is currently a forward for the Portuguese national team and Italian Serie A football team Juventus, charged with raping an American woman Kathryn Mayorga in a hotel room in Las Vegas in 2009.
ref: The Portugal and Juventus forward has been accused of raping an American woman, named as Kathryn Mayorga, in a Las Vegas hotel room in 2009.

src: 星期五《明鏡週刊》報導，據稱他之後付給該名女子 $375,000 的封口費。
mt: Friday's Mirror Weekly reported that he later paid the woman $375,000 in a cover fee.
ref: He is alleged to have then paid her $375,000 to keep quiet about the incident, Der Spiegel reported on Friday.

src: 指控經報導過後幾個小時，33 歲的羅納度在 Instagram 直播視訊中向其 1.42 億的追蹤者澄清，抨擊該報導是「假新聞」。
mt: A few hours after the report, 33-year-old Ronado clarified to his 142 million followers on an Instagram live video that he called the report "fake news".
ref: Speaking in an Instagram Live video to his 142 million followers hours after the claims were reported, Ronaldo, 33, slammed the reports as "fake news."

src: 羅納度是 5 屆年度金球獎得主，他在鏡頭前說到：「不不不。
mt: Ronaldo, winner of the five Golden Globe Awards, says in front of the camera, "No, no, no.
ref: "No, no, no, no , no.

src: 他們今天報導的是假新聞。
mt: They're reporting fake news today.
ref: What they said today, fake news," the five-time Ballon d'Or winner says into the camera.

src: 他們只是想要利用我的名聲來拉抬身價。
mt: They just wanted to use my reputation to raise their profile.
ref: "They want to promote themselves by using my name.

src: 這是常有的事。
mt: It's a common thing.
ref: It's normal.

src: 他們想要藉由我的名字來出名，這是我身為公眾人物所必須承擔的一部份。
mt: They want to be famous by my name, which is a part of what I have to bear as a public figure.
ref: They want to be famous to say my name, but it is part of the job.

src: 我很快樂，一切都沒事。」，他面露微笑地說著。
mt: I'm happy, everything's fine, "he says with a smile.
ref: I am a happy man and all good," the player added, smiling.

src: 路透社報導，羅納度的律師正準備控告《明鏡週刊》，他們指《明鏡週刊》「對事主的隱私權做出令人無法接受的猜測性報道」。
mt: Reuters reported that Ronaldo's lawyer was preparing to sue Mirror Weekly, saying that Mirror Weekly "made unacceptable speculative reports on the privacy rights of the plaintiff".
ref: Ronaldo's lawyers are preparing to sue Der Spiegel over the allegations, which they have called "an inadmissible reporting of suspicions in the area of privacy," according to Reuters.

src: 他的代表律師舒希茲 (Christian Schertz) 表示：「羅納度會提出與侵權程度相對應的精神索賠要求，這可能是近年來對人權最嚴重的侵害之一」。
mt: His representative lawyer, Christian Schertz, said: "Ronardo will raise a mental claim that corresponds to the degree of infringement, which may be one of the most serious violations of human rights in recent years."
ref: Lawyer Christian Schertz said the player would seek compensation for "moral damages in an amount corresponding to the gravity of the infringement, which is probably one of the most serious violations of personal rights in recent years."

src: 據稱事件發生於 2009 年，地點在拉斯維加斯的棕櫚樹賭場飯店 (Palms Hotel and Casino) 的一間套房內。
mt: It was claimed that the event occurred in 2009, located in a suite at the Palms Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
ref: The alleged incident is said to have taken place in June 2009 at a suite at the Palms Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.

src: 根據內華達州克拉克地方法院的訴狀文件上說，據報羅納度在夜店遇見了瑪尤佳後，兩人一同回到了羅納度的房間，他涉嫌在房間內對她犯下強暴行為。
mt: According to a complaint filed by the Nevada Clark District Court, it is reported that Ronadow met Mayuga at a nightclub and they returned together to Ronadow's room, where he was suspected of committing rape in his room.
ref: After meeting in a nightclub, Ronaldo and Mayorga reportedly went back to the player's room, where he allegedly anally raped her, according to papers filed at Clark County District Court in Nevada.

src: 瑪尤佳聲稱羅納度在發生此事件後對她下跪，並告訴她自己是「99% 的好人」，只是被「1%」的另一面拖累。
mt: Mayuja claimed that Ronatou kneeled down to her after the incident and told her he was "99% good people", but was dragged down by the other side of "1%.
ref: Mayorga claims Ronaldo fell to his knees after the alleged incident and told her he was "99 percent" a "good guy" let down by the "one percent."

src: 文件上說羅納度承認雙方進行了性行為，但兩情相願。
mt: According to the file, Ronaldo acknowledged that both parties had engaged in sexual behavior, but the two were mutually reciprocal.
ref: The documents claim that Ronaldo confirmed the pair had sex, but that it was consensual.

src: 瑪尤佳還聲稱她向警方求助並在醫院拍下傷口的照片，但擔心「遭到報復」及「公開羞辱」，因此之後同意在法庭外私下和解。
mt: Ma Yu Jia also claimed that she sought help from the police and took photos of the wound at the hospital, but was worried about "revenge" and "public humiliation", so later agreed to settle privately outside the courtroom.
ref: Mayorga also claims she went to the police and had photographs taken of her injuries at a hospital, but later agreed to an out-of-court settlement because she felt "terrified of retaliation" and was worried about "being publicly humiliated."

src: 34 歲的她表示多年來一直身心受創，因此現在希望出面推翻和解。
mt: At the age of 34, she says that she has been physically and emotionally traumatized for many years, and now hopes to come forward to overthrow the government and reconcile.
ref: The 34-year-old says she is now seeking to overturn the settlement as she continues to be traumatized by the alleged incident.

src: 發生涉嫌性侵的時候，羅納度正從曼聯轉隊至皇家馬德里，今年夏天他轉隊至義大利甲級聯賽尤文圖斯，轉隊費為 1 億歐元。
mt: During the alleged rape, Ronaldo was transferred from Manchester United to Real Madrid, and this summer he transferred to Italian Serie A club Juventus for a transfer fee of €100 million.
ref: Ronaldo was on the verge of joining Real Madrid from Manchester United at the time of the alleged assault, and this summer moved to Italian giants Juve in a €100 million deal.

src: 英國脫歐：英國會對失去汽車製造商一事「永遠後悔」
mt: Brexit: Britain will "forever regret" losing its car manufacturer
ref: Brexit: UK 'would forever regret' losing carmakers

src: 商務大臣克拉克 (Greg Clark) 表示，英國若在脫歐後失去汽車製造業的龍頭地位，英國將會「永遠後悔」。
mt: Business Secretary Greg Clark said that if the UK loses its leading position in the automotive industry after Brexit, it will "forever regret" the UK.
ref: The UK "would regret it forever" if it lost its status as a world leader in car manufacturing after Brexit, Business Secretary Greg Clark has said.

src: 他還提到，英國豐田告知 BBC 若英國無序脫離歐盟，豐田位於德比 (Derby) 附近的 Burnaston 工廠將暫停生產，對於此舉他感到「十分關切」。
mt: He also mentioned that British Toyota informed the BBC that if the UK were to leave the EU in an orderly manner, Toyota's Burnaston factory near Derby would suspend production, which he felt "very concerned" about.
ref: He added it was "concerning" that Toyota UK had told the BBC that if Britain left the EU without a deal it would temporarily halt production at its factory in Burnaston, near Derby.

src: 克拉克指出：「我們需要達成協議」。
mt: Clark noted: "We need to reach an agreement."
ref: "We need a deal," Mr Clark said.

src: 日本汽車製造商豐田表示，若英國無序脫歐，在邊界產生的延誤可能會造成工作流失。
mt: Japanese automobile manufacturer Toyota stated that if the UK were to leave Europe unorganized, delays caused by border delays could cause work loss.
ref: The Japanese carmaker said the impact of border delays in the event of a no-deal Brexit could cost jobs.

src: Burnaston 車廠負責打造豐田的 Auris 和 Avensis，去年生產了近 150,000 台車，當中 90% 出口到歐盟其他地區。
mt: Burnaston builds Toyota’s Auris and Avensis, producing nearly 150,000 last year, of which 90% are exported to other parts of the European Union.
ref: The Burnaston plant - which makes Toyota's Auris and Avensis - produced nearly 150,000 cars last year of which 90% were exported to the rest of the European Union.

src: 豐田 Burnaston 車廠總經理庫克 (Marvin Cooke) 說：「我的觀點是，若英國在 3 月底強硬脫離歐盟，那麼我們的工廠預計將會停產。」
mt: Marvin Cooke, General Manager of Toyota Burnaston, said, “My view is that if the UK were to hard-line away from the EU by the end of March, our factory is expected to be discontinued.”
ref: "My view is that if Britain crashes out of the EU at the end of March we will see production stops in our factory," said Marvin Cooke, Toyota's managing director at Burnaston.

src: 對於英國在無協議的情況下脫歐所造成的跨邊界貿易是否可進行，其他英國汽車製造商，包括本田、BMW 和 Jaguar Land Rover，也對此提出疑慮。
mt: Concerns are raised by other British car manufacturers, including Honda, BMW and Jaguar Land Rover, about the possibility of cross-border trade caused by Britain's unconditional Brexit.
ref: Other UK car manufacturers have raised fears about leaving the EU without agreement on how cross-border trade will function, including Honda, BMW and Jaguar Land Rover.

src: 例如 BMW 稱，將在英國脫歐後關閉位於牛津 (Oxford) 的 Mini 車廠。
mt: For example, BMW said it would close its Mini factory in Oxford after Brexit.
ref: BMW, for example, says it will close its Mini plant in Oxford for a month following Brexit.

src: 汽車製造商所表示的主要擔憂是英國無序脫歐時所發生的供應鏈危機。
mt: The main concern expressed by car manufacturers is the supply chain crisis that occurred during Britain's disorderly Brexit.
ref: The main concerns relate to what carmakers say are supply chain risks in the event of a no-deal Brexit.

src: 豐田的生產線在「及時」訂做汽車流程下，每 37 分鐘就有一個零件從英國和歐盟的供應商到達。
mt: Toyota's production line, under a "timely" custom-made car process, has one component arrive every 37 minutes from suppliers in the UK and EU.
ref: Toyota's production line is run on a "just-in-time" basis, with parts arriving every 37 minutes from suppliers in both the UK and the EU for cars made to order.

src: 若英國在 3 月 29 日無序脫歐，邊界通關可能會發生中斷，業界指這將導致零件延誤和短缺。
mt: If the UK were to leave the European Union without order on March 29, border crossings could be disrupted, with industry saying this would lead to delays and shortages of parts.
ref: If the UK leaves the EU without a deal on 29 March, there could be disruption at the border which the industry says could lead to delays and shortages of parts.

src: 豐田指出，其公司在 Derbyshire 車廠的庫存不足以撐過一天，因此生產將會停止。
mt: Toyota pointed out that the company's inventory at Derbyshire factory was insufficient to last a day, so production would stop.
ref: It would be impossible for Toyota to hold more than a day's worth of inventory at its Derbyshire plant, the company said, and so production would be stopped.

src: 克拉克說英國梅首相 (Theresa May) 對於未來與歐盟關係所制訂的契克斯 (Chequers) 計劃「正是精準的共同合作以避免邊界檢查。」
mt: Clark said that the Chequers programme, developed by the UK Prime Minister Theresa May for future relations with the EU, “is a precise collaboration to avoid border checks.”
ref: Mr Clark said Theresa May's Chequers plan for future relations with the EU is "precisely calibrated to avoid those checks at the border."

src: 「我們需要達成協議。我們想要達成能讓我們抓住機會的最佳協議，而不是只有享受眼下的成功。」，他在 BBC Radio 4 的 Today 節目中如此談到。
mt: “We need to reach an agreement. We want to reach the best agreement that will allow us to take advantage of the opportunity, not just enjoy the success that we see in our eyes,” he said in a BBC Radio 4 Today show.
ref: "We need to have a deal. We want to have the best deal that will allow as I say not just the success at present to be enjoyed but for us to grasp this opportunity," he told BBC Radio 4's Today program.

src: 「由豐田和其他製造商可知，我們必須要能夠保持非常成功的供應鏈系統。」
mt: "It is known to Toyota and other manufacturers that we must be able to maintain a very successful supply chain system."
ref: "The evidence from not just Toyota but other manufacturers is that we need to absolutely be able to continue what has been a highly successful set of supply chains."

src: 豐田無法預計生產會停止多久時間，但長遠來講，警告了增加的成本負擔會讓工廠的競爭力降低，最終流失工作機會。
mt: Toyota was unable to predict how long production would stop, but in the long run, it warned that increased cost burdens would lower the competitiveness of the factory and ultimately lose job opportunities.
ref: Toyota was unable to say how long production would be stopped, but in the longer term, warned that added costs would reduce the plant's competitiveness and eventually cost jobs.

src: 於 Burnaston 車廠工作 24 年的工會代表 Peter Tsouvallaris 表示，他的車廠成員越來越擔心：「以我的經驗來說，一旦工作機會流失，便無法再重新回來。」
mt: Peter Tsouvallaris, a trade union representative who has worked at the Burnaston factory for 24 years, says his factory members are increasingly worried: "In my experience, once job opportunities are lost, they can't come back again."
ref: Peter Tsouvallaris, who has worked at Burnaston for 24 years and is the Unite union convener at the plant, said his members are increasingly concerned: "In my experience once these jobs go they never come back.

src: 政府發言人提到：「我們已就與歐盟的未來關係提出精準且可靠的計畫。」
mt: "We have put forward precise and reliable plans for our future relations with the EU," a government spokesman said.
ref: A government spokesperson said: "We have put forward a precise and credible plan for our future relationship with the EU."

src: 白宮透漏川普與羅森斯坦的會談將再度延期
mt: The White House has revealed that Trump's talks with Rosenstein will be postponed again.
ref: Trump meeting with Rosenstein may be delayed again, says White House

src: 白宮在星期天表示，由於最高法院大法官提名人卡瓦諾 (Brett Kavanaugh) 所引發的爭議持續不斷，川普與司法部副部長羅森斯坦 (Rod Rosenstein) 的會談將「延期一星期」舉行。
mt: The White House said on Sunday that Trump's talks with Justice Deputy Minister Rod Rosenstein would be "deferred by a week" due to ongoing controversy caused by Brett Kavanaugh, the nominee of the Supreme Court Justice.
ref: Donald Trump's high-stakes meeting with deputy attorney general Rod Rosenstein could be "pushed back another week" as the fight over supreme court nominee Brett Kavanaugh continues, the White House said on Sunday.

src: 羅森斯坦是特別檢察官穆勒 (Robert Mueller) 的主管，穆勒正在調查俄羅斯介入美國選舉的案件，以及川普資金和俄羅斯之間的關係與總統是否妨礙司法。
mt: Rosenstein is the director of Special Prosecutor Robert Mueller, who is investigating Russia's involvement in U.S. elections and the relationship between Trump's funds and Russia and whether the president has obstructed justice.
ref: Rosenstein oversees the work of special counsel Robert Mueller, who is investigating Russian election interference, links between Trump aides and Russia and potential obstruction of justice by the president.

src: 這幾個月華盛頓都在持續討論川普是否會拔掉司法部副部長的職位，並從而危害到穆勒的獨立性。
mt: Over the past few months, Washington has been continuously discussing whether Trump will remove his position as Deputy Minister of Justice and thereby jeopardize Müller's independence.
ref: Whether or not Trump will fire the deputy attorney general, and thereby endanger Mueller's independence, has fueled Washington gossip for months.

src: 本月早些時候，《紐約時報》報導羅森斯坦討論要偷錄與川普的談話，並討論引用第 25 條修正案罷免總統的可能性。
mt: Earlier this month, The New York Times reported that Rosenstein was discussing the possibility of stealing a conversation with Trump and discussing the possibility of impeaching the President by citing Article 25 of the amendment.
ref: Earlier this month, the New York Times reported that Rosenstein discussed wearing a wire to record conversations with Trump and the possibility of removing the president via the 25th amendment.

src: 羅森斯坦否認該則報導。
mt: Rosenstein denied the report.
ref: Rosenstein denied the report.

src: 不過上星期一他前往白宮，據報他準備辭去職務。
mt: However, he went to the White House last Monday and was reported to be preparing to resign from his position.
ref: But last Monday he went to the White House, amid reports he was about to resign.

src: 其後發布星期四將與川普會面，當時川普人在紐約聯合國總部。
mt: Subsequently, it was announced that a meeting with Trump would be held on Thursday, when Trump people were at the United Nations headquarters in New York.
ref: Instead, a meeting with Trump, who was then at the United Nations in New York, was announced for Thursday.

src: 川普表示他「不希望」拔去羅森斯坦的職位，但為了避免與參議員司法委員會聽證會撞期，因此將會談時間延期。卡瓦諾和指控他犯下性侵的其中一名女性布萊西福特 (Christine Blasey Ford) 博士都出席聽證會作證。
mt: Mr. Trump said he "does not want" to remove Rosenstein from his position, but will delay his discussion to avoid a break with the Senate Judiciary Committee hearings. Mr. Kavanaugh and Dr. Christine Blasey Ford, one of the women who accused him of sexual assault, testify at the hearing.
ref: Trump said he would "prefer not" to fire Rosenstein but then the meeting was delayed to avoid a clash with the Senate judiciary committee hearing in which Kavanaugh and one of the women who have accused him of sexual misconduct, Dr Christine Blasey Ford, both testified.

src: 星期五，川普下令 FBI 對卡瓦諾一案的指控展開為期一星期的調查，因此全體參議員表決又再延後進行。
mt: On Friday, Trump ordered the FBI to conduct a week-long investigation into allegations of the Kawano case, so all senators voted to postpone it again.
ref: On Friday, Trump ordered a one-week FBI investigation of claims against Kavanaugh, further delaying a full Senate vote.

src: 川普的媒體秘書桑德斯 (Sarah Sanders) 在星期天接受福斯新聞網的專訪。
mt: Trump’s media secretary, Sarah Sanders, was interviewed on Sunday by Fox News.
ref: Trump's press secretary, Sarah Sanders, appeared on Fox News Sunday.

src: 被問到有關羅森斯坦會談時，她說：「相關日期尚未決定，可能是這個星期，現在最高法院發生這麼多其他紛爭，因此我認為可能還會再延期一星期。
mt: When asked about the Rosenstein talks, she said: "The relevant date has yet to be decided, possibly this week, there are so many other disputes in the Supreme Court, so I think it may be postponed for another week.
ref: Asked about the Rosenstein meeting, she said: "A date for that hasn't been set, it could be this week, I could see that pushing back another week given all of the other things that are going on with the supreme court.

src: 再觀察看看吧，我會讓媒體朋友知道最新消息。」
mt: I'll let my media friends know the latest news."
ref: But we'll see and I always like to keep the press updated."

src: 一些記者質疑：桑德斯自從 9 月 10 日後便未舉辦過白宮記者會。
mt: Some journalists questioned: Sanders has not held a White House press conference since September 10.
ref: Some reporters would contest that assertion: Sanders has not held a White House press briefing since 10 September.

src: 主播華勒斯 (Chris Wallace) 詢問了原因。
mt: Anchor Chris Wallace asked why.
ref: Host Chris Wallace asked why.

src: 桑德斯說未舉辦例行記者會的原因並不是出於對電視記者譁眾取寵的厭惡，然而她表示：「我不會不認為他們就是譁眾取寵。」
mt: Sanders said the reason for not holding a regular press conference was not out of hatred for the TV reporters' sensationalism, but she said: "I won't think they're just sensationalism."
ref: Sanders said the scarcity of briefings was not due to a distaste for TV reporters "grandstanding," although she said: "I won't disagree with the fact that they grandstand."

src: 她之後提議增加川普與媒體的直接接觸。
mt: She later proposed increasing direct contact between Trump and the media.
ref: She then suggested direct contact between Trump and the press will increase.

src: 她說：「川普總統所進行的問與答階段比任何一位前任總統都來得多。」，她在未提供證明的情況下繼續補充：「我們已經看過這些數據。」
mt: She said, “President Trump has done much more Q&A than any other former president.” She continued to add, without proof, that “we’ve seen this data.”
ref: "The president does more Q&A sessions than any president has prior to him," she said, adding without citing evidence: "We've looked at those numbers."

src: 桑德斯說例行記者會還是會舉行，不過「若媒體有機會直接對美國總統提問，那一定好過對著我講。
mt: Sanders said that the regular press conference would still be held, but "if the media had a chance to directly ask questions to the President of the United States, it would be better than telling me.
ref: Briefings will still happen, Sanders said, but "if the press has the chance to ask the president of the United States questions directly, that's infinitely better than talking to me.

src: 我們試著要經常這樣做，你們也看到我們過去幾個星期常常這樣進行，當你們能夠直接與美國總統交談時，這就會取代媒體簡報。」
mt: We're trying to do this all the time, and you've seen how we've done this over the last few weeks, and when you can talk directly to the President of the United States, it's going to replace the press briefing."
ref: We try to do that a lot and you've seen us do that a lot over the last few weeks and that's going to take the place of a press briefing when you can talk to the president of the United States."

src: 在離開白宮時，或是在參加與到訪政要的記者會等公開場合，川普都會固定接受提問。
mt: When leaving the White House, or attending press conferences and visiting dignitaries, Trump will always receive questions regularly.
ref: Trump regularly takes questions when leaving the White House or participating in open sessions or press conferences with visiting dignitaries.

src: 很少舉辦例行記者會。
mt: Rarely holds regular press conferences.
ref: Solo press conferences are rare.

src: 這星期在紐約，總統很可能就示範了箇中原因，他在一群記者前脫稿演出並不時做出怪異表情。
mt: This week in New York, the president is likely to have demonstrated the reasons behind the incident, as he often makes strange expressions in front of a group of reporters.
ref: In New York this week the president perhaps demonstrated why, making a freewheeling and at times bizarre appearance before gathered reporters.

src: 衛生大臣就英國脫歐擔憂去信蘇格蘭 NHS 的歐盟員工
mt: Health Minister's letter to Scottish NHS EU employees on concerns over Brexit
ref: Health secretary writes to EU workers at NHS Scotland over Brexit fears

src: 衛生大臣致函給在蘇格蘭 NHS 工作的歐盟員工，表達國家對他們的感謝之意，並期盼他們會在英國脫歐後留下。
mt: The Minister of Health wrote a letter to EU employees working at the NHS in Scotland, expressing their gratitude to the country and expecting them to stay behind after Brexit.
ref: The Health Secretary has written to EU staff working in Scotland's NHS to express the country's gratitude and wish for them to stay on post-Brexit.

src: 還有不到六個月英國就會脫離歐盟，身兼蘇格蘭議員身分的弗里曼 (Jeane Freeman) 在此時發出了一封信。
mt: In less than six months, Britain will leave the European Union, and Jeane Freeman, who is also a Scottish MP, has sent out a letter at this time.
ref: Jeane Freeman MSP sent a letter with less than six months to go until the UK withdraws from the EU.

src: 蘇格蘭政府已承諾會提撥已處理狀態申請的預算給擔任公職的歐盟公民。
mt: The Scottish government has promised to allocate the budget for processing status applications to EU citizens holding public office.
ref: The Scottish Government has already committed to meet the cost of settled status applications for EU citizens working in its devolved public services.

src: 弗里曼在信中提到：「在整個夏天中，英國與歐盟之間的協調持續進行，目標在這個秋天時達成預計的決定。
mt: Freeman mentioned in the letter that "coordination between the UK and the EU continued throughout the summer, with the goal of achieving the expected decision this autumn.
ref: In her letter, Ms Freeman wrote: "Over the summer, negotiations between the UK and EU on withdrawal have continued, heading towards expected decisions this autumn.

src: 不過在萬一未達成協議的情況下，英國政府也已準備著手應對。
mt: However, if an agreement is not reached, the British government is also ready to take action.
ref: But the UK Government has also been stepping up its preparations for a possible no-deal scenario.

src: 我知道現在人心惶惶。
mt: I know the mood's in jeopardy now.
ref: I know this must be a very unsettling time for all of you.

src: 因此我想要重申，無論任何國籍，我都十分重視每個員工的貢獻。
mt: Therefore, I want to reiterate that regardless of nationality, I attach great importance to the contributions of each employee.
ref: That is why I wanted to reiterate now how much I value the contribution of every member of staff, regardless of their nationality.

src: 來自歐盟及以外的同事帶來了寶貴的經驗和技術，強化並改善衛生服務作業，造福我們服務的病患和社區。
mt: Our colleagues from the EU and beyond have brought valuable experience and technology to strengthen and improve health service operations for the benefit of the patients and communities we serve.
ref: Colleagues from across the EU, and beyond, bring valuable experience and skills that strengthen and improve the work of the health service, and benefit the patients and communities we serve.

src: 蘇格蘭就是你們的家，我們非常想要你們留下。」
mt: Scotland is your home, and we want you to stay."
ref: Scotland is absolutely your home and we very much want you to stay here."

src: Christion Abercrombie 在頭部受傷後進行緊急手術
mt: Christion Abercrombie had emergency surgery after a head injury
ref: Christion Abercrombie Undergoes Emergency Surgery After Suffering Head Injury

src: 《田納西人報》(The Tennessean) Mike Organ 報導，田納西州立大學老虎隊 (Tennessee State Tigers) 線衛 Christion Abercrombie 在頭部受傷後進行了緊急手術，該隊最終以 31-27 輸給范德堡大學指揮官隊 (Vanderbilt Commodores)。
mt: The Tennessee Mike Organ reported that Christion Abercrombie, a linebacker with the Tennessee State Tigers, had an emergency surgery after a head injury, losing to Vanderbilt Commodores 31-27.
ref: Tennessee State Tigers linebacker Christion Abercrombie underwent emergency surgery after suffering a head injury in Saturday's 31-27 defeat to the Vanderbilt Commodores, the Tennessean's Mike Organ reported.

src: 田納西州立大學總教練里德 (Rod Reed) 告訴記者，該球員在半場結束前受傷。
mt: Tennessee State University head coach Rod Reed told reporters that the player was injured before the halftime.
ref: Tennessee State head coach Rod Reed told reporters the injury happened shortly before halftime.

src: 里德說：「他跑到場邊倒下。」
mt: Reed said, "He ran to the scene and fell."
ref: "He came to the sideline and just kind of collapsed there," Reed said.

src: 訓練員和救護人員先給 Abercrombie 氧氣後再將他抬上擔架，並將他帶回以做進一步評估。
mt: Trainers and paramedics first gave Abercrombie oxygen, then carried him onto a stretcher, and brought him back for further evaluation.
ref: Trainers and medical personnel gave Abercrombie oxygen on the sideline before placing him on a stretcher and taking him back for further evaluation.

src: 田納西州立大學的人員在田納西州納許維爾 (Nashville) 告訴 WSMV 的哈里斯 (Chris Harris)，Abercrombie 已在范德堡醫學中心 (Vanderbilt Medical Center) 做完手術。
mt: Tennessee State University staff in Nashville, Tennessee, told Chris Harris of WSMV that Abercrombie had performed surgery at Vanderbilt Medical Center.
ref: An official from Tennessee State told Chris Harris of WSMV in Nashville, Tennessee, that Abercrombie was out of surgery at Vanderbilt Medical Center.

src: 哈里斯補充說明，「尚未知道發生了何種傷害及受傷程度」，田納西州立大學正在嘗試了解傷害何時發生。
mt: Harris added, "We have not yet known what kind of injury or injury occurred," and Tennessee State University is trying to understand when the injury occurred.
ref: Harris added that there are "no details on type/extent of injury yet" and Tennessee State is trying to figure out when the injury occurred.

src: Abercrombie 是從伊利諾州轉學過來的大二學生，這是他在田納西州立大學的第一季。
mt: Abercrombie is a sophomore from Illinois, his first year at the University of Tennessee.
ref: Abercrombie, a redshirt sophomore, is in his first season with Tennessee State after transferring from Illinois.

src: 在他星期六退場前，他總共進行了 5 次擒抱，使得他這一季總共有 18 次擒抱。
mt: Before he retired on Saturday, he had a total of five clutches, making him have a total of 18 tackles this season.
ref: He had five total tackles Saturday before exiting the game, which brought his season total to 18 tackles.

src: 外國買家在英國購置房產時將須付出更高的印花稅
mt: Foreign buyers will pay higher stamp duty when purchasing properties in the UK
ref: Foreign buyers will be charged higher stamp duty when they buy a property in the UK

src: 在新的 Tory 計畫下，外國買家在英國購置房產時將須付出更高的印花稅，額外的款項將用於協助無家可歸者
mt: Under the new Tory programme, foreign buyers will be subject to higher stamp duty when purchasing properties in the UK, and additional funds will be used to assist homeless people
ref: Foreign buyers will be charged higher stamp duty when they buy a property in the UK with the extra cash used to help the homeless under new Tory plans

src: 在科爾賓 (Corbyn) 成功拉攏年輕選民後，此舉將有助扳回一城
mt: When Corbyn succeeds in wooing young voters, it will help bring the city back together.
ref: The move will neutralize the success of Corbyn's drive to attract young voters

src: 若未在英國繳稅，則是印花稅調漲的徵收對象
mt: If the tax is not paid in the UK, it is the subject of the increase in stamp duty
ref: The stamp duty rise will be levied on those who are not paying tax in the UK

src: 財政部預計一年可獲取多達 1.2 億英鎊，用於協助無家可歸者
mt: The Treasury expects to get up to £120 million a year to help homeless people
ref: The Treasury expects it raise up to £120 million a year- to help the homeless

src: 英國梅首相 (Theresa May) 將在今天宣布，外國買家在英國購置房產時將須付出更高的印花稅，額外的款項將用於協助無家可歸者。
mt: UK Prime Minister Theresa May will announce today that foreign buyers will be subject to higher stamp duty when purchasing properties in the UK, with the additional payment being used to help homeless people.
ref: Foreign buyers are set to be charged a higher stamp duty rate when they buy property in the UK - with the extra cash used to help the homeless, Theresa May will announce today.

src: 在科爾賓 (Jeremy Corbyn) 承諾要提供更多負擔得起的房屋並針對高所得一族而成功拉攏年輕選民後，此舉被視為有助扳回一城。
mt: Following Jeremy Corbyn's commitment to providing more affordable housing and successfully wooing young voters for the high-income family, this move was seen as helping to bring the city back together.
ref: The move will be seen as an attempt to neutralize the success of Jeremy Corbyn's drive to attract young voters with pledges to provide more affordable housing and target high earners.

src: 印花稅調漲的徵收對象為未在英國繳稅的個人和公司，額外的款項可協助政府解決露宿問題的決心。
mt: The increase in stamp duty is to individuals and companies who have not paid taxes in the UK, and additional funds can help the government's determination to solve the problem of accommodation.
ref: The stamp duty rise will be levied on individuals and firms not paying tax in the UK, with the extra money boosting the Government's drive to combat rough sleeping.

src: 除了目前的印花稅，附加費用可能多達 3 %，這包括兩年前實施對第二間房產和投資出租房產徵收的附加費用。
mt: In addition to the current stamp duty, the additional charge may be as much as 3%, including the additional charge imposed two years ago on the second property and the investment leasing property.
ref: The surcharge - which is in addition to the present stamp duty, including the higher levels introduced two years ago on second homes and buy-to-lets - could be as much as three per cent.

src: 財政部預計此舉一年可獲取多達 1.2 億英鎊。
mt: The Ministry of Finance expects this move to earn up to £120 million a year.
ref: The Treasury expects the move to raise up to £120 million a year.

src: 估計倫敦有 13% 的新建案是由非英國居民所購買，房價被炒高，使得首購族很難買到房子。
mt: It is estimated that 13% of new construction projects in London were purchased by non-British residents, and the price was skyrocketed, making it difficult for first-time buyers to buy a house.
ref: An estimated 13 per cent of new-build London properties are bought by non-UK residents, driving up prices and making it harder for first-time buyers to get a foot on the housing ladder.

src: 由於多數的外國買家大部分的時間都待在外國，因此許多高級住宅區已變成「鬼城」，特別是首都。
mt: Due to most foreign buyers spend most of their time abroad, many high-end residential areas have become "ghost cities", especially the capital.
ref: Many wealthy areas of the country - particularly in the capital - have become "ghost towns" because of the high number of foreign buyers who spend most of their time out of the country.

src: 在新政策發表的前幾個星期，強生 (Boris Johnson) 提出了減免印花稅以協助年輕人擁有他們的第一間房子。
mt: In the weeks leading up to the new policy’s launch, Boris Johnson introduced a stamp duty reduction to help young people own their first home.
ref: The new policy comes just weeks after Boris Johnson called for a stamp duty cut to help more young people own their first home.

src: 他指責大型建設公司搶購土地但卻不加以利用，藉此炒高房價，他並促請梅首相解除可負擔房屋的限額以解決英國的「居住問題」。
mt: He accused large construction companies of buying land but not using it to inflate house prices, and he also urged Prime Minister May to lift the limit on affordable housing to solve Britain's "residential problem".
ref: He accused big construction firms of keeping property prices high by snapping up land but not using it, and urged Mrs May to abandon quotas on affordable homes to fix Britain's "housing disgrace."

src: 科爾賓發表的一系列引人注目的房屋改革提案，包括控制出租及禁止「無過錯」趕走房客。
mt: Kolbin has published a series of striking housing reform proposals, including controlling rentals and prohibiting "mistake" from driving away tenants.
ref: Mr Corbyn has announced an eye-catching series of proposed housing reforms, including rent controls and an end to "no-fault" evictions.

src: 他也想要賦予各區政府更多建設新房屋的權力。
mt: He also wants to give district governments more power to build new houses.
ref: He also wants to give councils greater powers to build new homes.

src: 梅首相表示：「去年我說過我會首要致力於重建英國夢 - 每個世代的生活應該更好。
mt: Prime Minister May said, "Last year I told you I'd be first committed to rebuilding the British dream - that life should be better for every generation.
ref: Mrs May said: "Last year I said I would dedicate my premiership to restoring the British dream - that life should be better for each new generation.

src: 這意味著修復我們殘破的房市。
mt: This means repairing our ruined housing market.
ref: And that means fixing our broken housing market.

src: 英國永遠會開放給想要在此居住、工作並落地生根的人。
mt: The UK will always be open to those who want to live, work and take root here.
ref: Britain will always be open to people who want to live, work and build a life here.

src: 然而，若沒有住在英國的個人及外資公司像辛苦工作的英國居民一樣容易買到房子，則不是一件對的事情。
mt: However, if there is no individual and foreign-invested company living in the UK that can easily buy a house like hard-working British residents, it's not a right thing to do.
ref: However, it cannot be right that it is as easy for individuals who don't live in the UK, as well as foreign-based companies, to buy homes as hard-working British residents.

src: 對於太多人來講，擁有一間屬於自己房子的夢想已變得太遙遠，而迫使露宿街頭的事確確實實在發生。
mt: For too many people, the dream of owning a house has become too far away, and the forced street sleep indeed happened.
ref: For too many people the dream of home ownership has become all too distant, and the indignity of rough sleeping remains all too real."

src: 羅斯 (Jack Ross)：「我的終極野心是掌管蘇格蘭」
mt: Jack Ross: "My ultimate ambition is to be in charge of Scotland."
ref: Jack Ross: 'My ultimate ambition is to manage Scotland'

src: 桑德蘭 (Sunderland) 的總教練羅斯表示，他的「終極野心」是在大賽中掌管蘇格蘭隊。
mt: Sunderland's head coach Ross said his "ultimate ambition" was to run the Scottish team in the tournament.
ref: Sunderland boss Jack Ross says his "ultimate ambition" is to become the Scotland manager at some stage.

src: 身為蘇格蘭人的他現年 42 歲努力復甦目前位居甲級聯賽第三名的東北俱樂部，落後第一名 3 分。
mt: As a Scotsman, he is now 42 years old, recovering the Northeast Club, which currently ranks third in the First Division, trailing first place by three points.
ref: The Scot, 42, is relishing the challenge of reviving the North-East club, who currently sit third place in League One, three points off the top.

src: 他於上一季帶領聖美倫 (St Mirren) 返回蘇格蘭超級足球聯賽後，他在這個夏天轉往光明球場 (Stadium of Light)。
mt: After leading St Mirren back to the Scottish Premiership last season, he moved to the Stadium of Light this summer.
ref: He moved to the Stadium of Light this summer after guiding St Mirren back to the Scottish Premiership last season.

src: 「我想以球員身分為我的國家上場踢球。
mt: "I want to play as a player for my country.
ref: "I wanted to play for my country as a player.

src: 我進過國家隊一次，領過一頂 B 帽。」羅斯告訴蘇格蘭 BBC 的運動之聲 (Sportsound)。
mt: I've been to the national team once, and I've had a B-hat, "Ross told the Scottish BBC Sportsound.
ref: I got a B cap and that was it," Ross told BBC Scotland's Sportsound.

src: 「我從小就常常和我父親一起在咸普頓 (Hampden) 看蘇格蘭隊踢球，很吸引我。
mt: “I’ve always played with my dad in the Scottish team in Hampden since I was a kid, and it’s been really appealing to me.
ref: "But I grew up watching Scotland at Hampden a lot with my dad as a kid, and it is always something that has drawn me back.

src: 不過如果我管理俱樂部成功，可能才會有這個機會。」
mt: But if I manage the club successfully, I might have this opportunity. "
ref: That opportunity would only come, though, if I am successful in club management."

src: 暨艾德沃卡特(Dick Advocaat)、莫耶斯 (David Moyes)、艾拿戴斯 (Sam Allardyce)、歐尼爾 (Martin O'Neill)、堅尼 (Roy Keane)、普耶 (Gus Poyet) 和迪卡尼奧 (Paulo Di Canio) 之後，羅斯接管桑德蘭。
mt: After Dick Advocaat, David Moyes, Sam Allardyce, Martin O'Neill, Roy Keane, Gus Poyet and Paulo Di Canio, Rossandre took over.
ref: Ross's predecessors as Sunderland manager include Dick Advocaat, David Moyes, Sam Allardyce, Martin O'Neill, Roy Keane, Gus Poyet and Paulo Di Canio.

src: 這位 Alloa Athletic 的前教頭先前婉拒了 Barnsley 和 Ipswich Town 的挖角，對於在這麼多個出色的教練之後接管這個大俱樂部，他表示他並沒有感到不安。
mt: This former head coach of Alloa Athletic had previously declined Barnsley and Ipswich Town's poaching, and he was not anxious about taking over the big club after being taken over by so many excellent coaches.
ref: The former Alloa Athletic boss says he felt no trepidation in following such established names at such a big club, having previously rejected overtures from Barnsley and Ipswich Town.

src: 「我目前的成功與否將取決於：我是否能夠將這個俱樂部帶回超級聯盟？
mt: “My current success will depend on: Will I be able to bring this club back to the Super League?
ref: "Success for me at the moment will be gauged by 'can I return this club to the Premier League?'

src: 依照這個俱樂部的結構和設施來看，無可置疑地屬於超級聯盟。」他說到。
mt: The structure and facilities of this club are undoubtedly part of the Super League, "he says.
ref: Because of the structure and facilities at this club, it undoubtedly belongs in the Premier League," he said.

src: 「要晉升不是一件容易的事，如果我能夠讓俱樂部回到超級聯盟，我才會認為我自己成功了。」
mt: "It's not easy to get a promotion. If I could get the club back to the Super League, I'd think I'd succeeded."
ref: "It is not an easy task to get it there, but I would probably only view myself as being successful here if I can get the club back there."

src: 羅斯 3 年前才開始教練生涯，之前他在 Dumbarton 待任助理教練，還有在 Hearts 輪班擔任指導人員 15 個月。
mt: Ross started his coaching career three years ago as an assistant coach at Dumbarton and a 15-month shift coach at Hearts.
ref: Ross is only three years into his management career, after a period as assistant boss at Dumbarton and a 15-month spell on Hearts' coaching staff.

src: 之後他協助被降級的 Alloa 升回第三級，並將 St Mirren 從降低邊緣一舉推上之後一季的冠軍寶座。
mt: Later, he helped the relegated Alloa be promoted to third level, and from the edge of reduction, St Mirren was promoted to the championship title for the next season.
ref: He then helped Alloa recover from relegation to the third tier, and transformed St Mirren from the brink of relegation to Championship title winners the following season.

src: 羅斯還表示，比起他在 Clyde、Hartlepool、Falkirk、St Mirren 和 Hamilton Academical 時的球員生涯，他現在感到更加自信。
mt: Ross also stated that he now feels more confident than his playing career with Clyde, Hartlepool, Falkirk, St Mirren and Hamilton Academical.
ref: And Ross says he feels more comfortable now than he ever did during his playing career at Clyde, Hartlepool, Falkirk, St Mirren and Hamilton Academical.

src: 他回憶起掌管 Alloa 的時候：「那可能是個真的十字路口。」
mt: He recalled when he was in charge of Alloa: "That could be a real crossroads."
ref: "It was probably a real crossroads," he recalled, of taking charge of Alloa.

src: 「我真的相信我適合掌管球隊的工作，比踢球還適合。
mt: "I really believe that I'm fit to be in charge of the team, better than kicking the ball.
ref: "I genuinely did believe management was the right fit for me, more so than playing.

src: 聽起來很奇怪，因為我表現得還可以、靠這個生活得不錯，也很享受一些高峰。
mt: It sounds strange, because I'm doing well, living a good life, and enjoying some highs.
ref: It sounds bizarre because I did okay, made a reasonable living out of it, and enjoyed some reasonable highs.

src: 但踢球可以很艱辛。
mt: But playing football can be tough.
ref: But playing can be tough.

src: 每個星期必須固定要進行很多事情。
mt: A lot of things have to be done every week.
ref: There are a lot of things you have to get through on a weekly basis.

src: 我仍然要面對工作上的壓力，不過我覺得掌管球隊蠻合適的。
mt: I still have to face work pressure, but I think it's quite suitable to take charge of the team.
ref: I still go through that in terms of the stresses and pressure of the job but management just feels right.

src: 我一直都想要掌管球隊，而現在這就是我正在做的工作，這是在我成人後感到最自在的時候。」
mt: I've always wanted to run the team, and now that's what I'm doing, it's when I feel most comfortable as an adult."
ref: I always wanted to manage and now I am doing it, it feels the most comfortable I have been in my own skin throughout my entire adult life."

src: 您可於 9 月 30 日星期天的英國夏令時間 12:00 至 13:00，在蘇格蘭電台 (Radio Scotland) 收聽運動之聲的完整訪問。
mt: You can listen to the full interview of Voice of Sport on Radio Scotland on Sunday, September 30, from 12:00 to 13:00 British Summer Time.
ref: You can listen to the full interview on Sportsound on Sunday, 30 September, on Radio Scotland between 12:00 and 13:00 BST

src: 調查發現，星期六的下午 5:30 最適合喝杯啤酒
mt: The survey found that Saturday at 5:30 pm was the best place to have a beer.
ref: Perfect time for a pint is 5.30pm on a Saturday, survey finds

src: 夏天熱浪已讓英國搖搖欲墜的酒館增加客源，但對連鎖餐廳堆積了更多壓力。
mt: The summer heatwave has increased the number of customers for Britain's crumbling bars, but has accumulated more pressure on chain restaurants.
ref: The summer heatwave has boosted takings for Britain's struggling pubs but heaped more pressure on restaurant chains.

src: 數據顯示，酒館和酒吧集團在 7 月份的銷售額上漲 2.7% - 但餐廳下跌 4.8%。
mt: Data shows that pubs and bar groups saw sales increase by 2.7% in July - but restaurants fell by 4.8%.
ref: Pub and bar groups saw sales rise 2.7 per cent in July - but takings in restaurants were down 4.8 per cent, figures revealed.

src: 負責整理此數據的企業顧問公司 CGA 的 Peter Martin 說到：「持續的艷陽高照和英格蘭出乎意料在世界盃一路闖關，讓 7 月的模式與 6 月相似，酒館上漲 2.8%，但餐廳經營更加困難。
mt: Peter Martin of CGA, a consulting firm responsible for organizing this data, said: "Continuing bright sunshine and England's unexpected success in the World Cup have made July's model similar to June's, with taverns rising by 2.8%, but restaurant operations are even more difficult.
ref: Peter Martin, of business consultancy CGA, which compiled the figures, said: "Continued sunshine and England's longer than expected participation in the World Cup meant July followed a similar pattern to the previous month of June, when pubs were up 2.8 per cent, except that restaurants were hit even harder.

src: 6 月份的餐廳業務下跌 1.8%，到 7 月分更慘。
mt: The restaurant business fell by 1.8 % in June, and by July it was even worse.
ref: The fall of 1.8 per cent in restaurant trading in June just got worse in July.

src: 以飲料為主的酒館和酒吧到目前為止表現最強，營收比較下，餐廳下跌。
mt: Beverage-based taverns and bars have performed strongest to date, with revenue falling compared to restaurants.
ref: Drink-led pubs and bars performed by far the strongest with like-for-likes up more than restaurants were down.

src: 雖然以食物為主的酒館也在豔陽下吃到苦頭，但不像餐廳經營一般慘淡。
mt: Although taverns, which are mainly food, are suffering under the bright sun, they are not as dismal as restaurant operations.
ref: Food-led pubs also suffered in the sun, although not as dramatically as the restaurant operators.

src: 人們似乎只想要出外喝點東西。
mt: People seem to just want to go out and drink something.
ref: It seems people just wanted to go out for a drink.

src: 該月營業的酒館和酒吧飲料的銷售量上漲 6.6%，而食物的銷售量下跌 3%。」
mt: The sales of taverns and bar drinks that month rose by 6.6%, while the sales of food fell by 3%. "
ref: Across managed pubs and bars drink sales were up 6.6 per cent for the month, with food down three per cent."

src: 娛樂與飯店分析師 RSM Paul Newman 表示：「這些結果持續我們從 4 月底開始所見到的趨勢。
mt: Entertainment and hotel analyst RSM Paul Newman said: "These results continue the trend we've seen since late April.
ref: Paul Newman, of leisure and hospitality analysts RSM said: "These results continue the trend we've seen since the end of April.

src: 天氣和主要社交活動或運動賽事的影響仍然是外出市場銷售量的最大因素。
mt: The impact of weather and major social activities or sports events is still the largest factor in outbound market sales.
ref: Weather and the impact of major social or sporting events remain the biggest factors when it comes to sales in the out-of-home market.

src: 儘管除了現有的成本壓力之外，銷售量一年下跌 4.8% 將會是格外痛苦，不意外地餐廳集團持續掙扎。
mt: Despite the current cost pressures, the restaurant chain continues to struggle with sales falling by 4.8 percent a year.
ref: It comes as no surprise that restaurant groups continue to struggle, albeit a sales drop of 4.8 per cent year-on-year will be particularly painful on top of ongoing cost pressures.

src: 長時間酷熱的夏天對於以食物為主的經營業者來說是最慘的時候，等到過往氣溫較溫和的 8 月來臨便可知道是否有個得以喘息的機會。
mt: The hottest summers over a long period of time are the worst times for food-focused businesses. By August, when temperatures have been relatively mild, we can tell if there's a chance we'll catch our breath.
ref: The long hot summer could not have come at a worse time for food-led operators and time will tell whether the more moderate temperatures we've experienced in August will provide some much-needed respite."

src: 7 月份酒館和餐廳的總銷售成長為 2.7%，當中也包括新開幕的店家，顯示了品牌拓展緩和。
mt: In July, the total sales of taverns and restaurants grew to 2.7%, including new openings, indicating a slowdown in brand expansion.
ref: Total sales growth across pub and restaurants, including new openings, was 2.7 per cent in July, reflecting the slow down in brand roll-outs.

src: 做為業界基準的 Coffer Peach Tracker 是英國酒館、酒吧和餐廳的業務銷售監視，收集並分析 47 個營運集團的績效資料，當中的綜合周轉超過 9 千萬英鎊。
mt: The Coffee Peach Tracker is the industry benchmark that collects and analyzes the performance data of 47 operating groups, including a combined turnover of more than £90 million, from pubs, bars and restaurants in the UK.
ref: The Coffer Peach Tracker industry sales monitor for the UK pub, bar and restaurant sector collects and analyses performance data from 47 operating groups, with a combined turnover of over £9 billion, and is the established industry benchmark.

src: 5 分之 1 的孩子擁有不讓父母發現的秘密社交帳號
mt: 1 in 5 children have a secret social account that their parents won't find
ref: One in five children have secret social media accounts that they hide from their parents

src: 調查顯示，5 分之 1 的孩子擁有不讓父母和師長發現的秘密社交帳號，當中一些人只有 11 歲
mt: Surveys show that 1 in 5 children have secret social accounts that parents and teachers won’t find out, some of whom are only 11 years old.
ref: One in five children - some as young as 11 - have secret social media accounts that they hide from their parents and teachers, survey reveals

src: 20,000 名中學生的問卷調查顯示，「假 Insta」頁面越來越多
mt: A survey of 20,000 secondary school students showed that the "fake Insta" page is becoming more and more
ref: Survey of 20,000 secondary school pupils revealed growth in "fake Insta" pages

src: 新聞特別提到擔心有性內容的貼文
mt: The news especially mentions posts that are worried about sexual content
ref: The news has heightened fears that sexual content is being posted

src: 20% 的學生說他們有一個用來秀給父母看的「主要」帳號
mt: 20% of students say they have a "main" account to show their parents.
ref: Twenty per cent of pupils said they have a "main" account to show parents

src: 5 分之 1 的孩子建立了不讓大人知道的社交帳號，當中一些人只有 11 歲。
mt: 1 in 5 children have created social accounts that are not known to adults, some of whom are only 11 years old.
ref: One in five children - some as young as 11 - are creating social media accounts that they keep secret from adults.

src: 一份 20,000 名中學學生的問卷調查顯示，「假 Insta」帳號快速成長 - Insta 指的是照片分享網站 Instagram。
mt: A survey of 20,000 high school students showed that the "fake Insta" account grew rapidly - Insta refers to the photo-sharing website Instagram.
ref: A survey of 20,000 secondary school pupils revealed a rapid growth in "fake Insta" accounts - a reference to photo-sharing site Instagram.

src: 新聞特別提到擔心有性內容的貼文。
mt: The news particularly mentions posts that are worried about sexual content.
ref: The news has heightened fears that sexual content is being posted.

src: 20% 的學生說他們有一個用來秀給父母看的乖小孩「主要」帳號，同時也擁有私人帳號。
mt: 20% of students say they have a "primary" account to show their parents and also a private account.
ref: Twenty per cent of pupils said they operate a sanitized "main" account to show parents, while also having private ones.

src: 一位母親偶然發現她 13 歲女兒的秘密網站，發現有一名青少年慫恿其他人「強暴我。」
mt: One mother stumbled upon a secret website about her 13-year-old daughter, and discovered that one of the teenagers had encouraged others to "rape me."
ref: One mother who stumbled across her 13-year-old's daughter's secret site found a teenager urging others to "rape me."

src: 英國數位警覺 (Digital Awareness UK) 與獨立學校的校長會議 (HMC) 的研究顯示，40% 11 至 18 歲的人擁有兩個個人檔案，當中一半是私人帳號。
mt: A study by Digital Awareness UK and HMC, an independent school, found that 40% of people aged 11 to 18 have two personal files, half of which are private accounts.
ref: The research, by Digital Awareness UK and the Headmasters" and Headmistresses" Conference (HMC) of independent schools, found 40 per cent of 11 to 18-year-olds had two profiles, with half of those admitting to keeping private accounts.

src: HMC 主席 Mike Buchanan 表示：「那麼多青少年嘗試建立一個父母和師長找不到他們的線上空間，這著實令人感到不安。」
mt: “It’s really unsettling for so many teenagers to try to build an online space where parents and teachers can’t find them,” said Mike Buchanan, Chairman of HMC.
ref: HMC chief Mike Buchanan said: "It's disturbing so many teenagers are tempted into creating online spaces where parents and teachers cannot find them."

src: Eilidh Doyle 將在蘇格蘭運動員理事會中為「運動員發聲」
mt: Eilidh Doyle will speak for “athletes” on the Scottish Athletes Council
ref: Eilidh Doyle will be "voice for athletes" on Scottish Athletics board

src: 在管理委員會的年度大會上，Eilidh Doyle 被選為出任蘇格蘭運動員理事會的非執行董事。
mt: At the annual meeting of the Management Committee, Eilidh Doyle was elected as a non-executive director of the Scottish Athletes Council.
ref: Eilidh Doyle has been elected to the board of Scottish Athletics as a non-executive director at the governing body's annual general meeting.

src: Doyle 是蘇格蘭最優秀的田徑選手，主席 Ian Beattie 形容這是一個很好的機會，她過去十多年國際水準的豐富經驗會使主導運動的人能夠從中獲益。
mt: Doyle is the best track and field athlete in Scotland, and Chairman Ian Beattie describes it as a great opportunity. Her experience of more than ten years of international standard will benefit the people who lead the sport.
ref: Doyle is Scotland's most decorated track and field athlete and chairman Ian Beattie described the move as a great opportunity for those guiding the sport to benefit from her wide-ranging experience at international level over the past decade.

src: Beattie 表示:「Eilidh 非常受蘇格蘭、英國和世界上的運動員愛戴，我們相信她的加入會使蘇格蘭的運動員十分受益。」
mt: Beattie said, “Eilidh is very much loved by athletes from Scotland, the UK and the world. We believe her presence will benefit Scottish athletes very much.”
ref: "Eilidh has massive respect across the Scottish, UK and world athletics community and we are sure athletics in Scotland would benefit hugely by bringing her on to the board," Beattie said.

src: Doyle 說：「我非常想要為運動員發聲，希望我真的能夠在蘇格蘭有所貢獻並協助主導運動。」
mt: “I really want to speak up for athletes,” Doyle said. “I wish I could really contribute to and help lead the movement in Scotland.”
ref: Doyle said: "I am keen to act as a voice for athletes and I am hoping I can really contribute and help guide the sport in Scotland."

src: 一名於 1996 年雅典奧運贏得 200 公尺和 400 公尺比賽的美國人，發生暫時性腦缺血後便無法走路。他總共贏得 4 面奧運金牌，目前是 BBC 的固定名嘴。
mt: An American who won the 200m and 400m events at the Athens Olympics in 1996 was unable to walk after a temporary cerebral ischemia. He won a total of four Olympic gold medals, and is now a fixture of the BBC.
ref: The American, who won the 200 meters and 400 meters at the 1996 Games in Atlanta among his total of four Olympic golds and is now a regular BBC pundit, was left unable to walk after suffering a transient ischemic attack.

src: 他在推特上寫到：「一個月前的今天我中風了。
mt: He tweeted: "I had a stroke today a month ago.
ref: He wrote on Twitter: "A month ago today I suffered a stroke.

src: 我沒辦法走路。
mt: I can't walk.
ref: I could not walk.

src: 醫生說只能等看看我是否會康復或是康復到哪種程度。
mt: The doctor said that I could only wait to see if I would recover or recover to what extent.
ref: Doctors said only time will tell if I will recover or to what degree.

src: 整個過程很艱難，但完全康復了，重新學習了如何走路，今天是敏捷度訓練！
mt: The whole process was very difficult, but I fully recovered, and learned how to walk again, today is the agility training!
ref: Its been grueling work but made a full recovery, re-learned how to walk and today doing agility drills!

src: 感謝大家的鼓勵訊息！」
mt: Thank you for your encouragement! "
ref: Thanks for the messages of encouragement!"

src: 吸乳器廣告拿媽媽與乳牛做比較，引發網上不同的意見
mt: Ads for breast pump compares mother with cow, triggering different opinions online
ref: Breast pump advert comparing mothers to cows divides opinion online

src: 一間吸乳器公司的廣告拿哺乳媽媽與正在擠牛奶的乳牛做比較，引發網上不同的意見。
mt: An advertisement from a breast pump company compared breastfeeding mothers with cows who are milking them, sparking different opinions online.
ref: A breast pump company has divided opinion online with an advert that compares nursing mothers to cows being milked.

src: 為了推出據說是「世界上第一台可配戴式靜音吸乳器」，消費者科技公司 Elvie 製作出一則詼諧的音樂錄影帶風格的廣告，展示新款吸乳器能夠為擠乳媽媽帶來自由。
mt: Elvie, a consumer technology company, has produced a witty music video-style ad to promote the world's first wearable breast pump. Elvie has shown that the new breast pump can bring freedom to the breast-feeding mothers.
ref: To mark the launch of what is said to be the "world's first silent wearable breast bump," consumer tech company Elvie released a tongue-in-cheek music video-inspired advert to showcase the freedom the new pump gives to expressing mothers.

src: 4 名真正的媽媽在都是草的乳牛穀倉中跳舞，音樂中的歌詞像是：「是的，我自己擠奶，但你看不到尾巴」以及「萬一你沒留意到，那是我的胸部。」
mt: Four real mothers danced in a barn filled with grass cows. The lyrics were like, "Yes, I milk myself, but you can't see the tail." And, "If you don't notice it, it's my breast."
ref: Four real mothers dance in a hay-filled barn of cows to a track that includes lyrics like: "Yes, I milk myself, but you don't see no tail" and "In case you hadn't noticed these are not udders, they're my boobs."

src: 合唱繼續進行：「擠出來，擠出來，我在餵寶寶喝奶，擠出來，擠出來，我在擠奶。」
mt: The chorus continues: "Squeeze out, squeeze out, I'm feeding the baby, squeeze out, squeeze out, I'm milking."
ref: The chorus continues: "Pump it out, pump it out, I'm feeding them babies, pump it out, pump it out, I'm milking my ladies."

src: 然而，該公司的臉書頁面上所發表的此廣告已在網上引發爭議。
mt: However, this advertisement published on the company's Facebook page has sparked controversy online.
ref: However, the advert, which has been published on the firm's Facebook page, has caused controversy online.

src: 該影片有 77,000 次觀看及數百則留言，觀看者給予了不同的反應，許多人說這可以說明乳品加工業的「恐怖」。
mt: The video has 77,000 views and hundreds of comments, with viewers responding differently, many saying this can explain the "terror" of dairy processing industry.
ref: With 77,000 views and hundreds of comments, the video has received mixed reactions from viewers, with many saying it makes light of the "horrors" of the dairy industry.

src: 「使用乳牛來宣傳此產品真是一個很爛的決定。
mt: "It's really a bad decision to use a cow to promote this product.
ref: "Very poor decision using cows to advertise this product.

src: 就跟我們一樣，牠們必須先受孕並生產後才可分泌牛奶，不過在生完幾天內牠們的寶寶就會從牠們的身邊被偷走。」，有一個人這麼寫。
mt: Just like us, they have to get pregnant and give birth before they can secrete milk, but within a few days, their babies will be stolen from them. "There's a person who wrote that.
ref: Like us they need to get pregnant and give birth in order to produce milk, except their babies are stolen from them within days of giving birth," one wrote.

src: Elvie 吸乳器可穿在哺乳內衣 (Elvie/Mother) 裡，不會被人發現
mt: The Elvie breast pump can be worn in the breastfeeding underwear (Elvie/Mother) and will not be found
ref: The Elvie breast pump fits discreetly inside a nursing bra (Elvie/Mother)

src: 另一個人留言：「對媽媽和寶寶來講是個可以理解的創傷。
mt: Another person's message: "To mom and baby, it's an understandable trauma.
ref: Another commented: "Understandably traumatic for both mother and baby.

src: 不過對啊，可以用來宣傳吸乳器適用於能夠留下寶寶的媽媽啊。」
mt: But yes, it can be used to promote the use of breast pumps for mothers who can leave their babies behind. "
ref: But yeah why not use them to advertise a breast pump for mothers who get to keep their babies?"

src: 有一個人補充：「這個廣告真與社會脫節。」
mt: One person added, "This advertisement really is out of touch with society."
ref: Someone else added: "Such an out of touch advert."

src: 其他人為廣告說話，一名女性承認她覺得這首歌「很搞笑」。
mt: Other people talked about the advertisement, and a woman admitted that she thought this song was "very funny".
ref: Others defended the advert, with one woman admitting that she found the song "hilarious."

src: 有一個人寫到：「我覺得這主意真天才。
mt: One person wrote: "I think this idea is really genius.
ref: "I think this is a genus idea.

src: 如果我還在哺乳，我會買一台。
mt: If I'm still breastfeeding, I'll buy one.
ref: I would've had one if I was still breastfeeding.

src: 擠奶讓我真的覺得我像是一頭乳牛。
mt: Milking made me really feel like a cow.
ref: Pumping made me feel exactly like a cow.

src: 廣告有一點瘋狂，但我認為沒有別的意思。
mt: The ads are a little crazy, but I don't think it means anything else.
ref: The advert is a little mad but I took it for what it was.

src: 這個產品真鬼馬。」
mt: This product is really a ghost horse."
ref: This is a genius product," one wrote.

src: 另一個人留言：「這是一個有趣的廣告，目標客源是要擠奶 (通常在工作場所或廁所) 並覺得像是一頭乳牛的媽媽。」
mt: Another commenter said, “It’s an interesting ad targeting milking (often in the workplace or in the bathroom) and feeling like a mother of a cow.”
ref: Another commented: "This is a fun advert aimed at mums who pump (often in their workplaces or toilets) and feel like "cows."

src: 「此廣告不是要讚揚或批評乳品加工業。」
mt: "This ad is not intended to praise or criticize the dairy industry."
ref: This is not an advert praising or judging the dairy industry."

src: 在影片結尾處，這群女人展示她們跳舞時內衣裡塞了新款吸乳器。
mt: At the end of the film, this group of women showed them dancing and stuffed a new breast pump into their underwear.
ref: At the end of the video the group of women reveal they've all been dancing with the discreet pumps tucked in their bras.

src: 此活動背後的概念是，很多哺乳的女性表示她們覺得自己像乳牛。
mt: The concept behind this activity is that many breastfeeding women feel like cows.
ref: The concept behind the campaign is based on the insight that many women who breast-pump say they feel like cows.

src: 然而 Elvie 吸乳器完全靜音、沒有電線或管線，可塞在哺乳內衣哩，因此女性在擠奶時可自由活動、抱著她們的寶寶，甚至外出活動。
mt: However, the Elvie breast pumps are completely silent, without wires or pipes, and can be plugged into lactating lingerie miles, so women can freely move around, hold their babies while milking, and even go out to play.
ref: The Elvie Pump however, is completely silent, has no wires or tubes and fits discreetly inside a nursing bra, giving women the freedom to move, hold their babies, and even go out while pumping.

src: Mother 的 ECD 兼合夥人 Ana Balarin 表示：「Elvie 吸乳器是革命性的產品，值得我們用大膽且刺激的方式推出。
mt: Ana Balarin, ECD partner at Mother, said, “The Elvie breast pump is a revolutionary product and deserves a bold and exciting introduction.
ref: Ana Balarin, partner and ECD at Mother commented: "The Elvie Pump is such a revolutionary product that it deserved a bold and provocative launch.

src: 藉由拿擠乳媽媽與乳牛相提並論，我們以具備娛樂性又可聯想的方式，來展示新款吸乳器能夠帶來什麼不可思議的感覺，同時也想要將重點放在擠奶和當中的所有挑戰。
mt: By comparing a milking mother with a cow, we present the incredible feeling of the new breast pump in an entertaining and relatable way, and also want to focus on milking and all the challenges that come with it.
ref: By drawing a parallel between expressing women and dairy cows we wanted to put breast pumping and all its challenges in the spotlight, while demonstrating in an entertaining and relatable way the incredible sense of freedom that the new pump will bring.

src: 這不是第一次 Elvie 吸乳器上了頭條。
mt: This is not the first time that Elvie's breast pump has made headlines.
ref: This is not the first time the Elvie pump has made the headlines.

src: 在倫敦時尚週期間，一名有兩個孩子的媽媽一邊使用該產品，一邊登上設計師 Marta Jakubowski 的伸展台。
mt: During Fashion Week in London, a mother of two children used the product while climbing the runways of designer Marta Jakubowski.
ref: During London Fashion Week, a mother of two appeared on the catwalk for designer Marta Jakubowski while using the product.

src: 數以百計的流動兒童靜悄悄地搬到位於德州邊境的一處帳篷營地
mt: Hundreds of mobile children quietly moved to a tent camp on the Texas border.
ref: Hundreds of Migrant Children Quietly Moved to a Tent Camp on the Texas Border

src: 即使每個月跨境的人數相對維持不變，但被拘留的流動兒童數量飆升，部分原因是由於嚴厲的言論和川普政府訂下的政策，更難能夠透過擔保人來安置兒童。
mt: Even though the number of cross-border children remains relatively unchanged every month, the number of mobile children being detained has skyrocketed, partly because of harsh rhetoric and Trump's government-established policies, making it even harder to secure children through guarantors.
ref: The number of detained migrant children has spiked even though monthly border crossings have remained relatively unchanged, in part because harsh rhetoric and policies introduced by the Trump administration have made it harder to place children with sponsors.

src: 傳統上，大部分的擔保人本身是沒有證件的移民，他們害怕挺身擔保兒童會害到自己留在美國的能力。
mt: Traditionally, most guarantors themselves are undocumented immigrants, who fear that standing up to guarantee children will harm their ability to stay in the United States.
ref: Traditionally, most sponsors have been undocumented immigrants themselves, and have feared jeopardizing their own ability to remain in the country by stepping forward to claim a child.

src: 在 6 月時聯邦當局宣布，可能的擔保人和其家中成年人都必須繳交指紋，而且資料會與移民機關共用，進一步增加風險。
mt: In June, the federal authorities announced that potential guarantors and adults in their homes must submit fingerprints, and that the data will be shared with immigration authorities, further increasing the risk.
ref: The risk increased in June, when federal authorities announced that potential sponsors and other adult members of their households would have to submit fingerprints, and that the data would be shared with immigration authorities.

src: 就在上個星期，美國移民及海關執法局的資深官員 Matthew Albence 在國會上作證，指當局已經逮捕數十名申請擔保未成年無伴移民的民眾。
mt: Just last week, Matthew Albence, a senior U.S. immigration and customs law enforcement official, testified in Congress that authorities have arrested dozens of people who have applied to secure un ⁇  minor immigration petitions.
ref: Last week, Matthew Albence, a senior official with Immigration and Customs Enforcement, testified before Congress that the agency had arrested dozens of people who applied to sponsor unaccompanied minors.

src: 之後當局確認 70% 的被捕民眾之前沒有犯罪記錄。
mt: Authorities later confirmed that 70 percent of those arrested had no prior criminal records.
ref: The agency later confirmed that 70 percent of those arrested did not have prior criminal records.

src: 「擔保人或擔保人的家中成員有接近 80% 的人非法滯留在美國，絕大部分是犯罪外籍人士。
mt: "Nearly 80 percent of the guarantors or guarantors in their homes have been illegally stranded in the US, with the vast majority being foreign nationals of crime.
ref: "Close to 80 percent of the individuals that are either sponsors or household members of sponsors are here in the country illegally, and a large chunk of those are criminal aliens.

src: 所以我們持續追緝這些個人」，Albence 先生如此說到。
mt: So we're constantly chasing these individuals, "says Mr. Albence.
ref: So we are continuing to pursue those individuals," Mr. Albence said.

src: 根據庇護所工作人員的說法，為了更快速地處理這些兒童，官方採用了新規則，要求他們當中的一些人必須在被拘留的一個月內出庭，而不是在原本標準的 60 天後。
mt: According to the staff of the shelter, in order to handle these children more quickly, the official adopted a new rule, requiring some of them to appear in court within one month of being detained, rather than 60 days after their original standard.
ref: Seeking to process the children more quickly, officials introduced new rules that will require some of them to appear in court within a month of being detained, rather than after 60 days, which was the previous standard, according to shelter workers.

src: 許多人不會親自出席，而是以視訊的方式向移民法官辯護其合法地位。
mt: Many people will not attend in person, but rather use video conferencing to defend their legal status with immigration judges.
ref: Many will appear via video conference call, rather than in person, to plead their case for legal status to an immigration judge.

src: 被視為沒有資格獲得釋放的人將很快被驅逐出境。
mt: Those deemed unqualified to be released will soon be expelled from the country.
ref: Those who are deemed ineligible for relief will be swiftly deported.

src: 根據庇護所工作人員和最近幾個月系統所呈現的報告顯示，這些兒童留在看守所越久，他們會變得越焦躁不安，可能會演變為暴力衝突或試圖逃走。
mt: According to reports presented by shelter staff and recent months' systems, the longer these children stay in the detention center, the more anxious they become, which may evolve into violent conflicts or attempts to escape.
ref: The longer that children remain in custody, the more likely they are to become anxious or depressed, which can lead to violent outbursts or escape attempts, according to shelter workers and reports that have emerged from the system in recent months.

src: 辯護人指出，這些顧慮會在像是 Tornillo 的大型設施中增加，由於其規模的緣故，兒童掙扎的跡象比較可能被忽略。
mt: The defense attorney pointed out that these concerns will increase in large facilities such as Tornillo, and due to its scale, the signs of children's struggles are more likely to be ignored.
ref: Advocates said those concerns are heightened at a larger facility like Tornillo, where signs that a child is struggling are more likely to be overlooked, because of its size.

src: 他們還提到，將這些兒童搬去帳篷城之前，若沒有提供足夠的時間來讓他們做好心理準備或與朋友道別，可能會造成他們許多人都已在經歷的創傷。
mt: They also mentioned that if they didn't provide enough time for them to prepare mentally or say goodbye to their friends before moving these children to the tent city, it might be a trauma many of them have already experienced.
ref: They added that moving children to the tent city without providing enough time to prepare them emotionally or to say goodbye to friends could compound trauma that many are already struggling with.

src: 敘利亞告訴美國、法國和土耳其立刻撤回「佔領勢力」
mt: Syria has told the United States, France and Turkey to immediately withdraw the "occupation forces."
ref: Syria tells US, French and Turkish 'occupying forces' to withdraw immediately

src: 外交部長 Walid al-Moualem 在聯合國大會上發表演說，也呼籲敘利亞難民回到家鄉。敘利亞內戰已經是第 8 年了。
mt: Foreign Minister Walid al-Moualem addressed the United Nations General Assembly and called on Syrian refugees to return home. The Syrian civil war is already eight years old.
ref: Addressing the UN General Assembly, Foreign Minister Walid al-Moualem also called on Syrian refugees to come home, even though the country's war is now in its eighth year.

src: 身兼副總理的 Moualem 表示，外國勢力藉由對抗恐怖主義的名義非法進駐敘利亞的領土，將「依情況處理」。
mt: As deputy prime minister, Moualem said that foreign forces illegally entered Syria's territory under the pretext of countering terrorism, and would "deal with it on a case-by-case basis".
ref: Moualem, who also serves as deputy prime minister, said the foreign forces were on Syrian soil illegally, under the pretext of fighting terrorism, and "will be dealt with accordingly."

src: 他告訴大會：「他們必須毫無條件地立刻撤出。」
mt: He told the assembly, "They must leave immediately without conditions."
ref: "They must withdraw immediately and without any conditions," he told the assembly.

src: Moualem 堅持在敘利亞的「反恐戰爭幾乎要結束了」，從 2011 年起已經有超過 360,000 個人死亡，百萬人流離失所。
mt: Moualem insists on “The war on terror is almost over” in Syria, with more than 360,000 deaths and one million displaced since 2011.
ref: Moualem insisted that the "war on terror is almost over" in Syria, where more than 360,000 people have died since 2011, with millions more uprooted from their homes.

src: 他表示，大馬士革 (Damascus) 會繼續「打這場聖戰，直到我們從恐怖組織和任何非法的外國存在勢力收復敘利亞的領土。」
mt: He said Damascus would continue to “fight this jihad until we recover Syria’s territory from terrorist organizations and any illegal foreign power.”
ref: He said Damascus would continue "fighting this sacred battle until we purge all Syrian territories" of both terror groups and "any illegal foreign presence."

src: 美國在敘利亞有 2,000 名士兵，主要負責對反總統 Bashar al-Assad 的庫德爾勢力和敘利亞阿拉伯武裝進行訓練及宣傳。
mt: The United States has 2,000 soldiers in Syria, mainly responsible for training and propaganda against the Kurdish forces of anti-President Bashar al-Assad and the Syrian Arab armed forces.
ref: The United States has some 2,000 troops in Syria, mainly training and advising both Kurdish forces and Syrian Arabs opposed to President Bashar al-Assad.

src: 在這個被戰爭摧殘的國家，法國在場上有 1,000 名以上的士兵。
mt: In this war-ravaged country, France had more than 1,000 soldiers on the scene.
ref: France has more than 1,000 troops on the ground in the war-wracked country.

src: 對於難民的問題，Moualem 表示依目前的局勢良好，他們可以回家，而且他指責「一些西方勢力散播不合理的恐慌」，促使難民遠離家園。
mt: Regarding the issue of refugees, Moualem said that according to the current situation is good, they can go home and he accused "some Western forces spreading unreasonable panic" which has driven refugees away from their homes.
ref: On the issue of refugees, Moualem said the conditions were fine for them to return, and he blamed "some western countries" for "spreading irrational fears" that prompted refugees to stay away.

src: 他說：「我們已呼籲國際團體和人道組織協助他們返回家園。」
mt: He said, "We have called on international and humanitarian organizations to help them return home."
ref: "We have called upon the international community and humanitarian organizations to facilitate these returns," he said.

src: 「本來只是單純的人道問題，他們卻將其政治化。」
mt: "Originally it was just a humanitarian issue, but they politicized it," says Chen.
ref: "They are politicizing what should be a purely humanitarian issue."

src: 美國和歐盟警告，在 Assad 與反對派取得結束戰爭的政治協議前，將不會援助敘利亞重建。
mt: The United States and the EU have warned that they will not assist Syria's reconstruction until Assad and the opposition have secured a political agreement to end the war.
