ref: The United States and the European Union have warned that there will be no reconstruction aid for Syria until there is a political agreement between Assad and the opposition to end the war.

src: 聯合國外交官提到，俄羅斯與土耳其之間最近達成一項協議，將會在反政府軍主要據點的伊德利卜省 (Idlib) 劃設非軍事緩衝區，這項協議帶來了竭力推動政治對話的機會。
mt: UN diplomats mentioned that Russia and Turkey have recently reached an agreement to set up a non-military buffer zone in the main anti-government military stronghold of Idlib province, which has brought about the opportunity to vigorously promote political dialogue.
ref: UN diplomats say a recent agreement between Russia and Turkey to set up a buffer zone in the last major rebel stronghold of Idlib has created an opportunity to press ahead with political talks.

src: 有 3 百萬人居住在該省，俄羅斯與土耳其的協議在該省防止了背後有俄羅斯支撐的敘利亞勢力發生大規模衝突。
mt: Three million people live in the province, Russia's agreement with Turkey has prevented a large-scale conflict between Syrian forces backed by Russia.
ref: The Russian-Turkish deal averted a large-scale assault by Russian-backed Syrian forces on the province, where three million people live.

src: 不過 Moualem 強調該協議「沒有期限」，並期望軍事行動將剷滅蓋達組織派系「努斯拉陣線」(Al-Nusra Front) 等的聖戰份子。
mt: However, Moualem emphasized that the agreement had "no deadlines" and hoped that military action would eliminate al-Nusra Front, a group of al-Qaeda fighters.
ref: Moualem however stressed that the agreement had "clear deadlines" and expressed hope that military action will target jihadists including fighters from the Al-Qaeda-linked Nusra Front, who "will be eradicated."

src: 聯合國特使德米斯圖拉 (Staffan de Mistura) 希望由政府和反對派成員所組成的新委員會盡快招開第一次會議，以擬定戰後敘利亞的憲法並落實選舉。
mt: United Nations special envoy Staffan de Mistura hoped that a new committee composed of government and opposition members would convene as soon as possible to draft the post-war Syrian constitution and implement elections.
ref: UN envoy Staffan de Mistura is hoping to soon convene the first meetings of a new committee comprised of government and opposition members to draft a post-war constitution for Syria and pave the way to elections.

src: Moualem 提出讓敘利亞政府參與委員會的條件，表示小組工作應限制在「檢視目前憲法的條文」，並警告不可干預。
mt: Moualem proposes the conditions for the Syrian government to participate in the committee, stating that the work of the group should be limited to "viewing the provisions of the current constitution" and warning against interference.
ref: Moualem laid out conditions for the Syrian government's participation in the committee, saying the panel's work should be restricted "to reviewing the articles of the current constitution," and warned against interference.

src: 川普為何將贏得第二任期
mt: Why Trump Will Win His Second Term
ref: Why Trump Will Win a Second Term

src: 照邏輯來看，除非由於如同許多自由派民眾的期望，川普因彈劾及醜聞提前結束他的總統生涯，否則川普應該會在 2020 年再次贏得大選。
mt: Logically, unless Trump's presidential career is brought to an end by impeachment and scandal, as many liberals have hoped, Trump should win the general election again in 2020.
ref: By that logic, Mr. Trump would win re-election in 2020 unless, as many liberal viewers are probably hoping, impeachment and scandal end his presidency prematurely.

src: 毫無疑問，「有史以來最戲劇化的總統生涯大結局！」
mt: There's no doubt that "the most dramatic of all the presidential lives in history!"
ref: In what would no doubt be "The most dramatic finale of a presidency ever!"

src: 目前觀眾還看不膩。
mt: The audience is still not tired of it.
ref: As of now, there are no signs of viewer fatigue.

src: 從 2014 年起的精華時段收視人口，CNN 翻倍達到 105 萬，MSNBC 翻了近三倍，有 160 萬。
mt: Since 2014, the prime-time viewership population of CNN has doubled to 1.05 million, and MSNBC has nearly tripled to 1.6 million.
ref: Since 2014, prime-time ratings have more than doubled to 1.05 million at CNN and nearly tripled to 1.6 million at MSNBC.

src: 根據尼爾森 (Nielsen) 調查，福斯新聞網 (Fox News) 精華時段的平均觀眾人口上升到 240 萬，4 年前是 170 萬。有線電視收視率的冠軍是 MSNBC 的《瑞秋·梅道秀》(The Rachel Maddow Show)，在發生重大新聞的晚上有多達 350 萬個觀眾。
mt: According to a Nielsen survey, the average audience for Fox News' prime-time segment rose to 2.4 million, four years ago to 1.7 million. The winner of cable TV ratings was MSNBC's The Rachel Maddow Show, with an audience of 3.5 million on major news nights.
ref: Fox News has an average of 2.4 million prime-time viewers, up from 1.7 million four years ago, according to Nielsen, and MSNBC's "The Rachel Maddow Show" has topped cable ratings with as many as 3.5 million viewers on major news nights.

src: ABC 戲劇《指定倖存者》(Designated Survivor) 的節目統籌 Neal Baer 說：「這不是我們理解的事情，所以人們就被吸引過去。」。《指定倖存者》講的是國會遭到攻擊被摧毀後，一位內閣部長成為總統的故事。
mt: Neal Baer, program coordinator for ABC's drama "Designated Survivor," says, "It's not something we understand, so people are drawn to it." "Designated Survivor" tells the story of a cabinet minister who becomes president once Congress is attacked and destroyed.
ref: "This is a fire that people are being drawn to because it's not something we understand," said Neal Baer, show runner of the ABC drama "Designated Survivor," about a cabinet secretary who becomes president after an attack destroys the Capitol.

src: 資深喜劇作家 Nell Scovel，同時也是《Just the Funny Parts: And a Few Hard Truths About Sneaking Into the Hollywood Boys》的作者，則有另一套理論。
mt: Veteran comedian Nell Scovel, and the author of Just the Funny Parts: And a Few Hard Truths About Sneaking Into the Hollywood Boys, has another theory.
ref: Nell Scovell, a veteran comedy writer and author of "Just the Funny Parts: And a Few Hard Truths About Sneaking Into the Hollywood Boys" Club," has another theory.

src: 她記得 2016 年選舉前在波士頓搭了計程車。
mt: She remembers taking a taxi in Boston before the 2016 election.
ref: She remembers a cab ride in Boston before the 2016 election.

src: 司機告訴她他會投給川普一票。
mt: The driver told her he would vote for Trump.
ref: The driver told her he would be voting for Mr. Trump.

src: 她問：「為什麼」。
mt: She asked, "Why?"
ref: Why? she asked.

src: 他說：「因為他讓我大笑。」Scovell 告訴我。
mt: And he said, "Because he made me laugh," and Scovell told me.
ref: "He said, "Because he makes me laugh,"" Ms. Scovell told me.

src: 整個鬧劇具有娛樂價值。
mt: The entire farce has entertainment value.
ref: There is entertainment value in the chaos.

src: 不過當然與電視節目播出的內容不同，華盛頓裡的故事發展會決定羅伊訴韋德案的未來、移民家庭是否可團聚，以及全球經濟的健康。
mt: However, of course, unlike the content broadcast on television programs, Washington's story development will determine the future of Roy v. Wade, whether immigrant families can reunite, and the health of the global economy.
ref: Of course, unlike anything else on TV, the story lines coming out of Washington could determine the future of Roe v. Wade, whether immigrant families can reunite and the health of the global economy.

src: 只有最有特權的觀眾才可置之不理。
mt: Only the most privileged audience can ignore it.
ref: Tuning out is a luxury only the most privileged viewers can afford.

src: 還有，你不僅只是一個知情的市民，你發現你自己花了 6 個小時看一群專家爭論Bob Woodward 利用「極具背景」的消息來源寫了新書《Fear》、Paul Manafort 的鴕鳥皮夾克要價 $15,000 美金 (《華盛頓郵報》形容這是「滿是傲慢的服裝」)，以及 Stormy Daniels 對川普身體誇大描述的瓜葛。
mt: And you're not only an informed citizen, you've found yourself spending six hours reading a group of experts arguing that Bob Woodward wrote a new book called Fear using "background" sources, Paul Manafort's ostrich jacket asking for $15,000 (the Washington Post described it as "full of arrogant clothing"), and Stormy Daniels' tumbling block to Trump's body.
ref: And yet, it goes beyond being an informed citizen when you find yourself on hour six of watching a panel of experts debate Bob Woodward's use of "deep background" sourcing for his book "Fear," Paul Manafort's $15,000 ostrich-leather bomber jacket ("a garment thick with hubris," The Washington Post said) and the implications of Stormy Daniels's lurid descriptions of Mr. Trump's, um, anatomy.

src: 我再也不會以相同目光看待超級瑪莉。
mt: I'll never look at Super Mary the same way again.
ref: I, for one, will never look at Super Mario the same way again.

src: 對於川普秀的輪換演員和每天超展開的情節 (與 N.F.L. 爭吵、稱讚金正恩)，Wheelhouse Entertainment 的執行長兼《當鋪之星》 (Pawn Stars) 的構思者 Brent Montgomery 說：「部分原因是他每晚都給你看一點，因此他做的事情感覺好像是真人秀。」
mt: Regarding Trump’s cast and daily over-the-top storyline (s arguing with N.F.L., praising Kim Jong-un), Wheelhouse Entertainment’s CEO and Pawn Stars’ ideologue, Brent Montgomery said, “Part of the reason is that he shows you a little every night, so what he does feels like a reality show.”
ref: "Part of what he's doing that makes it feel like a reality show is that he is feeding you something every night," said Brent Montgomery, chief executive of Wheelhouse Entertainment and the creator of "Pawn Stars," about the Trump show's rotating cast and daily plot twists (picking a fight with the N.F.L., praising Kim Jong-un).

src: 你不可錯誤任何一集，要不然你就落後了。
mt: You can't miss any episode, or you're behind.
ref: You can't afford to miss one episode or you're left behind.

src: 當我這個星期拜訪 Fleiss 先生位於 Kauai 北岸的家時，外頭艷陽高照，華氏 80 度，但他在裡頭堅持著，一邊看著 MSNBC 一邊錄著 CNN。
mt: When I visited Mr. Fleiss' home on the north bank of Kauai this week, it was bright and sunny, 80 degrees Fahrenheit, but he insisted inside, watching MSNBC while recording CNN.
ref: When I reached Mr. Fleiss this week, it was a sunny 80 degrees outside his home on the north shore of Kauai, but he was holed up inside watching MSNBC while recording CNN.

src: 卡瓦諾 ( Brett Kavanaugh) 準備面對參議員司法委員會以及最高法院的未來懸置未決，讓他轉不開目光。
mt: Brett Kavanaugh is ready to face the uncertainty of the Senate Judiciary Committee and the Supreme Court's future, which has left him unable to turn his eyes around.
ref: He couldn't peel himself away, not with Brett Kavanaugh set to face the Senate Judiciary Committee and the future of the Supreme Court hanging in the balance.

src: Fleiss 先生告訴我：「我記得以前我們在製作這些瘋狂節目時，人們說這開始西方文明的結束。」
mt: Mr. Fleiss told me, "I remember when we were making these crazy shows, people said it was the beginning of the end of Western civilization."
ref: "I remember when we were doing all those crazy shows back in the day and people said, "This is the beginning of the end of Western civilization,"" Mr. Fleiss told me.

src: 「我以為是在開玩笑，沒想到他們是對的。」
mt: "I thought I was joking, but I didn't think they were right."
ref: "I thought it was sort of a joke, but it turns out they were right."

src: Amy Chozick 是回憶錄 (Chasing Hillary) 的作者，她主要為《時代雜誌》(The Times) 撰寫商業、政治和媒體文章。
mt: Amy Chozick is the author of the memoir, Chasing Hillary, who writes business, political and media articles for The Times.
ref: Amy Chozick, a writer at large for The Times covering business, politics and media, is the author of the memoir "Chasing Hillary."

src: 外部金錢流入最緊繃的中期選舉賽
mt: External money flows into the most tense midterm elections
ref: Outside money floods into tightest midterm election House races

src: 由於國會選區範圍改動，讓 2 名現任人員爭取相同席位，因此不意外賓州第 17 選區有大量金流。
mt: Due to changes in congressional district scope, two incumbents were able to secure the same seat, thus not surprisingly Pennsylvania's 17th district had a large influx of gold.
ref: It's not surprising that Pennsylvania's 17th is seeing a flood of cash, thanks to a realignment of a congressional districts that landed two incumbents in a race for the same seat.

src: 最近重劃匹茲堡 (Pittsburgh) 選區將民主黨代表 Conor Lamb 拉進來，他去年春天的補選中贏得另一區的席次。
mt: Recently redistricting of the Pittsburgh constituency brought in Democratic representative Conor Lamb, who won another district's seat last spring by-election.
ref: This recently redrawn suburban Pittsburg district pits Democrat Rep. Conor Lamb - who won his seat in another district in a special election last spring.

src: Lamb 將與另一名共和黨現任議員 Keith Rothfus 競爭，Rothfus 目前代表賓州舊的第 12 區，大部分與新的第 17 區重疊。
mt: Lamb will compete with another Republican incumbent, Keith Rothfus, who currently represents the old 12th district of Pennsylvania, most of which overlaps with the new 17th district.
ref: Lamb is running against another incumbent, Republican Keith Rothfus, who currently represents the old Pennsylvania 12th district, which overlaps heavily with the new 17th.

src: 賓州最高法院在 1 月判決舊選區有利共和黨因而違憲後，選區地圖被重劃。
mt: After the Pennsylvania Supreme Court ruled in January that the old district was unconstitutional for Republicans, the district map was redrawn.
ref: The maps were redrawn after the Pennsylvania Supreme Court ruled in January that the old districts were unconstitutionally gerrymandered in Republicans' favor.

src: 新的第 17 區競選激起了大黨財務部門、民主黨競選國會議員毀員會 (DCCC) 與全國共和黨競選委員會 (NRCC) 之間的財務鬥爭。
mt: The new 17th district campaign has sparked a financial struggle between the party's finance department, the Democratic Party's Congress Destroyer's Conference (DCCC) and the National Republican Campaign Committee (NRCC).
ref: The race in the new 17th has touched off a campaign finance slugfest between the major party finance arms, the Democratic Campaign Congressional Committee (DCCC) and the National Republican Campaign Committee (NRCC).

src: Lamb 在賓州第 18 州國會議員選區受人注目的三月補選險勝後，他的名字便在賓州變得耳熟能詳。
mt: Lamb's name became well-known in Pennsylvania after a narrow March by-election in the 18th congressional district.
ref: Lamb became a familiar name in Pennsylvania after a narrow win in a widely watched in March special election for Pennsylvania's 18th Congressional District.

src: 共和黨佔了此席位超過 10 多年，川普在該區勝出20個百分點。
mt: The Republican Party has held this seat for more than 10 years, with Trump winning 20 percentage points in the area.
ref: That seat had been held by a Republican for over a decade, and President Donald Trump won the district by 20 points.

src: 政治名嘴認為民主黨稍占優勢。
mt: Political commentators believe that the Democratic Party has a slight advantage.
ref: Political pundits have given Democrats a slight edge.

src: 美國對薩爾瓦多支持中國的決定祭出罰則但又收回
mt: The U.S. imposed a fine on El Salvador's decision to support China, but took it back.
ref: U.S. Weighed Penalizing El Salvador Over Support for China, Then Backed Off

src: 外交官員表示發現多明尼加共和國和巴拿馬已承認北京，華府稍加阻饒。
mt: Diplomats said they found that the Dominican Republic and Panama have recognized Beijing, Washington slightly obstructed.
ref: Diplomats noted that the Dominican Republic and Panama had already recognized Beijing, with little pushback from Washington.

src: 川普與巴拿馬總統瓦雷拉 (Juan Carlos Varela) 於 2017 年 6 月舉行溫馨會談，且曾在巴拿馬有一棟飯店，直到夥伴驅逐川普組織的管理團隊。
mt: Mr. Trump held a warm meeting with President Juan Carlos Varela in June 2017, and had a hotel in Panama until his partner expelled the Trump administration.
ref: Mr. Trump had a warm meeting with President Juan Carlos Varela of Panama in June 2017 and had a hotel in Panama until partners evicted the Trump Organization's management team.

src: 國務院發言人 Heather Nauert 在這個月初的聲明中表示，鑒於薩爾瓦多、多明尼加共和國和巴拿馬「最近決定不再承認台灣」，國務院官員決定這從三國召回美國外交使節團長。
mt: In a statement earlier this month, State Department spokesman Heather Nauert stated that, given that El Salvador, the Dominican Republic and Panama have "recently decided not to recognize Taiwan," State Department officials decided to call back the leader of the US diplomatic mission from the three countries.
ref: State Department officials decided to call back the American chiefs of diplomatic missions from El Salvador, the Dominican Republic and Panama over the "recent decisions to no longer recognize Taiwan," Heather Nauert, the department's spokeswoman, said in a statement early this month.

src: 不過只會對薩爾瓦多進行懲罰，該國在 2017 年接受 $1.4 億美元的援助，用於毒品控制、發展和經濟支援。
mt: However, it will only punish El Salvador, which received $140 million in aid in 2017 for drug control, development and economic support.
ref: But penalties were only considered against El Salvador, which received an estimated $140 million in American aid in 2017, including for narcotics controls, development and economic support.

src: 提議的罰則包括切斷金援和針對性的目標簽證限制，這將重創這個中美洲國家，並對高失業率和謀殺率造成衝擊。
mt: The proposed penalties include cutting off financial aid and targeted visa restrictions, which would severely damage this Central American country and impact high unemployment rates and murder rates.
ref: The proposed penalties, which included cuts to financial aid and targeted visa restrictions, would have been painful for the Central American country and its high unemployment and murder rates.

src: 隨著內部會議進行的同時，北美洲和中美洲官員延後了一場專於探討安全和經濟繁榮的高層會議，意在延續去年一場類似集會，以朝努力防堵移民前往美國邁進一步。
mt: As the internal meeting proceeded, North and Central American officials postponed a high-level conference focused on discussing security and economic prosperity, with the intention of continuing last year's similar gathering to further their efforts to prevent immigration to the United States.
ref: As internal meetings progressed, North American and Central American officials postponed a high-level conference focused on security and economic prosperity to follow up a similar gathering last year that was seen as a step forward in efforts to prevent migrants from heading to the United States.

src: 但是到了 9 月中，政府高層清楚表明希望重啟這場會議，等於結束對薩爾瓦多祭出懲罰的任何考慮。
mt: However, by mid-September, government officials clearly stated their desire to reopen this meeting, effectively ending any consideration of the punishment in El Salvador.
ref: But by mid-September, top administration officials made clear that they wanted the conference to go forward, effectively ending any consideration of penalties for El Salvador.

src: 外交官員說，美國副總統彭斯 (Mike Pence) 目前預計將在這場預計 10 月舉辦的會議上發表演說，表示政府十分看重這場聚會。
mt: Diplomats say Vice President Mike Pence is currently expected to deliver a speech at this October-planned meeting, saying the government attaches great importance to the meeting.
ref: Vice President Mike Pence is now slated to address the conference, now scheduled for mid-October, in a signal of the import the administration places on the gathering, the diplomats said.

src: 而 3 位美國大使也悄悄返回薩爾瓦多、巴拿馬與多明尼加共和國，且未從華府帶回新的強硬訊息或懲罰措施。
mt: The three U.S. ambassadors also quietly returned to El Salvador, Panama and the Dominican Republic, without bringing back new tough messages or punitive measures from Washington.
ref: And the three American envoys quietly returned to El Salvador, Panama and the Dominican Republic with no new tough messages or punishments from Washington.

src: 3 名美國官員 (當中包括 2 名外交官) 同意了在匿名的條件下談論內部討論。波頓 (Bolton) 的發言人拒絕對他們所述的爭辯詳情做出評論。
mt: Three U.S. officials, including two diplomats, agreed to discuss the internal discussion under anonymous conditions. A spokesman for Bolton refused to comment on the details of their said debate.
ref: A White House spokesman for Mr. Bolton declined to comment on the details of the debate that were described by the three American officials, including two diplomats, who agreed to discuss the internal deliberations on the condition of anonymity.

src: 他們的描述經與政府關係密切的外部分析家證實，他也在匿名的條件下發表意見。
mt: Their description has been confirmed by external analysts closely related to the government, and he also expressed his opinions under anonymous conditions.
ref: Their accounts were corroborated by an outside analyst who is close to the administration and also spoke on the condition of anonymity.

src: 學習歷史
mt: Learning History
ref: Study History

src: 下一個震撼彈可能是特別檢察官穆勒 (Robert Mueller) 對川普可能妨礙司法的報告，現在公開記錄中有可觀的證據。
mt: The next shock might be Special Prosecutor Robert Mueller's report on Trump's possible obstruction of justice, with considerable evidence now in public records.
ref: The next shoe to drop could be the special counsel Robert Mueller's report on Mr. Trump's possible obstruction of justice, of which there now is very substantial evidence in the public record.

src: 據報，穆勒也將調查轉向川普的競選活動是否與俄羅斯串通來攻擊美國的選舉。
mt: According to reports, Müller is also investigating whether his shift to Trump's campaign will collude with Russia to attack American elections.
ref: Mr. Mueller is reportedly also turning his investigation to whether Mr. Trump's campaign colluded with Russia in its attack on our elections.

src: 如果國會輪替，川普將會發現他要面對問責，就像他再次面對選民，也許甚至是陪審團。
mt: If Congress were to be replaced, Trump would find that he had to face accountability just like he faced voters again, perhaps even a jury.
ref: Should Congress change hands, Mr. Trump will find himself facing accountability in that body, just as he prepares to go again before the voters, and perhaps eventually a jury of his peers.

src: 有很多個如果，我不是在暗示川普無可避免地會失敗 - 也不是在說歐洲版的川普。
mt: There's a lot of things if I'm not suggesting that Trump will inevitably fail -- and I'm not talking about the European version of Trump.
ref: That is a lot of ifs, and I do not mean to suggest that Mr. Trump's fall is inevitable - nor that of his equivalents in Europe.

src: 大西洋兩岸的我們都要做一些決定，這會影響掙扎可能會延長多久。
mt: We have to make some decisions on both sides of the Atlantic, which will affect how long the struggle may be prolonged.
ref: There are choices to be made by all of us on both sides of the Atlantic that will affect how prolonged the struggle may be.

src: 在 1938 年，如果西方在慕尼黑抵擋了希特勒並支援捷克斯洛伐克，德國官員已準備好要對他發動政變。
mt: In 1938, if the West resisted Hitler in Munich and supported Czechoslovakia, German officials were ready to stage a coup against him.
ref: In 1938, German officers were ready to stage a coup d"état against Hitler, if only the West had resisted him and backed the Czechoslovaks at Munich.

src: 我們失敗了，並失去避免繼而發生大屠殺的機會。
mt: We've failed, and we've lost the chance to avoid a massacre.
ref: We failed, and missed an opportunity to avoid the years of carnage that ensued.

src: 歷史路線圍繞著這些轉折點，加速或延遲民主不可阻擋的持續發展。
mt: The historical route revolves around these turning points, accelerating or delaying the unstoppable development of democracy.
ref: The course of history pivots around such inflection points, and democracy's inexorable march is accelerated or delayed.

src: 美國人現在就面對幾個這些轉捩點。
mt: Americans are now facing a few of these turning points.
ref: Americans face several of these inflection points now.

src: 司法部副部長羅森斯坦 (Rod Rosenstein) 掌控穆勒的調查命運，如果川普拔掉羅森斯坦，那我們將怎麼做？
mt: Rod Rosenstein, Deputy Minister of Justice, is in control of Müller’s investigation. If Trump pulls him out, what will we do?
ref: What will we do if Mr. Trump fires Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein, the man who controls the fate of Mr. Mueller's investigation?

src: 自從有報紙報導去年羅森斯坦建議偷錄總統的談話並斷言他不適合白宮辦公室，他便處於陷入困境的狀態。
mt: Since newspapers reported last year that Rosenstein suggested recording the president's conversation and claiming he was not suitable for the White House office, he has been in a difficult situation.
ref: Rosenstein has been in hot water ever since this paper reported that, last year, he suggested secretly recording the president and speculated about his being unfit for office.

src: 羅森斯坦稱《泰晤士報》(The Times) 的報導不實。
mt: Rosenstein said that the report of The Times was untrue.
ref: Mr. Rosenstein says The Times's account is inaccurate.

src: 「如果 FBI 對卡瓦諾 ( Brett Kavanaugh) 的新調查不完整或不公平，或是儘管有性侵案的可靠指控和不誠實的證詞，如果他仍確認可坐上最高法院大法官的位子，我們將如何回應？」
mt: “If the FBI’s new investigation into Brett Kavanaugh is incomplete or unfair, or despite reliable allegations and dishonest testimony in the context of sexual assault, how will we respond if he still confirms he can sit on the Supreme Court’s bench?”
ref: "How will we respond if the newly requested F.B.I. investigation of Brett Kavanaugh is not full or fair - or if he is confirmed to the Supreme Court despite credible accusations of sexual assault and dishonest testimony?

src: 尤其是，我們在中期選舉時會選一個要川普負責的國會嗎？
mt: Especially, do we elect a Congress to be held by Trump in the midterm elections?
ref: And above all, will we vote in the midterms for a Congress that will hold Mr. Trump accountable?

src: 如果我們這些考驗失敗，民主將會進入好長的寒冬。
mt: If we fail these tests, democracy will enter a long and bitter winter.
ref: If we fail those tests, democracy will be in for a long winter.

src: 不過由於我在布拉格學到的經驗，我相信我們不會失敗。
mt: However, due to the experience I learned in Prague, I believe we will not fail.
ref: But I believe we will not fail, because of the lesson I learned in Prague.

src: 我的母親是捷克斯洛伐克猶太人，她被納粹政權送入奥斯威辛集中營，我的大使官邸就是被這個納粹政權佔領。
mt: My mother was a Czechoslovak Jew, she was sent to the Auschwitz concentration camp by the Nazi regime, and my ambassador's residence was occupied by this Nazi regime.
ref: My mother was a Czechoslovak Jew who was deported to Auschwitz by the same Nazi regime that once occupied my ambassadorial home.

src: 她存活下來並移民到美國，60 年之後，她送我去在帶有納粹黨徽的桌上點亮安息日蠟燭。
mt: She survived and immigrated to the United States, 60 years later, she sent me to light a Sabbath candle on a table bearing the Nazi party emblem.
ref: She survived, immigrated to America and, 60 years later, sent me off to light Sabbath candles on that table bearing the swastika.

src: 這是我具有歷史意義的遺產，我怎麼能夠不對未來感到樂觀？
mt: This is my historic heritage. How can I not be optimistic about the future?
ref: With that as my heritage, how can I not be an optimist about our future?"

src: Norman Eisen 是布魯金斯學會 (Brookings Institution) 的資深學者，也是華府公民責任與道德(Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics) 的主席，著有《The Last Palace: Europe's Turbulent Century in Five Lives and One Legendary House.》
mt: Norman Eisen is a Senior Fellow of the Brookings Institution and President of the Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics, author of The Last Palace: Europe's Turbulent Century in Five Lives and One Legendary House.
ref: Norman Eisen, a senior fellow at the Brookings Institution, is the chairman of Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington and the author of "The Last Palace: Europe's Turbulent Century in Five Lives and One Legendary House."

src: Rangers 的 Graham Dorrans 對於接下來與 Rapid Vienna 的激烈競爭感到樂觀
mt: Graham Dorrans of Rangers is optimistic about the next fierce competition with Rapid Vienna
ref: Rangers' Graham Dorrans optimistic ahead of Rapid Vienna clash

src: 在本月初於西班牙對上 Villarreal 時打出令人佩服的平手後，Rangers 星期四以主隊身分對上 Rapid Vienna，打敗奧地利會有利他們從 Europa 聯盟的 G 組晉級。
mt: Following a stunning draw against Villarreal in Spain earlier this month, Rangers will face Rapid Vienna on Thursday as their home team, defeating Austria will help them advance from the Europa League's G group.
ref: Rangers host Rapid Vienna on Thursday, knowing that victory over the Austrians, following the impressive draw in Spain against Villarreal earlier this month, will put them in a strong position to qualify from Group G of the Europa League.

src: 中場 Graham Dorrans 的膝蓋傷勢讓他到了與 Villarreal 2-2 平手那場才第一次在本季登場，但他相信 Rangers 能夠利用這次結果乘風追擊。
mt: The knee injury of midfielder Graham Dorrans allowed him to make his first appearance in the season when he drew with Villarreal 2-2, but he believed Rangers could take advantage of this outcome to pursue.
ref: A knee injury prevented midfielder Graham Dorrans from making his first appearance of the season until the 2-2 draw with Villarreal but he believes Rangers can use that result as a springboard to greater things.

src: 31 歲的他說：「Villarreal 是一支優秀的球隊，這點對我們來講很好。」
mt: “Villarreal is a great team, and that’s good for us,” he said at the age of 31.
ref: "It was a good point for us because Villarreal are a good side," said the 31-year-old.

src: 「我們開始比賽，並相信我們能夠獲得些什麼，然後帶走一分。」
mt: “We started playing and believed what we could get, and then we took a point.”
ref: "We went into the game believing we could get something and came away with a point.

src: 也許我們本來最後可以勝出，但平手很可能是個好結果。
mt: Maybe we could have won in the end, but a tie would probably be a good result.
ref: Maybe we could have nicked it in the end but, overall, a draw was probably a fair result.

src: 他們上半場表現得好像比較好，我們下半場開始後表現較佳。
mt: They performed better in the first half, and we performed better in the second half.
ref: They were probably better in the first half and we came out in the second half and were the better side.

src: 星期四是另一個盛大的歐洲之夜。
mt: Thursday is another grand European night.
ref: Going into Thursday, it's another big European night.

src: 希望我們能拿到 3 分，但他們上一場的結果很好，所以這場比賽會很辛苦，不過有大家的支持，我相信我們能夠邁向前並取得正面結果。
mt: I hope we can get 3 points, but their last game was good, so this game will be very hard, but with everyone's support, I believe we can move forward and have a positive result.
ref: Hopefully, we can get three points but that will be tough game because they had a good result in their last game but, with the crowd behind us, I'm sure we can push on and get a positive result.

src: 由於我受傷所發生的任何事和俱樂部本身的變化，去年真的很艱辛，不過對目前的情況有感覺良好的因素。
mt: Due to anything that happened to my injury and the changes in the club itself, last year was really tough, but there are some good reasons for the current situation.
ref: Last year was definitely tough, between everything that happened with my injuries and the changes at the club itself but there's a feelgood factor about the place now.

src: 整個隊很棒，所有球員真的很享受；訓練很好。
mt: The whole team is very good, all players really enjoy it; training is very good.
ref: The squad's good and the boys are really enjoying it; the training's good.

src: 希望我們現在可以堅持繼續，將上一季放在腦後並能夠成功。」
mt: I hope we can continue now, put the previous season behind the brain and be able to succeed."
ref: Hopefully, we can push on now, put last season behind us and be successful."

src: 女性對於此退休儲蓄恐慌輾轉難眠
mt: Women's panic over retirement savings is running out of sleep.
ref: Women are losing sleep over this retirement savings fear

src: 問卷調查參與者清楚明白他們想要如何被照顧，但沒什麼人與他們的家人談論此事。
mt: Survey participants clearly understood how they wanted to be taken care of, but few people discussed this with their families.
ref: Despite the fact that survey participants had a clear idea of how they wanted to be cared for, few people were talking to their family members about it.

src: 在全國調查中有一半的人表示他們與配偶談過長期照護費用。
mt: Half of the national survey respondents said they had talked with their spouse about long-term care costs.
ref: About half of the individuals in the Nationwide study said they were speaking with their spouses about the cost of long-term care.

src: 只有 10% 表示他們曾與小孩談過這個話題。
mt: Only 10% said they had talked to their children about it.
ref: Only 10 percent said they spoke with their kids about it.

src: 全國人壽保險業務的副總裁 Holly Snyder 說：「人們想要家人照顧他們，但他們卻不開口。」
mt: “People want their families to take care of them, but they don’t open their mouths,” said Holly Snyder, vice president of National Life Insurance.
ref: "People want a family member to care for them, but they aren't taking the steps to have the conversation," said Holly Snyder, vice president of Nationwide's life insurance business.

src: 下列是開始方法。
mt: The following is the start method.
ref: Here's where to begin.

src: 告訴你的配偶和小孩：如果你不事先說出你的期望，便無法讓你的家人做好提供照護的準備。
mt: Tell your spouse and children that if you don’t say what you want, you can’t prepare your family for care.
ref: Talk to your spouse and the kids: You can't prepare your family to provide care if you don't make your wishes known well ahead of time.

src: 與你的顧問和家人討論要在哪裡接受照護及如何受到照護，這些選擇是決定花費的重要因素。
mt: Discussing where to receive care and how to receive care with your advisor and family is an important factor in determining costs.
ref: Work with your advisor and your family to discuss where and how to receive care, as those choices can be a significant factor in determining the cost.

src: 讓你的財務顧問參與：你的財務顧問也可協助你制定這些花費的付款方式。
mt: Get your financial advisor involved: your financial advisor can also help you develop the payment methods for these expenses.
ref: Bring in your financial advisor: Your advisor can also help you come up with a way to pay for those expenses.

src: 長期照護的資金選擇可包括傳統的長期照護保單，這是一份混合現金價值的人壽保單，可協助支出這些花費，或者以你本身的財富自我保險 - 如果你有這些錢的話。
mt: Long-term care funding options can include traditional long-term care policies, a hybrid cash value life policy that can help cover these costs, or self-insure with your own wealth - if you have them.
ref: Your funding choices for long-term care can include a traditional long-term care insurance policy, a hybrid cash-value life insurance policy to help cover these expenses or self-insuring with your own wealth - as long as you have the money.

src: 制定你的法律文件：避免法律戰爭。
mt: Develop your legal documents: Avoid legal wars.
ref: Hammer out your legal documents: Head off legal battles at the pass.

src: 準備好醫療照護代理人，指定一位可信任的人來監督你的醫療照護，並在萬一您無法進行溝通的情況下，確保專業人員依照你的期望來行事。
mt: Prepare a health care agent, appoint a trusted person to oversee your care, and ensure that professionals act as expected in the unlikely event that you are unable to communicate.
ref: Get a health-care proxy in place so that you designate a trusted individual to oversee your medical care and ensure that professionals comply with your wishes in case you're unable to communicate.

src: 此外，考慮聘僱律師來處理你的財務。
mt: Also consider hiring a lawyer to handle your finances.
ref: Also, consider a power of attorney for your finances.

src: 你可選擇一位可信任的人來為您進行財務決定，並在您失去行為能力的情況下，確保你的帳單會繳交。
mt: You can choose a trusted person to make financial decisions for you, and ensure your bills are billed if you lose your capacity to act.
ref: You would select a trusted person to make financial decisions for you and ensure your bills get paid if you're incapacitated.

src: 別忘記小細節：試想，你年邁的父母發生醫療緊急狀況，正在前往醫院的途中。
mt: Don’t forget the small details: Imagine that your elderly parents have a medical emergency and are on their way to the hospital.
ref: Don't forget the small details: Imagine that your elderly parent has a medical emergency and is on the way to the hospital.

src: 您是否有辦法回答有關醫藥和敏感的問題？
mt: Can you answer questions about medicine and sensitivity?
ref: Would you be able to answer questions on medications and allergies?

src: 在書面計劃中記載這些細節，讓你準備就緒。
mt: Write down these details in your written plan so you are ready to go.
ref: Spell out those details in a written plan so that you're ready.

src: Martin 問到：「當中牽涉到不是只有財務，還有醫生是誰？
mt: Martin asks, "It's not just about finances. Who's the doctor?
ref: "It's not just the financials that are in play, but who are the doctors?" asked Martin.

src: 什麼藥？
mt: What's that?
ref: "What are the medications?

src: 誰來照顧狗？
mt: Who's gonna take care of the dog?
ref: Who will care for the dog?

src: 準備好計畫。」
mt: Prepare the plan."
ref: Have that plan in place."

src: 一名男人在伊爾弗勒科姆 (Ilfracombe) 遭空氣步槍射中多槍
mt: A man was shot multiple times by an air rifle in Ilfracombe.
ref: Man shot multiple times with air rifle in Ilfracombe

src: 一名男人在夜晚外出返家時遭空氣步槍射中多槍。
mt: A man was shot multiple times by an air rifle while going out and returning home at night.
ref: A man has been shot multiple times with an air rifle as he walked home from a night out.

src: 40 多歲的受害人在德文郡 (Devon) 伊爾弗勒科姆的 Oxford Grove 區域被射中胸部、腹部和手。
mt: Victims in their 40s were hit in the Oxford Grove area in Irflecom, Devon, on the chest, abdomen and hand.
ref: The victim, in his 40s, was in the Oxford Grove area of Ilfracombe, Devon, when he was shot in the chest, abdomen and hand.

src: 警方形容這場發生在英國夏令時間約 02:30 的槍擊案是「隨機犯案」。
mt: Police described the shooting that occurred around 02:30 British Summer Time as "randomly committed".
ref: Officers described the shooting, which took place at about 02:30 BST, as a "random act."

src: 受害人未看見攻擊者。
mt: The victim did not see the attacker.
ref: The victim did not see his attacker.

src: 他的傷勢不會危及生命，警方已尋求目擊證人。
mt: His injuries will not pose a threat to life, and police have sought eyewitnesses.
ref: His injuries are not life-threatening and police have appealed for witnesses.

src: 印尼的地震和海嘯
mt: Earthquakes and Tsunamis in Indonesia
ref: Earthquakes and tsunamis in Indonesia

src: 官方說，強震和印尼在星期五襲擊印尼的帕盧市 (Palu)，造成至少 384 人死亡，死亡人數預計會上升。
mt: Officially, the strong earthquake and the Indonesian attack on Palu, Indonesia on Friday killed at least 384 people, with death toll expected to rise.
ref: At least 384 people have been killed by a powerful earthquake and tsunami that hit the Indonesian city of Palu on Friday, officials said, with the death toll expected to rise.

src: 由於通訊中斷，援救官方尚無法從規模 7.5 的地震震央帕盧市北邊附近的棟加拉 (Donggala) 縣市收到任何資訊。
mt: Due to communications being cut off, rescue officials have yet to receive any information from the 7.5-magnitude earthquake in the northern part of the city of Tanggala.
ref: With communications knocked out, relief officials have not been able to get any information from Donggala regency, an area north of Palu that is closer to the epicenter of the 7.5 magnitude quake.

src: 災難來襲後，帕盧市有超過 16,000 人 被疏散。
mt: More than 16,000 people have been evacuated from Palou since the disaster struck.
ref: In Palu, more than 16,000 people were evacuated after the disaster struck.

src: 下列是位於蘇拉威西 (Sulawesi) 島上帕盧市和棟加拉的一些主要資料：
mt: Here are some of the main sources for Palu and Tonggala on Sulawesi Island:
ref: Here are some key facts about Palu and Donggala, on the island of Sulawesi:

src: 帕盧市是中蘇拉威西省的首都，坐落在蘇拉威西島西岸的狹窄海灣尾端，2017 年的人口估計為 379,800。
mt: The city of Palu is the capital of Central Sulawesi Province, located at the western coast of Sulawesi Island's narrow bay-like end, with an estimated population of 379,800 in 2017.
ref: Palu is the capital of Central Sulawesi province, located at the end of a narrow bay on the west coast of Sulawesi island, with an estimated population of 379,800 in 2017.

src: 地震和海嘯來襲時，這個城市正在舉辦 40 週年的慶祝活動。
mt: When earthquakes and tsunamis hit, the city was celebrating its 40th anniversary.
ref: The city was celebrating its 40th anniversary when the quake and tsunami hit.

src: 棟加拉縣市位在蘇拉威西島西北邊，海岸線蔓延 300 公里 (180 英哩) 以上。
mt: Donggala County is located on the northwest coast of Sulawesi Island, with a coastline stretching over 300 kilometers (180 miles).
ref: Donggala is a regency stretching along more than 300 km (180 miles) of coastline in the northwest of Sulawesi island.

src: 該縣市是省的下級管理區域，2017 年的人口估計為 299,200。
mt: The county is a provincial lower-level administrative area, with an estimated population of 299,200 in 2017.
ref: The regency, an administrative region below a province, had an estimated population of 299,200 in 2017.

src: 中蘇拉威西省的主要經濟依賴漁業和農業，特別是棟加拉的海岸區域。
mt: The main economy of Central Sulawesi Province is dependent on fishing and agriculture, especially the coastal areas of Tonggala.
ref: Fishing and farming are the mainstays of the Central Sulawesi province's economy, especially the coastal region of Donggala.

src: 該省的鎳礦也很重要，但主要集中在蘇拉威西對面海岸的莫羅瓦利 (Morowali)。
mt: The province's nickel mines are also important, but they are mainly concentrated in Morowali, off the coast of Sulawesi.
ref: Nickel mining is also important in the province, but is mostly concentrated in Morowali, on the opposite coast of Sulawesi.

src: 根據印尼的減災機構 (Disaster Mitigation Agency) 的資料，帕盧市和棟加拉在過去 100 年內曾多次遭受海嘯侵襲。
mt: According to data from Indonesia's Disaster Mitigation Agency, Palu and Tongara have been hit by tsunamis on multiple occasions over the past 100 years.
ref: Palu and Donggala have been hit by tsunamis several times in the past 100 years, according to Indonesia's Disaster Mitigation Agency.

src: 在 1938 年，一場海嘯在棟加拉奪去超過 200 條性命，並摧毀上百間房屋。
mt: In 1938, a tsunami took more than 200 lives and destroyed hundreds of houses in Donggala.
ref: In 1938, a tsunami killed more than 200 people and destroyed hundreds of houses in Donggala.

src: 還有一場海嘯在 1996 年侵襲西棟加拉，造成 9 人死亡。
mt: In 1996, another tsunami struck Western Donggala, killing nine people.
ref: A tsunami also struck western Donggala in 1996, killing nine.

src: 印尼位在地震頻發的環太平洋火山帶，經常受到地震襲擊。
mt: Indonesia is located in the Pacific Ring of Fire, which is frequently hit by earthquakes, and is frequently attacked by earthquakes.
ref: Indonesia sits on the seismically Pacific Ring of Fire and is regularly hit by earthquakes.

src: 下列是最近幾年發生的一些重大地震和海嘯：
mt: The following are some major earthquakes and tsunamis that have occurred in recent years:
ref: Here are some of the major quakes and tsunamis in recent years:

src: 2004：12 月 26 日在印尼蘇門答臘東北的亞齊省發生強震，所引發的海嘯襲擊了印度洋沿岸 14 個國家，造成 226,000 人死亡，其中亞齊的死亡人數超過一半。
mt: 2004: On December 26, 2004, a powerful earthquake struck Aceh Province in northeastern Sumatra, Indonesia, triggering a tsunami that struck 14 countries along the Indian Ocean coast, killing 226,000 people, more than half of whom were in Aceh.
ref: 2004: A major quake on the western coast of Indonesia's Aceh province in northern Sumatra on Dec. 26 triggered a tsunami that struck 14 countries, killing 226,000 people along Indian Ocean coastline, more than half of them in Aceh.

src: 2005：一連串的地震在 3 月尾和 4 月初襲擊了蘇門答臘的西岸。
mt: 2005: A series of earthquakes hit the western coast of Sumatra in late March and early April.
ref: 2005: A series of strong quakes hit the western coast of Sumatra in late March and early April.

src: 在蘇門答臘海岸旁的尼亞斯島 (Nias Island) 上造成數百人死亡。
mt: Hundreds of people were killed on Nias Island, just off the coast of Sumatra.
ref: Hundreds died in Nias Island, off the coast of Sumatra.

src: 2006：印尼最多人的爪哇島發生規模 6.8 的地震，所引發的海嘯沖入南岸，奪去近 700 條人命。
mt: 2006: The island of Java, Indonesia's most populous island, was hit by a 6.8-magnitude earthquake, which caused a tsunami that swept into the south coast and killed nearly 700 people.
ref: 2006: A 6.8 magnitude hit south of Java, Indonesia's most populated island, triggering a tsunami that smashed into the southern coast, killing nearly 700 people.

src: 2009：西蘇門答臘省的首都巴東市 (Padang) 附近發生規模 7.6 的地震。
mt: 2009: A 7.6-magnitude earthquake occurred near Padang, the capital of West Sumatra province.
ref: 2009: A 7.6 magnitude quake struck near the city of Padang, capital of West Sumatra province.

src: 造成超過 1,100 人罹難。
mt: More than 1,100 people were killed.
ref: More than 1,100 people were killed.

src: 2010：規模 7.5 的地震襲擊蘇門答臘外的明打威 (Mentawai) 其中一個島，引發高達 10 公尺的海嘯，摧毀數十個村莊並奪去約 300 條人命。
mt: 2010: A 7.5-magnitude earthquake struck one of the islands in Mentawai, just outside Sumatra, triggering a 10-meter tsunami that destroyed dozens of villages and claimed about 300 lives.
ref: 2010: A 7.5 magnitude quake hit one of the Mentawai islands, off Sumatra, triggering up tsunami of up to 10 meters that destroyed dozens of villages and killed around 300 people.

src: 2016：亞齊的畢迪賈雅縣 (Pidie Jaya) 發生淺層地震導致毀損，令人聯想到 2004 年的致命地震和海嘯所造成的破壞，因而引起人們恐慌。
mt: 2016: A shallow earthquake in Pidie Jaya, Aceh, has caused damage, reminiscent of the deadly 2004 earthquake and tsunami, causing panic.
ref: 2016: A shallow quake hit the Pidie Jaya regency in Aceh, causing destruction and panic as people were reminded by the devastation of the deadly 2004 quake and tsunami.

src: 這次沒有引發海嘯，但倒塌的建築物造成超過 100 人罹難。
mt: This time, no tsunami was triggered, but the collapsed building caused more than 100 deaths.
ref: No tsunami was triggered this time, but more than 100 were killed by fallen buildings.

src: 2018：印尼的旅遊勝地龍目島 (Lombok) 發生強烈地震，造成超過 500 人死亡，大部分位於該島北邊。
mt: 2018: Severe earthquakes hit Lombok, a tourist destination in Indonesia, killing more than 500 people, most of whom are located north of the island.
ref: 2018: Major quakes hit Indonesia's tourist island of Lombok, killing more than 500 people, mostly on the northern side of the island.

src: 地震摧毀了數千座建築物，並導致數千名旅客暫時被困。
mt: The earthquake destroyed thousands of buildings and trapped thousands of passengers temporarily.
ref: The quake destroyed thousands of buildings and left thousands of tourists temporarily stranded.

src: 裴琳 (Sarah Palin) 的長子被控家暴而遭到逮捕
mt: Sarah Palin's eldest son has been arrested for domestic violence
ref: Sarah Palin's Eldest Son Arrested on Domestic Violence Charges

src: 阿拉斯加前州長及副總統候選人裴琳的長子雀克‧裴琳 (Track Palin) 被控襲擊而被捕。
mt: Track Palin, the eldest son of former Alaskan governor and vice presidential candidate Périn, was arrested on charges of assault.
ref: Track Palin, the eldest son of former Alaska governor and vice presidential candidate Sarah Palin, has been arrested on assault charges.

src: 阿拉斯加州警星期六公布報告，指 29 歲的雀克‧裴琳被疑施行家暴、妨礙家暴案報案及拒捕，在阿拉斯加州瓦西拉 (Wasilla) 遭到逮捕。
mt: Alaska state police released a report on Saturday, stating that 29-year-old Jacques Périn was arrested in Wasilla, Alaska after being suspected of committing domestic violence, obstructing domestic violence and refusing to arrest her.
ref: Palin, 29, of Wasilla, Alaska, was arrested on suspicion of domestic violence, interfering with a report of domestic violence and resisting arrest, according to a report released Saturday by Alaska State Troopers.

src: 據警方報告，當女性熟人嘗試打電話給警方要對其涉嫌的罪行報案時，他搶走她的電話。
mt: According to police reports, when a female acquaintance tries to call the police and report her alleged crime, he snatched her phone.
ref: According to the police report, when a female acquaintance attempted to call police to report the alleged crimes, he took her phone from her.

src: KTUU 報導，雀克‧裴琳目前被還押在 Mat-Su Pretrial Facility，保釋金 $500。
mt: KTUU reported that Jock Peilin is currently in custody at Mat-Su Pretrial Facility, with a bail of $500.
ref: Palin is being remanded in Mat-Su Pretrial Facility and is being held on a $500 unsecured bond, reported KTUU.

src: 網路報導，他星期六出庭，當他被問到是否認罪，他聲稱自己「根本無罪」。
mt: Online reports, he appeared in court on Saturday, when asked if he had confessed, he claimed to be "completely innocent".
ref: He appeared in court Saturday, where he declared himself "not guilty, for sure" when asked his plea, reported the network.

src: 雀克‧裴琳面對 3 項 A 級罪行，可能會需要入獄 1 年以下並罰款 $250,000。
mt: In the face of three Class A offences, Jacques Pelin may be sentenced to less than one year's imprisonment and fined $250,000.
ref: Palin faces three Class A misdemeanors, meaning he could be imprisoned for up to a year and fined $250,000.

src: 他也被控 1 項 B 級罪行，可處 1 天拘役並罰款 $2,000。
mt: He was also charged with one Class B offence, subject to a one-day imprisonment and a fine of $2,000.
ref: He has also been charged with a Class B misdemeanor, punishable by a day in jail and a $2,000 fine.

src: 這不是雀克‧裴琳第一次被控犯罪。
mt: This is not the first time that Jacques Palin has been charged with a crime.
ref: It is not the first time criminal charges have been filed against Palin.

src: 於 2017 年 12 月，他被指控襲擊他的父親陶德‧裴琳 (Todd Palin)。
mt: In December 2017, he was accused of attacking his father Todd Palin.
ref: In December 2017, he was accused of assaulting his father, Todd Palin.

src: 他的母親莎拉‧裴琳打給警方，就這場涉嫌攻擊報案。
mt: His mother, Sarah Palin, called the police about this alleged attack.
ref: His mother, Sarah Palin, called police to report the alleged attack.

src: 此案目前已呈上阿拉斯加的退伍軍人法庭。
mt: This case has been presented to the Veterans' Court of Alaska.
ref: The case is currently before Alaska's Veteran's Court.

src: 於 2016 年 1 月，他被指控家暴、妨礙家暴案報案及案發時醉酒持有武器。
mt: In January 2016, he was accused of domestic violence, obstruction of domestic violence cases and drunken possession of weapons at the time of the incident.
ref: In January 2016 he was charged with domestic assault, interfering with the report of a domestic violence crime, and possessing a weapon while intoxicated in connection with the incident.

src: 他的女友指控他打了她的臉。
mt: His girlfriend accused him of hitting her face.
ref: His girlfriend had alleged that he punched her in the face.

src: 莎拉‧裴琳在 2016 年將她兒子的暴力行為與他在伊拉克服役後所得到的 PTSD 相連結，受到退伍軍人團體批評。
mt: In 2016, Sarah Palin linked her son's violent behavior to the PTSD he received after serving in Iraq, which was criticized by veterans.
ref: Sarah Palin was criticized by veterans groups in 2016 after linking her son's violent behavior to PTSD stemming from his service in Iraq.

src: 印尼地震海嘯：數百人罹難
mt: Earthquake Tsunami in Indonesia: Hundreds of dead
ref: Indonesia earthquake tsunami: hundreds killed

src: 印尼的蘇拉威西 (Sulawesi) 島在星期五發生地震，造成至少 384 人死亡。
mt: At least 384 people were killed in an earthquake on Friday in Sulawesi Island, Indonesia.
ref: At least 384 people have died after an earthquake hit the Indonesian island of Sulawesi on Friday.

src: 規模 7.5 的地震引發海嘯，摧毀了上千個房屋。
mt: A magnitude 7.5 earthquake triggered a tsunami, destroying thousands of houses.
ref: The 7.5-magnitude earthquake triggered a tsunami and has destroyed thousands of homes.

src: 電力和通訊網路中斷，死亡人數預計會在接下來幾天上升。
mt: Power and communication networks are disrupted, with death toll expected to rise over the next few days.
ref: Electricity and communication networks are down with death tolls expected to rise in coming days.

src: 地震襲擊印尼首都雅加達東北的中蘇門答臘附近。
mt: A earthquake struck the eastern part of Indonesia's capital Jakarta, near Central Sumatra.
ref: The earthquake hit just off central Sulawesi which is northeast of the Indonesian capital, Jakarta.

src: 衝擊時刻的影片傳遍社群媒體。
mt: Videos from the moment of impact have been widely circulated on social media.
ref: Videos are circulating on social media showing the moment of impact.

src: 當海嘯沖向海岸時，上百人正聚在在帕盧市 (Palu) 的海灘參加慶典。
mt: When the tsunamis hit the coast, hundreds of people gathered on the beach in Palu to attend the festival.
ref: Hundreds of people had gathered for a beach festival in the city of Palu when the tsunami smashed on shore.

src: 聯邦檢察官對 NYC 恐怖攻擊嫌犯罕有地求處死刑
mt: Federal prosecutors rarely seek executions against NYC terror suspects.
ref: Federal prosecutors seeking rare death penalty for NYC terror attack suspect

src: 紐約的聯邦檢察官希望對紐約市恐怖攻擊的嫌犯 Sayfullo Saipov 罕有地求處死刑 - 該州自從 1953 年後就未執行過死刑。這場恐怖攻擊造成 8 人罹難。
mt: New York's federal prosecutor wants the death penalty, the rarest suspect in a New York City terrorist attack, Sayfullo Saipov - the state has not carried out the death penalty since 1953. The terrorist attack resulted in eight fatalities.
ref: Federal prosecutors in New York are seeking the death penalty for Sayfullo Saipov, the suspect in the New York City terror attack that killed eight people -- a rare punishment that hasn't been carried out in the state for a federal crime since 1953.

src: 30 歲的 Saipov 涉嫌在 10 月時沿著曼哈頓下城的西城公路 (West Side Highway)，利用 Home Depot 的租用貨車在自行車道上發動攻擊，撞倒行人和自行車騎士。
mt: A 30-year-old Saipov is suspected of attacking a bike lane on the West Side Highway in Lower Manhattan in October, using a rented van from the Home Depot to knock down pedestrians and cyclists.
ref: Saipov, 30, allegedly used a Home Depot rental truck to carry out an attack on a bike path along the West Side Highway in Lower Manhattan, mowing down pedestrians and cyclist in his path on Oct.

src: 根據在紐約南區呈交的求償死刑意向書，檢察官將必須證明「刻意」殺害 8 名受害人且「刻意」造成嚴重的身體傷害，為了判處死刑。
mt: According to a letter of intent submitted by the South District of New York, the prosecutor must prove that he intentionally killed eight victims and "intentionally" caused serious bodily harm in order to sentence him to death.
ref: In order to justify a death sentence, prosecutors will have to prove that Saipov "intentionally" killed the eight victims and "intentionally" inflicted serious bodily injury, according to the notice of intent to seek the death penalty, filed in the Southern District of New York.

src: 據法庭文件指出，這兩項最高都可被判死刑。
mt: According to court documents, both of these can be sentenced to death.
ref: Both of those counts carry a possibly death sentence, according to the court document.

src: 攻擊過後幾個星期，聯邦陪審團對 Saipov 提出 22 項控罪，當中包括聯邦檢察官一般用於組織犯罪案的 8 項謀殺罪名，還有 1 項暴力毀壞汽車罪名。
mt: A few weeks after the attack, a federal jury charged Saipov with 22 counts of murder, including eight counts of murder typically used by federal prosecutors in organized crime cases and one count of violent vehicle destruction.
ref: Weeks after the attack, a federal grand jury slapped Saipov with a 22-count indictment that included eight charges of murder in aid of racketeering, typically used by federal prosecutors in organized crime cases, and a charge of violence and destruction of motor vehicles.

src: 檢察官表示，這次攻擊需要「縝密的計畫和預謀」，形容 Saipov 以「令人髮指、殘忍且墮落」的方式進行這次攻擊。
mt: Prosecutors said the attack required "a meticulous plan and premeditation", describing Saipov as conducting this attack in a "disguised, cruel and decadent" manner.
ref: The attack required "substantial planning and premeditation," prosecutors said, describing the manner in which Saipov carried it out as "heinous, cruel and depraved."

src: 意向書說：「Sayfullo Habibullaevic Saipov 對 Diego Enrique Angelini、Nicholas Cleves、Ann-Laure Decadt、Darren Drake、Ariel Erlij、Hernan Ferruchi、Hernan Diego Mendoza，以及 Alejandro Damian Pagnucco 的親友造成傷害、悲痛和損失。」
mt: The letter of intent says, “Sayfullo Habibullaevic Saipov is causing harm, grief and loss to Diego Enrique Angelini, Nicholas Cleves, Ann-Laure Decadet, Darren Drake, Ariel Erlij, Hernan Ferruchi, Hernan Diego Mendoza, and to the friends and family of Alejandro Damian Pagnucco.”
ref: "Sayfullo Habibullaevic Saipov caused injury, harm, and loss to the families and friends of Diego Enrique Angelini, Nicholas Cleves, Ann-Laure Decadt, Darren Drake, Ariel Erlij, Hernan Ferruchi, Hernan Diego Mendoza, and Alejandro Damian Pagnucco," the notice of intent states.

src: 其中 5 位受害人是來自阿根廷的遊客。
mt: Five of the victims were tourists from Argentina.
ref: Five of the victims were tourists from Argentina.

src: 紐約南區已經超過十多年未有案件被起訴死刑。
mt: New York's Southern District has had no cases of capital punishment for over a decade.
ref: It has been a decade since the Southern District of New York last prosecuted a death penalty case.

src: 被告 Khalid Barnes 因殺害 2 名藥頭而被定罪，不過最終在 2009 年 9 月被處無期徒刑。
mt: The defendant Khalid Barnes was convicted of killing two drug heads, but was sentenced to life imprisonment in September 2009.
ref: The defendant, Khalid Barnes, was convicted of murdering two drug suppliers but was ultimately sentenced to life in prison in September 2009.

src: 上一次執行死刑的紐約聯邦案件是 1953 年的Julius 和 Ethel Rosenberg 夫婦間諜案，他們在之前兩年以替蘇聯進行間諜活動的罪名被定罪。
mt: The last federal case of New York to be executed was the 1953 Julius and Ethel Rosenberg couple's espionage case, which they were convicted of for espionage in the Soviet Union two years earlier.
ref: The last time the death penalty was carried out in a New York federal case was in 1953 for Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, a married couple executed after they were convicted of conspiracy to commit espionage for the Soviet Union during the Cold War two years before.

src: 在 1953 年 6 月 19 日，夫婦兩人以坐電椅的方式處死。
mt: On June 19, 1953, the couple was executed by sitting on an electric chair.
ref: Both Rosenbergs were both put to death by the electric chair on June 19, 1953.

src: 據法庭文件指出，Saipov 是烏茲別克人，進行攻擊後毫無悔意。
mt: According to court documents, Saipov is an Uzbek person, who carried out the attack without remorse.
ref: Saipov, a native of Uzbekistan, demonstrated a lack of remorse in the days and months following the attack, according to court documents.

src: 警方表示，他對調查員聲稱他對自己做的事情感到很好。
mt: Police said he felt good about what he was doing, as investigators claimed.
ref: He stated to investigators that he felt good about what he had done, police said.

src: 起訴書說。Saipov 告訴當局他在電話上看了 ISIS 影片後才興起念頭。
mt: The indictment said that it was only after Saipov told the authorities that he had watched the ISIS video on the phone that he had an idea.
ref: Saipov told authorities he was inspired to carry out the attack after watching ISIS videos on his phone, according to the indictment.

src: 警方說，他也要求在他的醫院房間展示 ISIS 旗幟。
mt: Police said he also asked to display the ISIS flag in his hospital room.
ref: He also requested to display the ISIS flag in his hospital room, police said.

src: 他對 22 項控罪不認罪。
mt: He did not plead guilty to 22 charges.
ref: He has pleaded not guilty to the 22-count indictment.

src: Saipov 的代表律師聯邦公設辯護人 David Patton 表示，對檢察官的決定感到｜非常失望」。
mt: David Patton, a federal public defender of Saipov's lawyers, said he was very disappointed with the prosecutor's decision.
ref: David Patton, one of the federal public defenders representing Saipov, said they are "obviously disappointed" with the prosecution's decision.

src: Patton 說：｜他們求償死刑而不接受認罪協議並且判以無期徒刑不得保釋，我們認為這個決定只會延長事件相關者的創傷。」
mt: Patton said they are seeking the death penalty, they do not accept the plea agreement and are sentenced to life imprisonment without bail. We think this decision will only prolong the trauma of the event-related parties.”
ref: "We think the decision to seek the death penalty rather than accepting a guilty plea to life in prison with no possibility of release will only prolong the trauma of these events for everyone involved," Patton said.

src: Saipov 的辯護團隊先前已要求檢察官不要求償死刑。
mt: Saipov's defense team had previously asked prosecutors not to demand the death penalty.
ref: Saipov's defense team had previously asked prosecutors not to seek the death penalty.

src: 國會議員 Tory 表示 NIGEL FARAGE 應該負責英國脫歐談判
mt: Member of Parliament Tory says NIGEL FARAGE should be responsible for Brexit negotiations
ref: Tory MP says NIGEL FARAGE should be put in charge of Brexit negotiations

src: 今天在 Tory 會議抗議期間，Nigel Farage 發誓要「動員人民軍」。
mt: Today, at Tory, Nigel Farage vowed to "mobilize the People's Army."
ref: Nigel Farage vowed to 'mobilize the people's army' today during a protest at the Tory conference.

src: 由於梅首相 (Theresa May) 的一位國會議員建議他應該要負責在歐盟內談判，這位英國獨立黨 (UKIP) 前黨魁表示，政客應該要「感受疑歐派的熱度」。
mt: Because a member of parliament from Theresa May suggested he should be responsible for negotiating within the EU, the former leader of the UKIP said politicians should "feel the heat of the eurosceptic faction".
ref: The former Ukip leader said politicians had to 'feel the heat' from Eurosceptics - as one of Theresa May's own MPs suggested he should be in charge of negotiations with the EU.

src: 保守後排議員 Peter Bone 在伯明罕 (Birmingham) 的示威遊行說，如果 Farage 先生是英國脫歐部長，英國「早就脫歐了」。
mt: Conservative MP Peter Bone said in a demonstration in Birmingham that if Mr Farage was the UK's Brexit minister, the UK "would have left the EU long ago."
ref: Conservative backbencher Peter Bone told the march in Birmingham that the UK 'would have been out' by now if Mr Farage was Brexit Secretary.

src: 不過支持留歐的托利黨 (Tories) 在市中加入另一場反脫歐的抗議，加深了梅首相在調解極度分裂的成員中所面對的挑戰。
mt: However, the Tories, which supports EU membership, joined another anti-Brexit protest in the city, deepening Prime Minister May's challenge in mediating extremely divided members.
ref: But the challenge Mrs May faces in reconciling her deeply divided ranks has been underlined by pro-Remain Tories joining a separate protest against Brexit in the city.

src: 在受到脫歐派、留歐派和歐盟攻擊的期間，梅首相努力要保持她的契克斯 (Chequers) 妥協計劃如序進行。
mt: During the period of being attacked by the Brexit, the EU and the EU, Prime Minister May made an effort to keep her Chequers compromise plan proceeding as scheduled.
ref: The premier is struggling to keep her Chequers compromise plan on track amid attacks from Brexiteers, Remainers and the EU.

src: 儘管引起反彈，盟友堅持她會優先嘗試與布魯塞爾達成協議 - 並強制疑歐派和勞工黨在她的配套和「混戰」之間做出選擇。
mt: Despite sparking a backlash, the allies insisted that she would prioritize trying to reach an agreement with Brussels - and force the eurosceptic and Labour Party to make a choice between her arrangements and "mash".
ref: Allies insisted she will push ahead with trying to strike a deal with Brussels despite the backlash - and force Eurosceptics and Labour to choose between her package and 'chaos'.

src: Bone 在索利赫爾 (Solihull) 的「Leave Means Leave」造勢活動中表示，他要「甩掉契克斯計畫」。
mt: Bone said at Solihull's Leave Means Leave campaign that he wanted to "leave off the Chequers project".
ref: Mr Bone told the Leave Means Leave rally in Solihull that he wanted to 'chuck Chequers'.

src: 他建議 Farage 先生應該要參與並負責與布魯塞爾談判。
mt: He suggested that Mr. Farage should be involved and responsible for negotiating with Brussels.
ref: He suggested Mr Farage should have been made a peer and given responsibility for negotiations with Brussels.

src: 他說：「若是由他負責，我們現在早就脫歐了」。
mt: He said: "If he were responsible, we would have left the European Union by now."
ref: 'If he had been in charge, we would have been out by now,' he said.

src: 這位韋靈伯勒 (Wellingborough) 國會議員還說：「我會支持脫歐，但我們需要甩掉契克斯計畫」。
mt: This congressman from Wellingborough also said, "I'll support Brexit, but we need to get rid of the Chequers plan."
ref: The Wellingborough MP added: 'I will stand up for Brexit but we need to chuck Chequers.'

src: 他著手反歐盟，說：「我們不是為了低聲下氣才打打世界大戰的。
mt: He set out to fight against the EU, saying: "We're not fighting the World War for the sake of being silent.
ref: Setting out his opposition to the EU, he said: 'We didn't fight world wars to be subservient.

src: 我們要在自己的國家制定自己的法律。」
mt: We have to make our own laws in our own country."
ref: We want to make our own laws in our own country.'

src: Bone 不覺得 2016 年投票後公共意見改變了：對於英國人已變更他們的想法而且想要留下，這種講法完全不是真的。」
mt: Bone doesn't feel that public opinion changed after the 2016 vote: it's not true that the British have changed their minds and want to stay. "
ref: Mr Bone dismissed suggestions that public opinion had changed since the 2016 vote: 'The idea that the British people have changed their minds and want to remain is completely untrue.'

src: Tory 支持脫歐者 Andrea Jenkyns 也在遊行中，她告訴記者：「我只要說：首相，聽聽人民的聲音吧。
mt: Andrea Jenkyns, a supporter of Tory's Brexit movement, told reporters during the march: "I just want to say: Prime Minister, listen to the voice of the people.
ref: Tory Brexiteer Andrea Jenkyns was also at the march, telling reporters: 'I am simply saying: Prime Minister, listen to the people.

src: 「契克斯計畫不受一般公眾歡迎、反對派不會投它、也不受弊黨和我們的積極分子歡迎。我們原本就是靠這些積極分子上街並讓我們當選。
mt: “The Chequers program is not popular with the general public, the opposition will not vote for it, and it will not be welcomed by the cheating parties and our activists. We were the ones who took the streets and elected us.
ref: 'Chequers is unpopular with the general public, the Opposition's not going to vote for it, it's unpopular with our party and our activists who actually pound the streets and get us elected in the first place.

src: 請丟掉契克斯計畫並開始傾聽。」
mt: Please drop the Chequers program and start listening."
ref: Please drop Chequers and start listening.'

src: 在對梅首相發出的明確訊息中，她還提到：「如果首相保持承諾，就可以保住工作。」
mt: In a clear message to Prime Minister Mei, she also said: "If the Prime Minister keeps his promise, he can keep his job."
ref: In a pointed message to Mrs May, she added: 'Prime ministers keep their jobs when they keep their promises.'

src: Farage 先生告訴造勢活動，若政客要背叛 2016 年公投所做的決定，他們就必須要「感受熱度」。
mt: Mr Farage told campaigners that if politicians wanted to betray the decisions made in the 2016 referendum, they would have to "feel the heat."
ref: Mr Farage told the rally politicians must be made to 'feel the heat' if they were about to betray the decision made in the 2016 referendum.

src: 他說：「現在是我們 - 人民 - 和我們的治理階級之間信任的問題。」
mt: He said, "It's a matter of trust between us - the people - and our ruling class."
ref: 'This is now about a matter of trust between us - the people - and our political class,' he said.

src: 「他們正在嘗試背叛英國脫歐，我們今天就在這裡告訴他們"我們不會讓你們得逞。"」
mt: "They're trying to betray the British out of Europe, and we're here today to tell them, 'We're not going to let you get away with this.'"
ref: 'They are trying to betray Brexit and we are here today to tell them 'we won't let you get away with doing that'.'

src: 在對熱情的群眾講話時，他還提到：「我們的治理階級快要背叛英國脫歐，我要你們讓他們感受一下熱度。」
mt: As he spoke to the passionate crowd, he also said: "Our ruling class is about to betray Britain and leave Europe, I want you to let them feel the heat."
ref: In a message to the enthusiastic crowd he added: 'I want you to make our political class, who are on the verge of betraying Brexit, feel the heat.

src: 「我們正在動員這個國家的人民，他們讓我們贏得英國脫歐的決定，在我們成為獨立、自治、令人驕傲的英國前，他們都不會休息。」
mt: "We are mobilizing the people of this country, they have allowed us to win the decision to leave the UK. They will not rest until we become an independent, self-governing and proud Britain."
ref: 'We are mobilizing the people's army of this country that gave us victory in Brexit and will never rest until we have become an independent, self-governing, proud United Kingdom.'

src: 同時，留歐派在伯明罕遊行，之後在市中心舉辦 2 小時的造勢活動。
mt: At the same time, the Europeans marched in Birmingham and later held a two-hour campaign in the city center.
ref: Meanwhile, Remainers marched through Birmingham before holding a two-hour rally in the city center.

src: 在本星期發起群組後，有少量的積極分子揮舞著 “Tories Against Brexit” 的標語。
mt: After starting the group this week, a small number of activists waved the slogan "Tories Against Brexit".
ref: A smattering of activists waved Tories Against Brexit banners after the launch of the group this weekend.

src: 會議展開時，工黨議員 Lord Adonis 就保守黨 App 的安全問題嘲弄他們。
mt: At the start of the meeting, Labour MP Lord Adonis mocked them about the security issues of the Conservative app.
ref: Labour peer Lord Adonis mocked the Conservatives for the security issues they suffered with a party app as the conference opened.

src: 他還提到：「就是這些人告訴我們他們能夠準備好 IT 系統和加拿大的所有科技用於暢通無阻的邊界、在愛爾蘭沒有邊界的自由貿易。」
mt: He also said, "These are the people who tell us that they can prepare their IT systems and all the technology in Canada for unobstructed borders and free trade in Ireland without borders."
ref: 'These are the people who tell us they can have the IT systems in place and all of the technology for Canada plus plus, for the frictionless border, for free trade without borders in Ireland,' he added.

src: 「真是場鬧劇。」
mt: "It's really a joke."
ref: 'It is a complete farce.

src: 他還提到：「不可能有好的脫歐。」
mt: He also said, "There can't be a good Brexit."
ref: There isn't such a thing as a good Brexit,' he added.

src: Warren 計畫「認真考慮」參選總統
mt: Warren plans to "carefully consider" running for president.
ref: Warren plans to take a 'hard look' at running for president

src: 美國參議員華倫 (Elizabeth Warren) 表示，她會在 11 月的選舉後「認真考慮」參選總統。
mt: US Senator Elizabeth Warren said she would "carefully consider" running for president after the November elections.
ref: U.S. Sen. Elizabeth Warren says she'll take a "hard look at running for president" after the November elections.

src: Boston Globe 報導，在星期六的西麻州所舉辦的市民大會中，這位麻州民主黨人談到她的未來。
mt: Boston Globe reported that this Massachusetts Democrat spoke about her future at a town council meeting on Saturday in West Massachusetts.
ref: The Boston Globe reports the Massachusetts Democrat spoke about her future during a town hall in western Massachusetts Saturday.

src: 華倫經常批評川普總統，她正在參選 11 月的重新選舉，並將對上 GOP 州代表 Geoff Diehl，Diehl 是川普 2016 年麻州競選活動的副主席。
mt: Warren frequently criticizes President Trump, who is running for the November re-election and will face Geoff Diehl, a GOP representative, who was Vice President of Trump's 2016 Massachusetts campaign.
ref: Warren, a frequent critic of President Donald Trump, is running for re-election in November against GOP state Rep. Geoff Diehl, who was co-chairman of Trump's 2016 Massachusetts campaign.

src: 她一直都被認為可能會在 2020 年挑戰川普。
mt: She has always been thought to challenge Trump in 2020.
ref: She has been at the center of speculation that she might take on Trump in 2020.

src: 川普上位後，星期六下午在 Holyoke 所舉辦的活動是她第 36 次與選民進行市民大會。
mt: After Trump took office, her 36th public meeting with voters was held on Saturday afternoon at Holyoke.
ref: Saturday afternoon's event in Holyoke was her 36th meeting with constituents using the town hall format since Trump took office.

src: 一名出席者問她是否計畫參選總統。
mt: A attendee asked her if she planned to run for president.
ref: An attendee asked her if she planned to run for president.

src: 華倫回答說是時候「讓女性入主華盛頓並整頓殘破不堪的政府。」
mt: Warren replied, "It's time for women to take over Washington and clean up the dilapidated government."
ref: Warren replied that it's time "for women to go to Washington to fix our broken government, and that includes a woman at the top."

src: LSU 的 Sims 遭射殺案已進行逮捕行動
mt: LSU's Sims has been arrested.
ref: Arrest made in shooting death of LSU's Sims

src: 洛杉磯 Baton Rouge 的警方在星期六宣布，他們已逮捕在星期五射殺 LSU 籃球員 Wayde Sims 的一名疑犯。
mt: Los Angeles police at Baton Rouge announced on Saturday that they have arrested a suspect who shot and killed Wayde Sims, a basketball player from LSU on Friday.
ref: Police in Baton Rouge, La., announced Saturday that a suspect has been arrested in the shooting death of LSU basketball player Wayde Sims on Friday.

src: 在早上 11 點的 ET 記者會中，Baton Rouge 警察部門宣布逮捕 20 歲的 Dyteon Simpson。
mt: At an ET press conference at 11 a.m., Baton Rouge Police announced the arrest of 20-year-old Dyteon Simpson.
ref: The Baton Rouge Police Department announced the arrest of Dyteon Simpson, 20, at an 11 a.m. ET news conference.

src: 他們之前公布了一段星期五槍擊案的影片，尋求協助指證影片中的男子。
mt: They previously released a video of the Friday shooting, seeking help to identify the man in the video.
ref: They had released a video of the shooting on Friday, asking for help identifying a man seen in the footage.

src: 星期五一早，20 歲的 Sims 在南方大學 (Southern University) 附近被射殺。
mt: On Friday morning, 20-year-old Sims was shot dead near Southern University.
ref: Sims, 20, was shot and killed near Southern University's campus early Friday.

src: 據 247sports 報導，警長 Murphy J. Paul 在星期六告訴媒體：「Wayde Sims 頭部中槍因而致死」。
mt: According to 247sports, Sheriff Murphy J. Paul told the media on Saturday: "Wayde Sims was shot in the head and died."
ref: "Wayde Sims suffered a gunshot wound to the head and ultimately died as a result," police chief Murphy J. Paul told the media Saturday, per 247sports.

src: Wayde 挺身保護他的朋友，然後被 Simpson 開槍打中。
mt: Wayde stood up to protect his friends and was shot by Simpson.
ref: Wayde stepped in to defend his friend and was shot by Simpson.

src: Simpson 被審問，並承認人在現場、持有武器以及射殺 Wayde Sims。
mt: Simpson was interrogated and admitted to being on the scene, armed and shooting Wayde Sims.
ref: Simpson was questioned and admitted to being on scene, in possession of a weapon, and admitted to shooting Wayde Sims.

src: Simpson 遭到逮捕並居留在 East Baton Rouge Parish 警局。
mt: Simpson is arrested and resides at East Baton Rouge Parish Police Station.
ref: Simpson was arrested without incident and taken into custody at East Baton Rouge Parish Police Department.

src: 成長於 Baton Rouge 的 Sims 身高 6 尺 6 吋，他上一季出賽 32 次，有 10 次先發，每場平均上場 17.4 分鐘，5.6 分和 2.9 個籃板。
mt: Born in Baton Rouge, Sims is 6 feet 6 inches tall and played 32 times last season, starting 10 times, averaging 17.4 minutes per game, 5.6 points, and 2.9 rebounds per game.
ref: A 6-foot-6 junior who grew up in Baton Rouge, Sims played in 32 games with 10 starts last season and averaged 17.4 minutes, 5.6 points and 2.9 rebounds per game.

src: 俄羅斯大獎賽：在車隊下了指令後，Lewis Hamilton 擊敗 Sebastian Vettel 獲得世界冠軍頭銜。
mt: Russian Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton beat Sebastian Vettel to win the world championship title after the team gave the order.
ref: Russian Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton closes in on world title after team orders hand him win over Sebastian Vettel

src: Valtteri Bottas 在星期六超越 Lewis Hamilton 獲得晉級，明顯地顯示 Mercedes 車隊的指令對比賽有很大的影響。
mt: Valtteri Bottas overtook Lewis Hamilton on Saturday to qualify, clearly showing that Mercedes’ instructions had a big impact on the race.
ref: It became clear from the moment that Valtteri Bottas qualified ahead of Lewis Hamilton on Saturday that Mercedes" team orders would play a large part in the race.

src: 起跑後，Bottas 出發表現不錯，為了維持他的位置，他在頭兩個彎道幾乎不顧 Hamilton 並讓 Vettel 追擊他的隊友。
mt: After the start, Bottas set off well, in order to maintain his position, he almost ignored Hamilton on the first two turns and let Vettel pursue his teammates.
ref: From pole, Bottas got a good start and almost hung Hamilton out to dry as he defended his position in the first two turns and invited Vettel to attack his teammate.

src: Vettel 率先進站，留下 Hamilton 跟著車隊車尾，這應該是策略下所做的決定。
mt: Vettel leads the way, leaving Hamilton at the rear of the team, a decision that should be made strategically.
ref: Vettel went into the pits first and left Hamilton to run into the traffic at the tail of the pack, something which should have been decisive.

src: Mercedes 車隊一圈後進站稍停並在 Vettel 後出來， 在躲過第三個角落的雙變向後，Hamilton 利用 Ferrari 車手在內側勉強留下空隙的機會時，兩車左右並行後超越。
mt: The Mercedes team came in after a lap and stopped slightly behind Vettel. After avoiding the double shift in the third corner, Hamilton used the Ferrari driver's inner side to barely leave a gap when the two cars ran side by side to overtake.
ref: The Mercedes pitted a lap later and came out behind Vettel, but Hamilton went ahead after some wheel-to-wheel action that saw the Ferrari driver reluctantly leave the inside free at risk of holding out after a double-move to defend on the third corner.

src: 當天是 Max Verstappen 的 21 歲生日，他在後排格位出發，第 1 圈結束時排第 7 位。
mt: That day was Max Verstappen's 21st birthday, and he left in the back row, finishing seventh at the end of lap one.
ref: Max Verstappen started from the back row of the grid and was in seventh by the end of the first lap on his 21st birthday.

src: 他之後領先大半場比賽，因為他選擇不換胎以目標快速完賽並超越 Kimi Raikkone 爭第 4 位。
mt: He then led most of the game, as he chose not to change tires to quickly finish with his goal and overtook Kimi Raikkonone for fourth place.
ref: He then led for a large part of the race as he held onto his tires to target a quick finish and overtake Kimi Raikkonen for fourth.

src: 由於 Raikkonen 位在第 4，Verstappen 最終在第 44 圈進站，不過無法在剩餘 8 圈加快步調。
mt: Due to Raikkonen's position at 4th, Verstappen finally entered the 44th lap, but was unable to accelerate in the remaining eight laps.
ref: He eventually came into the pits on the 44th lap but was unable to increase his pace in the remaining eight laps as Raikkonen took fourth.

src: Hamilton 表示：「這一天很辛苦，Valtteri 整個周末的表現非常好，他被要求讓我先過，展現了紳士風度。
mt: “It was a tough day,” said Hamilton. “Valtteri did a great job all weekend, and he was asked to let me pass first and show off his gentlemanly demeanor.
ref: It's a difficult day because Valtteri did a fantastic job all weekend and was a real gentleman told let me by.

src: 整個團隊的表現太傑出了，讓我們贏得一二名。」
mt: The team's performance was outstanding, so we won one or two places. "
ref: The team have done such an exceptional job to have a one two," said Hamilton.

src: 肢體語言太差了
mt: Body language is so bad.
ref: That Was Really Bad Body Language

src: 在星期六的造勢活動上，川普總統嘲諷參議員范斯坦 (Dianne Feinstein)，她堅持沒有洩漏福特 (Christine Blasey Ford) 指控最高法院大法官提名人卡瓦諾 (Brett Kavanaugh) 性侵案的信件。
mt: On Saturday’s campaign, President Trump mocked Senator Dianne Feinstein, insisting that she did not leak letters from Christine Blasey Ford, the Supreme Court justice nominee Brett Kavanaugh, who accused the Supreme Court of sexual assault.
ref: President Donald Trump mocked Senator Dianne Feinstein at a rally on Saturday over her insistence she did not leak the letter from Christine Blasey Ford accusing Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh of sexual assault.

src: 在西維吉尼亞 (West Virginia) 的一場競選活動中，總統沒有直接點名福特在參議員司法委員會上所做的證詞，反倒是評論在參議院所發生的事顯示人心「苛薄骯髒又不老實」。
mt: During a campaign in West Virginia, the president did not directly name Ford's testimony on the Senate Judiciary Committee, but instead commented on what had happened in the Senate, showing that people were "spicuous, dirty and not honest".
ref: Speaking at a rally in West Virginia, the president did not directly address the testimony given by Ford before the Senate Judiciary Committee, instead commenting that what was going on in the Senate showed that people were "mean and nasty and untruthful."

src: 他說：「看看過去幾天在參議院可能發生的事而正在發生的美事，你看到怒火，你看到苛薄骯髒又不老實的人。」
mt: He said, "Look at the good things that have happened in the Senate over the past few days, you see the anger, you see the harsh, dirty and dishonest people."
ref: "The one thing that could happen and the beautiful thing that is going on over the last few days in the Senate, when you see the anger, when you see people that are angry and mean and nasty and untruthful," he said.

src: 「當你看到發佈和洩密，然後他們說：喔，不是我。
mt: "When you see the release and the leak, and they say, "Oh, it's not me.
ref: "When you look at releases and leaks and then they say "oh, I didn't do it.

src: 我沒有做。
mt: I didn't do it.
ref: I didn't do it."

src: 記得嗎？
mt: Remember that?
ref: Remember?

src: 范斯坦，妳有洩密嗎？
mt: Vanstan, are you leaking?
ref: Dianne Feinstein, did you leak?

src: 記得她的回答...妳有洩漏文件嗎 - 「啊，什麼？
mt: Remember her answer... did you leak the papers?
ref: Remember her answer... did you leak the document - "oh, oh, what?

src: 喔不。
mt: Oh no.
ref: Oh, no.

src: 我沒有洩漏。」
mt: I didn't leak anything."
ref: I didn't leak."

src: 好吧，等一下。
mt: Okay, wait a minute.
ref: Well, wait one minute.

src: 我們有洩漏嗎...不，我們沒有洩漏。」他模仿參議員的樣子說著。
mt: Did we leak... no, we didn't leak," he said, mimicking the look of a senator.
ref: Did we leak...No, we didn't leak," he added, in an impression of the senator.

src: 7 月時有人寄信給范斯坦，信中詳細說明福特對卡瓦諾的指控，但 9 月初遭洩漏 - 不過范斯坦否認是由她的辦公室所洩漏。
mt: In July, a letter was sent to Vanstan detailing the allegations against Cavanaugh by Ford, but was leaked in early September - though Vanstan denied it was leaked from her office.
ref: Feinstein was sent the letter detailing the allegations against Kavanaugh by Ford back in July, and it was leaked earlier in September - but Feinstein denied that the leak came from her office.

src: 「我沒有隱藏福特博士的指控，我沒有洩漏她的故事」《國會山莊報》 (The Hill) 報導范斯坦如此告訴委員會。
mt: “I didn’t hide Dr. Ford’s accusations, I didn’t leak her story,” The Hill reported Vanstin telling the committee.
ref: "I did not hide Dr. Ford's allegations, I did not leak her story," Feinstein told the committee, The Hill reported.

src: 「她告訴我要保密，我就照她所說的保密。」
mt: "She told me to keep it a secret, and I kept it as she said."
ref: "She asked me to hold it confidential and I kept it confidential as she asked."

src: 不過她的否認顯然不為總統接受，他在星期六晚間的造勢活動中說到：「我告訴你，肢體語言太差了。
mt: However, her denial was clearly not accepted by the President, and he said at a rally on Saturday night: "I tell you, body language is too bad.
ref: But her denial did not appear to sit well with the president, who commented during the Saturday night rally: "I'll tell you what, that was really bad body language.

src: 也許她沒做，但這是我看過最差的肢體語言。」
mt: Maybe she didn't do it, but it's the worst body language I've ever seen."
ref: Maybe she didn't, but that's the worst body language I've ever seen."

src: 總統繼續為遭 3 名女性指控性侵的最高法院大法官提名人辯護，表示民主黨人一己為私利用這些指控。
mt: The President continued to defend the nominees of the Supreme Court justices who were accused of sexual assault by three women, saying that Democrats themselves exploited these allegations privately.
ref: Continuing his defense of the Supreme Court nominee, who has been accused of sexual misconduct by three women, the president suggested that the Democrats were using the allegations for their own ends.

src: 媒體報導，總統說:「他們決心要採取任何必要的手段來奪回權力。
mt: Media reports, the president said: "They are determined to take any necessary measures to regain power.
ref: "They are determined to take back power by any means necessary.

src: 你看到最苛薄最骯髒的人，他們為了獲得權力和控制，根本不在乎會傷到誰或是要犧牲誰。」
mt: You see the most harsh and dirty people, they don't care who will hurt or sacrifice anyone to gain power and control."
ref: You see the meanness, the nastiness, they don't care who they hurt, who they have to run over to get power and control," Mediaite reported the president saying.

src: 菁英聯盟：Dundee Stars 5-3 Belfast Giants
mt: Alliance: Dundee Stars 5-3 Belfast Giants
ref: Elite League: Dundee Stars 5-3 Belfast Giants

src: Patrick Dwyer 在 Giants 對 Dundee 的比賽中進了 2 球。
mt: Patrick Dwyer scored 2 goals in Giants vs Dundee.
ref: Patrick Dwyer hit two goals for the Giants against Dundee

src: Dundee Stars 在星期五菁英聯盟的比賽輸給了 Belfast Giants，但在星期六的 Dundee 主場比賽以 5-3 獲勝，一洗前恥。
mt: Dundee Stars lost to Belfast Giants in Friday’s Elite League, but lost 5-3 to the team in the Dundee home game on Saturday, a big disappointment.
ref: Dundee Stars atoned for Friday's Elite League loss against Belfast Giants by winning the return match 5-3 in Dundee on Saturday.

src: 由 Patrick Dwyer 和 Francis Beauvillier 進攻，Giants 先以 2 球領先。
mt: Attacked by Patrick Dwyer and Francis Beauvillier, Giants led 2-0.
ref: The Giants got an early two-goal lead through strikes from Patrick Dwyer and Francis Beauvillier.

src: Mike Sullivan 和 Jordan Cownie 發揮主場優勢進球後，Dwyer 為 Giants 再次取得領先。
mt: Mike Sullivan and Jordan Cownie scored home advantage, Dwyer took the lead for Giants again.
ref: Mike Sullivan and Jordan Cownie brought the home side level before Dwyer restored the Giants' lead.

src: Francois Bouchard 為 Dundee 追平比數後，Lukas Lundvald Nielsen 再進 2 球，奠定勝利。
mt: Francois Bouchard tied Dundee’s score, and Lukas Lundvald Nielsen scored two more goals to secure the victory.
ref: Francois Bouchard equalized for Dundee before two Lukas Lundvald Nielsen goals secured their victory.

src: 這是 Adam Keefe 的球員在本季菁英聯盟的第 3 場敗仗，星期五晚上在 Belfast 他們則從落後到以 2-1 擊敗 Dundee。
