mt: This is Adam Keefe's player's third loss of the season in the Elite League, and Friday night in Belfast they fell behind to a 2-1 victory over Dundee.
ref: It was a third Elite League defeat of the season for Adam Keefe's men, who had come from behind to beat Dundee 2-1 in Belfast on Friday night.

src: 這是兩隊在本季第 4 次交手，Giants 贏得前 3 場比賽。
mt: This is their fourth encounter of the season, Giants won their first three games.
ref: It was a fourth meeting of the season between the sides, with the Giants winning the previous three matches.

src: 3:35 時，Dwyer 在 Kendall McFaull 的助攻下進了第 1 球，4 分鐘後在 David Rutherford 助攻下 Beauvillier 進球，領先兩球。
mt: At 3:35, Dwyer scored the first goal with Kendall McFaull's assist, and four minutes later, with David Rutherford's assist, Beauvillier scored, leading by two goals.
ref: Dwyer's opener came in the fourth minute on 3:35 from a Kendall McFaull assist, with David Rutherford providing the assist as Beauvillier doubled the lead four minutes later.

src: 經過忙碌的開場後，Sullivan 在 13:10 時開始在主場進球，Cownie 則在 15:16 時透過 Matt Marquardt 的協助下進球追平。
mt: After a busy start, Sullivan started scoring at home at 13:10, and Cownie tied the score with Matt Marquardt's help at 15:16.
ref: In what was a busy opening period, Sullivan brought the home side back into the game on 13:10 before Matt Marquardt became provider for Cownie's equalizer on 15:16.

src: 在第 1 局結束前，Dwyer 打進了今晚的第 2 球，確保 Giants 在中場休息前取得領先。
mt: Before the end of the first inning, Dwyer scored tonight's second goal to ensure Giants take the lead before midfield break.
ref: Dwyer made sure the Giants took a lead into the first break when he hit his second goal of the night at the end of the first period.

src: 主隊重新整裝，在 27:37 時，Bouchard 以 1 記有力的進球再次顯示他們不相上下的實力。
mt: The main team was reorganized, and at 27:37, Bouchard again showed their comparable strength with a powerful goal scored by one.
ref: The home side regrouped and Bouchard once again put them on level terms with a power play goal on 27:37.

src: 在第 2 局後段，Cownie 與 Charles Corcoran 一起協助Nielsen 得分，使 Dundee 在今晚比賽首次取得領先，之後在最後 1 局時 Nielsen 再下一城取得第 5 分，確保球隊勝利。
mt: In the latter half of the second inning, Cownie and Charles Corcoran helped Nielsen score, making Dundee take the lead for the first time in tonight's game, followed by Nielsen scoring fifth in the next city in the last inning to secure their team's victory.
ref: Cownie and Charles Corcoran combined to help Nielsen give Dundee the lead for the first time in the match late in the second period and he made sure of the win with his team's fifth halfway through the final period.

src: Giants 在最近 5 場比賽中已輸了 4 場，下一場比賽是在星期五，將於主場對上 Milton Keynes。
mt: Giants have lost 4 of their last 5 games, the next being Friday, to Milton Keynes at home.
ref: The Giants, who have now lost four of their last five matches, are at home to Milton Keynes in their next match on Friday.

src: 空中交通管制員犧牲自我以確保機上一百多人能夠逃過地震
mt: Air traffic controllers sacrificed themselves to ensure more than 100 people on board were able to escape the earthquake.
ref: Air Traffic Controller Dies To Ensure Hundreds On Plane Can Escape Earthquake

src: 在印尼，一名空中交通管制員犧牲自己的性命以確保一架載有一百多人的飛機能夠成功起飛，因此被視為英雄。
mt: In Indonesia, an air traffic controller sacrificed his own life to ensure that a plane carrying over 100 people could successfully take off, thus being considered a hero.
ref: An air traffic controller in Indonesia is being hailed as a hero after he died ensuring that a plane carrying hundreds of people made it safely off the ground.

src: 蘇拉威西 (Sulawesi) 島在星期五發生地震並引起海嘯，造成超過 800 人罹難，還有許多人下落不明。
mt: A tsunami struck Sulawesi Island on Friday, killing more than 800 people and leaving many unaccounted for.
ref: More than 800 people have died and many are missing after a major earthquake hit the island of Sulawesi on Friday, triggering a tsunami.

src: 當地仍然繼續發生強烈餘震，許多人被困在帕盧市 (Palu) 的瓦礫堆下。
mt: The area is still experiencing strong aftershocks, with many trapped under the rubble of Palu.
ref: Strong aftershocks continue to plague the area and many are trapped in debris in the city of Palu.

src: 儘管 Mutiara Sis Al Jufri Airport Palu 機場塔台劇烈搖晃，他的同事紛紛逃生，21 歲的 Anthonius Gunawan Agung 仍堅守岡位。
mt: Despite the violent rocking of the Mutiara Sis Al Jufri Airport Palu tower, his colleagues rushed to escape, and 21-year-old Anthonius Gunawan Agung still held the position.
ref: But despite his colleagues fleeing for their lives, 21-year-old Anthonius Gunawan Agung refused to leave his post in the wildly swaying control tower at Mutiara Sis Al Jufri Airport Palu airport.

src: 他留下來以確保當時已在跑道上的 Batik Air 編號 6321 班機能夠安全起飛。
mt: He stayed to ensure that the Batik Air flight number 6321, which was already on the runway at the time, could take off safely.
ref: He stayed put to make sure that the Batik Air Flight 6321, which was on the runway at the time, was able to take off safely.

src: 當他以為塔台要垮了的時候，他從塔台跳下。
mt: When he thought the tower was going to collapse, he jumped off the tower.
ref: He then jumped off the traffic control tower when he thought it was collapsing.

src: 之後他在醫院去世。
mt: Later he died at the hospital.
ref: He died later in hospital.

src: 澳洲的 ABC 新聞報導，Air Navigation Indonesia 的發言人 Yohannes Sirait 表示，他的舉動拯救了一百多條人命。
mt: Australian ABC News reported that Air Navigation Indonesia's spokesperson Yohannes Sirait said his actions saved more than a hundred lives.
ref: Spokesman for Air Navigation Indonesia, Yohannes Sirait, said the decision may have saved hundreds of lives, Australia's ABC News reported.

src: 我們在加里曼丹 (Kalimantan) 從巴厘巴板 (Balikpapan) 準備了一台直升機，要將他帶往另一個城市較大的醫院。
mt: We've got a helicopter from Balikpapan in Kalimantan that's going to take him to a larger hospital in another city.
ref: We prepared a helicopter from Balikpapan in Kalimantan to take him to a bigger hospital in another city.

src: 很不幸地，在直升機抵達帕盧前，他已於今早去世。
mt: Unfortunately, he had passed away this morning before the helicopter arrived at Palo.
ref: Unfortunately we lost him this morning before the helicopter reached Palu.

src: 他還說到：「聽到消息時，我們心都碎了。」
mt: He also said, "When we heard the news, we were heartbroken."
ref: "Our heart breaks to hear about this," he added.

src: 同時，印尼國家抗災署表示棟加拉 (Donggala)、希吉 (Sigi) 和布頓通 (Boutong) 城鎮的連外道路受阻，當局擔心死亡人數會達到上千人。
mt: Meanwhile, the Indonesian National Disaster Prevention Agency said that roads connecting the towns of Tonggala, Sigi and Boutong were blocked, with authorities worried that the death toll would reach over a thousand people.
ref: Meanwhile, authorities fear that the death toll could reach the thousands with the country's disaster mitigation agency saying that access to the the towns of Donggala, Sigi and Boutong is limited.

src: 該署的發言人 Sutopo Purwo Nugroho 表示：「很多屍體還被掩埋在斷垣殘壁下，許多人下落不明，因此相信死亡人數仍在上升。」
mt: Sutopo Purwo Nugroho, a spokesperson for the agency, said: "Many bodies are still buried under the rubble, many are still missing, and the death toll is believed to be on the rise."
ref: "The toll is believed to be still increasing since many bodies were still under the wreckage while many have not able to be reached," agency spokesman Sutopo Purwo Nugroho said.

src: 高達 6 公尺海浪毀滅了帕盧市，帕盧市將在星期天舉辦大型葬禮。
mt: A six-meter-high wave destroyed the city of Palu, which will hold a large funeral on Sunday.
ref: Waves that reached up to six meters have devastated Palu which will hold a mass burial on Sunday.

src: 軍用和商用飛機正送來援助和物資。
mt: Military and commercial aircraft are bringing aid and supplies.
ref: Military and commercial aircraft are bringing in aid and supplies.

src: 一名母親 Risa Kusuma (35 歲) 告訴 Sky News：「每分鐘都有救護車送來屍體。
mt: A mother, Risa Kusuma (35), told Sky News: "Every minute there's an ambulance bringing bodies.
ref: Risa Kusuma, a 35-year-old mother, told Sky News: "Every minute an ambulance brings in bodies.

src: 我們缺乏乾淨的水。
mt: We lack clean water.
ref: Clean water is scarce.

src: 每個地方的雜貨店都被洗劫一空。」
mt: The grocery stores in every place were looted empty. "
ref: The mini-markets are looted everywhere."

src: 國際紅十字會的印尼負責人 Jan Gelfand 告訴 CNN：「印尼紅十字會正在分秒必爭搜尋倖存者，但我們不知道他們在那裡能找到什麼。
mt: Jan Gelfand, the Indonesian head of the International Red Cross, told CNN: "The Indonesian Red Cross is searching for survivors every second, but we don't know what they can find there.
ref: Jan Gelfand, head of the International Red Cross in Indonesia, told CNN: "The Indonesian Red Cross is racing to help survivors but we don't know what they'll find there.

src: 這已經是一場悲劇，但情況可能會變得更糟。」
mt: It's a tragedy, but it can get worse."
ref: This is already a tragedy, but it could get much worse."

src: 印尼總統佐科威 (Joko Widodo) 在星期天抵達帕盧市，並告訴國軍：「我請你們大家日夜進行搶救，以完成疏散的每個相關任務。
mt: Indonesian President Joko Widodo arrived in Palu on Sunday and told the army: "I invite you all to carry out day and night rescue operations to complete each related task of evacuation.
ref: Indonesia's President Joko Widodo arrived in Palu on Sunday and told the country's military: "I am asking all of you to work day and night to complete every tasks related to the evacuation.

src: 準備好了嗎？」 CNN 報導。
mt: Are you ready?' CNN reported.
ref: Are you ready?" CNN reported.

src: 印尼龍目島 (Lombok) 今年初遭地震襲擊，造成超過 550 人死亡。
mt: Indonesia's Lombok island was hit by an earthquake earlier this year, killing more than 550 people.
ref: Indonesia was hit earlier this year by earthquakes in Lombok in which more than 550 people died.

src: 密克羅尼西亞飛機墜機：飛機墜入潟湖，新幾內亞航空 (Air Niugini) 現在表示有一人失蹤
mt: Micronesia plane crashes: the plane crashes into the lagoon, Air Niugini now says one is missing
ref: Micronesia plane crash: Air Niugini now says one man missing after lagoon plane crash

src: 一架飛機墜入密克羅尼西亞的太平洋潟湖，航空公司稍早說 47 名乘客和機組人員已全部安全地從下沉的飛機撤離，但現在表示有一人失蹤。
mt: A plane crashed into the Pacific Lagoon of Micronesia, and the airline earlier said that all 47 passengers and crew members had safely evacuated from the sinking plane, but now said one person was missing.
ref: The airline operating a flight that crashed into a Pacific lagoon in Micronesia now says one man is missing, after earlier saying all 47 passengers and crew had safely evacuated the sinking plane.

src: 新幾內亞航空在新聞稿中表示，在星期六下午為止，還有一名男乘客尚未找到。
mt: New Guinea Airlines said in a press release that as of Saturday afternoon, there was still one male passenger who had not been found.
ref: Air Niugini said in a release that as of Saturday afternoon, it was unable to account for a male passenger.

src: 航空公司表示，他們正與當地政府、醫院和調查人員合作，嘗試找到該男子。
mt: The airline said they are cooperating with local government, hospitals and investigators to try to find the man.
ref: The airline said it was working with local authorities, hospitals and investigators to try to find the man.

src: 當被要求提供該名乘客的更多資料，例如年齡或國籍時，航空公司未做出立即回應。
mt: When asked to provide more information about the passenger, such as age or nationality, the airline did not respond immediately.
ref: The airline did not immediately respond to requests for more details about the passenger, such as his age or nationality.

src: 飛機在嘗試降落 Chuuk Island 機場時墜入水面後，當地船隻協助拯救旗他乘客和機組人員。
mt: The plane crashed into the water while attempting to land at Chuuk Island Airport, and local ships helped rescue flag passengers and crew members.
ref: Local boats helped rescue the other passengers and crew after the plane hit the water while trying to land at the Chuuk Island airport.

src: 官方在星期五表示，有 7 人被送往醫院救治。
mt: Officials said on Friday that seven people were sent to the hospital for treatment.
ref: Officials said on Friday that seven people had been taken to a hospital.

src: 航空公司星期六說有 6 名乘客繼續待在醫院，他們所有人的狀況穩定。
mt: The airline said on Saturday that six passengers continued to be in the hospital, and all of them were in stable condition.
ref: The airline said six passengers remained at the hospital Saturday, and all of them were in stable condition.

src: 還不清楚造成墜機的原因，以及事件發生的確實先後順序。
mt: The cause of the crash is still unclear, as well as the actual order in which the event occurred.
ref: What caused the crash and the exact sequence of events remains unclear.

src: 航空公司和美國海軍都說飛機降落在跑道附近的潟湖。
mt: Airlines and the US Navy both said that planes landed near a lagoon on the runway.
ref: The airline and the U.S. Navy both said the plane landed in the lagoon short of the runway.

src: 一些目擊者認為飛機衝出跑道。
mt: Some witnesses believe that the plane ran off the runway.
ref: Some witnesses thought the plane overshot the runway.

src: 美國籍乘客 Bill Jaynes 表示飛機進場時很低。
mt: U.S. passenger Bill Jaynes said the plane was entering very low.
ref: American passenger Bill Jaynes said the plane came in very low.

src: Jaynes 說：「這是一件非常好的事。」
mt: Jaynes said, "It's a very good thing."
ref: "That's an extremely good thing," said Jaynes.

src: Jaynes 表示他和其他人涉過及腰的水，成功到達正在下沉的飛機緊急出口。
mt: Jaynes said he and others were wading through the lower back of the water, successfully reaching the emergency exit of the plane that was sinking.
ref: Jaynes said he and others managed to wade through waist-deep water to the emergency exits on the sinking plane.

src: 他說空服員很驚慌並在尖叫，以及他的頭部受到輕傷。
mt: He said that the flight attendant was very panic-stricken and screamed, as well as his head being lightly injured.
ref: He said the flight attendants were panicking and yelling, and that he suffered a minor head injury.

src: 美國海軍表示，在附近進行碼頭改善作業的船員也協助救援，在飛機沉入 30 公尺 (100 呎) 的水前，利用充氣式救生艇來接駁人員上岸。
mt: The U.S. Navy said that crew members conducting dock improvement operations nearby also assisted in the rescue, using inflatable lifeboats to connect personnel ashore before the plane sank 30 meters (100 feet) of water.
ref: The U.S. Navy said sailors working nearby on improving a wharf also helped in the rescue by using an inflatable boat to shuttle people ashore before the plane sank in about 30 meters (100 feet) of water.

src: Aviation Safety Network 的報告資料顯示，巴布亞新幾內亞註冊的航空公司在過去 20 多年內，有 111 人於空難中罹難，但未涉及新幾內亞航空。
mt: According to the Aviation Safety Network, 111 people have died in the crash of an airline registered in Papua New Guinea over the past 20 years, but not in the case of Air New Guinea.
ref: Data from the Aviation Safety Network indicates 111 people have died in crashes of PNG-registered airlines in the past two decades but none involved Air Niugini.

src: 分析師解釋女性被活活燒死當晚的先後順序
mt: Analysts explain the order in which women were burned alive that night.
ref: Analyst lays out timeline of night woman was burned alive

src: 有關再審一名男性於 2014 年將一名密西西比女性活活燒死的案件，檢察官在星期六陳述完畢。
mt: Regarding the retrial of a male case in 2014 that burned a Mississippi woman alive, prosecutors completed their statement on Saturday.
ref: The prosecution rested its case Saturday in the retrial of a man who is accused of burning a Mississippi woman alive in 2014.

src: 美國司法部分析師 Paul Rowlett 做為情報分析的專家證人出庭，作證幾個小時。
mt: Paul Rowlett, a U.S. Department of Justice analyst, appeared in court as an expert witness for intelligence analysis and testified for several hours.
ref: U.S. Department of Justice Analyst Paul Rowlett testified for hours as an expert witness in the field of intelligence analysis.

src: 他向陪審團概述他如何利用手機記錄，拼湊出 29 歲的被告 Quinton Tellis 和 19 歲的受害者 Jessica Chambers 在死者去世當晚時的活動。
mt: He outlined to the jury how he used mobile records to piece together the activities of 29-year-old defendant Quinton Tellis and 19-year-old victim Jessica Chambers on the night of the death.
ref: He outlined for the jury how he used cellphone records to piece together the movements of 29-year-old defendant Quinton Tellis and the 19-year-old victim, Jessica Chambers, on the night she died.

src: Clarion Ledger 報導，Rowlett 說他從多部手機收集位置資料，顯示 Chambers 死亡當晚 Tellis 與她在一起，與他之前的說詞矛盾。
mt: Clarion Ledger reports that Rowlett says he collects location data from multiple phones, showing that Chambers was with Tellis the night of his death, contradicting his earlier statements.
ref: Rowlett said he received location data from several cellphones that showed Tellis was with Chambers the evening of her death, contradicting his previous claims, The Clarion Ledger reported .

src: 在他聲稱他與他的朋友 Michael Sanford 在一起的期間，資料顯示他的手機與 Chambers 的手機在一起，因此警察向 Sanford 問話。
mt: During his claim to be with his friend Michael Sanford, data showed that his phone was with Chambers' phone, so the police asked Sanford.
ref: When data showed his cellphone was with Chambers' during the time he said he was with his friend Michael Sanford, police went to talk to Sanford.

src: 星期六 Sanford 出庭，作證說他當天不在城裡。
mt: On Saturday, Sanford appeared in court, testifying that he was not in the city that day.
ref: Sanford took the stand Saturday and testified that he wasn't in town that day.

src: Tellis 說他那晚在 Sanford 的貨車裡，當檢察官詢問 Sanford 關於 Tellis 是否在講真話，Sanford 說他在「說謊，因為我的貨車在 Nashville。」
mt: Tellis said he was in Sanford's van that night, when the prosecutor asked Sanford if he was telling the truth, Sanford said he was "lying because my van was in Nashville."
ref: When prosecutors asked if Tellis was telling the truth when he said he was in Sanford's truck that night, Sanford said he was "lying, because my truck was in Nashville."

src: 另一項不一致的事情是，Tellis 說他在 Chambers 死前差不多兩個星期才認識她。
mt: Another inconsistent thing is that Tellis said he met Chambers almost two weeks before she died.
ref: Another inconsistency was that Tellis said he had known Chambers for about two weeks when she died.

src: 手機記錄顯示他們只認識了一個星期。
mt: Mobile phone records show they only knew each other for a week.
ref: Cellphone records indicated they'd only known each other for a week.

src: Rowlett 說，在 Chambers 死後，Tellis 刪除了 Chambers 的簡訊、通話和連絡人資訊。
mt: Rowlett said that after Chambers died, Tellis deleted Chambers’ text messages, calls, and contact information.
ref: Rowlett said that sometime after Chambers' death, Tellis deleted Chambers' texts, calls and contact information from his phone.

src: Hale 說：「他從他的生活刪除了她。」
mt: “He deleted her from his life,” Hale said.
ref: "He erased her from his life," Hale said.

src: 被告預定在星期天開始終結辯論。
mt: The defendant is scheduled to start ending the debate on Sunday.
ref: The defense is scheduled to begin its closing arguments Sunday.

src: 法官說他預期審判當天稍後將交給陪審團。
mt: The judge said he expected that the trial would be handed over to the jury later that day.
ref: The judge said he expected the trial to go to the jury later that day.

src: The High Breed：什麼是意識嘻哈？
mt: The High Breed: What is Conscious Hip Hop?
ref: The High Breed: What is conscious hip hop?

src: 嘻哈三人組想要透過在他們的音樂中注入正面訊息，以挑戰風格的負面觀感。
mt: The hip-hop trio wants to inject positive messages into their music, with a challenging style of negative perception.
ref: A hip hop trio wants to challenge the negative view of the genre by filling their music with positive messages.

src: 來自布里斯托 (Bristol) 的 The High Breed，表示嘻哈已不再像原本一樣散發政治訊息及追蹤社會問題。
mt: From Bristol's The High Breed, hip-hop no longer releases political messages and tracks social issues like before.
ref: The High Breed, from Bristol, claim hip hop moved away from its origins of political messages and tackling social issues.

src: 他們想要回到根源並再次讓意識嘻哈受歡迎。
mt: They want to go back to their roots and make consciousness hip hop popular again.
ref: They want to go back to its roots and make conscious hip hop popular again.

src: 藉由像是 Akala 和 Lowkey 的藝人，The Fugees 和 Common 等藝人最近在英國看到了再度流行的趨勢。
mt: With artists like Akala and Lowkey, The Fugees and Common recently saw a trend of re-popping in the UK.
ref: Artists like The Fugees and Common have seen a recent resurgence in the UK through artists such as Akala and Lowkey.

src: 又是黑人？！
mt: Black again?!
ref: Another black person?!

src: 紐約保母控告一對夫婦傳了「種族歧視」的簡訊後解雇她
mt: New York nanny sued a couple for "racially racist" text and fired her.
ref: NY nanny sues couple over firing after "racist" text

src: 紐約保母在收到一位媽媽寄錯對象的簡訊抱怨她「又是黑人」後，控告這一對夫婦歧視性解雇。
mt: After receiving a message from a mother complaining that she was "black" again, the New York nanny sued this couple for discriminatory dismissal.
ref: A New York nanny is suing a couple for discriminatory firing after receiving a misdirected text from the mother complaining that she was "another black person."

src: 這對夫妻否認他們種族歧視，認為這場官司像是「敲詐」。
mt: The couple denied their racial discrimination, believing that this lawsuit was "extortion".
ref: The couple deny they are racist, likening the suit to "extortion."

src: Lynsey Plasco-Flaxman 有 2 個小孩，當她的新保母 Giselle Maurice 在 2016 年第一天來工作時，她對保母是黑人一事表達沮喪。
mt: Lynsey Plasco-Flaxman has two children, and when her new babysitter, Giselle Maurice, came to work on the first day of 2016, she expressed her dismay that the babysitter was black.
ref: Lynsey Plasco-Flaxman, a mother of two, expressed dismay when finding out that the new child care provider, Giselle Maurice, was black upon arriving for her first day of work in 2016.

src: Plasco-Flaxman 太太在傳給她老公的簡訊中寫到：「不，又是黑人。」
mt: In a text message to her husband, Mrs Plasco-Flaxman wrote, "No, it's black again."
ref: "NOOOOOOOOOOO ANOTHER BLACK PERSON," wrote Mrs Plasco-Flaxman to her husband in a text.

src: 然而，她傳給 Maurice 小姐兩次，而不是傳給她的丈夫。
mt: However, she was sent to Miss Maurice twice, rather than to her husband.
ref: However, instead of sending it to her husband, she sent it to Ms. Maurice, twice.

src: 據《紐約郵報》(New York Post) 報導， Plasco-Flaxman 在明白她的失言後解僱了 Maurice 小姐，她聲稱他們外向的非洲裔美國人保母的工作表現很差，她想要換個菲律賓人。
mt: According to a New York Post report, Plasco-Flaxman fired Miss Maurice after realizing her blunders, claiming that their outgoing African-American nanny's performance was poor and she wanted to change for a Filipino.
ref: After realizing her gaffe, an "uncomfortable" Plasco-Flaxman fired Ms. Maurice, stating that their outgoing nanny, who was African-American, had done a bad job and that she was instead expecting a Filipino, according to the New York Post.

src: 她付了 Maurice 小姐第一天的工錢並叫了 Uber 送她回家。
mt: She paid for Miss Maurice's first day's pay and asked Uber to take her home.
ref: Ms. Maurice was paid for her one day of work and then sent home for an Uber.

src: 現在，Maurice 控告該夫婦應就解雇做出賠償，儘管沒有合約，但她本來被請來做 6 個月，因此要求賠 日薪 $350 共 6 個月。
mt: Now, Maurice sued the couple for dismissal and compensation, although she had no contract, but she was originally asked to do it for six months, so she demanded compensation of $350 per day for six months.
ref: Now, Maurice is suing the couple for compensation over the firing, and is seeking compensation to the tune of $350 a day for the six-month, live-in gig she had initially been hired to do, albeit without a contract.

src: 星期五時她告訴郵報：「我想讓他們知道，看吧，你們不能這樣做。」，並補充：「我知道這是歧視。」
mt: On Friday, she told the Post, "I want them to know, see, you can't do that." She added, "I know it's discrimination."
ref: "I want to show them, look, you don't do stuff like that," she told the Post on Friday, adding "I know it's discrimination."

src: 對於種族歧視的指控，該夫婦做出回擊，他們說在冒犯 Maurice 後他們怕無法再相信她，因此中止雇用她很合理。
mt: The couple responded to the allegations of racial discrimination, saying that after offending Maurice, they were afraid they could no longer believe her, so it was reasonable to stop hiring her.
ref: The couple have hit back at the claims that they are racist, saying that terminating Maurice's employment was the reasonable thing to do, fearing they could not trust her after offending her.

src: 「我的妻子傳給 Maurice 的話並不是她的本意。
mt: "It was not her intention that my wife's words be passed on to Maurice.
ref: "My wife had sent her something that she didn't mean to say.

src: 她沒有種族歧視。
mt: She's not racist.
ref: She's not a racist.

src: 我們沒有種族歧視。」，丈夫 Joel Plasco 這樣告訴郵報。
mt: We're not racially racist," said her husband, Joel Plasco, to the Post.
ref: We're not racist people," husband Joel Plasco told the Post.

src: 「但是你想要把你的小孩交給你曾不小心對其無禮的人來照顧嗎？
mt: "But do you want to hand your child over to someone you've accidentally taken care of who you've been impolite to?
ref: "But would you put your children in the hands of someone you've been rude to, even if it was by mistake?

src: 你剛出生的寶寶？
mt: Your newborn baby?
ref: Your newborn baby?

src: 拜託喔。」
mt: Please."
ref: Come on."

src: 他們認為這場官司像是「敲詐」，Plasco 說他的妻子剛生完小孩兩個月，「情況很差」。
mt: They think this lawsuit is like "extortion", Plasco said his wife had just given birth to a child for two months, "the situation is very bad".
ref: Likening the suit to "extortion," Plasco said his wife was just two months off having a baby and was in a "very difficult situation."

src: 這位投資銀行家補充：「你要對付對這樣的人？
mt: The investment banker adds, "Are you dealing with people like that?
ref: "You're going to go after someone like that?

src: 這樣做不好。」
mt: It's not good."
ref: That's not a very nice thing to do," the investment banker added.

src: 這場官司還在進行中，與論已快速在社交媒體上譴責這對夫妻，討伐他們的行為和邏輯。
mt: This lawsuit is still going on, and the discussion has quickly condemned the couple on social media, suppressing their behavior and logic.
ref: While the legal case is still ongoing, the court of public opinion has been quick to denounce the couple on social media, slamming them for their behavior and logic.

src: 新聞透露，派丁頓熊 (Paddington) 出版商怕讀者不接受會說話的熊
mt: News reveals that Paddington publishers fear that readers won't accept talking bears
ref: Paddington publishers feared readers wouldn't relate to a talking bear, new letter reveals

src: Bond 的女兒 Karen Jankel 在書被接受後不久出生，她在信中提到：「在出版前第一次閱讀時，很難產生共鳴。
mt: Bond's daughter, Karen Jankel, was born shortly after the book was accepted, and in the letter she wrote: "It was very difficult to resonate with the first time I read it before publication.
ref: Bond's daughter Karen Jankel, who was born shortly after the book was accepted, said of the letter: "It's hard to put oneself in the shoes of somebody reading it for the first time before it was published.

src: 很高興知道現在我們對於派丁頓熊的成功了解什麼。」
mt: It's great to know what we know now about the success of the Paddington Bear."
ref: It's very amusing knowing now what we know about Paddington's huge success."

src: 她說她的父親以前是 BBC 攝影師，之後從玩具小熊獲得靈感而寫出童書，他應該會對於他的作品被拒絕一事感到樂觀。她還說他在去年過世後，書的出版 60 周年紀念顯得「苦中帶甜」。
mt: She said that her father was a BBC photographer, and that he should be optimistic about the rejection of his work after drawing inspiration from the teddy bear. She also said that after his death last year, the 60th anniversary of the publication of the book was "sweet and bitter."
ref: Saying her father, who had worked as a BBC cameraman before being inspired to write the children's book by a small toy bear, would have been sanguine about his work being rejected, she added the 60th anniversary of the books publication was "bittersweet" after his death last year.

src: 她形容派丁頓熊是「非常重要的家庭成員」，她還補充說到她的父親對他最終成功暗自感到驕傲。
mt: She described the Paddington bear as a "very important family member," and added that her father was secretly proud of his eventual success.
ref: Of Paddington, whom she describes as a "very important member of our family," she added her father was quietly proud of his eventual success.

src: 她說：「他很安靜，不愛炫耀。」
mt: She said, "He's very quiet and doesn't like to show off."
ref: "He was quite a quiet man, and he wasn't a boastful person," she said.

src: 「但是由於派丁頓熊對他來說好像是真的，幾乎就像你有一個小孩達成某件事：雖然不是真的你自己做的，但你引以為傲，」
mt: “But because the Paddington Bear seems real to him, it’s almost as if you have a child who does something: you’re proud to do it yourself, even if it’s not really what you do yourself,” he said.
ref: "But because Paddington was so real to him, it was almost like if you have a child who achieves something: you're proud of them even though it's not your doing really.

src: 我認為他是這樣看待派丁頓熊的成功。
mt: I think that's how he sees Paddington Bear's success.
ref: I think he viewed Paddington's success sort of in that way.

src: 雖然這是他的創作和想像，他總是歸功於派丁頓熊自己。
mt: Although this is his creation and imagination, he always owes it to Paddington Bear himself.
ref: Although it was his creation and his imagination, he always used to give the credit to Paddington himself."

src: 我女兒快死了，而我必須透過電話道別
mt: My daughter's dying and I have to say goodbye over the phone.
ref: My daughter was dying and I had to say goodbye over the phone

src: 降落後，她的女兒被緊急送往尼斯的 Louis Pasteur 2 醫院，醫生搶救她的生命無效。
mt: After landing, her daughter was rushed to the Louis Pasteur 2 hospital in Nice, and the doctor's rescue of her life was ineffective.
ref: On landing her daughter had been rushed to Nice's Hospital Louis Pasteur 2, where doctors worked in vain to save her life.

src: Ednan-Laperouse 太太說：「Nad 準時打電話說情況真的很糟，她可能撐不過去。」
mt: Mrs. Ednan-Laperouse said, “Nad called on time and said it was really bad. She might not be able to make it through.”
ref: "Nad was calling regularly to say it was really bad, that she wasn't expected to make it," said Mrs Ednan-Laperouse.

src: 「然後我接到 Nad 來電，說她再過 2 分鐘就要死了，而我必須跟她道別。
mt: "Then I got a call from Nad saying she'd be dead in two minutes, and I had to say goodbye.
ref: "Then I got the call from Nad to say she was going to die within the next two minutes and I had to say goodbye to her.

src: 我就這麼做。
mt: I'll do that.
ref: And I did.

src: 我說：「Tashi，我很愛你。
mt: I said, "Tashi, I love you very much.
ref: I said, "Tashi, I love you so much, darling.

src: 我很快就到你身邊了。
mt: I'll be right there with you.
ref: I'll be with you soon.

src: 我會來找你。
mt: I'll come find you.
ref: I'll be with you.

src: 醫生給她維持心臟跳動的藥物慢慢地消失並離開她的系統。
mt: The doctor gave her a medicine to keep her heart beating slowly and disappeared from her system.
ref: The drugs doctors had given her to keep her heart pumping were slowly petering out and leaving her system.

src: 她稍早前去世了，就這樣全部關閉了。
mt: She passed away a little earlier, and she closed it all.
ref: She had died some time before hand and this was it all shutting down.

src: 我只能坐在那裡等待，知道全部都攤開來了。
mt: I could only sit there and wait, knowing that everything was unfolding.
ref: I had to just sit there and wait, knowing this was all unfolding.

src: 我身邊有家人和其他人，我無法哀號尖叫或哭泣。
mt: I have family and other people around me, and I can't scream or cry.
ref: I couldn't howl or scream or cry because I was in a situation surrounded by families and people.

src: 我必須撐著。」
mt: I have to hold on."
ref: I had to really hold it together."

src: 最後，沉浸在失去女兒悲痛考驗中的 Ednan-Laperouse 太太與其他不知情的乘客登上了飛機。
mt: Finally, Mrs. Ednan-Laperouse and other unsuspecting passengers boarded the plane, immersed in the pain of losing their daughter.
ref: Eventually Mrs Ednan-Laperouse, by now grieving for the loss of her daughter, boarded the plane alongside the other passengers - oblivious to the ordeal she was going through.

src: 她說：「沒有人知道。」
mt: She said, "No one knows."
ref: "No-one knew," she said.

src: 「我一路低著頭掉眼淚。
mt: "All the way I looked down, I cried.
ref: "I had my head down, and tears were falling the whole time.

src: 很難形容，我在飛機上時對 Nad 感到無比同情。
mt: It's hard to describe how much I sympathized with Nad when I was on the plane.
ref: It's hard to explain, but it was on the flight I felt this overwhelming sense of sympathy for Nad.

src: 他需要我的愛和理解。
mt: He needs my love and understanding.
ref: That he needed my love and understanding.

src: 我知道他有多愛她。」
mt: I know how much he loves her."
ref: I knew how much he loved her."

src: 悲傷女性張貼卡片以防止在橋上自殺
mt: Sad woman posts cards to prevent suicide on the bridge
ref: Grieving women post cards to prevent suicides on bridge

src: 兩名失去自殺摯愛的女性正在努力避免其他人犧牲自己的性命。
mt: Two women who have lost a loved one of their suicides are trying to prevent others from sacrificing their lives.
ref: Two women who lost loved ones to suicide are working to prevent others from taking their own lives.

src: Sharon Davis 和 Kelly Humphrey 在一座威爾斯的橋上張貼帶有鼓勵話語和求援電話號碼的卡片。
mt: Sharon Davis and Kelly Humphrey posted cards with encouraging words and distress numbers on a Welsh bridge.
ref: Sharon Davis and Kelly Humphreys have been posting cards on a Welsh bridge with inspirational messages and phone numbers that people can call for support.

src: Davis 太太的兒子 Tyler 在 13 歲開始飽受憂鬱症困擾，在 18 歲時自殺。
mt: Mrs. Davis's son, Tyler, began suffering from depression at the age of 13 and committed suicide at the age of 18.
ref: Ms Davis' son Tyler was 13 when he began suffering with depression and killed himself aged 18.

src: 她說：「我不要任何作父母的感受我每天在感受的事。」
mt: She said, "I don't want anything to be a parent to feel what I feel every day."
ref: "I don't want any parent to feel the way I have to feel everyday," she said.

src: 45 歲的 Davis 太太住在 Lydney，她說她的兒子是個前途一片光明的廚師，笑容很具感染力。
mt: Mrs. Davis, 45, lives in Lydney. She says her son is a promising chef with a bright smile that's infectious.
ref: Ms Davis, aged 45, who lives in Lydney, said her son was a promising chef with an infectious grin.

src: 「每個人因為他的笑容而知道他。
mt: " ⁇  knows him because of his smile.
ref: "Everyone knew him for his smile.

src: 他們總是說他的笑容照亮了任何房間。」
mt: They always say his smile lights up any room."
ref: They always said his smile lit up any room."

src: 然而他的心靈「處於非常黑暗的地方」，他在去世前放棄了他的工作。
mt: However, his mind was "in a very dark place," and he gave up his job before his death.
ref: However, he gave up work before he died, as he was "in a really dark place."

src: 在 2014 年，Tyler 的弟弟當時 11 歲，他第一個發現 Tyler 自盡。
mt: In 2014, Tyler's brother was then 11 years old, and he first discovered Tyler's death.
ref: In 2014, Tyler's brother, who was 11 at the time, was the one to find his sibling after he had taken his own life.

src: Davis 太太說：「我一直擔心會友連鎖反應。」
mt: Mrs. Davis said, "I've always been worried about the chain reaction of our friends."
ref: Ms Davis said: "I continually worry that there's going to be a knock on effect."

src: Davis 太太做了卡片，「要讓大家知道你可以接近人並跟人談一談，即使是朋友。」
mt: Mrs. Davis made a card: "I want everyone to know that you can get close to people and talk to people, even friends."
ref: Ms Davis created the cards, "to let people know there are people out there that you can go to and you can talk to, even if it's a friend.

src: 「別靜靜地坐著 - 你需要談一談。」
mt: "Don't sit still -- you need to talk."
ref: Don't sit in silence - you need to talk."

src: Humphreys 是 Davies 的多年老友，她 15 年的伴侶 Mark 在母親過世不久後自殺了。
mt: Humphreys is a longtime friend of Davies, whose 15-year-old partner Mark took his own life shortly after her mother's death.
ref: Ms Humphreys, who has been friends with Ms Davies for years, lost Mark, her partner of 15 years, not long after the death of his mother.

src: 她說：「他沒提到他心情低落、憂鬱或任何事。」
mt: She said, "He didn't mention that he was depressed, depressed or anything."
ref: "He didn't say that he was feeling down or depressed or anything," she said.

src: 「耶誕節前幾天，我們注意到他的態度改變。
mt: "A few days before Christmas, we noticed a change in his attitude.
ref: "A couple of days before Christmas we noticed his change in attitude.

src: 他在耶誕節時心情盪到谷底 - 當小孩拆開他們的禮物時，他沒有與他們目光接觸或表達任何事。」
mt: His mood swings to the bottom at Christmas - when children open up their gifts, he doesn't make eye contact with them or express anything."
ref: He was at rock bottom on Christmas Day - when the kids opened their presents he didn't make eye contact with them or anything."

src: 她說她的去世對他們來說是很大的創傷，但他們必須努力度過：「這在家庭中鑿了個洞。
mt: She said her death was a great trauma to them, but they had to work through it: "This drilled a hole in the family.
ref: She said his death was a huge trauma to them, but they have to work through it: "It rips a hole through the family.

src: 拆散我們。
mt: Disassembling us.
ref: It tears us apart.

src: 但我們都必須向前奮鬥。」
mt: But we all have to struggle forward."
ref: But we've all got to carry on and fight."

src: 如果你正在掙扎，你可以打免付費電話 116 123 (英國和愛爾蘭) 給「撒瑪利亞會」(Samaritans)、傳送電子郵件到 jo@samaritans.org，或是在此瀏覽「撒瑪利亞會」網站。
mt: If you’re struggling, you can call Samaritans toll-free at 116 123 (UK and Ireland), email jo@samaritans.org, or visit the Samariat website here.
ref: If you are struggling to cope, you can call Samaritans free on 116 123 (UK and Ireland), email jo@samaritans.org, or visit the Samaritans website here.

src: FBI 開始調查，卡瓦諾 (Brett Kavanaugh) 的未來懸置未決
mt: The FBI is investigating an undecided future for Brett Kavanaugh.
ref: Brett Kavanaugh's future hangs in the balance as FBI begins investigation

src: 費拉克 Flake) 先生在星期六表示：「我認為，如果我們真的能取得他要求的東西 - 時間和範圍有限的調查 - 我們可能會帶來一些團結。」，他還提到他擔心委員會因根深柢固的黨派僵局而「解體」。
mt: Mr. Flake said on Saturday, “I think if we can really get what he asked for - limited time and scope of investigation - we might bring some unity,” he also mentioned, he was worried that the committee would “disintegrate” due to the deep-rooted partisan stalemate.
ref: "I thought, if we could actually get something like what he was asking for - an investigation limited in time, limited in scope - we could maybe bring a little unity," said Mr Flake on Saturday, adding that he feared the committee was "falling apart" amid entrenched partisan gridlock.

src: 為什麼卡瓦諾先生和他的共和黨支持者不要 FBI 調查？
mt: Why would Mr. Cavanaugh and his Republican supporters not want the FBI to investigate?
ref: Why didn't Mr Kavanaugh and his Republican supporters want the FBI to investigate?

src: 他們的不情願都是由於時間點。
mt: Their unwillingness is all due to time.
ref: Their reluctance is all due to timing.

src: 還有 5 個星期就是中期選舉了，就在 11 月 6 日 - 若共和黨人如預期地表現很差，那他們將很難嘗試把他們想選的人送進國家最高法院。
mt: Five more weeks is midterm elections, on November 6th -- and if Republicans do poorly as expected, they'll have a hard time trying to get the people they want to run to the National Supreme Court.
ref: The midterm elections are only five weeks away, on November 6 - if, as expected, the Republicans do badly, then they will be severely weakened in their attempts to get the man they want elected to the highest court in the land.

src: 小布希 (George W. Bush) 一直在打電話給參議員，遊說他們支持卡瓦諾先生，卡瓦諾以前在白宮為小布希工作，並藉此認識了小布希的私人秘書並娶她為妻。
mt: George W. Bush has been calling senators to persuade them that they support Mr. Cavanaugh, who previously worked for him at the White House and used this to get to know his private secretary and marry him.
ref: George W. Bush has been picking up the phone to call Senators, lobbying them to support Mr Kavanaugh, who worked in the White House for Mr Bush and through him met his wife Ashley, who was Mr Bush's personal secretary.

src: FBI 出了報告後會發生什麼事？
mt: What happens when the FBI reports?
ref: What happens after the FBI produces its report?

src: 參議院會舉行投票，共和黨在參議院佔 51 個席次，而民主黨佔 49 個席次。
mt: The Senate will hold a vote, with Republicans holding 51 seats in the Senate and Democrats holding 49.
ref: There will be a vote in the Senate, where 51 Republicans and 49 Democrats currently sit.

src: 仍不清楚卡瓦諾先生是否能夠在參議院獲得至少 50 張選票，以便讓副總統彭斯 (Mike Pence) 打破僵局並確認他能進入最高法院。
mt: It is still unclear whether Mr. Cavanaugh will be able to secure at least 50 votes in the Senate, so that Vice President Mike Pence can break the deadlock and confirm he can enter the Supreme Court.
ref: It's still not clear whether Mr Kavanaugh can get to at least 50 votes on the Senate floor, which would allow Mike Pence, the vice president, to break a tie and confirm him to the Supreme Court.

src: 在北韓金正恩政權下的脫北者人數下降
mt: The number of defectors in North Korea under Kim Jong-un's regime has declined.
ref: North Korea defector numbers 'drop' under Kim

src: 一名南韓國會議員表示，自從金正恩 7 年前開始掌權後，向南韓投誠的北韓脫北者人數已下降。
mt: A South Korean congressman said that since Kim Jong-un took power seven years ago, the number of North Korean defectors who defected to South Korea has declined.
ref: The number of North Korean defectors to South Korea has fallen since Kim Jong-un came to power seven years ago, a South Korean lawmaker has said.

src: 朴炳錫引述統一部的數據指出，2011 年有 2,706 名，去年則有 1,127 名。
mt: Park Ping-hsi quotes the Ministry of Unification's data as saying that in 2011 there were 2,706, and last year there were 1,127.
ref: Park Byeong-seug, citing data from the South's unification ministry, said there had been 1,127 defections last year - compared with 2,706 in 2011.

src: 朴議員指出，北韓和中國收緊邊境控管以及人口走私販的收費上升是關鍵因素。
mt: Legislator Park pointed out that North Korea and China tightened border control and the rising charges of human trafficking traffickers were key factors.
ref: Mr Park said tighter border controls between North Korea and China and higher rates charged by people smugglers were key factors.

src: 平壤未發表公開意見。
mt: Pyongyang has not issued a public opinion.
ref: Pyongyang has made no public comments.

src: 絕大部分的北韓脫北者最終都取得南韓國籍。
mt: Most North Korean defectors eventually obtained South Korean nationality.
ref: The vast majority of defectors from the North are eventually offered South Korean citizenship.

src: 首爾表示，1953 年韓戰結束以來，已有超過 30,000 名北韓人非法越過北韓邊界。
mt: Seoul said more than 30,000 North Koreans have illegally crossed the North Korean border since the end of the Korean War in 1953.
ref: Seoul says more than 30,000 North Koreans have illegally crossed the border since the end of the Korean War in 1953.

src: 由於兩韓之間的非軍事區 (DMZ) 受到嚴密保護，因此大多數北韓人會選擇較易跨越的中國邊境。中國邊境是北韓最長的邊境。
mt: Due to the tight protection of the demilitarized zone (DMZ) between the two Koreas, most North Koreans choose the easier-to-cross Chinese border. The Chinese border is the longest in North Korea.
ref: Most flee via China, which has the longest border with North Korea and is easier to cross than the heavily protected Demilitarised Zone (DMZ) between the two Koreas.

src: 中國將這些叛逃者視為非法移民而非難民，經常強制遣返他們。
mt: China views these defectors as illegal immigrants rather than refugees, often forcing them back.
ref: China regards the defectors as illegal migrants rather than refugees and often forcibly repatriates them.

src: 在近幾個月內，技術上仍處對戰狀態的南北韓之間的關係已大有改善。
mt: Over the past few months, relations between North and South Korea, which are still technically at war status, have greatly improved.
ref: Relations between the North and the South - who are still technically at war - have markedly improved in recent months.

src: 這個月初，兩國領導人在平壤會面，主要討論延宕多時的非核化談判。
mt: At the beginning of this month, leaders from both countries met in Pyongyang, mainly discussing long-term denuclearization negotiations.
ref: Earlier this month, the leaders of the two countries met in Pyongyang for talks that centered on the stalled denuclearization negotiations.

src: 在進行這次會面前，金正恩與美國總統川普於新加坡進行歷史性的會面，他們大抵同意會力促朝鮮半島無核化。
mt: Before this meeting, Kim Jong-un and US President Trump had a historic meeting in Singapore; they generally agreed to urge the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.
ref: This came after June's historic meeting between US President Donald Trump and Kim Jong-un in Singapore, when they agreed in broad terms to work towards the nuclear-free Korean peninsula.

src: 但是在星期六，北韓外交部長李容浩譴責美國制裁在之後鮮少進展。
mt: However, on Saturday, North Korean Foreign Minister Lee Jung-ho condemned the US sanctions for making little progress afterwards.
ref: But on Saturday, North Korean Foreign Minister Ri Yong-ho blamed US sanctions for the lack of progress since then.

src: 李容浩在紐約的聯合國大會發表演說時，表示「對美國沒有任何信任，對我們的國家安全就不會有信心，在此情況下，我們絕不會單方面先行解除武裝。」
mt: In a speech at the United Nations General Assembly in New York, Lee said, "We have no trust in the United States and will not have confidence in our national security. In this case, we will never unilaterally disarm ourselves."
ref: "Without any trust in the US, there will be no confidence in our national security and under such circumstances, there is no way we will unilaterally disarm ourselves first," Mr Ri said in a speech to the UN General Assembly in New York.

src: 裴洛西 (Nancy Pelosi) 稱卡瓦諾 (Brett Kavanaugh)「太激動」，不適合出任最高法院的職務
mt: Nancy Pelosi called Brett Kavanaugh "too excited" to be unfit for a Supreme Court position
ref: Nancy Pelosi calls Brett Kavanaugh "hysterical," says he is unfit to serve on the Supreme Court

src: 美國聯邦眾議院議長裴洛西稱最高法院大法官提名人卡瓦諾「太激動」，他在性格上不適合出任最高法院的職務。
mt: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Pelosi said the nominee for Supreme Court Justice Cavanaugh was "too excited", and he was not suitable for the position of Supreme Court in terms of character.
ref: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi called Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh "hysterical" and said that he was temperamentally unfit to serve on the Supreme Court.

src: 星期六在德州奧斯丁所舉辦的德州論壇節 (Texas Tribune Festival)上，裴洛西在一場面談時發表此言論。
mt: On Saturday at the Texas Tribune Festival in Austin, Texas, Pelosi made this speech during an interview.
ref: Pelosi made the comments in an interview Saturday at the Texas Tribune Festival in Austin, Texas.

src: 裴洛西對於星期四卡瓦諾在參議員司法委員會上的作供，她說「我忍不住想，若是一位女性表現那樣子，他們會說她”太激動了”。」
mt: Pelosi said on Thursday, "I can't help but think that if a woman behaves like that, they'll say she's too excited."
ref: "I couldn't help but think that if a woman had ever performed that way, they would say 'hysterical,'" Pelosi said about her reaction to Kavanaugh's testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee on Thursday.

src: 卡瓦諾情緒化地否認了他曾在兩人少年時代性侵過福特 (Christine Blasey Ford) 博士。
mt: Cavanaugh emotionally denied that he had sexually assaulted Dr. Christine Blasey Ford during their teenage years.
ref: Kavanaugh emotionally denied allegations that he had sexually assaulted Dr. Christine Blasey Ford when they were both teenagers.

src: 在卡瓦諾的開場陳述中，他很情緒化，在談論他的家庭和中學時光期間，有時幾乎喊叫及語塞。
mt: In his opening statement, he was very emotional, and during conversations about his family and high school days, he would sometimes almost shout out and say stuff.
ref: During his opening statement, Kavanaugh was very emotional, at times nearly shouting and choking up while discussing his family and his high school years.

src: 他也在委員會上明確地譴責民主黨，將針對他的指控稱為「荒謬且有計謀的個性暗殺行動」，源於部分人對希拉蕊 (Hillary Clinton) 在 2016 年的總統大選中敗陣感到憤怒。
mt: He also explicitly condemned the Democratic Party on the committee, calling his accusations "absurd and cunning individual assassination", due to some people's anger over Hillary Clinton's defeat in the 2016 presidential election.
ref: He also explicitly condemned Democrats on the committee, calling the allegations against him a "grotesque and coordinated character assassination" organized by liberals angry that Hillary Clinton lost the 2016 presidential election.

src: 裴洛西表示，她相信卡瓦諾的供詞證明了他不能擔任最高法院的職位，因為他對民主黨有偏見。
mt: Pelosi stated that she believed the testimony of Cavanaugh proved he could not hold a position in the Supreme Court, because he was biased against the Democratic Party.
ref: Pelosi said that she believed Kavanaugh's testimony proved that he could not serve on the Supreme Court, because it showed that he is biased against Democrats.

src: 她說：「我認為他針對希拉蕊和民主黨所做出的這些說法和行徑，讓他自己失去了資格。」
mt: She said, "I think that the statements and actions he made about Hillary and the Democratic Party disqualify him himself."
ref: "I think that he disqualifies himself with those statements and the manner in which he went after the Clintons and the Democrats," she said.

src: 當裴洛西被問到若卡瓦諾確認出任且民主黨取得眾議院的大部分席次，她是否會嘗試彈劾他時，她則沒有正面回應。
mt: When Pelosi was asked if she would try to impeach him if the Democratic Party had secured a majority of seats in the House of Representatives, she did not respond positively.
ref: Pelosi demurred when asked if she would try to impeach Kavanaugh if he is confirmed, and if Democrats gain the majority in the House of Representatives.

src: 裴洛西表示：「我會說，如果他沒有對國會或 FBI 講實話，那他不僅不適合站上最高法院，也不適合站在他目前所在的法院中。」
mt: Pelosi said, "I would say that if he hadn't told the truth to Congress or the FBI, he wouldn't have been fit to stand in the Supreme Court and his current court."
ref: "I will say this -- if he is not telling the truth to Congress or to the FBI, then he's not fit not only to be on the Supreme Court, but to be on the court he's on right now," Pelosi said.

src: 卡瓦諾目前是 D.C.聯邦上訴法院的法官。
mt: Cavanaugh is currently a judge of the D.C. Court of Appeals.
ref: Kavanaugh is currently a judge on the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals.

src: 身為共和黨人的裴洛西還表示，她擔心卡瓦諾可能會判決平價醫療法案或羅伊訴韋德案無效，因為他被認為是保守派法官。
mt: As a Republican, Pelosi also expressed concern that Cavanaugh might invalidate the Affordable Care Act or Roy v. Wade case because he was considered a conservative judge.
ref: Pelosi added that as a Democrat she was concerned about potential Kavanaugh rulings against the Affordable Care Act or Roe v. Wade, as he is considered to be a conservative justice.

src: 在卡瓦諾的確認聽證會中，他迴避了是否會推翻最高法院特定決定的問題。
mt: At the confirmation hearing of Cavanaugh, he avoided the question of whether he would overturn the Supreme Court's specific decision.
ref: In his confirmation hearings, Kavanaugh sidestepped questions on whether he would overturn certain Supreme Court decisions.

src: 裴洛西說：「不應讓激動又有偏見的人進入法院，然後又期待我們說”這不是很棒嗎”。」
mt: Pelosi said, "Don't let the excited and prejudiced people enter the courthouse, and then expect us to say, "Isn't that great?"
ref: "It's not time for a hysterical, biased person to go to the court and expect us to say, 'isn't that wonderful,'" Pelosi said.

src: 女人需要施加影響。
mt: Women need to exert influence.
ref: And Women Need to Wield It.

src: 這是正義的毀謗，經年累月的憤怒爆發出來，她沒有辦法吐苦水時不哭泣。
mt: This is a slander of justice, after years of anger burst out, she can't spit when not to cry.
ref: It is a righteous diatribe, months and years of fury spilling over, and she can't get it out without weeping.

src: 45 年後，施若德告訴我：「我們生氣時會哭。」
mt: Forty-five years later, Schroeder told me, "We cry when we're angry."
ref: "We cry when we get angry," Ms. Steinem said to me 45 years later.

src: 「我不覺得這不正常，你會覺得嗎？」
mt: "I don't think that's normal, do you think?"
ref: "I don't think that's uncommon, do you?"

src: 她繼續說：「有個主管級的女人幫了我很多，她說她生氣時也會哭，但她培養了一種習慣，就是她生氣然後開始哭時，她會告訴本來在跟她講話的人：”你可會以為我哭是因為我難過。
mt: She continued: "A woman in charge helped me a lot, she said she would cry when she was angry, but she cultivated a habit that when she got angry and started crying, she would tell the people who were talking to her:" You would cry for me because I'm sad.
ref: She continued, "I was greatly helped by a woman who was an executive someplace, who said she also cried when she got angry, but developed a technique which meant that when she got angry and started to cry, she'd say to the person she was talking to, "You may think I am sad because I am crying.

src: 我在生氣。」
mt: I'm angry."
ref: I am angry."

src: 然後她就繼續講。
mt: And then she went on.
ref: And then she just kept going.

src: 我覺得這很棒。」
mt: I think it's great."
ref: And I thought that was brilliant."

src: 眼淚在某種程度上被允許作為憤怒的發洩出口，因為它們在根本上被誤解。
mt: Tears are to some extent allowed as an outlet for anger, because they are fundamentally misunderstood.
ref: Tears are permitted as an outlet for wrath in part because they are fundamentally misunderstood.

src: 我對一開始工作最深刻的印象之一就是，在男性主掌的辦公室中，我因為無法表達憤怒而哭泣，我被一個較年長冷酷的女經理抓到樓梯間，每次我都有點怕她。
mt: One of the things I was most impressed with at first was that in the office where the man was in charge, I cried because I couldn't express my anger, and I was caught by an older, colder woman manager in the stairwell, every time I was a bit afraid of her.
ref: One of my sharpest memories from an early job, in a male-dominated office, where I once found myself weeping with inexpressible rage, was my being grabbed by the scruff of my neck by an older woman - a chilly manager of whom I'd always been slightly terrified - who dragged me into a stairwell.

src: 她告訴我：「不要讓他們看到妳在哭。」
mt: She told me, "Don't let them see you crying."
ref: "Never let them see you crying," she told me.

src: 「他們不知道妳很兇。
mt: "They didn't know you were mean.
ref: "They don't know you're furious.

src: 「他們認為妳很難過，並且會因擊垮妳了而感到開心。」
mt: “They think you’re sad and they’ll be happy to take you down.”
ref: They think you're sad and will be pleased because they got to you."

src: 施若德 (Patricia Schroeder) 之後成為克羅拉多的民主派眾議員，她在哈特 (Gary Hart) 參選總統時與他一起工作。
mt: After Patricia Schroeder, she became a Democratic congressman from Colorado, working with him during Gary Hart's presidential election.
ref: Patricia Schroeder, then a Democratic congresswoman from Colorado, had worked with Gary Hart on his presidential runs.

src: 在 1987 年，哈特因在「Monkey Business」號的遊艇上所發生的婚外情而退出大選，施若德當時很受挫，想要看看有什麼理由不自己出來參選。
mt: In 1987, Hart dropped out of the general election due to an affair on a yacht on Monkey Business, and Schrader was frustrated at the time, wanting to see if there's any reason not to run for office himself.
ref: In 1987, when Mr. Hart was caught in an extramarital affair aboard a boat called Monkey Business and bowed out of the race, Ms. Schroeder, deeply frustrated, figured there was no reason she shouldn't explore the idea of running for president herself.

src: 30 年後她對我大笑，說著：「那不是一個經過深思熟慮的決定。」
mt: Thirty years later, she laughed at me and said, "That's not a deliberate decision."
ref: "It was not a well-thought-out decision," she said to me with a laugh 30 years later.

src: 「已經有其他 7 名候選人參選，他們最不需要的就是再多一個人。
mt: "There are already seven other candidates running, and the last thing they need is one more person.
ref: "There were already seven other candidates in the race, and the last thing they needed was another one.

src: 有人稱之為 ”白雪公主與七個小矮人”」。
mt: It's called Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.
ref: Somebody called it "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.""

src: 由於已經是選戰後期，因此她來不及籌措資金，所以她發誓，若沒有籌到 $2 百萬，她就不會參選。
mt: Because she was already in the post-election stage, she had no time to raise funds, so she swore that if she didn't raise $2 million, she wouldn't run for election.
ref: Because it was late in the campaign, she was behind on fund-raising, and so she vowed that she wouldn't enter the race unless she raised $2 million.

src: 她打了敗仗。
mt: She lost the war.
ref: It was a losing battle.

src: 她發現一些她的支持者會給男性 $1,000，但只給她 $250。
mt: She found that some of her supporters would give men $1,000, but only gave her $250.
ref: She discovered that some of her supporters who gave $1,000 to men would give her only $250.

src: 她懷疑，「他們認為我有折扣嗎？」
mt: She wonders, "Do they think I have a discount?"
ref: "Do they think I get a discount?" she wondered.

src: 當她宣布不會發起正式活動時，她激動得難以自持 - 對她支持者的感激、對難以籌款及必須面對代表而不是選民的系統運作感到挫折，以及對性別主義的憤怒。
mt: When she announced that she would not launch a formal campaign, she was so excited that she found herself unable to support herself - grateful to her supporters, frustrated by the difficulty of fundraising and the need to face the operation of a system that represented instead of a voter, and angry at sexism.
ref: When she made her speech announcing that she would not launch a formal campaign, she was so overcome by emotions - gratitude for the people who'd supported her, frustration with the system that made it so difficult to raise money and to target voters rather than delegates, and anger at the sexism - that she got choked up.

src: 施若德回憶起新聞媒體對她的反應：「你可能會以為我嚴重地崩潰了。」
mt: She recalls how the news media reacted to her: "You might think I'm going to crash badly."
ref: "You would have thought I'd had a nervous breakdown," recalled Ms. Schroeder about how the press reacted to her.

src: 「你以為舒潔 (KLEENEX) 是我的企業贊助商。
mt: "You think KLEENX is my corporate sponsor.
ref: "You'd have thought Kleenex was my corporate sponsor.

src: 「我記得我在想，他們會在我的墓誌銘上寫什麼？
mt: "I remember thinking, what would they write on my tombstone?
ref: I remember thinking, what are they going to put on my tombstone?

mt: "She's crying?"
ref: "She cried"?""

src: 中美貿易戰如何有利於北京
mt: How the Sino-US Trade War Can Benefit Beijing
ref: How the US-China trade war may be good for Beijing

src: 專家指出，中美之間的貿易戰開場序章震耳欲聾，此戰還沒結束，兩國之間的裂痕長遠來講可能有利於北京。
mt: Experts point out that the opening chapter of the trade war between China and the US is deafening, this war has not yet ended, and the rift between the two countries may be beneficial to Beijing in the long run.
ref: The opening salvos of the trade war between the US and China were deafening, and while the battle is far from over, a rift between the countries may be beneficial to Beijing in the long term, experts say.

src: 美國總統川普今年初率先發出警告，會對主要的中國出口商品課稅，包括太陽能面板和鋼鋁。
mt: U.S. President Donald Trump was the first to warn early this year that he would charge taxes on major Chinese exports, including solar panels and steel and aluminum.
ref: Donald Trump, the US President, fired the first warning earlier this year by taxing key Chinese exports including solar panels, steel and aluminum.

src: 本星期有著最顯著的升級，新關稅影響價值 $2000 億美元 (£1500 億英鎊) 的商品，中國輸入美國的商品實際上有一半會被課稅。
mt: This week is the most significant upgrade, with new tariffs impacting $200 billion (£150 billion) of goods, and half of the goods imported into the US will actually be taxed.
ref: The most significant escalation rolled in this week with new tariffs affecting $200 billion (£150 billion) worth of items, effectively taxing half of all goods coming into the US from China.

src: 北京亦隨即實施對價值 $600 億美元的美國商品課徵 5% 至 10% 的關稅。
mt: Beijing has also imposed tariffs of 5 to 10 percent on US $60 billion worth of goods.
ref: Beijing has retaliated each time in kind, most recently slapping tariffs of five to ten per cent on $60 billion of American goods.

src: 中國發誓要對美國以牙還牙，這個世界第二大經濟體不太會在近期內退縮。
mt: China has vowed to retaliate against the United States, and the world's second-largest economy will not likely retreat in the near future.
ref: China has pledged to match the US shot-for-shot, and the world's second largest economy is unlikely to blink anytime soon.

src: 讓華盛頓打退當鼓意味著對需求讓步，然而公開向美國鞠躬的話，對中國國家主席習近平來說就太尷尬了。
mt: Making Washington take a step back means giving in to demand, but publicly bowing to the United States is too embarrassing for Chinese President Xi Jinping.
ref: Getting Washington to back down means caving into demands, but publicly bowing to the US would be far too embarrassing for Xi Jinping, China's president.

src: 專家表示，若中國能好好出牌，長遠來講，兩個經濟體之間的依賴下降，美國貿易戰可能對中國起正面支持作用。
mt: Experts say that if China can make a good start, in the long run, the decline in dependence between the two economies may have had a positive impact on China's trade war.
ref: Still, experts say if Beijing can play its cards right, US trade war pressures could positively support China over the long term by lowering the inter-dependence of the two economies.

src: 在新美國安全中心專門研究亞洲的助理研究員 Abigail Grace 表示：「華盛頓或北京所做的快速政治決策，可能會在雙方國家產生開始造成經濟混亂的情況，這比旁觀者之前認為的還要危險」。新美國安全中心是美國智庫。
mt: Abigail Grace, an assistant researcher at the New American Security Center who specializes in Asia, said, “The rapid political decisions made in Washington or Beijing could lead to economic chaos in both countries, which is more dangerous than the bystanders had previously thought.” The New American Security Center is an American think tank.
ref: "The fact that a quick political decision in either Washington or Beijing could create the conditions that start an economic tailspin in either country is actually a lot more dangerous than onlookers have acknowledged before," said Abigail Grace, a research associate who focuses on Asia at the Center for New American Security, a think tank.

src: 外交部長表示，敘利亞準備好讓難民返回
mt: The foreign minister said Syria is ready to return refugees.
ref: Syria 'ready' for refugees to return, says Foreign Minister

src: 敘利亞表示已準備好讓難民自願返家，並尋求協助重建被超過 7 年的戰爭所摧殘的家園。
mt: Syria said it was ready to allow refugees to return voluntarily and seek help in rebuilding homes devastated by more than seven years of war.
ref: Syria says it's ready for the voluntary return of refugees and is appealing for help to rebuild the country devastated by a more than seven-year long war.

src: 外交部長 Walid al-Moualem 在聯合國大會上發表演說，表示該國的狀況正在改善。
mt: Foreign Minister Walid al-Moualem delivered a speech at the United Nations General Assembly, stating that the situation in the country is improving.
ref: Speaking to the United Nations General Assembly, Foreign minister Walid al-Moualem said conditions in the country are improving.

src: 他說：「多虧在打擊恐怖主義方面取得進展，目前地面的情況比較穩定安全了。」
mt: He said, "Thanks to the progress made in countering terrorism, the current situation on the ground is more stable and secure."
ref: "Today the situation on the ground is more stable and secure thanks to progress made in combating terrorism," he said.

src: 政府繼續修復被恐怖份子摧毀的區域，以恢復正常狀態。
mt: The government continues to repair areas destroyed by terrorists, in order to restore normal conditions.
ref: The government continues to rehabilitate the areas destroyed by terrorists to restore normalcy.

src: 難民離鄉背井的原因是恐怖主義和單方的經濟手段手段目標他們的日常生活和生計，目前所有條件已準備好讓難民自願返回家園。
mt: Refugees leaving their homes are driven by terrorism and unilateral economic means, targeting their daily lives and livelihoods; all conditions are now ready to allow refugees to voluntarily return home.
ref: All conditions are now present for the voluntary return of refugees to the country they had to leave because of terrorism and the unilateral economic measures that targeted their daily lives and their livelihoods.

src: 聯合國估計，自從 2011 年爆發戰爭後，有超過 550 萬名敘利亞公民逃離該國。
mt: The UN estimates that more than 5.5 million Syrian citizens have fled the country since the war broke out in 2011.
ref: The UN estimates that more than 5.5 million Syrians have fled the country since the war began in 2011.

src: 還有 6 百萬人仍然居住在該國，極需人道救援。
mt: In addition, 6 million people still live in the country and desperately need humanitarian aid.
ref: Another six million people still living in the country are in need of humanitarian assistance.

src: Al-Moualem 表示，敘利亞政權歡迎各方協助重建被毀的國家。
mt: Al-Moualem says the Syrian regime welcomes all parties to help rebuild the destroyed country.
ref: Al-Moualem said the Syrian regime would welcome help in rebuilding the devastated country.

src: 不過他強調，他們不接受有條件的援助，也不會從資助叛亂的國家所提供的協助。
mt: However, he emphasized that they do not accept conditional assistance and will not provide assistance from countries that support the rebellion.
ref: But he stressed that it would not accept conditional assistance or help from countries that sponsored the insurgency.

src: 歐洲隊在巴黎萊德盃取得勝利
mt: European team won the Paris Ryder Cup
ref: Europe clinches Ryder Cup victory in Paris

src: 歐洲隊在法國巴黎外的 Le Golf National 球場最終以 16.5 比 10.5 打敗美國隊，贏得 2018 年萊德盃。
mt: The European team defeated the US team 16.5-10.5 at Le Golf National Stadium outside Paris, France, to win the 2018 Ryder Cup.
ref: Team Europe has won the 2018 Ryder Cup defeating Team USA by a final score of 16.5 to 10.5 at Le Golf National outside Paris, France.

src: 美國隊已經連 6 次在歐洲的土地上吃敗仗，從 1993 年起從未在歐洲贏過萊德盃。
mt: The U.S. team has lost six consecutive matches on European soil, and since 1993 has never won the Leder Cup in Europe.
ref: The US has now lost six consecutive times on European soil and has not won a Ryder Cup in Europe since 1993.

src: 丹麥籍隊長比昂 (Thomas Bjorn) 的團隊達到打敗美國隊所需的 14.5 分，讓歐洲隊重獲王位。
mt: The team led by Danish captain Thomas Bjorn scored 14.5 points to defeat the US team, allowing the European team to regain the throne.
ref: Europe regained the crown as the Danish captain Thomas Bjorn's team reached the 14.5 points they required to beat the United States.

src: 在標準桿 3 桿的第 16 洞，美國王牌米克森 (Phil Mickelson) 將球開到水裡，將他的比賽拱手讓給莫里納瑞 (Francesco Molinari)。
mt: On the 16th hole of the standard three-pole, American ace Phil Mickelson drove the ball into the water, handing over his match to Francesco Molinari.
ref: US star Phil Mickelson, who struggled most of the tournament, plunked his tee-shot into the water at the par-3 16th hole, conceding his match to Francesco Molinari.

src: 義大利球員莫里納瑞所有回合都表現出色，他成為從 1979 年以目前的形式比循環賽後，唯 4 獲得 5 勝 0 敗 0 和的球員之一。
mt: Italian player Molineari performed outstandingly in all rounds, becoming one of the only four players to win 5 games and lose 0 draws since their current format in 1979.
ref: The Italian golfer Molinari shined in all of his rounds, becoming 1-of-4 players to ever go 5-0-0 since the tournament's current format begun in 1979.

src: 歐洲隊排名最低的歐列森(Thorbjorn Olesen) 以贏 5 洞剩 4 洞擊敗美國隊的史畢斯 (Jordan Spieth)。
mt: Europe's lowest ranked player Thorbjorn Olesen beat the US team's Jordan Spieth with 4 of 5 holes left.
ref: American Jordan Spieth was blown out 5&4 by the lowest-ranked player on the European team, Thorbjorn Olesen of Denmark.

src: 英格蘭的波特 (Ian Poulter) 以贏 2 洞剩 1 洞擊敗世界球王強森(Dustin Johnson)，本屆可能是他最後一次參加萊德盃。
mt: England's Ian Poulter won 2 holes and beat world champion Dustin Johnson, this may be his last appearance in the Leeder Cup.
ref: The world's top-ranked player, Dustin Johnson, fell 2 and 1 to Ian Poulter of England who may have played in his final Ryder Cup.

src: 已參加過 8 屆萊德盃的西班牙老將賈西亞 (Sergio Garcia) 生涯累積分數達到 25.5 分，成為巡迴賽的歐洲積分王。
mt: Spanish veteran Sergio Garcia, who has participated in the 8-time Ledder Cup, scored a career-high 25.5 points to become the European Tour leader.
ref: A veteran of eight Ryder Cups, Spaniard Sergio Garcia became the tournaments all-time winningest European with 25.5 career point.

src: 「男兒有淚不輕彈，但我控制不了。
mt: "Men don't play lightly with tears, but I can't control them.
ref: "I don't usually cry but today I can't help it.

src: 今年很辛苦。
mt: It's been tough this year.
ref: It's been a rough year.

src: 非常謝謝比昂獨具慧眼相信我。
mt: Thank you very much, Beyoncé for believing in me with her own clever eyes.
ref: So thankful for Thomas to pick me and believe in me.

src: 我好開心好開心能夠奪回獎盃。
mt: I'm so happy and happy to be able to take back the trophy.
ref: I am so happy, so happy to get the cup back.

src: 是整個團隊的功勞，我很高興我能夠盡一己之力。」在歐洲隊贏得勝利後，賈西亞如此表示。
mt: It's the credit of the whole team, and I'm glad I'm able to do my best, "says Jasiya after the European team won the victory.
ref: It's about the team., and I'm happy I was able to help," said an emotional Garcia following the European victory.

src: 他交棒給同鄉拉姆 (Jon Rahm)，拉姆在星期天的個人賽以贏 2 洞剩 1 洞擊敗美國高爾夫傳奇老虎伍茲。
mt: He handed the bat to his fellow countryman Jon Rahm, who won two holes in a Sunday individual game to defeat American golf legend Tiger Woods with one hole left.
ref: He passes the torch to his fellow countryman John Ram who took down US golf legend Tiger Woods 2&1 in singles play on Sunday.

src: 23 歲的拉姆表示：「我感到無比光榮能夠打敗老虎伍茲，我從小就看他打球。」
mt: "I feel so proud to beat Tiger Woods," says 23-year-old Ram. "I've seen him play ball since I was a kid."
ref: "The incredible pride I feel, to beat Tiger Woods, I grew up watching that guy," said 23-year-old Rahm.

src: 伍茲在法國的 4 戰皆輸，現在萊德盃戰績 13 勝 21 敗 3 和。
mt: Woods lost all four matches in France, and now has a record of 13 wins, 21 losses, and 3 draws in the Leder Cup.
ref: Woods lost all four of his matches in France and now has a record of 13-21-3 career Ryder Cup record.

src: 這對於最佳球員之一的他來說是一項很奇怪的數據，他贏過 14 次大賽，僅次於尼克勞斯 (Jack Nicklaus)。
mt: This was a strange data for one of the best players, who won 14 major tournaments, second only to Jack Nicklaus.
ref: A strange statistic by one of the greatest players of all-time, having won 14 major titles second to only Jack Nicklaus.

src: 美國隊整個周末都陷入苦戰，除了利德 (Patrick Reed)、湯瑪斯 (Justin Thomas) 和費納 (Tony Finau) 在整個巡迴賽都發揮高水準。
mt: The U.S. team struggled through the weekend, with Patrick Reed, Justin Thomas and Tony Finau playing top-notch throughout the tour.
ref: Team USA struggled all weekend to find the fairways with the exception of Patrick Reed, Justin Thomas and Tony Finau, who played high-caliber golf throughout the entire tournament.

src: 在表現令人失望後，美國隊隊長福瑞克 (Jim Furyk) 為他的團隊講話：「我為這些隊友感到驕傲，他們盡力了。
mt: After a disappointing performance, American team captain Jim Furyk said to his team: "I'm proud of these teammates, they've done their best.
ref: US captain Jim Furyk spoke after a disappointing performance for his squad, "I'm proud of these guys, they fought.

src: 今天早上我們曾經帶給。
mt: This morning we brought it.
ref: There was time this morning when we put some heat on Europe.

src: 我們搞砸了。
mt: We fucked up.
ref: We scrapped.

src: 向比昂致敬。
mt: Pay tribute to Beyoncé.
ref: Hats off to Thomas.

src: 他是個很棒的隊長。
mt: He's a great captain.
ref: He is a great captain.

src: 他 12 個球員全部都打得很好。
mt: All 12 of them played well.
ref: All 12 of his players played very well.

src: 我們會重新整裝。我將與美國 PGA 和我們的萊德盃委員會合作，我們將再出發。
mt: We’ll refit it up. I’ll be working with the PGA of America and our Lede Cup Committee, and we’ll be back on track.
ref: We'll regroup, I'll work with the PGA of America and our Ryder Cup Committee and we'll move forward.

src: 我愛這 12 個球員，非常榮幸能夠擔任隊長。
mt: I love these 12 players, and it's a great honor to be captain.
ref: I love these 12 guys and I'm proud to serve as captain.

src: 你必須向對手致意。
mt: You have to pay your respects to your opponent.
ref: You have to tip your cap.

src: 我們被打敗了。
mt: We were defeated.
ref: We got outplayed."

src: 紅潮更新：Pinellas、Manatee 和 Sarasota 的濃度下降
mt: Red tide updates: Decreased concentrations of Pinellas, Manatee, and Sarasota
ref: Red Tide Update: Concentrations decrease in Pinellas, Manatee and Sarasota

src: 佛羅里達魚類和野生動物委員會 (Florida Fish and Wildlife Commission) 的最新報告顯示，部分坦帕灣地區的紅潮濃度下降。
mt: A recent report by the Florida Fish and Wildlife Commission shows that some parts of the Tampa Bay area have seen a decrease in red tide levels.
ref: The newest report from the Florida Fish and Wildlife Commission shows a general decrease in Red Tide concentrations for parts of the Tampa Bay area.

src: 據 FWC 的報告，Pinellas、Manatee、Sarasota、Charlotte 和 Collier 區域回報海藻參差不齊的狀況 - 表示濃度下降中。
mt: According to the FWC report, the areas of Pinellas, Manatee, Sarasota, Charlotte and Collier reported uneven seaweed content - indicating a decrease in concentration.
ref: According to the FWC, patchier bloom conditions are being reported in areas of Pinellas, Manatee, Sarasota, Charlotte and Collier counties - which suggests decreasing concentrations.

src: 紅潮海藻從北 Pinellas 到南 Lee 縣的海岸線延伸約 130 哩。
mt: The red seaweed stretches about 130 miles from the northern Pinellas to the southern coastal line of Lee County.
ref: A bloom the Red Tide extends approximately 130 miles of coastline from northern Pinellas to southern Lee counties.

src: 可在 Hillsborough 縣離岸 10 哩外發現海藻堆，但位置比上星期少。
mt: Seaweed piles can be found 10 miles off the coast of Hillsborough County, but they are less than last week.
ref: Patches can be found about 10 miles offshore of Hillsborough County, but at fewer sites relative to last week.

src: 也可在 Pasco 縣看到紅潮。
mt: A red tide can also be seen in Pasco County.
ref: Red Tide has also been observed in Pasco County.

src: 上星期回報的 Pinellas 縣近海或離岸的濃度中等，Hillsborough 縣近海或離岸的濃度低至高，Manatee County 縣基數至濃度高，Sarasota 縣近海或離岸的基數至濃度高，Charlotte 縣基數至濃度中，Lee 縣近海或離岸的基數至濃度高，Collier 縣的濃度低。
mt: Last week, the reported concentration of Pinellas County offshore or offshore was moderate, Hillsborough County offshore or offshore was as low as high, Manatee County cardinality to concentration, Sarasota County offshore or offshore cardinality to concentration, Charlotte County cardinality to concentration, Lee County offshore or offshore cardinality to concentration is high, Collier County is low.
ref: Medium concentrations in or offshore of Pinellas County have been reported in the past week, low to high concentrations offshore of Hillsborough County, background to high concentrations in Manatee County, background to high concentrations in or offshore of Sarasota County, background to medium concentrations in Charlotte County, background to high concentrations in or offshore of Lee County, and low concentrations in Collier County.

src: Pinellas、Manatee、Sarasota、Charlotte 和 Collier 縣持續回報有呼吸系統刺激。
mt: Pinellas, Manatee, Sarasota, Charlotte, and Collier counties continue to report respiratory stimulation.
ref: Respiratory irritation continues to be reported in Pinellas, Manatee, Sarasota, Lee, and Collier counties.

src: 上個星期北佛羅里達未回報呼吸系統刺激。
mt: Last week North Florida did not report any respiratory irritation.
ref: Respiratory irritation was not reported in Northwest Florida over the past week.
